story:
Story:

 

‘Bloom’ is a story about one woman’s recovery after a traumatic period in her life. The story is anchored by a therapy session, where Amy, the lead character reflects on the occurrences of the events surrounding her 20th Wedding Anniversary. As filmmakers, we have always found nonlinear storytelling to be our preferred method as it gives greater opportunities to experiment with the audience's expectations.  Bloom is a positive look at recovery and the concept that embracing SELF LOVE is the only way for humans to be able give love to others. 

 


This story stems from the personal experiences that our writers have had while undergoing psychotherapy. It is easily relatable, as Amy learns that she must let go in order to have a second chance at life, in order to Bloom.

 

 

Filled with an ethnically diverse cast and crew, we want to tell a story of the challenges that some women go through in their romantic relationships, and how they can be used as a driver of growth. One can bloom even after their world has crumbled - if only they participate in their healing process. 

 

THE CAST 

 

CLAIRE JONES - Claire graduated from Manchester Metropolitan University School Of Theatre in 2005. Since graduation, she has obtained credits in TV series BBC Doctors and Paddy McGuiness' Saturday Night Live Arena Tour. Claire has worked extensively within theatre and radio and is also an established voiceover artist having recorded numerous audio books and audio dramas. She is also the founder of Professional Actors Birmingham based in the UK. 

 

YINKA AWONI - He is an actor, known for I May Destroy You (2020), The Stranger (2020) and On the Edge (2018). Yinka just wrapped on BBC comedy drama 'This Is Going To Hurt'. He is appearing in BBC Radio 4's highly anticipated series 'World of Curls' and has finished recording a featured role in Netflix's first all African animated series Mama K Team 4 airing fall 2021. You can also see him in critically acclaimed BBC 1's 'I May Destroy You', Netflix's No 1 series 'The Stranger' and BAFTA TV Nominated 'Single Drama' One The Edge 'BBW'. 

 

 

JULIA-MARIA ARNOLDS - A German/English actor, director and scriptwriter. After graduating as actor/director at the Giles Foreman Centre for Acting in London, Julia-Maria has appeared in various short and feature films and is currently seen in Christopher Nolan’s “Tenet”.   She is a member of the London based film-production “Focus Frame Production” and is starring in two of her own written short films, currently running and nominated at international film festivals.

 

ANABEL KUTAY - Anabel is an actress and filmmaker who has recently completed filming BROKEN SHELTER directed by Tim Hewitt. She also stars in BIRDS WITH NO LEGS opposite Leo Gregory, which recently made its premiere at Drama Film festival and Aesthetica Short Film Festival. Her directorial Debut, DOGHOUSE, is currently in post-production and she has two feature films in development. She is also known for Youth (2015), High Strung (2016) and Hold the Dark (2018).

 

VONNY LANG is a walking, talking embodiment of female sexual liberation. She radiates and promotes female empowerment and self-ownership as a lingerie model. A curator of adult events and play-parties, she believes in being able to use everything that she has to make a life for myself, and being able to thrive independently is akin female empowerment.  Vonny has featured in many television commercials, print ads and is the main actor in "Shangri-La", a Singaporean feature film currently in production.

 

What We Need:

 

This project is being made as part of coursework for an MA in Film Production at the University of Lincoln. By contributing and helping us fund this short film, you will be helping these students (two of the writers) to complete coursework that will lead to their graduation at the end of the academic year.

 

Our film has a cast of 5 paid actors, and 4 paid professional crew members, as well as the unpaid creators. Our budget stands at ￡2755 and the breakdown is as follows:

By giving to this campaign, you are supporting YOUNG PEOPLE IN FILM, and championing INCLUSION and DIVERSITY on screen and in the film industry.

 

Our cast is 60% female, and our crew is 50% female as well, with the talented Maya Bell as Director of Photography. 

 

Contributing to our campaign comes with a range of perks:

  • ￡1  - “Thank You” credit in the film
  • ￡5 - Digital Film Poster + Digital Copy of Script (plus above perks)
  • ￡10 - Exclusive Online Premiere on paus.tv (plus above perks)
  • ￡25 - Physical DVD of film (plus above perks)
  • ￡50 - Executive producer credit (plus above perks)

 

If we exceed our goal, any extra funding will be used to fund the submission of this film into Film Festivals, as well as other post-production costs. 

 

THE CREATIVE TEAM:

 

MICHAEL CLAYTON JR:

 

Michael is a location Sound Recordist with 6 years experience in the film and media industry. Possessing a broad range of skills recording for feature film/short film productions, corporate, promotional, documentary, online content and commercial projects.

 

MAYA BELLE:

 

Maya Belle is a creative cinematographer with her credits spanning Narrative Shorts, Documentaries, Commercials and Music Videos.

She has a 1st Class BA (Hons) degree in Film Production from The University of Gloucestershire and was awarded an RTS Cinematography Craft Award for her work on Intergalactic Empress Stah Power Girl, a short documentary character piece.

 

ALISHA COLLINS:

Alisha is a candidate for an MA in Film Production at the University of Lincoln, but originates from Essex. She is a screenwriter and line producer who is an emerging talent in the film industry. 

 

LIKOJI MIHOVA:

Likoji is an up and coming Food Writer that has recently been experimenting with screenwriting and this will be her first credit as a Screenwriter.

 

TIM PORTER:

 

Tim is a candidate for an MA in Film Production from the University of Lincoln and has an extensive portfolio as a Director & Editor. This is his "comeback" short film after taking a break from the industry and Bloom is the first Drama project under his new London-based company, Second Chance Media Ltd. 

 

EWERTON RODRIGO:

 

He has studied Audio Production at SAE London in 2013 and have been recording sound for Film and TV since 2014, shooting across various European countries, as well as the USA, Israel, Brazil and Costa Rica on a wide variety of productions such as documentaries, TV Factual, corporate videos and drama.

 

 

PERRY FRANK: A one man band project of Ambient, Post-Rock and Acoustic Music. The unique sound of Perry Frank is based on guitar and synth loops soundscapes that create imaginary and dreamy textures on which arpeggios and melodies move with a timeless and spaceless feeling. His influences range from Basinski, Brian Eno, Boards of Canada, Fennesz, Tycho, Bonobo to Robin Guthrie and Harold Budd.

 

 

Risks & Challenges:

The biggest risk we currently face is the threat of COVID-19 infection. The United Kingdom has become a hotspot for a new strain which is more transmittable. However, the Film & TV Industry has been permitted to continue working, but with measures in place to protect all cast and crew. This means mandatory testing before filming takes place, and the use of PPE on set to protect everyone. We will also be paying for insurance as a safety net.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that not everyone can contribute as much as they want to. We are doing this with faith that we will reach our goal, and that this film will have an amazing impact in our society. Please share this campaign with anyone you know who might take an interest in it. Using Facebook and Twitter, we believe we can reach as many people as possible needed to fully fund this project. Please use the share tools here on Indiegogo to get people directly to this page.

 

ABOUT SECOND CHANCE MEDIA LTD:

Second Chance is a media production company that was established in 2021, at University. The company produce short documentaries, one of which has been submitted to several film festivals, a podcast called HE BLACK, SHE WHITE, and now short films, Bloom being the first drama. 

Second Chance exists to tell stories of unity, hope and redemption. The company remains apolitical at its core, and seeks to elevate voices from all walks of life. 

 

Other Projects We Have Done:
https://vimeo.com/tjpfilm

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCimD7LRUbDd9Td...

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPdxB1sTg0_2D2...

story:
WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU STEP OVER THE LINE OF SANITY?

 

 

After months of grieving over her mother's untimely passing, a girl named Scarlett tries to push forward with her life and follow in her mother's footsteps. She soon finds herself trapped in the clutches of her delusional professor's home. Paralyzed and unable to fight back, Scarlett's only option is to hope the drugs wear out in time... before it's too late.

 

This is the second feature film by writer/director Samuel Vainisi; his first feature film 'Violet' was released on BD-R in early March of 2020, and the film is also available to watch for free through Amazon Prime as of 7/24/20! Link below <3

 

https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/B08DK74X...

 

Teaser posters for 'Violet' & 'Scarlett' by the amazing Martin Trafford

 

 

 Brittany Blanton

 "Scarlett"

 

Kaylee Williams

"Abbey"

 

Tom Komisar

"Calvin Byars"

 

 Cody Kilpatrick Steele

 "Tommy"

 

Katelynn Newberry

"Claire"

 

Chris Jehnert

"Cody"

 

Rebecca Rinehart

"Madison"

 

Vergena Fields

"Tymber"

 

Matt Brown

"Kyle"

 

Max Groah

"Max"

 

Sam Hodge

Score / Music

 

Zeke Dixon-Kitt

Editor

 

Rob Collins

Makeup / FX

 

Stephen J. Hodke

Makeup / FX

 

Charlie Ours

Sound

 

Joslyn Eckert

PA / Makeup / "Sydney"

 

Samuel Vainisi

Writer / Director

 

 

You might be wondering where the Post Production, Shipping and BD-R costs are? It's because we are taking care of that on our end. All we are asking for this Indiegogo campaign is for $6000 to take care of our Cast & Crew, Travel and SFX expenses. This budget is as tight as it can be; not a penny will be pocketed nor be wasted. We cannot do this without your help, so please share this campaign with your friends or anyone who may be interested in our film.

 

 

Message by Samuel Vainisi  (writer / director of Scarlett)

The Scarlett Project truly means the world to me. I've been working on it on and off since 2015. It started out as a short story that slowly kept evolving into a feature film script. The script is cute, funny and relatable... but it's also terrifying, nerve wracking and brutal. It is a slow burn but if you stick with it, it definitely delivers.

 

The first person I reached out to about it was Tom Komisar (aka Mr. Byars). When I was writing the story I couldn't help but think of Tom as the character, so it meant that much more to me when he loved the script and signed on to be the character. This was years ago... and over time I've been keeping him updated with every revision and I'm happy he is still by my side after all this time.

 

If you're wondering; I have made four Indiegogo campaigns for four separate projects in the past. And with every campaign, I kept my word and all of the perks went out on time. The difference between those campaigns and this one is that I had already finished my short films or was near the end of finishing my first feature, Violet. The difference with this Scarlett campaign is that I'm currently in Pre-Production and this film won't be completed for a while. With the current pandemic and us having to shoot at a college campus, shoot dates could be delayed because of this - so the estimated perk delivery might be a bit longer. It all depends on any set backs in production, but if there is any I will post updates right here on this IGG and on our Facebook page.

 

I know a ton of people have been screwed over by other campaigns, but I can only use my words and say that you will not be screwed over with our campaign. With having done previous campaigns in the past, I hope you know I'm trust worthy with your donation.

 

Previous Campaigns

- Agony & Pleasure: A Samuel Vainisi Collection

- Senses - A Short Film

- Akrasia - A Short Film

- Feature Film: Violet - Finishing Funds Campaign

story:
Who we are

My name is Matthew Lee Anderson, co-founder of independent production company Key 13 Film Partners. Craig M. Rosenthal and I created Key 13 to make films that everyone could enjoy and feed our creative drive.  We are no strangers to the hard work required to make a movie. Between the two of us, we have over 20 years of filmmaking experience.  We are excited to move into the next phase in our filmmaking careers.

"Serious Profession" is going to be the first full length feature film for Key 13. This idea was created over 20 years ago and has always been a goal to make. Already, the script has won an award (the first of many we hope). Completing this film will not only be a dream come true, it will showcase the skills of the talented people who work on, and make films in the Washington DC area and beyond. Plus, how many independent films start off with an award winning script? Not many!

By donating, you will not only bring this award winning script into reality but provide employment for many hard working (and serious) entertainment professionals who have been struggling due to COVID.

Already off with a bang!

We were over 20% funded in the first three days, 30% in just our first week! We have some new producers, several extras, and quite a few other surprises. One perk, the "Name the Boss" perk completely changed the nationality of the crime boss. How's that for making your perk super cool!

What your funding provides!

To just get started, we need $13,000. That money will go to:

  • Paying the cinematographer and the gaffer (lighting guy)
  • Paying the actors
  • Use of a police car and buying/renting any equipment we need
  • Feeding the cast and crew

On average, it will cost us $1300 a day (somedays more, somedays less) to pay everyone, keep them fed, and create a great looking movie. Every 10% we raise is another day of filming.

If we go over that amount, there is a lot more we can do to improve the film. We can rent/purchase better equipment to give us more options to make the film look really polished.  Andrew Stainer our composer is scoring the entire film without compensation so it's only fair to pay him for his time (he is donating his time because he believes in this project). We can hire a sound engineer, key grip, and other important persons that are needed so we can focus on the performances. We can also pay the volunteers and those who donated time and effort to help make the posters and other swag. The truth is, if everyone on our Facebook pages just donated $15, we will get this movie DONE!

We have many of the standard perks (producer credits, DVD/Blu-Ray's, T-Shirts, posters) but we have some cool ones:

  • Props from the movie (most of those have already sold out)
  • MP3 of the opening theme "Cruisin'" by Andrew Stainer (a stretch goal offering)
  • Signed instant pictures by the cast while they are on the set
  • Personalized video messages from the cast
  • Having your name mentioned
  • and so much more!

If we don't make our $13,000 goal, we will make as much of the movie we can with what we have to show what we can do with the funding we receive. The cinematographer and the gaffer get paid first, then the actors, then the rest of the crew. We would rather not have to do a second campaign or rely on a distribution deal to pay everyone. This movie will be made, no matter if we have to do it a little at a time.

 

What this means to us

As I mentioned earlier, this film is intended to be a showcase of the vast talent in the DC, Maryland, and Virginia area (what we call the DMV) and even as far as Texas. By donating to this funding campaign, you will directly support the entrepreneurial spirit of so many independent film makers and actors. This a dream project, and we have assembled people who love this script and the concept.

In the first year of our existence, Key 13 Film Partners completed a wide variety of projects. We produced and released the award winning short film "Hoodie". We did a music video, worked on a comic book fan project, and even made a commercial. We also supported our local film community by supporting the movies "Remnants" and "Brazen Impact" for Absurd Production Pictures.  While we did have some setbacks, we continued to move forward and do our best to achieve our goals. We don't buckle under pressure.

Success is not guaranteed 

As with anything different, there are risks, and we know that we have a lot of work ahead of us. Finding the right people and places to film was our first big hurdle, and we managed to clear it. Next is convincing people to invest in something that isn't typical for this area. A crime film about two mobsters going about their day (ala Pulp Fiction) is a tough sell. We know we have a great script and an awesome cast and crew, so the next step is being able to bring everyone together. With our experience and knowledge, as well as many wonderful supporters like you, we know we will get "Serious Profession" made.

Money helps, but so does love!

The cast and crew of "Serious Profession needs your help and support. We have a page https://www.facebook.com/SeriousProMovie that shows every aspect of the production. We encourage you to interact; ask questions, share posts, and even send us fan art!

We know times are tough, so money isn't the only thing you can help us with. Share this campaign on your Facebook personal page. You can contact us at Key 13 Film Partners https://www.facebook.com/key13film and volunteer your time, talent, or even food. You can support us simply by giving us an encouraging word. That can be just as important as $15.

Here is the link to the Serious Profession IMDb page as well https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13819330/

On behalf of all of us, we thank you for your time and support of Key 13 Film Partners and "Serious Profession"

Break a leg!

Matthew Lee Anderson, Craig M. Rosenthal, Rick Jermain, Thomas Touhey, and Matt Burns.

Meet the cast!

By donating, you will not only bring this award winning script into reality but provide employment for many hard working (and serious) entertainment professionals who have been struggling due to COVID.
Already off with a bang!
We were over 20% funded in the first three days, 30% in just our first week! We have some new producers, several extras, and quite a few other surprises. One perk, the "Name the Boss" perk completely changed the nationality of the crime boss. How's that for making your perk super cool!

What your funding provides!
To just get started, we need $13,000. That money will go to:

Paying the cinematographer and the gaffer (lighting guy)
Paying the actors
Use of a police car and buying/renting any equipment we need
Feeding the cast and crew

On average, it will cost us $1300 a day (somedays more, somedays less) to pay everyone, keep them fed, and create a great looking movie. Every 10% we raise is another day of filming.
If we go over that amount, there is a lot more we can do to improve the film. We can rent/purchase better equipment to give us more options to make the film look really polished.  Andrew Stainer our composer is scoring the entire film without compensation so it's only fair to pay him for his time (he is donating his time because he believes in this project). We can hire a sound engineer, key grip, and other important persons that are needed so we can focus on the performances. We can also pay the volunteers and those who donated time and effort to help make the posters and other swag. The truth is, if everyone on our Facebook pages just donated $15, we will get this movie DONE!

We have many of the standard perks (producer credits, DVD/Blu-Ray's, T-Shirts, posters) but we have some cool ones:

Props from the movie (most of those have already sold out)
MP3 of the opening theme "Cruisin'" by Andrew Stainer (a stretch goal offering)
Signed instant pictures by the cast while they are on the set
Personalized video messages from the cast
Having your name mentioned
and so much more!

If we don't make our $13,000 goal, we will make as much of the movie we can with what we have to show what we can do with the funding we receive. The cinematographer and the gaffer get paid first, then the actors, then the rest of the crew. We would rather not have to do a second campaign or rely on a distribution deal to pay everyone. This movie will be made, no matter if we have to do it a little at a time.
 
What this means to us

As I mentioned earlier, this film is intended to be a showcase of the vast talent in the DC, Maryland, and Virginia area (what we call the DMV) and even as far as Texas. By donating to this funding campaign, you will directly support the entrepreneurial spirit of so many independent film makers and actors. This a dream project, and we have assembled people who love this script and the concept.
In the first year of our existence, Key 13 Film Partners completed a wide variety of projects. We produced and released the award winning short film "Hoodie". We did a music video, worked on a comic book fan project, and even made a commercial. We also supported our local film community by supporting the movies "Remnants" and "Brazen Impact" for Absurd Production Pictures.  While we did have some setbacks, we continued to move forward and do our best to achieve our goals. We don't buckle under pressure.

Success is not guaranteed 
As with anything different, there are risks, and we know that we have a lot of work ahead of us. Finding the right people and places to film was our first big hurdle, and we managed to clear it. Next is convincing people to invest in something that isn't typical for this area. A crime film about two mobsters going about their day (ala Pulp Fiction) is a tough sell. We know we have a great script and an awesome cast and crew, so the next step is being able to bring everyone together. With our experience and knowledge, as well as many wonderful supporters like you, we know we will get "Serious Profession" made.

Money helps, but so does love!

The cast and crew of "Serious Profession needs your help and support. We have a page https://www.facebook.com/SeriousProMovie that shows every aspect of the production. We encourage you to interact; ask questions, share posts, and even send us fan art!
We know times are tough, so money isn't the only thing you can help us with. Share this campaign on your Facebook personal page. You can contact us at Key 13 Film Partners https://www.facebook.com/key13film and volunteer your time, talent, or even food. You can support us simply by giving us an encouraging word. That can be just as important as $15.
Here is the link to the Serious Profession IMDb page as well https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13819330/
On behalf of all of us, we thank you for your time and support of Key 13 Film Partners and "Serious Profession"
Break a leg!
Matthew Lee Anderson, Craig M. Rosenthal, Rick Jermain, Thomas Touhey, and Matt Burns.
Meet the cast!

story:
The Mission:

My goal with making this film is to reimagine and reintroduce the Vietnam conflict and get a glimpse into the kinds of stories that were swept under the rug, so to speak. I feel the conflict draws a lot of parallels to the Anti Asian Violence we see in the U.S. today, and the themes of the story speak to that. We have very little seen portrayals of the Vietnam War from a Vietnamese American perspective, and considering what we've seen in the Asian American Community over the past year, it's high time we do so. 

The Story: 

In North Vietnam in 1970, U.S. Army Private Daniel Jennings befriends a young Vietnamese boy, Xuan. But when his platoon returns to his camp, the dangers of that friendship become apparent, and an innocent and playful relationship soon becomes a tense conflict of life or death.

The Gist:

All in all, we need $10,000 to make this short film the best it can be. By donating, not only will you helping film students of all backgrounds advance their career and education, but you will be supporting a story meant to inspire change and reflection, not to mention the artistic perspective of Asian Americans. 

 

The Troop

We have a number of talented film makers, both student and professional, dedicated bringing this project to life. 

Writer and Director: Leonardo Trejo-Bien

You already know about me, so this will be brief. I've Produced, Shot, Directed, and Edited a plethora of short films in the past, both outside and inside of my education, even working with other film schools like NYU Tisch. I've been involved in commercial projects, working with clients like Sonic and Dairy Queen, but that's enough about me. Let's get to the others. 

Director of Photography: Stone Taul

A film student from Cincinnati, Ohio, Stone Taul is a gifted Photographer and Cinematographer. His experience shooting with film stock combined with his vintage, ominous aesthetic and visual style, pair exceptionally well with the themes and tones of this film. He's premiered a variety of his work at festivals from across the country, and accumulated a collection of awards doing so. 

First Assistant Director: Yasmine Torres

Having just recently graduated from film school, Yasmine is one of the most driven, determined, and indomitable people you will ever meet. Not only is she a talented filmmaker, but she has a proficiently high aptitude for organization, making her the perfect and most reliable 1st AD for this project. Not to mention, she is incredibly passionate about this film. With Yasmine behind scheduling and managing set operations day to day, the project is ensured to remain on track.

Production Designer: Joseann Reynoso Tejeda

A film student from Although Joseann has no ancestral connection to Asian culture or heritage, he has an immense respect and admiration for it. It's evidently a part of his personal aesthetic. He may not look  very approachable in the photo above, but in reality, he's one of the warmest,  most positive and optimistic people I know. Much like Stone, his visual aesthetic tends to be dark, dramatic, and filmic - again, ideal for the themes of this film. Above all, he's passionate about this project and his knowledge and experience will be a vital asset to production.

Gaffer: Sam Cook

Unrelated to the great soul R&B singer of the 50s and 60s, Sam is not only talented behind the camera, but he knows more about light than God on the first day of creation. He's worked in Grip and Electric on a wide variety of both professional and student productions, and he has been a lead creative influence on a number of music videos. With Sam leading the lighting crew, we will be able to achieve that cinematic look that fully immerses the audience and speaks to the themes of the story. 

Can't Donate?

If you have reached this section, you're probably interested in this project, but what if you can't donate? Share this Campaign! Sharing the campaign and spreading the word about this film has its worth and value, and sometimes it can mean more than any dollar amount. 

 

Link to the CONCEPT SHORT: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r4lJsZCMk6k

story:
Short Summary

After a teenage girl's spiritual rebirth gives her the ability to see angels and demons, she finds romance and danger as she battles demons who have overrun her rural hometown. Based on the book, "They Don't Cast Shadows" by Bob Leone and produced by Inspireworks Productions.

We need your help to back this unique Christian, Romance, Fantasy film. The Christian version of the "Twilight" series. 

About the Producers

Melissa Goad, director of 'They Don't Cast Shadows' is a SAG actor, producer, screenwriter and director.  She has been acting professionally since the age of 12 and has starred in many indie feature films. Melissa understands what it takes to get the performance out of the actor to accomplish the feel and mood of the scene. She is a hard worker, dedicated and loyal to her work and those around her. 

Bob Leone is the author of the Shadow Series books.  He is a purple heart veteran, author, writer, cartoonist, widower and father of 5.  Bob loves to share the truth of Jesus with anyone he comes in contact with which is why he is so excited that his first book is being turned into a feature film. 

Bob and Melissa met at church.  One afternoon, about a year ago, Bob gave Melissa his first book and asked her to read it. After reading, Melissa told Bob she could see his book being turned into a film. Six months later, Bob and Melissa decided to make that dream a reality. They created Inspireworks Productions and then produced their first teaser trailer for 'They Don't Cast Shadows' to raise funds to film the feature in July 2021 in Georgetown, CA.  Their goal is to glorify God, to reach those who haven't heard of Jesus, who might not normally come to church or watch a Christian film. 

For those who do not know Bob and Melissa, Bob is a doer! You ask him to do something, even mention it and he's already started implementing your idea. Melissa has a heart and passion for film and they both have a heart for the Lord. Bob and Melissa are the perfect team, they balance each other out and they both have different strengths which makes for a beautiful partnership. Once they decided to make Bob's book into a feature film, it took them less than 4 months to create a production company, write the teaser trailer script, hire an incredible crew, cast the film and then film the project. They are dedicated and they follow through. 

Funding

This is a SAG feature film, meaning SAG rates will increase the budget. It will run closer to 110 minutes. We currently have $80,000 to start our feature film, however, with the amount of special effects, flying angels and demons (their makeup and costumes), large cast and crew and multiple locations, in order to accomplish a believable "Hollywood" type film that will reach millions, it needs to be done right. We could accomplish this film on a $250k level, but it would be more believable on a $500k budget.  Either way, we're starting production July 2021 with the goal in mind to bring more people to Jesus. 

A $250K budget means no flying angels or demons and no big special effects.  We have to cut down the number of cast and crew.  

With a $500K budget we can have flying angels and demons, great special effects, a green screen if needed and custom set pieces. 

We are planning on showing and pitching our project to the bigger Christian networks such as Pure Flix, Affirm Films, Christian Cinema, Fox Faith and more. 

Impact

Christian films have skyrocketed during this last year, people are looking for something greater than themselves.  According to the CBN*, "major movies released theatrically in the United States shows that movies with very strong Christian worldviews do much better at the box office than movies with Non-Christian worldviews".  Since 2014, films produced and distributed by Pure Flix** have collectively grossed over $195 million at the worldwide box office.

*https://www.cbn.com/entertainment/screen/ans_ch...

**https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pure_Flix

Perks

We have a lot of cool perks to offer including: shout outs, meet and greets, autographed copy of the book the movie is based off of, wardrobe worn by the cast from the teaser trailer, executive producer credit, invitation to the premiere and more. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray!  Pray that God will provide all the funding we need to make the best film possible. Pray that this film will reach those who do not know Jesus. 

Share! Help us spread the good news of Jesus by sharing this campaign with everyone you know. Share our trailer and our websites so that we can get more traction for when the film is finished. 

Follow Us:

Website: www.Inspireworksproductions.com

Facebook: Inspireworksproductions

IG: Inspireworks_Productions

Twitter: TDCS2021

story:
THE BEGINNING:

Last July, I met Carman on his tour bus and we instantly clicked. As he began to open up to me about his personal life and ministry, I felt connected to him even more. It was clear to me that he was passionate about his desire to lead people to Christ. As I continued to listen, the story got even better as he began sharing stories about his brother Mario (just think Joe Pesci meets Jack Black). Mario was the older brother that Carman looked up to, but he found himself in some pinches from time to time when Mario exercised authority he didn't really have. On the streets of New Jersey one day after an encounter with a bully, Mario taught Carman how to stand up for himself. It follows that he would later become Carman's tour bodyguard. Mario fired people he didn't have any authority over and overstepped boundaries at times, yet everyone who knew him found him endearing and hilarious. It was clear to me from listening to Carman's stories that Mario was a huge part of his life story. He never really got over Mario's death in 2000.

Carman quickly became my friend, and over the course of the next eight months, we started planning a feature film about his life. It had become clear that this was not the typical "Christian" film. At one point I said, "I'm not sure if we can make a movie that's part 'I Can Only Imagine' and part 'Goodfellas'. We laughed about that, but the truth is this: Carman's story is really about a guy who was the least likely to achieve this platform where millions of people would come to know Christ as their Savior. Many people considered him the Billy Graham of Christian music. To some, he was more like the Elvis of the genre. He led millions to the Lord, and this truly was his only passion.

By helping us tell Carman's full story, we believe you will be not only entertained, but essentially responsible for bringing millions more to Christ. This is not a documentary. This is a narrative, scripted film that will be based entirely on Carman's own words, with funny and heart-wrenching stories about his childhood and family life, going all the way through his music ministry and career.

 

 

PRODUCER BACKGROUND:

I'm Jack Vale, and I have been in the entertainment industry for 13 years. Starting on YouTube in 2007, I have produced and starred in TV shows and films, and recently created a show with an academy award-winning director which was sold to Fox. I currently have another feature film in pre-production which is being shot in February and March, 2022. My social media platforms have a combined following of 5 million fans, and over the years, my family-friendly comedy videos have been viewed 10 billion times on YouTube and Facebook.

I have always felt God gave me this platform because it was a conduit to reach people for Jesus. You see, when I was 15, I had a rather unique experience: one night after a concert, I spent half an hour alone in a room with my favorite Christian music artist: Carman. He was at the top of his career, doing the Radically Saved tour, but he took time to sit with a teenager with questions. That time, mostly I talked and he listened. He prayed with me. That night, his words changed my life. The fact that I met him again (this time as a 47-year-old film producer) and became his friend was no accident. It was ordained by God, and Carman and I both knew that. We began to work consistently on this project together, discussing the storyline, potential cast members, and music. I made it clear to him that my goal was the same as his: reaching more people for Jesus. I found out early on that there was nothing more important to him than that. 

One of my last meetings with him was November 24th, 2020. He showed up with a giant poster-board and various colored markers, so that he and I could map out his life story for the film. I was completely blown away by his stories. Not only were they some of the most entertaining stories I had ever heard, but many were touching and frankly, life changing. I had never met anyone who was more focused on the end result being "souls saved". When I had an idea for something, his main focus was "How will this contribute to leading people to the Lord?" He said to me several times, "If it doesn't bring more people to Christ, then what's the point?"

On February 16th, 2021, I received the most unexpected, devastating news: Carman had passed away after complications from surgery. My friend, who was so full of life and energy, was gone. I realize that eight months is not a long time to get to know someone, but we had spent hours together planning this movie, sharing stories, and putting all the pieces in place. This film was the most important thing to him, and I promised him several times that I would see it through. Even today, as I am still grieving the loss of Carman, I can hear his voice motivating and encouraging me to move this forward. He wanted things done yesterday, because "The people might not be here tomorrow".

THE MUSIC:

I called Carman several months ago to tell him that legendary record producer Rodney Jerkins was a fan of his, and he'd told me he would love to be involved in the music for this film. Carman had followed Rodney's career and was thrilled with the news. Rodney's involvement in production will be in the scoring for the movie and also in producing an all-star artist tribute album to Carman with re-imagined songs of some of his biggest CCM hits. Over the years, Rodney has produced for Michael Jackson, Mariah Carey, Whitney Houston, Kelly Clarkson, Justin Bieber, Mary J. Blige, Kanye West & many others. He has had multiple Grammy nominations and two wins!

I know Rodney, and can tell you that this man has a heart for God. Aside from his extensive accomplishments, he is a loving and committed husband and father. Rodney is excited to be a part of our project to bring honor to Carman's legacy and contribute by creating a soundtrack that Carman would be very proud of.

SCRIPT & PRODUCTION:

Carman and I carefully considered some accomplished screenwriters, directors, and additional producers who we felt would do a great job bringing his story to the big screen. I am happy to say that we have made some of these decisions. The writers are very familiar with Carman's ministry and music business all the way through his life. And here's the BIG NEWS: The script is FINISHED! We even have the shooting schedule and plan to be filming SUMMER of '22!

We cannot yet divulge who this next person is but we are in talks with an Academy Award-winning director to join us as an executive producer. As we get new information, we will be updating you. Gathering the team and crew is something that we largely have done already, but as I'm sure you can imagine, it is a process and we are SO EXCITED about the level of interest from some of the most accomplished movie industry professionals!

CAST and CREW:

The obvious elephant in the room is... "WHO'S GOING TO PLAY CARMAN?" Well, we will need three actors to cover various ages. We knew we needed someone very special to play him for the majority of the film and decided to do a nationwide casting call for this Italian Stallion. We do have someone in mind to play his older brother Mario, and all I can tell you is that you have seen him a lot! When I called Carman to tell him, he shouted his name and said, "I THINK HE COULD PULL IT OFF!" We did have discussions about the rest of the cast, and since this largely has to do with coordinating shooting schedules with theirs, we will be flexible while only hiring top-tier talent. We will update you as these decisions are made. Experienced crew members are being rounded up as we speak, and we plan to shoot in New Jersey and Tennessee.

That night, his words changed my life. The fact that I met him again (this time as a 47-year-old film producer) and became his friend was no accident. It was ordained by God, and Carman and I both knew that. We began to work consistently on this project together, discussing the storyline, potential cast members, and music. I made it clear to him that my goal was the same as his: reaching more people for Jesus. I found out early on that there was nothing more important to him than that. One of my last meetings with him was November 24th, 2020. He showed up with a giant poster-board and various colored markers, so that he and I could map out his life story for the film. I was completely blown away by his stories. Not only were they some of the most entertaining stories I had ever heard, but many were touching and frankly, life changing. I had never met anyone who was more focused on the end result being "souls saved". When I had an idea for something, his main focus was "How will this contribute to leading people to the Lord?" He said to me several times, "If it doesn't bring more people to Christ, then what's the point?"On February 16th, 2021, I received the most unexpected, devastating news: Carman had passed away after complications from surgery. My friend, who was so full of life and energy, was gone. I realize that eight months is not a long time to get to know someone, but we had spent hours together planning this movie, sharing stories, and putting all the pieces in place. This film was the most important thing to him, and I promised him several times that I would see it through. Even today, as I am still grieving the loss of Carman, I can hear his voice motivating and encouraging me to move this forward. He wanted things done yesterday, because "The people might not be here tomorrow".THE MUSIC:I called Carman several months ago to tell him that legendary record producer Rodney Jerkins was a fan of his, and he'd told me he would love to be involved in the music for this film. Carman had followed Rodney's career and was thrilled with the news. Rodney's involvement in production will be in the scoring for the movie and also in producing an all-star artist tribute album to Carman with re-imagined songs of some of his biggest CCM hits. Over the years, Rodney has produced for Michael Jackson, Mariah Carey, Whitney Houston, Kelly Clarkson, Justin Bieber, Mary J. Blige, Kanye West & many others. He has had multiple Grammy nominations and two wins!I know Rodney, and can tell you that this man has a heart for God. Aside from his extensive accomplishments, he is a loving and committed husband and father. Rodney is excited to be a part of our project to bring honor to Carman's legacy and contribute by creating a soundtrack that Carman would be very proud of.SCRIPT & PRODUCTION:Carman and I carefully considered some accomplished screenwriters, directors, and additional producers who we felt would do a great job bringing his story to the big screen. I am happy to say that we have made some of these decisions. The writers are very familiar with Carman's ministry and music business all the way through his life. And here's the BIG NEWS: The script is FINISHED! We even have the shooting schedule and plan to be filming SUMMER of '22!We cannot yet divulge who this next person is but we are in talks with an Academy Award-winning director to join us as an executive producer. As we get new information, we will be updating you. Gathering the team and crew is something that we largely have done already, but as I'm sure you can imagine, it is a process and we are SO EXCITED about the level of interest from some of the most accomplished movie industry professionals!CAST and CREW:The obvious elephant in the room is... "WHO'S GOING TO PLAY CARMAN?" Well, we will need three actors to cover various ages. We knew we needed someone very special to play him for the majority of the film and decided to do a nationwide casting call for this Italian Stallion. We do have someone in mind to play his older brother Mario, and all I can tell you is that you have seen him a lot! When I called Carman to tell him, he shouted his name and said, "I THINK HE COULD PULL IT OFF!" We did have discussions about the rest of the cast, and since this largely has to do with coordinating shooting schedules with theirs, we will be flexible while only hiring top-tier talent. We will update you as these decisions are made. Experienced crew members are being rounded up as we speak, and we plan to shoot in New Jersey and Tennessee.

story:
Message from the director

My rescue dog, Leo (aka Lord Leopold) and I, would like to thank you for stopping by and finding out more about our effort to make a difference for strays! Even reading this is a huge step towards our goal of raising awareness and spreading the word.

We all have a list of things we're passionate about. On the top of my list are films and dogs. So, making a film about dog rescue just came naturally. I have been making films for a living, while also helping out in shelters for more than a decade, and the results so far have been nothing but rewarding. Several films I've worked on have been awarded in international festivals (check out IMDb for details, https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3408378), while some have been distributed to millions of households around the globe.

Yet, looking into the grateful eyes of a rescued dog is worth more than any award in the world! And that is why I want to make this film - to explain how the problem arises, celebrate the incredible work of volunteers out there and inspire more people to make a difference, any way they can: either by looking after their pets more responsibly, or by rescuing, or by supporting those who rescue, or simply by spreading the word (it helps!).

No matter who you are, where you come from, or what you do for a living, becoming a superhero for a cause takes nothing more than finding what you believe in and doing what you can to make a difference. I've found my calling, and would like you to come with me on this unforgettable journey. 

 

Audience engagement

The positive response we’ve had so far has been incredible, and the film has taken on a life of its own, developing into something much larger and more important. Though our digital strategy was only launched a few weeks ago, our project has received a massive reach and has grown  more impact than ever imagined, and this is just the beginning! Our recent posts on www.facebook.com/thestraystory received thousands of views and an impressive percentage of audience engagement. The project receives constant interest from media, and was recently featured extensively in an article by In-Cyprus, https://in-cyprus.com/a-cypriot-dogumentary-aiming-to-become-global/, which prompted numerous radio and TV shows in Europe to present our project. Follow us on facebook for updates!

 

Some of our featured volunteers

Andreea Roseti - Translator / Events Organizer - Sibiu, Romania

Andreea has been voluntarily helping stray dogs for the last 11 years and is now the President of Animal Life in Sibiu, a developed area of Romania. Legislation allows for the capture and killing of dogs, which certain individuals have taken advantage of for profit, receiving high payments by local authorities for each dog they capture and kill. 

Nicos Kountouris - Air Traffic controller - Nicosia, Cyprus

Through a primary school education program on companion animal welfare, Nicos aims to decrease the numbers of strays and incidents of animal abuse in Cyprus. He also lobbies for new companion animal legislation. He is the director of the NGO Zootropion Humane Education Society Against Animal Cruelty.  

Norma Torres - Forensic Neuropsychologist - Gadsden, FL and Puerto Rico

Norma was the first to introduce pet therapy within the prison system, healing abused animals and people. She lives in Gadsden, known for animal abuse and dogfights. She is the founder/director of the NGO youcanmakeadifference.inc, and aids both people and animals stricken by the hurricanes in Florida and in her homeland, Puerto Rico.  

Takis Proestakis - Former Dentist / Night club owner - Crete, Greece

Takis quit his job in 2012 to open his own 6 sq. km shelter in Ierapetra, Crete. Also known as "the Saint of dogs", he runs a vivid social media campaign in order to acquire donations and support. Local authorities in his area do little to help, while many of his fellow citizens continue to abandon and mistreat animals.  
  
          

What We Need

"Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success." - Henry Ford

This has been my passion project for several years, with footage dating from as early as 2014 and with all expenses covered by myself, with the kind generosity of fellow film-makers (who either worked voluntarily or with discounted fees), friends and family. With their help, I have so far filmed extensively with selected volunteers from Cyprus, Romania and the U.K. We are pretty much half-way through filming.

But there's much more that needs to be done before the film can be released:

  • Traveling to Florida, U.S.A. to film our featured volunteer and her shelter
  • Traveling to Crete, Greece, to film our feature volunteer and his shelter
  • Proceeding with an assembly edit, to establish any need for additional filming
  • Complementary filming (if required)
  • Post-production: Final editing, color grading, sound design, music scoring, up-scaling etc.
  • Promotion and distribution to festivals (spreading the word as widely as possible is why we do this!)

As you can see, completing this film requires that the expenses of traveling, accommodation, filming, insurance, post-production and distribution are covered. And for these, your much appreciated contribution, no matter how small, would make a huge difference towards realizing our goal.

 

What You Get

"If you would not be forgotten as soon as you're dead, either write something worth reading, or do something worth writing." - Benjamin Franklin

Films have a long-lasting impact, and so do animal welfare causes. This project merges both, and by contributing, your name (or your beloved pet's name and photo) will live on for years on end through the end credits of our widely disseminated film.

Additionally, we have put together a wonderful series of perks, as thanks for your valuable contribution and as a reminder of how you've made a difference to the lives of dogs and their rescuers. Go ahead and find out more by checking our individual perks, and watch out for flash sales and limited offers!

Ultimately though, the most important gift you get in return for your contribution is knowing that you have made a difference for the two hundred million stray dogs out there. Now, can you picture that many loving puppy eyes smiling at you gratefully? Yup, it's overwhelming, and it's all because of you!

 

The Impact

"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." - Nelson Mandela

Our project is a social contribution initiative - one that aims to encourage change through positive example and success stories, with a global reach. The inspirational work of featured volunteers from all over the world, sets forth key issues and simple solutions which can really go a long way. Among other, the documentary sheds light on:

  • what it means to volunteer - forever grateful rescuees vs. people taking rescuers for granted
  • responsible pet handling - a pet is for life and deserves a loving home!
  • animal welfare educational programs - shaping people's views and behavior
  • the connection between animal abuse and criminal behavior
  • consumerism and its impact on every living creature's quality of life
  • the importance of comprehensive legislation and of its implementation
  • controlled breeding / reproduction - many strays are thrown-away litter
  • spaying / neutering - it can save lives and keep your pet healthy
  • name-tagging / microchipping - making sure your pets find their way home safely
  • adopt, don't shop! - animals shouldn't be sold! Open your home to a rescued dog instead
  • what to do if you find a stray dog - understanding body language - do you speak dog? 
  • no-kill policy - adopt shelter dogs, to give other dogs a second chance in life
  • how one can help the cause - fostering, fundraising, educating, donating

 

Risks & Challenges

"To make a film is easy; to make a good film is war; to make a very good film is a miracle." Alejandro González Iñárritu.

What we want to make is nothing short of a miracle, and that requires time, money, hard work and tons of patience, commitment and perseverance. But most importantly, it requires skill and passion, and we feel we've got what it takes to make it happen.

That means that some of your perks (such as the digital link to the finished film) may take some time to reach you, depending on when the film will be completed. We are estimating that by the end of 2020, we will have reached our goal.

As a passion project, this film is all about communicating something important and reconnecting people with each other and with the world around them.  What we would like is for the film to reach as wide an audience as possible, whether that means box office success or online dissemination. 

Films cost a lot to be produced, and sometimes never make any profit - documentaries even less so. There's some truth in the joke "if you want to be a millionaire, all you have to do is be a billionaire who's made a film". But even if this film never makes any profit, this does not affect any of your perks. You can rest assured that the film will be completed and all the perks will be distributed as promised. And, if all goes well (fingers crossed!), 50% of net proceeds will be donated to shelters.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

"Optimism is a strategy for making a better future. Because, unless you believe that the future can be better, it's unlikely you will step up and take responsibility for making it so. [...] The choice is yours" - Noam Chomsky

The main goal of this project is to encourage change by raising awareness. Which means that, whether you can donate or not, there are still numerous ways you can join this cause and help us make a difference.

First of all,  you can get the word out and make some noise about our cause, by

  • sharing a link of this campaign on your social media or via email
  • using Indiegogo's share tools to help us promote the campaign
  • liking and sharing our facebook page, www.facebook.com/thestraystory
  • sharing our website, www.thestraystory.com

Additionally, feel free to contact us if you would like to:

  • volunteer for our project (media exposure, film-making or other services)
  • send us footage of you and your dogs - it may find its way into our film!
  • share your rescue story with us (we love listening to success stories!)
  • share your opinions and ideas - because "none of us is as smart as all of us" (K. Blanchard)
  • offer your services or donate in-kind (flights, accommodation, post-production  etc.)
  • provide us with constructive criticism (it is always very much appreciated!)
  • give us some encouragement (long projects require a lot of stamina)

Last but not least, you can become a volunteer for any cause you believe in, and be the change you want to see in the world!

Thanks again for taking the time to view our campaign!

story:
Current Status 

FISH & MEN is the most ambitious documentary film to tell the story of how the globalized seafood industry impacts all of us - including our public health. We've been working on this film since 2013 to make an epic story of the American fisherman and how we view seafood.

After our successful Kickstarter campaign and some generous support, the project has been self-funded by the two co-directors who each risked their personal savings to get here.

We've captured amazing personal stories of fishermen - the heart of our story - along with inspiring entrepreneurs, authors and some of the most celebrated chefs in the world. 

We are now at the most critical point in post-production where we need funding to help get this film to the finish line so that we can premiere in October or November 2019!  

What We Need & What You Get

  • Post-production on feature docs is often 65% of the budget - for us, it's $200K +
  • Our goal is to raise $50,000 to help cover most our remaining costs to finish
  • If we meet our $50K goal, we have stretch goals to hit $75K and $100K   
  • Our contributors have some great perks options as supporters of FISH & MEN 
 

What Your Contributions Fund:

  • Editing, Graphics, Archival, Original Score, Sound Design/Mix, Color Correction, Legal
  • Stretch Goals: Footage & Music Licensing, Film Festival Marketing, PR Strategy and Campaign, Website Redesign 
  • Supporters get updates, social mentions, digital downloads, screenings and film credits

 

The more we raise, the more we can promote this film and influence change on a mass scale. 

 

The Story

For centuries, cod fed the world and helped build a nation. Nowhere was that more so than in Gloucester, Massachusetts - America's oldest fishing port. But, today all that has changed... 

From California to Maine, small fishing communities struggle to survive. The iconic American fisherman is in a perfect storm of foreign competition, erratic regulations and rising costs.

Foreign fish is flooding the United States. In fact, 91% of the seafood we eat is imported, sold in restaurants and grocery stores - over six billion pounds a year.

Only 1% of seafood imported into the U.S. is inspected. Of that, 51% is discarded for things like filth and not meeting U.S. health standards.    

The American Seafood Diet: Top 5 

  • #1: Shrimp (90% is farm-raised in Asia from India, Thailand, Vietnam, etc.) 
  • #2: Salmon (75% is farm-raised in Norway, Canada, etc.)
  • #3: Canned Tuna (90% coming from Asia such as Thailand, Indonesia, etc.)
  • #4: Tilapia (62% is farm-raised in China)
  • #5: Pollock (harvested in Alaska and processed into products like fish sticks, etc.)
 

Know Where Your Seafood Comes From

America has more coastline and fishing grounds than any other country in the world. The bounty of healthy fish that could be sustainably harvested in the United States is more than enough to feed us, yet lesser known species have little market appeal to consumers.

A new movement is underway – a sustainable opportunity for both fish and fishermen.

Thriving on local communities, pioneering fishermen and chefs are working together to build a revolutionary new model - a ‘Catch of the Day’ revival where supply trumps demand. 

Chefs are introducing consumers to discover new varieties of sustainable and storied seafood.

School lunch programs are sourcing fresh, local fish to provide healthy seafood to students.

While programs like Dock to Dish are reconnecting us to those who harvest from the sea. 

The future of fishermen and our access to healthy, sustainable seafood begins now with you. 

 

    The Impact

    We hope the fishing families and pioneers featured in this film will inspire a movement to:

    • Encourage Americans to consume more domestically harvested seafood products
    • Enable family-operated, artisanal fishing communities to thrive and prosper
    • Enact policies to safeguard public health by testing imported seafood into the U.S.

     

    Your contribution will raise awareness to help preserve our American fishing communities!

     

    Make Some Noise

    Follow us on social media and share the FISH & MEN campaign with your network.

    FACEBOOK: @fishandmen

    TWITTER: @FishnMen

    INSTAGRAM: @fishnmen

#5: Pollock (harvested in Alaska and processed into products like fish sticks, etc.)
 Know Where Your Seafood Comes From

America has more coastline and fishing grounds than any other country in the world. The bounty of healthy fish that could be sustainably harvested in the United States is more than enough to feed us, yet lesser known species have little market appeal to consumers.

A new movement is underway – a sustainable opportunity for both fish and fishermen.

Thriving on local communities, pioneering fishermen and chefs are working together to build a revolutionary new model - a ‘Catch of the Day’ revival where supply trumps demand. 

Chefs are introducing consumers to discover new varieties of sustainable and storied seafood.

School lunch programs are sourcing fresh, local fish to provide healthy seafood to students.

While programs like Dock to Dish are reconnecting us to those who harvest from the sea. 

The future of fishermen and our access to healthy, sustainable seafood begins now with you. 
 



The Impact
We hope the fishing families and pioneers featured in this film will inspire a movement to:

Encourage Americans to consume more domestically harvested seafood products
Enable family-operated, artisanal fishing communities to thrive and prosper
Enact policies to safeguard public health by testing imported seafood into the U.S.

 
Your contribution will raise awareness to help preserve our American fishing communities!

 
Make Some Noise
Follow us on social media and share the FISH & MEN campaign with your network.
FACEBOOK: @fishandmen
TWITTER: @FishnMen
INSTAGRAM: @fishnmen

story:
They say.. "You cross paths with at least 20 killers in your lifetime and don't even know it" Well, this time you will...

 

Meet the Director Thomas Walton 

 

 

Thomas Walton is a Writer, Director, Producer and an Actor. Walton got started in the late 90's as an Actor and has appeared in numerous TV shows and films. Walton focused his energy into making films and had since two scripts over at the prestigious ICM Partners with the late Jack Gilardi. Walton honed his craft by making short films. One in particular (Booked) which debuted at the famed New York International Film Festival. From there he went into feature films. His latest feature film completed is the horror film Room 9. It stars: Kane Hodder, Michael Berryman and Scout Taylor-Compton.

 

Meet the Producer Jared Safier 

 

Jared Safier is a 4 Time Emmy Award Winning Producer who has produced a variety of films and series with numerous Oscar, Emmy and Golden Globe winning actors and actresses. Jared is a member of the Producers Guild of America and the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences. 

 

Meet the Cast : 

Lauren Francesca in an actress and social media personality and Youtube. She is know for your youtube channel Iwantmylauren. She recently stared in the upcoming horror film Scream Bloody Murder.

Nikki Baker "Your Favorite Nikki"

 

 

Welcome Executive Producer:

Jackson started his career in entertainment at the early age of 6 years old reading local box scores on the radio while growing up outside of Pittsburgh, PA. After college, and a stint doing stand up comedy he moved to Television hosting "After Dark" and "Beers with Jacks & Ned". Loving being in front of the camera, he transitioned to starring in over 20 locals commercials. Now, after a brief 20 year hiatus Jackson is hoping to make his mark in the film industry.

 

**FILM SHOOTS LOCATIONS & DATES TBD**

story:
Overview

Sissy is a deeply personal story based on my relationship with my sister and the shared events of our past that have both forged and tested our bond.  When I tell people about our story, their jaws drop, and I often hear, “This should be a movie!”  After two plus years of working on the feature script, visualizing the film, and planning the production, we are ready to make that a reality. The first step is directing this short film version of Sissy to communicate my vision for the feature. 

While the short film shares characters, themes and dilemmas with the feature film, it's not pulled directly from the feature script.  This short film version of Sissy will stand alone as its own complete story. 

It's a scene between the sisters in a psychiatric hospital, after Elizabeth has found Mary homeless in a Denver winter, disheveled and disoriented.  Can Elizabeth even help Mary at this point, or is she too far gone?  Does Mary even want her help?  Should Elizabeth decide to become Mary's legal guardian since her parents won't?  Or maybe she should do it for other reasons?  There are no easy answers as two women navigate their unusual relationship and try to understand their past and decide their future. 

Our team has connections to top industry talent and producers who can ensure Sissy, the feature film, will get made and be seen by audiences worldwide.  The script is ready.  Our pitch is ready.  The only hitch in the plan is that Shannon has yet to formally direct anything on film.  Our main objective with this short film version of Sissy is to show those A-listers that Shannon has a compelling vision and is the right person to bring the larger story to life.  Your support will help Shannon take the next leap toward becoming the storyteller she's always longed to be and ensure the feature film is made with her at the helm.  In addition, we will be submitting the short to festivals and seeking distribution so people all over the world can enjoy this short film that you helped to create.  

The Team 

Shannon received her B.A. in theater from the University of Southern California in 2002 and has been working as an actress ever since.  Along with producing partners Charlie Hofheimer and Derin Turner, she founded the production company Filament Features in 2009.  With Filament, she has produced and co-written numerous projects, including viral music videos, award and competition winning short films, and worldwide distributed feature films.  In addition to Sissy, she has written two other feature films, To Be With You and Into the Dark, and co-written two others, Freed and Followers.

Charlie’s first producing venture, Against the Current, starred Joseph Fiennes and Mary Tyler Moore and world premiered at Sundance 2009.   Shortly thereafter, Charlie started Filament Features to produce projects across the media spectrum.  Filament has completed thirty-two short format productions and partnered on four feature length films.  Charlie has directed two short films, Baggage and Home.  In addition to Sissy, Charlie is currently developing the independent feature Followers, which he will direct.  Charlie has been a professional actor for thirty years and has worked on projects of all scales, including over a dozen independent feature films of similar scope to Sissy.  

Berman Fenelus is an award winning Producer/Director based in New York City with 20 years of professional experience.  He has made it his mission to create and produce unique, visually stimulating stories about diverse communities that mainstream Hollywood tends to neglect.  He is currently Senior Content Producer at understood.org.  He has directed and shot for Maybelline, Adidas X FinishLine, Tide, Toyota, and McDonalds.  In 2020, Berman won an Emmy for directing Spell It Out, a PSA about food allergies.  Through his production company All Area Crew, he has also produced award-winning short films and documentaries including Kojo, LANA, and SELFie.

Creative Vision

Sissy explores themes of family and self-realization as Elizabeth and Mary begin to overcome their traumas by facing each other.  We will experience this story through Elizabeth's eyes.  The movie will often assume her first person perspective, and the camera will be handheld, communicating her tumultuous inner state and the uncertainty of her journey. The look of the film will be cold, grimy, and sometimes gruesome.  Low-key lighting will reflect Elizabeth's psychology.  Muted colors with a blue undertone will pervade, except in flashback scenes between the sisters, where warmer, more saturated tones will communicate Elizabeth and Mary's bond and the hope therein. Scenes from Elizabeth's past will be shot on 16mm film, conveying her nostalgic longing to reclaim her childhood.

Our filmmaking process will allow for long takes and improvisation so the actresses can fully inhabit each moment.  Together we will make certain both women are flawed, relatable humans whose choices will build to an emotional climax and inconvenient, unexpected, yet hopeful resolution.  Sissy will leave the audience in an ethical bind, wrestling with the limits and responsibilities of this unusual relationship.  

We expect pre-production to begin starting February of 2021.  We will shoot over a three day period in mid-March.  Post-production will commence immediately after production ends and last for 2-3 months.  The film is expected to be completed in early June 2021.

Why Invest in SISSY?

Sissy is a female driven, suspenseful, family drama that will appeal especially to mothers, daughters, and sisters 25+.  Elizabeth's struggle to balance her responsibilities to family with her personal ambition is a relatable and contemporary issue facing many women.  The film will also be directly relatable to disabled individuals and their families.  This community is underrepresented in film.  According to the CDC, in the United States about 17% of children aged 3-17 years have one or more developmental disabilities.  Sissy deals with struggles that face this community, including mental health, homelessness, and inadequate healthcare, at a moment in time when culture is hotly debating these issues.  By casting Mary from the community of disabled actors and by receiving script consultation from Christine Bruno, as well as Shannon's sister Erin, Sissy will be inclusive of individuals who have been historically overlooked in both subject matter and execution. 

Even with difficult subject matter, Sissy is uplifting.  It inspires us to face our unresolved past and reminds us that love can heal any wound.   

Comparable Films

What We Need and Why We Need It

We need to raise financing to pay for production and post production costs like: 

  • paying the cast and crew and contributing to their various union pension and health plans 
  • transporting and housing some cast and crew members
  • feeding the cast and crew 
  • location rental
  • equipment rental
  • legal fees
  • general liability and worker's compensation insurance

Also, a sizable portion of the budget is going toward complying with covid-19 regulations, including quarantining certain cast members who will travel for the production, testing all cast and crew prior to filming, providing PPE while working, and hiring a dedicated Covid Compliance Officer who's sole job is to ensure the production adheres to our unions' Zone system, protocols designed to keep everyone on set safe from the spread of covid-19.  

Shannon and Charlie are not taking a penny from the capital raised.  Every dollar will exclusively fund the filming and completion of the project.     

What You Get for Your Contribution

We don't imagine you're considering contributing to this project because you want a mug or a t-shirt.  Our guess is you want to be a piece of the puzzle and help complete the picture.  So our perks are all about including you in the experience of making Sissy and bringing you into our filmmaking process. 

In addition to social media shout outs or a credit in the Special Thank You section of the credits, you can get:                 

  • A Digital Download of the Film       
  • Autographed Copies of the Original Script so you can compare what was on the page to the final product 
  • The Director's Storyboards, the physical blue print for how she intends to construct the film 
  • We will let you behind the scenes via a live stream so you can see how the film is made   
  • Exclusive Filmmaking Session with the Producers     
  • Associate Producer Credit and participation in a pre-production meeting         
  • Executive Producer Credit and a visit to the set so you can experience the action in person    

No matter how much you want to contribute, we want to share this epic moment with you.     

We know this is a difficult time as a global pandemic has affected so many of us.  So if you aren't able to contribute at the moment, sharing the project with your family, friends, and followers would help us spread the word and would be very much appreciated.  Please use this Indiegogo share tool: https://igg.me/at/sissy-short-film

Risks and Challenges

While Shannon and Charlie have completed 100% of the projects they have taken into production, there are, of course, always many challenges to making a film - even a short film.   When dealing with the many variables of film production on a limited budget, there can sometimes be unexpected delays.  For example, unforeseen Covid 19 shut downs could arise and postpone our delivery.  If a lockdown does occur, we will continue our pre-production phase and use the time to prepare even more.  

We greatly appreciate the time you've taken to consider supporting our film and artistic growth!  Help us give you a one of a kind piece of cinema that you will be proud to have had a hand in making.

story:
WHAT IS MONTAUK77?

The simple answer...MONTAUK77 is a feature film written by Michael Scully and his daughter, Michayla. Now in pre-production, MONTAUK77 is scheduled to begin shooting in March of 2021.

The REAL answer...MONTAUK77 is a passion project of filmmaker, Michael Scully of Island Long Productions. Serving as writer, director and performer on the film, Michael's 20+ years of experience in writing, directing, and editing short films, music videos, television commercials, corporate & other promotional videos, etc. has ALL LED TO THIS...his FIRST FEATURE FILM.

 

WHAT IS THE FILM ABOUT?

MONTAUK77 tells the story of Harry, a middle aged, "down on his luck" rideshare driver whose day begins like any other. That is, until he meets his next passenger, a snarky, fifteen year old girl named Liz who hires Harry to drive her out to the beaches at Montauk Point, Long Island for the purposes of laying her late mother's remains to rest.

Little does Harry know, at the end of their day's long journey, his young passenger has an ulterior motive. Realizing her driver's questionable past, Liz intends to recruit Harry's help and ask him to pull off a risky bank heist...prompting Harry to question whether their meeting was by chance, or perhaps, destiny.

Mixing light drama with a bit of comedy, this road trip (turned bank heist) film also serves as story about coping with loss and seeking forgiveness...particularly from oneself. 

 

WHAT IS THE FILM'S INTENT?

We intend MONTAUK77 to make its way to the film festival circuit as early as summer 2021 where we will seek distribution on either an "ON DEMAND" platform (ie: NETFLIX, AMAZON, etc.) or as a theatrical release.

 

HOW WILL MONTAUK77 GO FROM A PASSION PROJECT TO A THEATER NEAR YOU?

With YOUR help, of course!

Although Michael's plan for MONTAUK77 always intended to keep a realistic perspective in terms of budget (as its story was specifically written to mostly utilize accessible and/or free talent, locations, equipment, etc.), funds are still needed to help bolster this production.

With a basement level, micro-budget of $25,000, MONTAUK77 will resourcefully allocate its acquired contributions with priority given to the following:

  • Food, transportation and lodging for crew
  • Additional equipment rental costs
  • Additional talent & location fees
  • Post-production costs
  • Marketing & festival fees

 

WHY SHOULD YOU CONTRIBUTE?

Have you ever been a part of the making of a movie? No? Well, this is your chance to not only help support independent film and its artists, BUT it's also a way for YOU to be directly involved with the production and see the results of your contribution (and, perhaps, even YOUR NAME) forever immortalized up on the silver screen!

AND, if that's not enough...we also have PERKS available to purchase!!!                                         (see below for more info.)

 

HOW CAN YOU CONTRIBUTE?

There are TWO ways you can make a contribution:

  • TRADITIONAL MONETARY CONTRIBUTION
  • PURCHASING A PERK

 

In either case, you'll begin by clicking on the pink "BACK IT" button near the top of this page. On the next page you'll be able to choose whether to fill out a monetary contribution of your choosing, or, make a purchase from the selection of PERKS listed on the page. Once you've entered your selection, you will be taken to a page where you will complete your order.

 

WHAT PERKS ARE BEING OFFERED?

For those contributors looking for a tangible souvenir to remember their role in the production, we're offering many great PERKS which include the following:

  • Social Media 'Thank You'
  • 'Thank You' with your name listed in closing credits of film
  • Bumper Stickers
  • T-Shirts & Hoodies
  • Associate Producer credits
  • Producer credits
  • Executive Producer credits

 

WHAT HAPPENS IF FILM IS UNDERFUNDED?

Although we believe MONTAUK77 will run a successful campaign and raise enough of our goal to create a memorable feature film, the following alternatives will be considered if contributions fail to ease the current budget: 

  • Cuts made to non-essential scenes
  • Deletion of non-essential scenes
  • Produce a portion of the film & launch additional campaign
  • Delay production & launch additional campaign
  • Produce film as a short

 

HOW ELSE CAN I CONTRIBUTE TO MONTAUK77?

Not everyone can make a financial contribution to MONTAUK77, but you can still help support the film by following and sharing its progress on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter with your family and friends! You can find out more about MONTAUK77 by visiting the following:

  • www.facebook.com/montauk77film
  • www.twitter.com/montauk77film
  • www.instagram.com/montauk77film
  • www.montauk77film.com
