Although we believe MONTAUK77 will run a successful campaign and raise enough of our goal to create a memorable feature film, the following alternatives will be considered if contributions fail to ease the current budget: 

Cuts made to non-essential scenes
Deletion of non-essential scenes
Produce a portion of the film & launch additional campaign
Delay production & launch additional campaign
Produce film as a short


 
HOW ELSE CAN I CONTRIBUTE TO MONTAUK77?
Not everyone can make a financial contribution to MONTAUK77, but you can still help support the film by following and sharing its progress on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter with your family and friends! You can find out more about MONTAUK77 by visiting the following:

www.facebook.com/montauk77film
www.twitter.com/montauk77film
www.instagram.com/montauk77film
www.montauk77film.com

story:
What is this?

From the original proof of concept “The Goddamn Proof of Concept” comes the ambition for a 20 min pilot episode! Student Affairs. An outlandish bold high energy Sitcom dedicated to highlighting the real shit young people go through every day. Follow 5 college friends, with manic personalities, who always end up dealing with each other’s selfish motives, and poor choices, all while maneuvering through their day-to-day lives.

 

Tell me about the show 

The most entertaining aspects of college always take place outside of the university, but an entertaining experience doesn’t always mean a good one.  As Seinfeld grounded its humor in everyday situations for adults who make poor choices, Student Affairs seeks to find humor in everyday situations for young adults.

Characters

Caster: Male. Strong-willed, and sociable.  On the quiet side and a bit reserved, but not to a point where he’s awkward.  Very passive, few things go his way.  An unheard voice of reason in his friend group.  Typically sucked into dealing with other people’s problems.  Sometimes he lets his emotions get the best of him, which leads him to more trouble. Also, he’s gay but that doesn’t define his personality.

 

Britney: Female, Very self-centered, and loud. Will usually do things that are to her benefit. She's either zero or one hundred, there’s not much room for a middle ground with her. She is pushy. A loyal friend who will do anything for the people she likes to tolerate, even if it’s the wrong course of action. In her mind, she is always right.

 

Jordyn: Female, Roommate, Wild and wacky. Chaotic energy all the time. Obsessed with her long-distance boyfriend (Will Fredo) She has no filter and is extremely spontaneous. She’s secretly really smart but you would never know because she’s always on her phone. She always has a comment, even if it’s not relevant.  

 

Chase: Male, Roommate(?) And friend. Like if Creed from the Office was partly James Bond. Very accepting, even in the strangest situations. Chase is skillful, but definitely not the brightest bulb in the group. He will have spontaneous outbursts caused by saying: I’ve said too much. Chase prefers to be a mystery to his friend group. In his best-case scenario, he’s kinda just there.

 

Victoria: Female, The Pure one.  She is very inexperienced in life but is somehow able to handle herself around others. She may be the most normal out of all the group, but to her friends, she's the oddball. She can be a bit naive at times but is not dumb by any means. Her reactions are not as big as others around her. She is dependent on the group to have fun. In high school, she was the type of girl who did not go out because of the risks, but now that she’s in college, and she wants to go on a few adventures.

 

Cast

What’s this pilot about?

Our first full-length episode will consist of an A and B storyline Britney’s parents come into town, but she can’t stand them.  After Caster realizes he has no money, he devises a plan to be her buffer, this way, he gets a free meal.  Unfortunately, Britney leaves Caster alone with her parents and he discovers why she can’t stand them. Meanwhile, Chase, Jordyn, and Victoria feel left out and decide to have a fancy dinner of their own.  However, they’re poor college students and have limited options.  Chase warns them to prevent chaos from ensuing they’ll have to get food soon or he’s going to get: Hangary. 

Crew

 

What’s the goal?

Parents aren't always easy. Everyone knows someone who just doesn't understand what's ok to say, or even worse, does know but doesn't care. Whether it be your Dad saying those off-color remarks, or your mom who makes those assumptions based on stereotypes. Our goal with this episode is to bring light and humor to the relationships people have with difficult parents who claim to be too old to change with the world.

 

Many shows today struggle to reach out to and capture a younger audience. This is because generational humor is just for that, the generation. And as we move forward into the next generation we understand how to utilize Defeatist, spontaneous, and reflective humor because we’ve lived through it. Our experiences allow us to relate to the up-and-coming adults. At the moment, certain issues overwhelm our thoughts, but in retrospect, these issues are always something to laugh about. Our generation struggles with letting go and laughing about it. We know it first hand. What our show gives others is that scapegoat for people our age to laugh about an embarrassing moment or that poor choice. Misery is comedy

 

Budget!

 

How’s it going to look?

Our show will present a look that is bright, airy, and colorful, all while utilizing depressive real and dark humorous themes. The clashing of these two tones will enhance the comedy within each episode.   

For the future

Of course, we have aspirations for this project. In the short term, we would love to submit this to festivals as well as continue pursuing our other episode ideas. The ultimate goal would be to pitch this show and become a series showcasing an under-represented audience, young people.

 

THANK YOU

story:
Golden Handcuffs

The Origin

I worked in the Legal Department at Warner Bros. for almost two years and had the amazing opporuntiy to work for incredibly smart and talented attorneys. However, their stories about corporate legal life prior to working at Warner Bros. would give anyone nightmares.

My boss at the time, who's now a good friend of mine, used to tell me that working in big law is like being in a pie eating contest where the winner wins more pie. One day, I was watching a pie eating contest and saw that they had their hands handcuffed behind them to participate.

Then it all clicked. Pun intended. I wrote the script immediately after and have only received positive feedback. Now, I'm taking the plunge and trying to throw this together. Learning to spin plates as I go.

Why Do It?

It's safe to say after pondering this concept for a while, I realized that I haven't seen anything quite like it. And after assembling everything I need, I can see why! It's a great idea, sure. But executing it correctly will push me to the edge of my creative ability and all the skills I've been developing over many years.

So in short, the reason why I'm making this, is to not only make something worth talking about, but to do something new and risky. For my growth, and everyone involved.

I've got to really get my feet wet. I might as well just dive in head first. Hopefully it's not the shallow end...

The Future

I wouldn't be able to do this without all of you. It goes without saying, I'd owe you favors for life. (I'm really good at housesitting mansions just FYI). I wish I could give a guarantee of what will happen when it's finally finished. I'm hoping festivals. Worst case scenario it's something fun to put on LinkedIn. But I'm banking on entering some festivals.

With all that being said, thank you so much for reading this all and any contribution and support would be extremely appreciated!

story:
NEW PERK ADDED!!!

Send us a photo of your face and we will animate it to appear in the credit sequence in TERROR TOONS 4.

(ONLY 20 SLOTS ARE AVAILABLE SO HURRY

AND GET YOURS TODAY)

 
 

WELCOME TO THE TERROR TOONS UNIVERSE!

Terror Toons was first conceived and released in 2001, by creators, Joe Castro and Steven Escobar.

The franchise has spanned 2 sequels since and now, in its final film, TERROR TOONS 4. 

60% of the final sequel has been filmed and we are now finishing up the final climatic sequence and want our fans to be part of the 20th Anniversary Release which will feature all 4 films in a LIMITED EDITION Terror Toons Box Set on DVD or Blu-Ray!

We are presenting to you, our FANS, fellow ACTORS, PRODUCERS, and CINEMA CONNOISSEURS, the opportunity to appear in TERROR TOONS 4, and/or become an Associate Producer, Producer, or Executive Producer on the film. This will also include a credit in the film and on the movie poster, as well as IMDB.

 

You will find many perks that will satisfy your taste including:

  • Special Thanks credit at the end of TERROR TOONS 4
  • Autographed TERROR TOONS 3 on DVD or Blu-Ray
  • Autographed TERROR TOONS 4 on DVD or Blu-Ray (Released once the film is complete)
  • The TERROR TOONS "QUADRILOGY" BOX SET on DVD or Blu-Ray
  • Dr. Carnage T-shirt
  • Max Assassin T-shirt
  • Get an exclusive on screen "Bloody Death" in TERROR TOONS 4
  • Act in a scene that BRINKE STEVENS appears in the film.
  • Act in a scene that LINNEA QUIGLEY appears in the film.
  • Act in a scene that DEBBIE ROCHON appears in the film.
  • Be in a scene with Dr. Carnage (DOUGLAS EPPS) in the film.
  • Get your own LIMITED EDITION, Dr. Carnage Rubber Mask from film.
  • Design an on screen kill with Joe Castro and appear in the film.
  • Be a Dr. Carnage victim on screen.
  • Get a crazy cartoon on screen decapitation and a mold of your head by Joe Castro and keep the head.

We have never offered our fans a chance to be part of the Terror Toons  franchise until now. And this will be your last and only opportunity to be forever part of the cult movie classic series!

 

 

TERROR TOONS 4

TERROR TOONS 4  is an American live action/animated horror movie directed by Joe Castro, produced by Steven Escobar and written by Rudy Balli, Brinke Stevens, & Joe Castro. The movie is an anthology based on the original TERROR TOONS with the same evil villains from the original movie: DR. CARNAGE & MAX ASSASSIN.

TERROR TOONS 4 will also include Brinke Stevens' directorial debut, PERSONAL DEMONS.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our primary goal for this campaign is to raise the funds to complete the quintessential vision based on the style of Warner Bros cartoons vs. Nightmare on Elm Street. By helping us reach this goal, we will be able to produce the special effects and visual style like Terror Toons was always meant to be seen. 2021 will be the 20th anniversary of the principal photography of  the original TERROR TOONS. Join our team and forever be apart of the history of cult horror cinema in the TERROR TOONS UNIVERSE.

Your name will forever be attached to the TERROR TOONS SERIES.

60% of the movie has already been completed and we are looking to invite you to be part of the Terror Toons finale, of the evil Dr. Carnage, as he battles our fans in the cartoon universe.

Funding for this campaign will go the 2 week shoot for these scenes and post-production costs (picture editing, sound effects editing, 5.1 sound mix, final deliverables for distributor, and DCP).

Also, perks will give fans one last chance to get their names in the credits of TERROR TOONS 4 and / or pre-order the "Quadrilogy," "Terror Toons 3" or "Terror Toons 4" on DVD/Blu-Ray. The funding raised by this campaign will also cover the cost of printing and shipping the DVD/Blu-Ray.
 

 

 

 

Founded in 2016, CINEMA FACTORY, INC was created by Emmy winner, Steven Escobar as a Motion Picture Production and Post-Production company.  Since 1997, Steven has partnered with Joe Castro and have produced feature films in the horror & science fiction genre.

Some titles include: Terror Toons, Terror Toons 2, Terror Toons 3, XENOPHOBIA, The Summer of Massacre (Guinness World Record Holder), Near Death, and Jackhammer, The Legend of the Chupacabra.
 

LINKS:

https://www.imdb.me/stevenescobar

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm0145581/

story:
The Movie

The Third is a feature film about a young couple, Buddy and Catherine, who have their Fourth of July holiday interrupted by the arrival of Catherine’s childhood friend. 

Behind the Lens

Manuel Lagos, Jr.  - Writer/Director

I grew up in rural Tennessee with very little entertainment but a whole lot of imagination. That creativity turned towards the family’s home video camera as I made goofy videos with my friends nearly every weekend. Something that started as a way to pass the time eventually became my lifelong obsession—filmmaking. 

I studied Motion Pictures at Belmont University and screened my thesis film at regional film festivals. Now, I work full-time in post-production, editing broadcast TV. But one thing remains from my childhood, in my free time, I continue to write short and feature films. 

As an independent filmmaker, I have to be intentional when choosing a project to bring to life. The Third, is a concoction of personal expression and practicality. Ultimately, I want to make feature films, so I wrote one that I could make with the resources I have access to and places I know. Or most of the resources I have access to. That’s where this campaign comes in...

The Money

I’ve found ways to fund my short films up until now, but this is a feature film. A lot more goes into this type of project and as a result, it’s more expensive. I’ve been able to raise two-thirds of the budget by getting creative with my own money and time but I need some help.

Although this is a modest film, I want to pull together a high-quality, super talented, face-meltingly, cool team on set. But to secure my cast and crew’s time, I need to compensate them. Raising this money will help me protect the budget that I’ve allocated for locations and production design while still guaranteeing the cast and crew’s time... and keeping them fed. 

While there are perks for donations of specific sizes, any amount truly helps. And if you can’t donate right now but still want to contribute, just sharing this campaign on social media would be a big help too.

Thank you! 

P.S. About that poster art...

The poster artwork was custom made by Jess Villarreal, a queer mixed media artist based in Seattle, WA. The image was made by hand using vintage magazines and ephemera collected and curated by the artist.

story:
"Turn Your Back To The Forest" is a short horror film about a young boy who strays from the path and encounters the witch Baba Yaga, he must escape her labyrinth house.

"A Feel Ing" is a short silent art film, A young woman's constant companion, the manifestation of depression

 

  • Two micro budget short film
  • We have completed filming (both) 
  • We are looking for funding for editing costs
  • We have an editor
  • IMDB credits as perks
  • Completed short films will be released on YouTube
  • We don't need £500. for this but that was the minimum Indiegogo campaign amount
  • Any extra funds will be put towards our next film (1st feature film)

 

Any questions feel free to ask.

story:
Short Summary

Bamby Salcedo, a nationwide recognized undocumented transgender Latina human rights activist, celebrates her 50th birthday celebration which is attended by many important people, including 49 women significant to her life and survival. As she prepares for her birthday celebration, Bamby travels through Los Angeles county and watches her life go past; from the streets where she smoked crack and the Men’s County Jail where she was raped to journalists, academics and activists she has enlisted to her causes, plush homes of supporters, and communities and organizations she has gathered to change the life of transgender people across the United States. The film reveals the great story of strength and joyful celebration of life that is powered by acceptance of the most painful past experiences to make a real difference for others and oneself.

Story Summary

Bamby Salcedo is turning 50 years old. For most people, a 50th birthday is a time of reflection. For Bamby, it is a moment to celebrate. In a society where transgender people face endemic violence, discrimination, and huge barriers to flourishing,as the life expectancy of a trans woman is 35 years,  survival to the age of 50 marks a real milestone. And Bamby is a true survivor: an HIV-positive, undocumented immigrant, victim of multiple sexual assaults, in recovery from drug addiction. Through her time as a sex worker and a life on the streets, she has emerged as one of the most nationally and internationally recognizable trans activists. She has won numerous community service awards, and earned a Master’s degree in Latin" studies. Bamby is a force of nature and an inspiration to many.

LA QueenCiañera follows Bamby as she prepares for her birthday celebration with characteristic activist energy: this event is not really about her, but rather a way to bring visibility and power to the populations she cares about:  trans folks, queer people, the homeless, incarcerated and the HIV positive. The party is a deliberate queering of a traditional Latinx ritual, a Quinceañera, in which a 15-year-old girl is “presented” to society as a young woman, typically by a family patriarch. Bamby’s party will have many of the trappings of the Quinceañera—decorations, Latin culture, music, and extravagant dresses—but without the patriarchal touches. In fact, this is a celebration of matriarchy, the 49 women who have been instrumental in Bamby’s survival and the ability to thrive. This celebration is one for the history books.

As she prepares for the big day, Bamby travels through Los Angeles, from the streets where she walked street corners and smoked crack, to journalists, activists and academics she has enlisted to her causes, to plush homes of supporters like Patricia Arquette and Rosario Dawson. Through this remarkable tour we see Bamby’s ability to connect with people, and join in a telling of her life story. She faces challenges from early on in life. Poverty is prevalent in her childhood in Mexico, a single mother working long hours. When her father leaves the family for the U.S., Bamby’s life becomes chaotic. She suffers psychological abuse from her mother and traumatic sexual abuse from her stepfather and as a teenager immigrates to the U.S. to re-unite with her birth father, who had formed a new family.

Bamby creates an alternative family in the city streets. She had struggling with her own trans identity since early childhood and now, surrounded by the anti-LGBT rhetoric of 1980s America, her life becomes fractured between school, gangs, and home. She embraces sex work, petty theft, drug abuse, and inevitable incarceration. After several visits to jails and prison, she discovers her positive HIV status, and begins a nihilist descent in hard drug addiction, sex work, and risky sexual encounters. Raw, revealing interviews with Bamby sketch this difficult personal history. After several close encounters with death, she admits herself to a rehabilitation center where she regains her state of mind and health.

Since the beginning her recovery journey at a treatment center, Bamby dedicates her life to helping others. In 2009 she founds the TransLatin@ Coalition, building visibility and a voice for the Trans Latinx community across the United States. Bamby also creates the nonprofit Angels of Change to address a severe lack of visibility and funding for the trans youth at children’s hospitals. As we explore the impact of these organizations and groups, we learn more about the severe hurdles faced by trans people everywhere—academics, journalists, activists, and community members explain the deep, structural barriers trans people face in their day-to-day lives.

We also follow Bamby through the byzantine immigration process. At one point, Bamby is scheduled for deportation, but her trans status earned her the protection of a “withholding of removal,” as the U.S. government recognized that returning Bamby to Mexico would be a likely death sentence. And, yet, ironically, as her immigration lawyer explains, that protected status also makes harder to establish her as a naturalized citizen. With her 50th approaching, Bamby tries to put an end to this years’ long legal battle, but it’s clear in the current political landscape of the U.S., her road to citizenship will be a long one.

It’s finally time for the celebration. As Bamby’s friends and family gather and reminisce, LA QueenCiañera highlights the hardships and the lessons Bamby has learned and how they have shaped her and her extended, chosen family. Dancing, great food and music paint a portrait of a vibrant community of artists, activists and individuals who celebrate.Bamby has come through hell, and rather than turning her back on that grim past and hold the pain close.  Bamby has chosen to put out hands to help others trying to make it through. We see the joy and freedom of gender, ethnic and sexual identities, broken free from the toxic structures of the past—the essential, the binary, the oppressively simple and uncomplicated. In the end, LA Queenciañera celebrates a justice only possible with the acceptance of fluidity and choice. Through continuous work and bravely leading with her truest self, Bamby comes to personify this brand of trans-feminism that comes through the hard work of knowing oneself and helping others push through blind social barriers.

Motivation

I met Bamby in the Summer of 2017. I was preparing a film dealing with the relevance of Latinas in U.S. society and I wanted to include a transgender woman in it.

Bamby was just one of eight characters in the film, but we developed a special bond and mutual admiration. After the film was completed, we kept on collaborating and I told her I wanted to make a film exclusively about her. I found that life story very inspiring, especially since Bamby is such a kind person. “One among many,” you might say. But I would not expect someone who has been raped, who has been beaten and humiliated over and over, who has struggled with addiction and homelessness, to be a kind person. Yet Bamby has a special aura around her, she has special powers. That is a quality I want to capture in Bamby, and this Queenciañera event—sassy and celebratory, yet still transgressive and activist—was the perfect opportunity.

Key Creative Personnel 

Pedro Peira, PhD (Director & Producer)

Pedro is a Fulbright scholar and filmmaker. He produced the feature documentary 'Soul' (Berlinale, 2017), which screened at Transylvania, Valladolid, Traverse City, and Haifa, amongst others. The film received distribution in North America and Japan, where it was theatrically released at 16 theaters. His first feature documentary as a director was 'Música Maestros' (2014), a movie on the positive effects of music on people with problems such as Parkinson’s disease or Down’s syndrome. In 2016, he completed a Ph.D. in film studies at Complutense University in Madrid and was awarded a Fulbright scholarship to study documentary at the New York Film Academy, Los Angeles branch. While in California, he directed five short documentaries focused on the Latino population in the U.S.: '(Latin) American Dream', 'Veterana', 'Trabajadores', 'Center Cut' and 'Españomics', which screened and won awards at numerous festivals, and which enabled him to return to Spain and consolidate his career as a director. Besides working on 'LA QueenCiañera', he's now producing the film 'Free Way', a personal-growth story of a mother and a son, considered amongst the world's top chefs.

Rosario Dawson (Executive Producer)

Rosario is an actress and producer. She started her film career with the picture Kids and, since then, has appeared in a wide spectrum of feature films such as Sin City, Grindhouse or Zombieland: Double Tap and TV shows like Jane the Virgin or Dare Devil. She has also been executive producer of the documentaries 'LA Woman Rising', 'The Need to Grow', 'The Deported' or 'Lost in America', all of which promote social change. Dawson is also an energetic political activist who fights for Latino’s and women’s rights by supporting charities like the Lower East Side Girls Club and the International Voto Latino, amongst others. She identifies as a member of the LGBT community and fights for their rights through her participation in Parents, Families and Friends of Lesbians and Gays (PFLAG).

Maria Roman (Executive Producer)

Maria has been a leader in social services for the transgender community in Los Angeles for over 20 years. She has worked with community organizations like the Liberty Hill Foundation, Los Angeles and West Hollywood Task Force, Transgender Advisory Committee, Alianza and the Los Angeles and West Hollywood Police Department Sensitivity Training Program. Among her many advocacy roles, Maria was a Presenter at the U.S. Conference on AIDS, and the Creating Change Conference. Maria is also an accomplished actor and performer. After appearing in the World's Most Beautiful Transsexual pageant in Las Vegas, she became one of the featured stars in the hit Showtime documentary 'Trantasia'. She also co-starred in Amazon's series 'Transparent' and appeared in the Tyra Banks Show or Entertainment Tonight, amongst others. Today Maria is an HIV Commissioner for the Los Angeles County and a Board member of the West Hollywood Advisory Board as well as the Vice President and Chief Operations Officer of the TransLatin@ Coalition.

Romas Ušakovas (Cinematographer)

Romas has a background in cinema and photography. He was educated at VGIK Cinema institute in Moscow, one of the oldest film schools in the world. He then moved to United States where he gained an M.F.A. degree and joined the film industry in Los Angeles. Romas served as a Director of Photography for a number of films that screened and earned awards in international film festivals around the world. His film Simon was selected to compete at the world’s top cinematography festival, Camerimage, receiving attention among the world’s top-tier cinematography community. Selected filmography: 'Hide and Seek' (Shiqi Huang, 2019), 'The Golden Scissors' (Maggie Le, 2019), 'Simón' (Diego Vicentini, 2018) & 'Españomics' (Pedro Peira, 2018).

Nacho Ruiz Capillas (Editor)

Nacho is a veteran editor of more than 100 titles. Winner of a Goya Award (Spanish equivalent of the Oscars). He's the editor of most of Alejandro Amenábar's films like 'The Others', with Nicole Kidman or 'Agora', starring Rachel Weisz.
He has also edited many of Fernando León de Aranoa's movies like 'A perfect day', with Benicio del Toro and Tim Robbins , 'Loving Pablo', starring Penélope Cruz and Javier Bardem, and 'Mondays in the sun", starring Javier Bardem. Additionally, he has been part of indie documentaries like 'Brain Matters', 'Boxing for Freedom' or 'Kafana, enough, already'.

Antoni M. March (Composer) 

Antonio is an award-winning Fulbright scholar and composer from Spain, currently based in Los Angeles. He was educated in Composition at the Royal Conservatory of Madrid and earned a master’s degree in Screen Scoring from the University of Southern California and the Film Scoring program at UCLA, where he was awarded the 2019 BMI/Jerry Goldsmith Film Scoring Scholarship. He has conducted and recorded his music at Warner Brothers Studios and 20th Century Fox Studios. In the last years, he has scored numerous short films produced in Los Angeles, London and Spain, as well as two feature documentaries. His film Lunch Ladies won 31 awards (including Best Soundtrack) and has screened in more than 100 film festivals around the world. His music has been heard in TV series and feature film productions from Spain, China and Mexico.

Fernando Marcilla (Motion Graphics Director)

Fernando is the founder and creative director of Monografo Estudio, a 7-year old animation and postproduction company. With his team, he has developed animations, illustrations and visual effects for numerous TV & film projects such as the awarded documentary feature Notes for a Heist Film, A World in Two Cities (National Geographic) and the series The Alcàsser’s Murders (Netflix).

 

Importance of the Campaign

Before meeting Bamby, I thought that transgender people just wanted to perform cosmetic changes in their bodies such as the individuals who undertake a nose or boob job in order to look better. After getting to know Bamby deeply, I realized that this issue goes beyond an aesthetic lift, it also affects the psychology of the person who happens to have been born in the wrong body.

Through this documentary, we want people to treat transgender people with respect, understand their situation, end the discrimination and eradicate gender-based transgender crime.

We invested our own funds to start the film as we had to rush to shoot Bamby's birthday. If we want to continue making the film, we just need a small "push" from people like you. It'll be worth it.

What We Need & What You Get

Prior to the Covid-19 crisis, we attended the Berlin Film Festival with a teaser for the film and met with sales agents, distributors, and festivals. We had positive meetings with top tier festival programmers, who loved our topic, our main character, and the birthday celebration story. We expect the film to be finished in January 2021.

Particularly, we hope to make it to Berlinale and opt for the Teddy Award, aimed at films with LGBT topics. Our director is an alumni of the festival as he participated in the 2006 Berlinale Talents Scheme and had a feature documentary in the festival in 2017 as a producer.

  • Where it's going?

The amount received will be spent in the following items:

One of these festivals is Sundance. What filmmaker hasn't dreamt about going to Sundance? We are aware that Sundance acceptance rate for documentaries is around 2% but everyone in our team is a dreamer, so we want to make it happen. Therefore, we want to send the film to the festival, before the August deadline is over

  • How much funding do we need?

In order to keep the project going, 20,000 € (US$ 22,000), are needed. This amount will ideally cover a portion of our post-production. We would like to spend it in video editing, animations, music and sound editing and mixing as follows:

- Animation 7,000 € (US$ 7,500): Animation is one of our tools for filling out the narrative and creating visual interest in the movie, so we will be hiring Monografo Studio, a high quality documentary animation studio best known for projects with  Netflix  or Santander, to recreate parts of Bamby's early years.

- Video Editing 5,500 € (US$ 6,000): We will partially cover the salary of our editor, Nacho Ruiz Capillas.

- Original Music 3,500 € (US$ 4,000): We will cover part of the salary of Antoni M. March, who will be composing an original score for the film,

- Sound Editing and Mix 4,000 € (US$ 4,500): We will cover part of the costs of the sound works and the salary of our re-recording mixer.

  • Our unique perks!

The Candle: leave your footprint.

The Paper Lantern: be one of the first to watch.

The Streamer: have your own QueenCiañera Party screening.

The Party Hat: try our Queen outfit.

The Music: want an autograph?

The Ice Cream: receive our famous "Thank you Video".

The Piñata: have dinner with us.

The Cake: be one of our VIP's.

The Present: become an Associate Producer.

The Birthday Girl/Boy: be our Exec Producer.

 

Impact & Value of the Project

We think that a part of society has become more tolerant and has embraced diversity but there’s another part which needs to be educated. We also hope that this film reaches them and helps them empathize.

Besides entertaining and informing, we also aim to raise awareness and hopefully make a change. English and Spanish languages coexist in the film and help it appeal to broader audiences, since the trans topic has a worldwide appeal. All her unexpected personal and academic triumphs, her bravery and immensity of humanity deliver us a message of motivation.

By making a contribution to our campaign, you'll be helping raise awareness for the trans community in order to integrate them into society so that they have the same opportunities. We believe making this documentary will be our contribution to making the world a better place. This inspiring personal-growth story has the potential to impact the audience in a compelling way.

Our engagement and social impact campaigns will reach out to underserved trans and Trans Latinx communities in a variety of targeted ways. The film is intended to inspire new perspectives and actions regarding the quality of Latinx and all transgender people in the US. Our close collaboration with equality activists committed to raising the visibility of trans people of color, especially Latinx people, is the first step to creating change through their protests. Through the film, more people could understand the struggles of the transgender community from within and therefore support the protests or form a positive public opinion.

Moreover, we plan a community screening campaign after the festival run for LGBTQ, Latinx, and equal rights activists with the aim to inspire transgender rights movements in the U.S. that would raise the visibility of the injustice the community is facing.

Regarding the connections we are planning to employ, we have engaged a vast number of prominent LGBTQ figures and allies such as Patricia Arquette and Rosario Dawson who are committed to supporting this campaign. Bamby’s organization TransLatin@ Coalition will also be an important partner in Southern California. We are exploring relationships with leading service organizations Lambda Legal, OutServe-SLDN, the Institute of Latino Policy and MANA, as well as a University-based screening and/or speaker series in partnerships with Queer and LGBT Resource Centers on select campuses with significant Latinx populations.

We are choosing to target the academic environment as we believe it is crucial to start open conversations in the learning environment to erase the fear of the unknown and influence the perspective of future generations, who would later become activists, thinkers, politicians, business owners, academics, and more. Our main hope is that this film will significantly contribute to the overall public mindset that according to Bamby is the first and most important step to the changes in governmental policies as well as acceptance of transgender people.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can:

- Follow us on Social Media and share!!

  • FACEBOOK http://www.facebook.com/laqueencianera
  • INSTAGRAM https://www.instagram.com/laqueencianera​
  • TWITTER https://twitter.com/laqueencianera

- Spread our Indiegogo campaign

  • Like on Indiegogo
  • Use the share tools

Short Summary
Bamby Salcedo, a nationwide recognized undocumented transgender Latina human rights activist, celebrates her 50th birthday celebration which is attended by many important people, including 49 women significant to her life and survival. As she prepares for her birthday celebration, Bamby travels through Los Angeles county and watches her life go past; from the streets where she smoked crack and the Men’s County Jail where she was raped to journalists, academics and activists she has enlisted to her causes, plush homes of supporters, and communities and organizations she has gathered to change the life of transgender people across the United States. The film reveals the great story of strength and joyful celebration of life that is powered by acceptance of the most painful past experiences to make a real difference for others and oneself.

Story Summary
Bamby Salcedo is turning 50 years old. For most people, a 50th birthday is a time of reflection. For Bamby, it is a moment to celebrate. In a society where transgender people face endemic violence, discrimination, and huge barriers to flourishing,as the life expectancy of a trans woman is 35 years,  survival to the age of 50 marks a real milestone. And Bamby is a true survivor: an HIV-positive, undocumented immigrant, victim of multiple sexual assaults, in recovery from drug addiction. Through her time as a sex worker and a life on the streets, she has emerged as one of the most nationally and internationally recognizable trans activists. She has won numerous community service awards, and earned a Master’s degree in Latin" studies. Bamby is a force of nature and an inspiration to many.
LA QueenCiañera follows Bamby as she prepares for her birthday celebration with characteristic activist energy: this event is not really about her, but rather a way to bring visibility and power to the populations she cares about:  trans folks, queer people, the homeless, incarcerated and the HIV positive. The party is a deliberate queering of a traditional Latinx ritual, a Quinceañera, in which a 15-year-old girl is “presented” to society as a young woman, typically by a family patriarch. Through continuous work and bravely leading with her truest self, Bamby comes to personify this brand of trans-feminism that comes through the hard work of knowing oneself and helping others push through blind social barriers.

All her unexpected personal and academic triumphs, her bravery and immensity of humanity deliver us a message of motivation.
By making a contribution to our campaign, you'll be helping raise awareness for the trans community in order to integrate them into society so that they have the same opportunities. We believe making this documentary will be our contribution to making the world a better place. This inspiring personal-growth story has the potential to impact the audience in a compelling way.

Our engagement and social impact campaigns will reach out to underserved trans and Trans Latinx communities in a variety of targeted ways. The film is intended to inspire new perspectives and actions regarding the quality of Latinx and all transgender people in the US. Our close collaboration with equality activists committed to raising the visibility of trans people of color, especially Latinx people, is the first step to creating change through their protests. Through the film, more people could understand the struggles of the transgender community from within and therefore support the protests or form a positive public opinion.
Moreover, we plan a community screening campaign after the festival run for LGBTQ, Latinx, and equal rights activists with the aim to inspire transgender rights movements in the U.S. that would raise the visibility of the injustice the community is facing.
Regarding the connections we are planning to employ, we have engaged a vast number of prominent LGBTQ figures and allies such as Patricia Arquette and Rosario Dawson who are committed to supporting this campaign. Bamby’s organization TransLatin@ Coalition will also be an important partner in Southern California. We are exploring relationships with leading service organizations Lambda Legal, OutServe-SLDN, the Institute of Latino Policy and MANA, as well as a University-based screening and/or speaker series in partnerships with Queer and LGBT Resource Centers on select campuses with significant Latinx populations.
We are choosing to target the academic environment as we believe it is crucial to start open conversations in the learning environment to erase the fear of the unknown and influence the perspective of future generations, who would later become activists, thinkers, politicians, business owners, academics, and more. Our main hope is that this film will significantly contribute to the overall public mindset that according to Bamby is the first and most important step to the changes in governmental policies as well as acceptance of transgender people.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can:
- Follow us on Social Media and share!!

FACEBOOK http://www.facebook.com/laqueencianera

INSTAGRAM https://www.instagram.com/laqueencianera​

TWITTER https://twitter.com/laqueencianera

- Spread our Indiegogo campaign

Like on Indiegogo
Use the share tools

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everybody!

My name is Sean Small and I am a director/writer/actor based out of Los Angeles. I have been directing, acting in, and writing content for the past 12 years. I have directed shorts and web series that have been highly successful in the film circuit, won best actor in the LA Live Film Festival last year, and am currently shopping around various screenplays as we speak.

But, let's get to the reason why you are all here. This campaign was set up for the short Lost, Not Forgotten, a passion project I have been wanting to shoot for years. I know what you're thinking, why is this a passion project? Well, there was a seminal moment in my life that I thought could have led me down two very different paths. This moment was when my biological father decided to not be a part of my life. With the help of a strong single mother and an amazing support system along the way, I came out to be (at least I think) somewhat normal. This script is the other path I could have easily gone down.

With your contributions you would help in creating a film that will not only put forth an amazing story, but a true one that hopefully many can resonate with and never feel alone in the daily struggle that comes with this abandonment. This is the reason I produce. My main purpose is to get stories out there that connect and impact people that unfortunately are going through the same thing.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to create great content, we need great people! Film is a collaborative art, and in that regard I want to make sure everyone is the best of the best when it comes to cast and crew. With that said, we are trying to raise $10,000 in order to produce, shoot, edit, complete, and circulate this short through the film circuit after completion!

First, we want to pay our amazing cast and crew members. The Producers are taking no cut of this budget, only the people that will be working within the film. 

Second, we will be paying for things like locations, production design, props, wardrobe, crafty, lunch (to feed the amazing crew and cast), and any miscellaneous things necessary to create the best quality film we can.

Lastly, once the film has been edited and the finishing touches have been added, we will use the remaining funds to apply to various film festivals in order to get this film seen by anyone and everyone! Hopefully this will bring either a distribution deal, or a possibility of expanding the short into a feature length film that will hit the big screen!

The thing we wanted to do with our campaign was give everyone the opportunity to benefit from the perks we are giving. For the highest contributors, we are promising to cut them in on any possible profits that come in the future. So when we make money on this, you would too! Our other exciting perks include an onset prop of your choosing, signed posters and shooting scripts, a digital screener, a social media shout out, and a Thank You in the credits!

It means a lot for us if you contribute, so no matter how much you contribute, we will be extremely appreciative! If you are unable to contribute, no worries, but we would kindly ask you to share and post this campaign wherever you see fit!

Now let's get the ball rolling and put Lost, Not Forgotten on the map!

story:
\

'The Mix' is a short thriller that takes place entirely in a recording studio, where podcast producer Becca makes repeatedly failed attempts to convince her stubborn spouse - and host Sean Palermo - to recognize the increasingly hostile threats being made by online conspiracy groups in opposition to special guest, Dr. Janet Weddley, who's promoting controversial views on differences in IQ.

The tone of The Mix combines the off-camera tension-building of Oliver Stone's interpretation of Talk Radio (1988) with the pacing precision David Fincher's Gone Girl (2014), and the industrial soundtracks of early 2000s Trent Reznor, Nine Inch Nails.

Christian LaMorte, is an NYC-based independent narrative filmmaker who's written and directed a number of short films focused on social topics such as male stereotypes, spiritual agnosticism  and modern social media addiction. He's a graduated with a BFA in Film Directing from School of Visual Arts, where his thesis film Boy Code was selected to premiere at the Max Ophuls Film Festival in Saarbrücken, Germany, as well as in Cannes Court Métrage in France. Boy Code was praised for it's realistic and disturbing interpretation of teen male peer pressures.

An obsessively creative/talented/passionate crew is on board for this film with some of my best friends and new collaberators.

Anthony Altamura, Lauren Molina, Max Seiler, Brianna Mestre, Magee Fahey, Alex Seefried James Newberry Maximilian Arias 

We believe the best way to portray social media's transformation of the human psyche is by creating a satirical, suspense-driven drama focused on the dynamic and sometimes dangerous personalities behind the content we consume on a daily basis thus leaving us to question how well we communicate to others in our own lives.

Becca and Sean Palermo used to be a giddy, health and wellness couple before their podcast grew in popularity due to unfettered and "unbiased" conversations with disagreeable celebrities, philosophers and entrepreneurs. 

But, Sean's in his late 30s, making up for his failed acting career by prioritizing the growth of the podcast and shunning the naysayer's of the most controversial guest he's had on thus far, as Becca, unheard and slipping into a deep depression, foresees the dangers of the backlash, and is forced to decide between cancelling the show or holding onto the principle of free speech.

Our budget will be used for (1) location fees: 4 days (September 18/19 and 25/26) at  Brewery Recording Studio which is allowing up generous access to the mixing room, recording room, storage space AND rooftop patio.

Paying the professional and passionate cast members, Sophia Parola, Thomas Philip O'Neill, Kurt Slater, Brandice Peltier and Grant Neale.

Paying the crew members who, without them, there is no organization, realization of vision or execution.

• Set Design/Props. The recording studio is beautiful, but movies are about building worlds, so we need to touch it up with Palermo's Perspectives artwork, portraits and other memorabilia that will sell you that this is NOT Brewery Recording Studio, but Sean Palermo and Becca's private space.

• Food. Food. Food. Not caviar. Just breakfast lunch and dinner for 12+ people so that they have the energy for 12-14 hour days under extremely hot lights.

And that's 'The Mix'

Giving us money is not by any means the only way of contributing. Share the link to this page, tell your friends, family and anyone who believes in our vision of a bold short film that reflects where many of us are in the modern, media-addicted world.

story:
Nachiketa and the Lord of Death is a modern retelling of the Katha Upanishad. The timeless tale follows the boy, Nachiketa, whose father sends him to the Lord of Death. With the Lord of Death, Nachiketa experiences deep spiritual truths, gains the key to enlightenment and discovers the secret of transcending the cycle of birth and death. Filmmakers Gayle Embrey and Hannah Holland are modern yoga practitioners endeavoring to bring this story to modern audiences by animating the classic Vedic story. 

Gayle Embrey has been a documentary filmmaker since 2006. She has produced a number of films, as well as directed the documentary, Beyond The Walls, which had a very successful run in film festivals in 2014. Hannah Holland began working in television at Nickelodeon Studios in Orlando, FL. She has held many titles and been a Producer on a number of shows. Her most notable credits include Global GUTS, Legends of the Hidden Temple, and All That.

We’ve set an initial fund-raising goal of $10,000. These funds will allow us to hire an additional animator to move the project closer toward completion. Doing this will enable us to finish the film in time to submit for fall festival deadlines. Regardless of how much we raise, all funds will go directly toward paying animators for the film. 

Every dollar we receive is important to us. Since we know that some people are able to comfortably give more than others, we want to offer the same perk regardless of donation size: an 8X10 photograph of our two animated main characters, Nachiketa and the Lord of Death, together. Another way you can contribute is by sharing about this project on social media, directing people to our campaign. 

By contributing to the making of this film, you are supporting a fun, colorful and lively story that seeks to answer some of the most important questions about personal transformation as well as thoughts on the purpose of life, death and what happens after we die.

story:
About 'Jangle'

Ned and Noah are about to spend their first Christmas living together as a couple. Ned is a total Jingle and is obsessed with anything Christmas, meanwhile Noah is a Jangle and despises the season. A clash of views is imminent, but will the relationship survive the rift?

In 2019, Simone Greenwood wrote a festively fabulous short film for Andrew Creak to direct, but sadly due to scheduling issues the project didn't take off. In 2020 the world was hit by a global pandemic, which meant once again Jangle couldn't go into production. Now in 2021 the gears are in motion and Jangle will be created for all to see!

What We Need 

After a year of creative workers being left behind by the Westminster government, it is important, now more than ever, to ensure that people are paid for the work they do, while short films are often labours of love and passion projects, ethically it is important that people are paid for their work.

The money we raise from this crowdfunder will contribute to paying for the cast and crews time, locations, props and costumes, as well as providing PPE and ensuring the production is a covid safe environment.

Our goal for this short film £1,500 which in terms of short film productions is a micro budget, but this amount of money to working class film makers like myself is huge, so every little donation will go a long way in producing a fun festive short film. If we don't meet the target the money we do raise will still go towards this project, though some elements of the production may need to be changed to accommodate the lower budget.

If you decide to help us fund this short film then we will be offering a wide range of rewards, from early access to the script and production news before our social channels, early access to the finished film, and much more!

 

The Impact

As a working class film maker, to forward your aspirations in becoming a director is hard without any disposable income at hand to fund your projects it is difficult to learn and adapt your style and forward your career.

This film also is important because of how it depicts queer lives, and not focusing around coming out or being closeted, but looking at problems that could affect anyone, no matter your sexuality or gender.

Risks & Challenges

Filming in a world still in the grips of a pandemic is difficult, but I have recently worked as a Covid Compliance Officer across several well known productions, which have helped me gain an understanding of what is needed for the cast and crew to be safe.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you are unable to financially help with this production, but there are other ways you can help too! Such as sharing our crowdfunding campaign on your socials.

We are also looking for a shop or bar in Cardiff to film some short shots of one of the main characters at work to form a montage.

If you'd like to help please email us at info@thirdtime.co.uk

story:
The Story

Boxer is a story that needs to be told. It’s vastly beautiful, from the visual, mood and tones, to the cast, and writing. This story is extremely important to me because I feel that as a filmmaker and storyteller, I need to find a way to create the stories that I wish to see...that people would like to see, that shows my range as an artist as well as the different stories that we, as a people, are capable of telling.

Boxer is a feature film about the traumas in two professional fighters' lives that bring them together in an unexpected way, forcing them to look at themselves and come face to face with their reality...all while preparing to reclaim the number one spot. Set in New York City, Boxer lives in a world of grit, heart and taking chances.

The Rundown

My name is Katie Mack and I’ve been a writer my entire life, with at least 15 years of acting/filmmaking/directing under my belt. I began earning my stripes in entertainment as a background artist in Hype Williams' first silver screen directorial endeavor, ​Belly​, moved on to be featured on ​Chapelle's Show​ and in the blockbuster hit ​American Gangster.​ As a graduate of the Meisner conservatory program at The William Esper Studio, I’ve also studied at Matthew Corozine and HB Studios.

KMackBrand, a comprehensive look at everything that is me. The Brand can be defined in four simple words, "Be Inspired. Be You." and is an artistic derivation of acting, writing, and filmmaking. With my first lead role in the film ​The Trade Off​ (2006) a few years later under the KMackBrand umbrella, I premiered my first short, MAC,​ at the NYC International Film Festival in NY City (2012), celebrated an Emmy nominated PSA for the Rhode Island International Film Festival (I portrayed the lead in, 2015), has had two of my films in The People’s Film Festival in NYC (at the same time in 2017) and have won Best Director for one of them. A five episode miniseries, Charlie, can be found online here.

What We Need & What You Get

In November 2019, we filmed the first 15 minutes of Boxer with the support of our AMAZING cast and crew! Now, in order to complete this film, we need you to help to make it happen. Film production is an exciting process, but as you can see above it can be pretty costly!

In exchange for your generous support, we have some dope perks for you! Check them out & make sure you, your family and your friends grab your favorite(s)! We appreciate you all being part of the Boxer family!

Your Impact

You as a contributor would be helping this amazing team of creatives accomplish something magical, to visually tell a story, proving that Black stories are layered, and filled with experiences that deserve to be shared on the big screen.  We get to see how people deal with trauma in the best possible ways, as well as struggles with accepting help, and being open to people and experiences that aid in healing. You would be helping the Boxer story and all its layers be a very tangible thing that is sure to warm hearts and engage minds.

Risks & Challenges

Let's face it, making movies is challenging. It takes lots of time, effort, dedication and above all money. Movie-making is a collaborative effort across the board. There are really great movies that don't get made, and stories that don't get told, for the lack of funding. Simply put, we need your help. As we continue to apply for grants and such (wish us luck!), we have to also take matters into our own hands and make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

After you donate, PLEASE don’t forget to share our campaign with friends & family. Spread the word via social media and word of mouth. Also, follow us at @Boxer_Film #BoxerFilm on Instagram & Twitter and visit our website www.boxerthemovie.com for the latest podcast episodes, blog posts, other K.Mack Productions projects, and all the behind the scenes exclusives! WE APPRECIATE ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Hello Horror Fans! 

Sick & Twisted FX is excited to welcome you to the Valentine Bluffs: A My Bloody Valentine Fan Film crowdfunding campaign! Watch our campaign video to the end to see our full trailer.

After the horrific events that took place in Valentine Bluffs, TJ and Sara struggle to move on with their lives in a new town. Circumstances force TJ to move back to his hometown, where he tries to start a new life.

40 years pass, and the town of Valentine Bluffs has forgotten the names of Axel Palmer and Harry Warden. The next generation is getting ready to celebrate the big Valentine’s Day dance. All seems well, until an ominous figure wielding a pick axe appears, leaving a trail of carnage behind.

 

                         





Why a My Bloody Valentine Fan Film? Because many fans have felt that the original My Bloody Valentine film needed a sequel and to this day they continue to ask for one. We as filmmakers and fans agree.  A little over a year ago, I had the idea of doing this fan film. I had the story in my head but that's where it stayed. I recall vending at Horror Hound Weekend years ago, and getting a picture with a cosplayer wearing an amazing Miner costume. I thought if I can find this guy, I can pitch my idea to him. After asking around for a while, a convention friend said it was a cosplayer named Chuck Ryan. So I reached out to this man whom I never met, and told him my idea. He was intrigued and asked to read my script which had not been written yet. In two weeks, I wrote the script and sent it off to Chuck. He contacted me and said "I'm in"! Here we are one year later, and after a lot of production meetings, late nights, and after a near death experience due to Covid, we are ready to deliver not only a great story, but a gory one.
- Tom Smith

 


           
 








                                                  












 


 

Our initial Goal is to raise $20,000 for the production of Valentine Bluffs. 

Funds designated for production will go towards film permits, insurance, gear and vehicle rentals, stunts, special FX & make up,  post-production services and other items that are essential in running a safe and productive film set.


     

The original 1981 My Bloody Valentine film is beloved by many. There is a rabid fan base of diehards out there who have been frothing at the mouth for a proper sequel and more Miner madness in general. The challenge is to deliver a heart pumping, nuts to butts fan film that not only pays homage to the 1981 film, but also delivers a quality product on a modest budget. With that being said this is a 100% not for profit passion project.

Help us spread the word! We can’t have a successful campaign without YOU. Even if you can’t donate financially, you're still a valuable asset to our team. You can help by sharing our campaign as much as you can across all social media platforms as well as to your family and friends. Remember to always keep the spirit of independent film making alive. We're extremely grateful for your support.
 



 
    


   


 


On the subject of the rights to My Bloody Valentine, we would like to formally acknowledge that Sick N Twisted FX, Anthracite Studios and our Sponsors are in no way affiliated with Paramount Pictures, Lionsgate, or anyone else associated with My Bloody Valentine. If any of those entities take issue with what we are trying to accomplish, we will happily comply with whatever is asked of us by those parties.

That being said, we know that studios love fan-films and most often support them. That is why there are so many Friday the 13th, Star Wars, Predator, Halloween, Star Trek, Nightmare on Elm Street, Batman, and countless other fan-films floating around the web. As long as one does not try to profit or compete with the canon films, studios usually see them as a free marketing tool.

*You must provide your own transportation and lodging for any applicable perks.

story:
Help Us Fund Part 2 of "THE ROMULAN WAR"!

Thanks to our previous Contributors, we were able to bring Part 1 of TRW up to a high standard of quality and we want to amp up the action even more for Part 2!

That means new ships, new sets, new characters, and explosive sci-fi action!

This is the Story You've Always Wanted to See!

The Earth-Romulan War was first mentioned in the original Star Trek episode "Balance of Terror," but this pivotal "historical" event has never actually been shown on-screen in an official Star Trek production. Our fan film delivers the high-quality effects, production, and acting to tell the story of the ORIGIN OF THE FEDERATION. A story that Enterprise never got to tell before it went off the air.

We Need Your Help to Hit Our Goal!

In order to cut costs and time, we're going to release all of our perks digitally and we hope all of our supporters can help spread the word among the fan community to help us fund Part 2.

And now... a little more about the world of The Romulan War and what our needs are.

 

THE ROMULAN WAR ("TRW") is a Star Trek fan film production which documents the plight of humanity as it faces extinction at the hands of the Romulan Empire in the 22nd century.

If you like Star Trek, war movies, or the History Channel, be part of our campaign to complete production on THE ROMULAN WAR, Part II!

THE ROMULAN WAR saga is based on the Star Trek universe created by Gene Roddenberry and documents the historic event leading to the creation of the United Federation of Planets... the war between Earth and the Romulan Empire! 

Captain's logs, eyewitness video, journal entries, and period photographs combine with "found footage" of the war's key conflicts to realistically depict a world where mankind's very survival is at stake.

​THE ROMULAN WAR vividly embraces the entire sweep of the 22nd century's most devastating war, covering the battles in space, on alien worlds, and on the home fronts of both Earth and Romulus. These are the heroic adventures of captain and cadet alike that ultimately leads to the formation of the Federation!

 

​

The events of THE ROMULAN WAR take place in the"prime" Star Trek universe from the years 2155-2161, and is our interpretation of what seasons 5-7 of Star Trek: Enterprise could have been if that series had continued.

From the ambush of Salem One to the Battle of Cheron, THE ROMULAN WAR tells the stories of heroism and courage alongside tales of loss and brutality which affected countless millions, including:

  • The attack on Starbase One which serves as the Pearl Harbor-like catalyst which thrusts humanity into a war against the militaristic and brutal Romulan Star Empire.
  • The debut of a new enemy weapon which renders Earth and Coalition ships unable to resist the Romulans.
  • The political intrigue surrounding Earth's struggle to hold the Coalition of Planets together while the Romulan Praetor consolidates power by crushing his political adversaries.
  • The harrowing story of Earth colonists who face torture and unthinkable medical experiments while under Romulan captivity.
  • The tale of the Kobayashi Maru, which puts Captain Jonathan Archer into a no-win scenario that haunts him for the rest of his career.
  • The Reman resistance movement and how their actions change the course of the war and Romulan society.
  • The heroic last mission of Starship Challenger and how Captain Stiles' actions saved the Andorian homeworld from disaster.

  • The story of how Earth's breakthroughs in engine, weapons, and computer technology led to the creation of Starfleet's first (and only) battleships: the Yorktowns.
  • The true motivations for Romulus' war against Earth... the Praetor's near-religious quest to unlock an ancient alien technology which would allow the Romulans to conquer the entire galaxy.
  • How the Battle of Cheron not only ended the war, but resulted in the creation of the Neutral Zone and began new talks that lead to the formation of the Federation we are all familiar with.​​​

 

Even though most of our pre-production and principal photography has been completed (see the section on "Sets" below), our team needs your help to complete our mission!

Our Goal is $10,000. Primarily the campaign will fund the remaining principal photography as well as editing, visual effects modeling & animation, film score, ADR, and other post-production expenses.

Our Perks Are Unique. We respect the CBS fan film guidelines about making a profit off of their IP, so extravagant perks are being replaced by unique items like posters, digital downloads, and extra digital content that is accessible only to backers. Contributors at certain levels will be able to lend their voice to the production, get their name in the credits, and even appear ON CAMERA in a role we will write just for you!

 

The cast of The Romulan War are professionally-trained actors based in the United States who have years of experience in stage, television, and film acting. Check out this video to find out more about some of the Cast members on The Romulan War.

 

We've been lucky to have a great team of virtual set designers bringing us some new and familiar settings for Star Trek fans, including:

  • Deep Space Nine
  • Memory Alpha
  • Romulus
  • Starfleet Command
  • Alpha Centauri

And more locations across the galaxy coming... if you help us reach our goal!

 

DISCLAIMER:
Star Trek and all related marks, logos and characters are solely owned by CBS Studios Inc. This fan production is not endorsed by, sponsored by, nor affiliated with CBS, Paramount Pictures, or any other Star Trek franchise, and is a non-commercial fan-made film intended for recreational use. No commercial exhibition or distribution is permitted. No alleged independent rights will be asserted against CBS or Paramount Pictures.

story:
En bref ...

Valérie Lecomte, réalisatrice, a été retenue parmi 10 réalisateurs du Canada francophone pour participer à La Course des Régions pancanadienne 2021, afin de réaliser un court métrage de fiction. Elle représente la région Ontario-Ottawa. Les Anges font le ménage sera tourné en français avec un peu d’anglais. Le film doit être finalisé avant le 1er novembre 2021.

Les Anges font le ménage nous emmène au cœur d'un mystère. Il y est question d’adoption, d’amitié et de doutes. Valérie Lecomte veut embrasser la diversité ethnique canadienne et la montrer à l’écran.

Pour voir les bandes-annonces des derniers courts-métrages réalisés par Valérie, encore en circuit festivals, allez sur : www.iridisproduction.com

Overview

Les Anges font le ménage, fictional short film, in French (and a bit in English), has been selected in the "Course des Régions pancanadienne 2021", a short-film contest for French speaking emerging directors. Valérie Lecomte, director, has been selected to represent the Ottawa Region. The film has to be completed by November 1st 2021. 

Les Anges font le ménage is a family drama dealing with mysteries. Adoption, friendship and personal quests are at the heart of Valérie’s short-film while embracing the Canadian ethnic diversity.

To see the trailers of Valérie’s previous short-films, still in festivals, visit www.iridisproduction.com

Combien et pourquoi participer?

Atteindre notre objectif de 2 000 $ nous permettra de créer une œuvre à la hauteur de nos ambitions, en recrutant les compétences et le matériel nécessaires et nous permettra une post-production plus soignée.

Seriez-vous prêts à participer au financement de ce projet?

Toute participation est la bienvenue, quelle que soit son montant. Les contributeurs apparaîtront dans les remerciements du générique. Si vous ne pouvez pas donner, n'hésitez pas à partager notre appel auprès de votre entourage. Merci !

What We Need & What You Get

By reaching our goal of $ 2,000, we will be able to produce a short-film that lives up to our ambitions, using better human and technical resources, and achieving a better post-production quality.

Would you like to contribute to this short-film?

Any contribution is welcome, whatever the amount. The contributors name will appear in the credit in the Special Thanks section. If you cannot give, do not hesitate to share with your network! Thanks !

Où voir le film?

Le film bénéficiera d’une projection au Théâtre Granada de Sherbrooke, QC, en décembre 2021, ainsi que d’une large diffusion dans le circuit international des festivals et pourrait être sélectionné pour une diffusion sur la chaîne francophone UnisTV.

Where can I see the movie

The film will be screened in Sherbrooke, QC (December 2021), in the Theatre Ganada, and will be submitted to film festivals worldwide for the 2022 festival season. The film may also be selected by UnisTV, a Canadian francophone TV channel.

Merci de votre aide ! 

Thank you for your help!

story:
How can you let the person you love the most walk out of your life? Do we be selfish and fight for them to stay even if that means their unhappiness? Sometimes it takes sacrifice to let them move on. Moving on explores a couple realizing the relationship is done. We are shown the emotional toll of this decision through dance and we hope to leave you asking, Is it true that if you truly love someone you must let them go?

Our Director's Heart

Back in 2017 I was handling my own first real breakup from a long term relationship. I struggled with the initial breakup with realizing the relationship was at its end. I fought so hard to make the relationship work that it took time for me to accept it was done. I came across a song that just reflected what was currently going on in my life with this breakup. I just visualized this whole music video while hearing it for the first time. Back then I had no means as to how I could create a project like this. Now in 2021 I am in film school with the ability to make this dream a reality. Since this project hits home for me, I hope that I can share a little part of my past with the world. This chapter changed me and made me become my better self. It is my hope that this piece will tug on your heartstrings through both its dancing and its acting.

The Bang for Your Buck

If this piece has already begun to tug on your heart, we would love to see your support through donations. Donate what you can! Any size will help us to be one step closer to getting this project completed. As a plus to donating we are offering perks according to the amount you donate.

When you donate any amount, you get to see your name up on the big screen! Each of our donors will receive a thank-you in the credits and will be placed into tiers according to their donations:

Each donor will receive a .png of their respective medal, in honor of dance competitions. (This applies even for those who choose to donate by selecting a perk!) To donate for just a medal, select "BACK IT" at the top and donate your desired amount.

For those interested in additional perks, feel free to take a look at the "perks" section of this page! (Towards the top of this page on mobile and on the right hand side on desktop.)

In order to bring this dream to life, we will need to raise at least $1,000. These donations will be used approximately according to the following distribution:

The Impact

With this project, I (the director) hope to show just how amazing dancers are at storytelling. Much of dance is acting and I would love to increase the public's awareness of that. Dancers are true artists and honestly deserve to be leads. 

I also want to explore the hardships that happen in the midst of a breakup. Initially it can be overwhelming! I want viewers to see though that breakups are universally difficult and often require loving from afar, it's okay if your partner needs to move on.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges that we anticipate is maintaining a safe and healthy working environment in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic while simultaneously achieving the utmost quality possible. Due to COVID-19 protocols, our personnel will be limited, making grand shots more difficult than usual. However, our crew members are top-notch at what they do and are largely well-versed in current health and safety protocols for set.

Another challenge we anticipate facing is reaching our funding goal. We recognize not everyone may be in a place to donate at the moment but we will need to reach our $1,000 goal in order to finance our location, the pending song license, COVID-19 supplies, and other various aforementioned production and distribution costs. If we are not able to reach this goal through fundraising, we will need to reimagine our location and distribution plans to suit the amount that we were able to raise.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may want to support this film but cannot help out with it financially in this season of life. If that is you, (1) thank you for your passion for this project and (2) we would love to have you join our support team in any of the following ways:

  • Spread the word! Share this page with your friends on social media, especially those who you think might have a heart for this piece
  • Keep this project in your prayers. Pray especially for the impact that this film will have on its audiences, for safety for our crew, and for open doors throughout the production process.
  • Follow our film. Check us out on Instagram (@MovingOn_OfficialPage) and hit the “Follow” button at the top of this page!
