With this project, I (the director) hope to show just how amazing dancers are at storytelling. Much of dance is acting and I would love to increase the public's awareness of that. Dancers are true artists and honestly deserve to be leads. 
I also want to explore the hardships that happen in the midst of a breakup. Initially it can be overwhelming! I want viewers to see though that breakups are universally difficult and often require loving from afar, it's okay if your partner needs to move on.

Risks & Challenges
One of the biggest challenges that we anticipate is maintaining a safe and healthy working environment in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic while simultaneously achieving the utmost quality possible. Due to COVID-19 protocols, our personnel will be limited, making grand shots more difficult than usual. However, our crew members are top-notch at what they do and are largely well-versed in current health and safety protocols for set.
Another challenge we anticipate facing is reaching our funding goal. We recognize not everyone may be in a place to donate at the moment but we will need to reach our $1,000 goal in order to finance our location, the pending song license, COVID-19 supplies, and other various aforementioned production and distribution costs. If we are not able to reach this goal through fundraising, we will need to reimagine our location and distribution plans to suit the amount that we were able to raise.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that you may want to support this film but cannot help out with it financially in this season of life. If that is you, (1) thank you for your passion for this project and (2) we would love to have you join our support team in any of the following ways:

Spread the word! Share this page with your friends on social media, especially those who you think might have a heart for this piece
Keep this project in your prayers. Pray especially for the impact that this film will have on its audiences, for safety for our crew, and for open doors throughout the production process.
Follow our film. Check us out on Instagram (@MovingOn_OfficialPage) and hit the “Follow” button at the top of this page!

story:
Click Here for the English version!

Des Vies après la Vie

Un documentaire de Sébastien Bouillé

Y’a-t-il une vie après la mort? Plusieurs? Existe-t-il des mondes parallèles, d’autres univers?

Jusqu’à lors, médiums, magnétiseurs ou victimes de chocs post-traumatiques suggéraient des pistes de réflexions. Depuis peu, certains chercheurs proposent des explications scientifiques à ces questions. Le but de ce documentaire est de mettre en corrélation ou en opposition les théories ésotériques et scientifiques,  pour apporter des réponses à ces questions que nous nous posons tous.


Il existe de nombreux témoignages de personnes qui affirment avoir fait une expérience de mort imminente, vivant une décorporation et se voyant projetées dans un tunnel de lumière.

Celles qui disent en être revenues sont changées. Elles ne perçoivent plus le monde comme avant.

Certaines avouent être devenues capables d’entrer en résonance avec leur entourage, quand d’autres se disent capables de prévoir ces événements.

La science n’a jamais accordé beaucoup de crédit à tous ces témoignages.

Il y a quelques années, Eben Alexander, un neuro-chirurgien extrêmement réputé tombe dans le coma. Il reprend miraculeusement conscience quelques jours après. Alors qu'il était déclaré cliniquement mort (sans activité cérébrale), il affirme avoir visité d'autres mondes.

Pour la première fois, un médecin osait parler de ce phénomène.

Emmanuel est grand reporter. Spécialiste du Moyen-Orient, il est diplômé de sciences politiques. En 2011, alors qu’il couvre la révolution du Nil en Egypte, il se retrouve pris au milieu de violents affrontements et frôle la mort avec son cameraman.

Au moment où l’un de ses agresseurs tente de le poignarder, il éprouve l’étrange sensation de sortir de son corps et voit se dessiner devant lui un halo lumineux. Il entend également une voix qui lui dit qu’il ne doit pas avoir peur.  En l’espace de quelques secondes, la situation s’apaise.

Lorsqu'il rentre en France quelques jours plus tard, Emmanuel sent qu’il a changé. Il est devenu réceptif aux autres, plus « sensitif ».

Il commence un long travail de recherches et d’enquête qui va lui permettre de rencontrer d’autres personnes ayant vécu le même type d’expérience.

Anouck est magnétiseuse. Elle a vécu une enfance difficile. A l’âge adulte, elle  tombe très malade. Ces expériences, douloureuses, vont créer un traumatisme.

Avec le temps, elle découvre qu’elle possède la faculté de guérir les gens par l’apposition des mains et qu’elle possède également le don de précognition. Elle dit communiquer avec un être de l’au-delà, qui la protège.

En novembre 2013, dans les environs de Montpellier, une jeune femme est victime d’un accident de la route et décède. Elle s’appelait Jehnza ; elle était chanteuse et venait de terminer, quelques jours plus tôt, son premier album.

Son producteur, Marc-Eric, était aussi son compagnon dans la vie. Marc-Eric sort d’un milieu intellectuel. C’est un chef d’entreprise dynamique, qui produit et compose également des bandes sonores pour la télévision.

Depuis le décès de Jehnza, il s’est livré à de nombreuses expériences, notamment chamaniques. Il a ainsi découvert que son esprit pouvait entrer en résonance avec un autre monde. Il explique parfois sentir la présence de Jehnza.

Tout au long de l’enquête, Christophe M, un psychotérapeute spécialiste des chocs post traumatiques ayant été confronté à des EMI de patients (Expériences de Mort Imminente), décryptera l’enquête.

Des scientifiques soumettront également les protagonistes de l’histoire à des tests précis, qui devront permettre de comprendre si ceux-ci sont victimes d’hallucinations ou s’ils sont réellement connectés à un autre monde, une autre vie … quelque part, ailleurs !..

Ces trois personnages vont constituer les fils rouges de notre film documentaire, qui nous conduira de la France aux Etats-Unis. Leurs histoires seront entrecoupées de témoignages de scientifiques, d’expérience réalisées en laboratoire (notamment avec Anouck) et de spécialistes reconnus des phénomènes paranormaux.

Son récit sera celui d’une quête qui nous permettra de savoir s’il existe bel et bien une vie après la vie, où s’il agit simplement de phénomènes hallucinatoires.


Interview de Sébastien Bouillé, réalisateur du documentaire.

Quel est l’objectif de votre film ?

Ce film doit permettre de donner des réponses, d’un point de vue scientifique, à tous les gens qui ont été confrontés à des expériences de mort imminente, comme à ceux qui ont perdu un être proche et qui continuent de sentir leur présence. Des scientifiques ont récemment tenté de démontrer qu’une fois que nous sommes morts, notre conscience continue d’avoir une activité. En Russie, un chercheur a démontré récemment que le corps expulse une énergie au moment de la mort. Le documentaire evoquera ces avancées scientifiques.

Pourquoi demander aux internautes de financer ce documentaire ?

Nous nous demandons tous s’il y a quelque chose après la mort.  C'est pourquoi nous avons décidé de rendre ce documentaire accessible au plus grand nombre, gratuitement. Mais nous avons besoin de mécènes.

Vous-même, croyez-vous qu’il y ait une vie après la mort ?

Je ne sais pas.  L'objectif de ce film est justement d'apporter une ou plusieurs réponses à cette question.

Sur quel type de média le film sera-t-il diffusé ?

« Vers d’autres vie », sera diffusé en ligne gratuitement en français et en anglais sur une chaîne Internet du site YouTube mais aussi via des sites d’informations nationaux et régionaux auxquels nous céderons gratuitement les droits de diffusion.

Pourquoi avoir choisi Internet et pas la télévision ?

Réaliser un documentaire pour la télévision, média pour lequel je travaille depuis des années, répond à des impératifs de format et de temps de tournage.  Même sur les chaînes culturelles et scientifiques, la vocation d’une chaîne de télévision est d’être commerciale et de répondre à des critères précis. Si je juge avec mon équipe que le film mérite 90 minutes ou plus, je peux le faire. Et le documentaire doit être accessible à tous. Internet est un média universel.

Comment avez-vous choisi les témoins qui vont intervenir dans votre documentaire?

Je travaille sur le sujet depuis trois ans. Lors de mon enquête, j’ai pu rencontrer des gens ayant vécu des EMI, d’autres qui se disent en contact avec l’au-delà, des médecins, des psychanalystes et des religieux ... A l’issue de ce travail de fond, j’ai choisi des personnes comme Anouck et Marc Eric car leurs expériences, bien que différentes, nous ramènent toujours à la même question : Y-a t-il une vie après la vie ? Anouck comme Marc-Eric ont de plus accepté que je les mette en situation et d’être confronté au monde médical et scientifique. Nous nous livrerons donc à quelques expériences avec eux.

Les internautes auront-ils leur mot à dire sur le film?

Nous consultons beaucoup les forums sur internet qui portent sur la question de la vie après la mort. Cela nous aide dans nos réflexions et sur le choix des pistes à exploiter. Nous créons également des fils de discussion sur ces forums pour savoir ce que chacun attend du documentaire. C'est aussi une source d'inspiration.

Vous êtes connu pour vos reportages de guerre au Moyen-Orient. Avec ce film, vous n’avez pas peur qu’on vous attende au tournant ?

Non. Je travaille avec des gens de confiance depuis des années. Ceux qui me connaissent savent que je suis très pragmatique et bien loin d’avoir la tête dans les étoiles.

Une dernière question : Votre film coûte près de 60 000 euros. N’est pas un gros budget?

Non. Un film documentaire, réalisé selon des critères professionnels, coûte rarement moins de 130 000 euros pour quelques mois de travail. Là, nous travaillons sur le projet depuis trois ans. La société de production avec laquelle je travaille a d’ailleurs financé la moitié de mes recherches. Elle a mis à la disposition de mon équipe des moyens techniques conséquents, ce qui a constitué 30% du budget. Qu’il s’agisse des journalistes, techniciens ou même de moi, tous ont accepté de travailler sur ce film documentaire à moitié prix ou gratuitement, ce qui explique le coût relativement faible pour un projet de ce genre. 

Le projet étant déjà financé à 42%, le budget nécessaire pour achever la réalisation de notre film est de 60 000 euros qui se répartit comme suit (ce budget est indicatif, plus il sera important plus l'enquête sera fournie):





L'équipe


Sébastien Bouillé  est co-fondateur, directeur d’agence et grand reporter à BEW TV. Il a travaillé sur un grand nombre de sujets tels que la reconstruction de Gaza après la guerre, les Réfugiés Syrien en Jordanie, le combat des Kurdes en Irak ou la résistance chrétienne en Syrie. Ses reportages ont été diffusés dans d’importantes chaines de média en France et à l’international comme TF1, France 24, Babel Press et Canal+. Il a travaillé deux ans pour le service documentaire de Qatar TV, chaîne pour laquelle il a tourné et produit des sujets en Europe, en Egypte, au Qatar, au Koweït, Oman, Abu Dhabi,  et à Madagascar. Il a aussi travaillé au sein du comité de développement de Qatar TV durant sa rénovation en 2012.


Emmanuel Razavi,  est Grand reporter et chercheur associé à l’Université du Littoral. Diplômé de sciences politiques, il est  spécialiste du golfe Persique, il a couvert depuis 1997 les grands évènements et conflits du Proche et Moyen-Orient : seconde Intifada en Palestine, révolution du cèdre au Liban, intervention américaine en Afghanistan, révolution du Nil en Egypte… Il a notamment vécu en Afghanistan, au Qatar et en Espagne et a travaillé pour des rédactions telles M6, Canal+, Planète,  Arte, Valeurs Actuelles, Le Spectacle du Monde, Paris Match et Le Figaro Magazine. Nommé au prix des correspondants de guerre en 2004 et 2009, il a réalisé une centaine de reportages et documentaires sur le Moyen-Orient parmi lesquels, en 2006, le très remarqué « Ben Laden, les ratés d’une traque », diffusé dans le monde entier. Emmanuel a également publié plusieurs essais et romans sur le Proche et le Moyen-Orient. Son travail en tant que Grand reporter a été salué par de nombreux médias parmi lesquels Le Figaro, l’Express et Télérama.


English


                                                      Toward other lives ?

                                       A documentary by Sébastien Bouillé

Is there a life after death? Do we have many lives? Is there a parallel universe? 

Until now, only mediums, spiritual healers or victims of post-traumatic shock gave us the opportunity to reflect on this  subject. Recently, a certain number of researchers have started to offer scientific explanations to these questions. The objective of this documentary is to harmonise or to oppose these esoteric and scientist theories, in order to answer the questions that we all ask ourselves.

There are plenty of testimonials from people who have experienced near-death experiences, leaving their physical bodies and seeing themselves projected into tunnel of light.Those who say they have come back from these experiences feel completely changed.

They don’t perceive the world in the same way  anymore. Some of them confess that are now able to resonate with the people around them others say that they are capable of predicting these events.

Science has never given much  credit to all these testimonials.

A few years ago, Eben Alexander, a well known American neurosurgeon, fell into a coma. He miraculously regained consciousness a few days later. Although he was declared clinically dead (without any cerebral activity), he claimed  that he had visited parallel worlds. For the first time, a doctor dared to speak about this phenomenon.

Emmanuel is a senior reporter. He graduated in Political sciences, and is a specialist of the Middle East and Persian Gulf. In 2011, while he was covering the Nile Revolution in Egypt, Emmanuel  found himself in the middle of violent confrontations and he and his cameraman nearly died.

While one of his agressors was trying to stab him, he felt the strange sensation that he was leaving his body and observing a halo of light. He also heard a voice telling him to not be afraid. Within a few seconds, the situation calmed down.

Returning to France a few days after, Emmanuel felt that he had changed. He had become more receptive to others, more sensitive.

He started a lot of research and investigation work which gave him the possibility to meet other people who had lived this kind of experience.

Anouck is a spiritual healer.She had a difficult childhood. When she grew up she became very ill. These painful childhood experiences left her traumatised. With time, she discovered that she possessed the faculty to treat people by laying her hands on them and that she also had the gift of precognition or second sight. She says that she communicates with someone from the hereafter, who protects her.

In November 2013, in the suburbs of Montpellier, France, a young lady was a victim of a car accident and died. She was called Jenza, she was a singer and had, a few days before, released her first album.

Her producer, Marc Eric, was also her partner. Marc Eric comes from an intellectual background. He is an energetic entrepreneur, who specialises in Gregorian chants which he produces and composes for television.

Since Jenza’s death, he has tried several experiments, especially shamanic ones.By doing this he discovered that his mind could enter into contact with another world. He explains that sometimes he can feel Jenza’s presence.

Throughout the investigation, Christopher M , a psychotherapist specialized in post-traumatic shocksand who faced NDE (Near Death Experience) patients, will decrypt the investigation.

Scientists will also submit the protagonists of the story to specific tests, which will help us to understand if they are victims of hallucinations or are actually connected to another world , another life ... somewhere else! ..

These three characters will make up the leading theme in our documentary which will take us from France to the USA. Their stories will be interspersedby testimonials from scientists, experiments carried out in a laboratory (especially with Annouck) and by specialists who are well known in the field of paranormal phenomena.

This story will be a quest during which we will be able to discover if there  really is a life after death, or if it is simply a hallucinatory phenomenon

An interview of Sébastien Bouillé, producer of the documentary

What are the objectives of your documentary?

This film should allow us  to provide answers, from a scientific point of view, to all the people who have faced a near-death experiences, as well as people who have lost close family members or relations and who still feel their presence. Scientists recently tried to demonstrate that once we are dead, our mind continues its activity. In Russia, a searcher recently proved that the human expel energy at death moment. This documentary will evoque these scientific progresses. 

Why ask internet users to finance this documentary?

We all ask ourselves if something exists after our death. That's why we decided to make this documentary available to everybody for free. But for this, we need support and sponsors.

How about  you? Do you believe that there is a life after death?

I don't know. The aim of this film is precisely to provide one, or several answers to that question.

Which kind of media will this documentary be broadcasted on?

 “Toward other lifes”, will be available for free in French and English on our own YouTube channel, but also on national and regional news websites to whom we will transfer the exploitation rights.

Why did you choose Internet and not television?

Producing a documentary for television, a media I have worked for,  for many years, is restricted, in terms of timescale and of format type.  Even on cultural and scientific TV channels, the vocation of a TV channel is commercial and shouldcorrespond to precise criteria. Here, if my team and I judge that the movie should last 90minutes or more, I can do it. And the documentary  has to  be available to everybody, Internet being an univeral media.

How did you choose the witnesses who will take part in your documentary?

I have been working on the subject for 3 years. During my investigation, I was lucky to meet people who experienced NDE, others who say they are in contact with the afterlife, doctors, psychoanalyst, clergymen… At the end of my research, I chose people such as Anouck and Marc Eric because their experiences, even if they are very different, always bring back us to the same question: Is there a life after life? Anouck and Marc Eric also accepted to be confronted with the medical and scientific world. We will carry out some experiments with them.

Can internet users give their opinion about the film ?

We consult a lot of forum discussions which deal with this topic on Internet. This helps us in our reflexion and in the choice of avenues to explore.  We also create discussions on these forums in order to know what people are expecting from our documentary. This is also an inspiration for us.

« You are known for your war documentaries in the Middle East. With this documentary, are you not worried that people are waiting to catch you out? »

No, I completely trust the team I have been working with for many years. Everybody who knows me, knows that I have a pragmatic attitude and  that I am far from having my head in the clouds.

Your documentary cost about 75,000$ , that’s a huge budget, isn’t it?

No, a documentary produced according to professional criteria, costs rarely less than 130 000€ for a few months work. In this case , we have been working on this project for three years. The production company which I’m working with financed half of my research. They allowed my team to use a lot of technical equipment, which represents about 30% of the budget. The journalists, technicians and even myself agreed to work for free or half salary, that explains the relatively low cost for this kind of project.

The project has already recieved 42% of its financing, the budget we need to finalise our film is 60 000 euros which can be broken down as follows ; ( this budget is only a guide, the higher it is, the more developed the documentary will be)

Sébastien  Bouillé,  co-founder,  office  chief  and  senior reporter at BEW TV. He has worked on a range of stories; from the rebuilding of Gaza after the war to Syrian Refugees in Jordan. His work has been featured in many prominent television networks around the world including TF1, France 24, Babel press and Canal plus in France. For the last two years, he has been shooting and producing for Qatar TV’s documentary unit, in Europe, Egypt, Qatar, Kuwait, Oman, Abu Dhabi and in Madagascar.  He has also worked at the heart of the the development committee for Qatar TV during its renovation in 2012.

Emmanuel Razavi, senior reporter and associate researcher at Littoral Univiersity Graduated in Political Science, he is a specialist of the Persian Gulf, since 1997 he has covered the main events and conflicts in the Near and Middle-East: The second Intifada in Palestine, the Cedar revolution in Lebanon, the American military intervention in Afghanistan, the Nile revolution in Egypt… He has lived in Afghanistan, Qatar and Spain and worked for prominent editorials such as M6, Canal+, Planète, Arte, Valeurs Actuelles, Le Spectacle du Monde, Paris Match et Le Figaro Magazine. Nominated for the War Correspondents Awards in 2004 & 2009, He has produced hundreds of reports and documentaries about the Middle-East  including, in 2006 the remarkable  “Ben Laden, Les ratés d’une traque” which was broadcasted all over the world. Emmanuel has also produced and published essays and novels about the Near & Middle-East.  His work as senior reporter has been recognized by many medias such as Le Figaro, L’Express and Télérama.

en situation et d’être confronté au monde médical et scientifique. Nous
nous livrerons donc à quelques expériences avec eux. 
Les internautes auront-ils leur mot à dire sur le film?Nous consultons beaucoup les forums sur internet qui portent sur la question de la vie après la mort. Cela nous aide dans nos réflexions et sur le choix des pistes à exploiter. Nous créons également des fils de discussion sur ces forums pour savoir ce que chacun attend du documentaire. C'est aussi une source d'inspiration.
Vous êtes connu pour vos reportages de guerre au Moyen-Orient. Avec ce
film, vous n’avez pas peur qu’on vous attende au tournant ?
Non. Je travaille avec des gens de
confiance depuis des années. Ceux qui me connaissent savent que je suis très
pragmatique et bien loin d’avoir la tête dans les étoiles.
Une dernière question : Votre film coûte près de 60 000 euros.
N’est pas un gros budget?
Non. Un film documentaire, réalisé
selon des critères professionnels, coûte rarement moins de 130 000 euros pour
quelques mois de travail. Là, nous travaillons sur le projet depuis trois ans. La
société de production avec laquelle je travaille a d’ailleurs financé la moitié
de mes recherches. Elle a mis à la disposition de mon équipe des moyens
techniques conséquents, ce qui a constitué 30% du budget. Qu’il s’agisse des
journalistes, techniciens ou même de moi, tous ont accepté de travailler sur ce
film documentaire à moitié prix ou gratuitement, ce qui explique le coût
relativement faible pour un projet de ce genre. Le projet étant déjà financé à 42%, le budget nécessaire pour achever la réalisation de notre film est de 60 000 euros qui se répartit comme suit (ce budget est indicatif, plus il sera important plus l'enquête sera fournie):L'équipeSébastien Bouillé  est co-fondateur, directeur d’agence et grand
reporter à BEW TV. Il a travaillé sur un grand nombre de sujets tels que la
reconstruction de Gaza après la guerre, les Réfugiés Syrien en Jordanie, le
combat des Kurdes en Irak ou la résistance chrétienne en Syrie. Ses reportages
ont été diffusés dans d’importantes chaines de média en France et à
l’international comme TF1, France 24, Babel Press et Canal+. Il a travaillé
deux ans pour le service documentaire de Qatar TV, chaîne pour laquelle il a
tourné et produit des sujets en Europe, en Egypte, au Qatar, au Koweït, Oman,
Abu Dhabi,  et à Madagascar. Il a aussi
travaillé au sein du comité de développement de Qatar TV durant sa rénovation
en 2012.Emmanuel Razavi,  est Grand reporter et chercheur
associé à l’Université du Littoral. Diplômé de
sciences politiques, il est  spécialiste du golfe Persique, il a couvert depuis 1997 les grands évènements
et conflits du Proche et Moyen-Orient : seconde Intifada en Palestine,
révolution du cèdre au Liban, intervention américaine en Afghanistan,
révolution du Nil en Egypte… Il a
notamment vécu en Afghanistan, au Qatar et en Espagne et a travaillé pour des
rédactions telles M6, Canal+,
Planète,  Arte, Valeurs Actuelles, Le Spectacle du Monde, Paris Match et Le Figaro Magazine. Nommé au prix
des correspondants de guerre en 2004 et 2009, il a réalisé une centaine de reportages et documentaires sur le
Moyen-Orient parmi lesquels, en 2006, le
très remarqué « Ben Laden, les ratés
d’une traque », diffusé dans le monde entier. Emmanuel a également
publié plusieurs essais et romans sur le Proche et le Moyen-Orient. Son travail en tant que Grand reporter a été
salué par de nombreux médias parmi lesquels Le Figaro, l’Express et Télérama.English                                                      Toward other lives ?
                                       A documentary by Sébastien Bouillé
Is there a
life after death? Do we have many lives? Is there a parallel universe? 
Until now,
only mediums, spiritual healers or victims of post-traumatic shock gave us the
opportunity to reflect on this  subject. Recently,
a certain number of researchers have started to offer scientific explanations
to these questions. The objective of this documentary is to harmonise or to
oppose these esoteric and scientist theories, in order to answer the questions that
we all ask ourselves.
There are
plenty of testimonials from people who have experienced near-death experiences,
leaving their physical bodies and seeing themselves projected into tunnel of
light.Those who say they have come back from these experiences feel
completely changed.
They don’t
perceive the world in the same way  anymore. Some of them confess
that are now able to resonate with the people around them others say that they are
capable of predicting these events.
Science has
never given much  credit to all these testimonials.
A few years
ago, Eben Alexander, a well known American neurosurgeon, fell into a coma. He
miraculously regained consciousness a few days later. Although he was declared
clinically dead (without any cerebral activity), he claimed  that he had visited parallel worlds. For
the first time, a doctor dared to speak about this phenomenon.
Emmanuel is a senior reporter. He
graduated in Political sciences, and is a specialist of the Middle East and
Persian Gulf. In 2011, while he was covering the Nile Revolution in Egypt,
Emmanuel  found himself in the middle of violent confrontations and he and
his cameraman nearly died.
While one of
his agressors was trying to stab him, he felt the strange sensation that he was
leaving his body and observing a halo of light. He also heard a voice
telling him to not be afraid. Within a few seconds, the situation calmed down.
Returning to
France a few days after, Emmanuel felt that he had changed. He had become more
receptive to others, more sensitive.
He started a
lot of research and investigation work which gave him the possibility to meet
other people who had lived this kind of experience.
Anouck is a
spiritual healer.She had a
difficult childhood. When she grew up she became very ill. These painful
childhood experiences left her traumatised. With time, she discovered that she
possessed the faculty to treat people by laying her hands on them and that she
also had the gift of precognition or second sight. She says that she
communicates with someone from the hereafter, who protects her.
In November
2013, in the suburbs of Montpellier, France, a young lady was a victim of a car
accident and died. She was called Jenza, she was a singer and had, a few days
before, released her first album.
Her
producer, Marc Eric, was also her partner. Marc Eric comes
from an intellectual background. He is an energetic entrepreneur, who
specialises in Gregorian chants which he produces and composes for television.
Since
Jenza’s death, he has tried several experiments, especially shamanic ones.By
doing this he discovered that his mind could enter into contact with another
world. He explains that sometimes he can feel Jenza’s presence.
Throughout
the investigation, Christopher M , a psychotherapist
specialized in post-traumatic shocksand who faced NDE (Near Death Experience)
patients, will decrypt the investigation.
Scientists
will also submit the protagonists of the story to specific tests, which will
help us to understand if they are victims of hallucinations or are actually
connected to another world , another life ... somewhere else! ..

These three
characters will make up the leading theme in our documentary which will take us
from France to the USA. Their stories will be interspersedby testimonials from
scientists, experiments carried out in a laboratory (especially with Annouck)
and by specialists who are well known in the field of paranormal phenomena.
This story
will be a quest during which we will be able to discover if there  really
is a life after death, or if it is simply a hallucinatory phenomenon
An interview
of Sébastien Bouillé, producer of the documentary
What are the
objectives of your documentary?
This film
should allow us  to provide answers, from a scientific point of view, to
all the people who have faced a near-death experiences, as well as people who
have lost close family members or relations and who still feel their presence.
Scientists recently tried to demonstrate that once we are dead, our mind
continues its activity. In Russia, a searcher recently proved that the human
expel energy at death moment. This documentary will evoque these scientific
progresses. 
Why ask
internet users to finance this documentary?
We all ask
ourselves if something exists after our death. That's why we decided to make
this documentary available to everybody for free. But for this, we need support
and sponsors.
How about
 you? Do you believe that there is a life after death?
I don't
know. The aim of this film is precisely to provide one, or several answers to
that question.
Which kind
of media will this documentary be broadcasted on?
 “Toward
other lifes”, will be available for free in French and English on
our own YouTube channel, but also on national and regional news websites to
whom we will transfer the exploitation rights.
Why did you
choose Internet and not television?
Producing a
documentary for television, a media I have worked for,  for many years, is
restricted, in terms of timescale and of format type.  Even on cultural
and scientific TV channels, the vocation of a TV channel is commercial and
shouldcorrespond to precise criteria. Here, if my team and I judge that the
movie should last 90minutes or more, I can do it. And the documentary  has to  be available to everybody, Internet being an univeral
media.
How
did you choose the witnesses who will take part in your documentary?
I
have been working on the subject for 3 years. During my investigation, I was
lucky to meet people who experienced NDE, others who say they are in contact
with the afterlife, doctors, psychoanalyst, clergymen… At the end of my
research, I chose people such as Anouck and Marc Eric because their
experiences, even if they are very different, always bring back us to the same
question: Is there a life after life? Anouck and Marc Eric also accepted to be
confronted with the medical and scientific world. We will carry out some
experiments with them.
Can internet
users give their opinion about the film ?
We consult a
lot of forum discussions which deal with this topic on Internet. This helps us
in our reflexion and in the choice of avenues to explore.  We also create
discussions on these forums in order to know what people are expecting from our
documentary. This is also an inspiration for us.
« You
are known for your war documentaries in the Middle East. With this documentary,
are you not worried that people are waiting to catch you out? »
No, I
completely trust the team I have been working with for many years. Everybody
who knows me, knows that I have a pragmatic attitude and  that I am far
from having my head in the clouds.
Your
documentary cost about 75,000$ , that’s a huge budget, isn’t it?
No, a
documentary produced according to professional criteria, costs rarely less than
130 000€ for a few months work. In this case , we have been working on this
project for three years. The production company which I’m working with financed
half of my research. They allowed my team to use a lot of technical equipment,
which represents about 30% of the budget. The journalists, technicians and even
myself agreed to work for free or half salary, that explains the relatively low
cost for this kind of project. 
The project
has already recieved 42% of its financing, the budget we need to finalise our
film is 60 000 euros which can be broken down as follows ; ( this
budget is only a guide, the higher it is, the more developed the documentary
will be)
Sébastien 
Bouillé, 
co-founder,  office  chief  and  senior reporter at BEW TV.
He has worked on a range of stories; from the rebuilding of Gaza after the war
to Syrian Refugees in Jordan. His work has been featured in many prominent
television networks around the world including TF1, France 24, Babel press and
Canal plus in France. For the last two years, he has been shooting and
producing for Qatar TV’s documentary unit, in Europe, Egypt, Qatar, Kuwait,
Oman, Abu Dhabi and in Madagascar.  He
has also worked at the heart of the the development committee for Qatar TV
during its renovation in 2012.
Emmanuel
Razavi, senior
reporter and associate researcher at Littoral Univiersity Graduated in
Political Science, he is a specialist of the Persian Gulf, since 1997 he has
covered the main events and conflicts in the Near and Middle-East: The second
Intifada in Palestine, the Cedar revolution in Lebanon, the American military
intervention in Afghanistan, the Nile revolution in Egypt… He has lived in
Afghanistan, Qatar and Spain and worked for prominent editorials such as M6,
Canal+, Planète, Arte, Valeurs Actuelles, Le Spectacle du Monde, Paris Match et
Le Figaro Magazine. Nominated for the War Correspondents Awards in 2004 &
2009, He has produced hundreds of reports and documentaries about the Middle-East
 including, in 2006 the remarkable  “Ben Laden, Les ratés d’une traque” which was
broadcasted all over the world. Emmanuel has also produced and published essays
and novels about the Near & Middle-East.  His work as senior reporter
has been recognized by many medias such as Le Figaro, L’Express and
Télérama.

story:
----- We have raised 10.946€ on Indiegogo and through private donations. 31% of our target. We want to thank each and every one of you for this great achievement. We couldn't have done it without you ----

The House of Dreams project was launched before the earthquakes happened in Nepal.
A Hand for a House of Dream is not an urgent rescue NGO, we can not provide help for earthquake casualties, but we are very aware of the impact it will have on the Nepalese children. We HAVE to think of the future and try to build them a safe House they can call Home. Please donate and share the campaign. Thank you ------


Who are we ?

We, A Hand for A House of Dreams, are an Austrian NGO committed to give our children a second chance to a secure life, to their healing of what often is a painful past, to a future protected from the hazards of poverty and the exclusion lack of education brings. We work closely with a Nepalese family, who’s grassroots NGO provides care on the ground.

  www.hhdprogram.org

From Europe to Asia, our teams and volunteers, work hand in hand to ensure the effectiveness of the work we are doing.

We believe the greatest of dreams are achieved one small step at the time. Today, our project aims at providing them a decent and safe house.


Why build a house ?

A house is a shelter. A basic need. And in Nepal, it can be so much more:

  • ECONOMIC SECURITY: Through property ownership, the Nepalese organization we are supporting can turn into a sustainable infrastructure, attract further investments and develop revenue generating socio-economic activities.
  • EDUCATION: Children in stable environments can follow a proper education without being dragged from school to school, regularly attend classes and have a better focus on their superior studies.
  • HEALTH: By providing most decent conditions and facilities, preserving a good hygiene environment and maintaining education at the earliest age.
  • SAFETY: By avoiding another forced eviction, constructing a secure structure for natural disasters and building safe accommodations to prevent from criminal activities in and around the house (e.g. house break-in)
  • COMMUNITY: Housing, as a social priority, helps creating social stability, improving the local integration and preserving the cultural identity.


What do we need ?

Our wish for the coming year is to build one house for 15 people. A house adapted and suitable to their needs :

- 6 rooms with individual beds and wardrobes (1 for boys, 1 for girls, 2 for the Nepalese family and 2 for volunteers)

- 1 study room with desks, furniture storage, library and computers

- 1 kitchen with place at the table for everyone and safe cooking equipment

- 2 bathrooms, good sanitaries and 1 nursery

- 1 generator for back-up electric power

- a garden for vegetables farming and piece of land for playground area

Without land purchasing, we need around 35.000€.  Out of this amount:

 - 60% will go to actual construction costs 

 - 10% to workforce

 - 20% to building permits and governmental taxes

 - 5% to transport, organization, operational costs

 - 5% to furniture and equipment

This is a community-based project – that is, all materials and workforce will be sourced locally to help to develop the local economy and boost the incomes of local families.


Who is involved ?
More than our permanent team members, we are grateful to count on amazing people, supporting and helping us in particular for this dream to come true :


How can YOU help ?
  • Make a donation and receive a meaningful gift
  • Help us spread the word about the campaign (you can use the social media sharing tools here on our Indiegogo page)
  • Volunteer in Nepal during the construction : please contact volunteer[at]hhdprogram.org
  • Tell us what you think about the campaign. We are learning along the way and we would like to hear your thoughts: communication@hhdprogram.org
You will also be able to track the project progress and updates on www.facebook.com/hhdprogram
If we don't reach our €35,000 goal, the "Flexible Funding" option will allow us to keep the money and invest it into renovating the current old house. From new furniture, proper ceiling isolation and two new windows, to the building of decent toilets and showers, a local water disinfection system and a power invertor to secure 24h electricity, all are foreseen. In addition, we aim at financing at least the building of a house extension to allow for separate sleeping rooms for the boys and girls in the house, proper for optimum health conditions.

THANK YOU
-- A Hand for A House of Dreams team --

From new furniture, proper ceiling isolation and two new windows, to the building of decent toilets and showers, a local water disinfection system and a power invertor to secure 24h electricity, all are foreseen. In addition, we aim at financing at least the building of a house extension to allow for separate sleeping rooms for the boys and girls in the house, proper for optimum health conditions.
THANK YOU
-- A Hand for A House of Dreams team --

story:
The Shack, A Family Owned Restaurant with a Passion for food Wants to Grow and has to Move!

The Shack was established in 2011 by the husband-wife duo of James and Chauntelle Grigsby.  Since opening their doors, The Shack has been Featured on ABC 33/40 Taste of Alabama twice, NBC 13 Daytime Alabama, Discover Saint Clair Magazine and The Saint Clair Times. A Finalist in nine categories of The Peoples Choice Awards by The Trussville Tribune and featured on the Gulf Shores/Orange Beach Board of tourisms' "Eat Your Way to The Beach". The recognition we have received has been nice, but our satisfaction comes from feeding people and seeing the enjoyment that a great plate of food can create. 

Please take a stroll down memory lane with us, www.shackburgers.com will take you to our Facebook page. Our entire history, from day one, is right there.  

Because of the valued support of our guests, we now have the opportunity to expand The Shack and establish a brand new permanent home within the Clay/Trussville area. We are currently evaluating three locations to find the perfect spot to allow The Shack to grow and reach its potential.  We cannot make this transition successful without your support. 

"We are a family business without large investors. This new restaurant is the biggest investment and risk we have ever undertaken and we can only do so much on our own. That's why we are asking for your help."

Since our humble beginning we have grown every year and have already made a couple of moves, and now, four years later, we're ready (and it's necessary!) to do it again. With owners working side by side with the amazing employees, and dedicating themselves to consistently good food and service, you can be assured you're supporting not only an ethical establishment, but also hard-working families. Our food is our passion, and your support makes all the difference in the world. 

Each of the locations we are evaluating have amazing features that will benefit The Shack and allow us to do a better job of serving our customers and creating a memorable experience. However each of the spots also have areas that will need improvement.  No matter the success of this campaign, you can rest assured that every last cent will go towards the betterment of The Shack, making your visit the best possible experience. 

We have come up with some especially great rewards for all levels of donation, ranging from private catered events to heartfelt thanks to free coffee for life! Be sure to peruse all our offerings to find something that speaks to you. And do check back often as we will continue to update and add rewards as they are claimed. If you happen to find yourself in the position of not being able to afford to donate, do not despair! Make a valuable contribution by making some noise and spreading the word about this campaign. Also, be sure to utilize IndieGoGo's share tools.

The Shack is quickly becoming an institution in the area and with your help it will only get better. We are incredibly grateful for the support of our community throughout the years, and our goal is to reward that dedication with delicious food, served by a courteous and competent staff in a family-oriented atmosphere. The Shack is a place where all are welcomed with a warm smile, and leave with a full belly.

story:
Who are we? What's our goal?

Hello Internet! My name is Kyle Kelly, an inspiring film maker. I have a passion and a love for film, music, and art. These medias have interested me since I was little and I feel like I have so much to share with the world through them! Currently I am working on starting up a film studio with a group of like minded individuals, but as you can imagine, it is expensive.  Our goal is to make a studio that doesn't just work on making and producing movies, but also allows for collaboration with other independent artist to help them get their product into the world. Whether your product is music, art, short stories, plays, full length films, or community improvement, we want to help!


Costs

Our goal is to get our first production, a feature length film called What Irish Luck, in the public eye and generate the fiscal means to support the film and its participates.  Here is a short breakdown of what the funds will go to.



Equipment - $15,500
  • Editing hardware (Computers/hard drives/storage equipment)
  • Cameras
  • Shoulder Rigs
  • Dollies
  • Stabilizers 
  • Video Heads 
  • Tripods
  • External Monitors
  • Back Lighting
  • Sliders
  • Editing Software 
Marketing - $4,500.
  • Facebook Ads
  • YouTube Ads
  • Google Ads
  • Film Festival Costs
  • Travel Costs (for talk/radio shows and festivals)
  • Community Advertising
Production - $20,000
  • Location
  • Wardrobe
  • Cast + Crew Costs 
Unforeseen Expenses - $500

What is What Irish Luck?

What Irish Luck is the story of a young Irish-American who wants more out of life than he was given. This film follows Sean Callahan as he deals with his deadbeat family, looses those closest to him, and tries to figure out his place in the world. What Irish Luck is a film about relationships and how they change who we are, for better or for worse.


What's The Deal With The Perks?

Each perk will include all of the perks priced below the one you choose (with a few exceptions). Each perk gets you a special thank you mention in the end credits of What Irish Luck. If you select perks that require delivery by mail (shirt, DVDs, picture), they will be mailed as soon as they are ready to be delivered.


Membership Access 
With the membership access perk you'll get an access code that you can redeem on our website. This will get you discounts on LBZstudios apparel and behind the scenes footage not seen anywhere else. As a member you will also have access to exclusive shorts, sketches, and DIY videos. The access code can be redeemed at anytime, giving you the opportunity to wait until we have fully established the studio to reap the most out of your reward!

When can you expect them?
  • DVD's will be sent out in January of 2016
  • Digital copies of What Irish Luck and the OST will be sent out as soon as post production has finished (most likely November or December)
  • Shirts, hoodies, posters will be put in the mail during the tail end of filming in July
  • The signed pictures will be put in the mail as soon as filming has rapped up in late July
  • Thank you cards will be signed and sent during post production between August and October

Other Ways You Can Help


Don't feel like handing over money? That's understandable! You can still help us by getting the word out!

  • Share this page on your Facebook or other sites!
  • Talk to friends and family to see if they would be interested in joining us!
  • Share our other sites like our Facebook and Twitter pages. 
  • Go check out our website!
  • Any questions? E-mail us at lbz.films@gmail.com or use the hashtag #WhatIrishLuck or #LBZfilms on Twitter and Facebook.
story_txt:
Who are we? What's our goal?Hello Internet! My name is Kyle Kelly, an inspiring film maker. I have a passion and a love for film, music, and art. These medias have interested me since I was little and I feel like I have so much to share with the world through them! Currently I am working on starting up a film studio with a group of like minded individuals, but as you can imagine, it is expensive.  Our goal is to make a studio that doesn't just work on making and producing movies, but also allows for collaboration with other independent artist to help them get their product into the world. Whether your product is music, art, short stories, plays, full length films, or community improvement, we want to help!

Costs




Our goal is to get our first production, a feature length film called What Irish Luck, in the public eye and
generate the fiscal means to support the film and its participates.  Here is a short breakdown of what the funds will go to.


Equipment - $15,500
Editing hardware (Computers/hard drives/storage equipment)

Cameras
Shoulder Rigs
Dollies
Stabilizers 
Video Heads 
Tripods
External Monitors
Back Lighting
Sliders
Editing Software 
Marketing - $4,500.
Facebook Ads
YouTube Ads
Google Ads

Film Festival Costs
Travel Costs (for talk/radio shows and festivals)
Community Advertising

Production - $20,000
Location
Wardrobe

Cast + Crew Costs 

Unforeseen Expenses - $500
What is What Irish Luck?What Irish Luck is the story of a young Irish-American who wants more out of life than he was given. This film follows Sean Callahan as he deals with his deadbeat family, looses those closest to him, and tries to figure out his place in the world. What Irish Luck is a film about relationships and how they change who we are, for better or for worse.

What's The Deal With The Perks?Each perk will include all of the perks priced below the one you choose (with a few exceptions). Each perk gets you a special thank you mention in the end credits of What Irish Luck. If you select perks that require delivery by mail (shirt, DVDs, picture), they will be mailed as soon as they are ready to be delivered. 





Membership Access With the membership access perk you'll get an access code that you can redeem on our website. This will get you discounts on LBZstudios apparel and behind the scenes footage not seen anywhere else. As a member you will also have access to exclusive shorts, sketches, and DIY videos. The access code can be redeemed at anytime, giving you the opportunity to wait until we have fully established the studio to reap the most out of your reward!When can you expect them?

DVD's will be sent out in January of 2016


Digital copies of What Irish Luck and the OST will be sent out as soon as post production has finished (most likely November or December)

Shirts, hoodies, posters will be put in the mail during the tail end of filming in July
The signed pictures will be put in the mail as soon as filming has rapped up in late July
Thank you cards will be signed and sent during post production between August and October





Other Ways You Can Help


   
Don't feel like handing over money? That's understandable! You can still help us by getting the word out!


Share this page on your Facebook or other sites!
Talk to friends and family to see if they would be interested in joining us!
Share our other sites like our Facebook and Twitter pages. 
Go check out our website! 

Any questions? E-mail us at lbz.films@gmail.com or use the hashtag #WhatIrishLuck or #LBZfilms on Twitter and Facebook.

story:
The Pigman

A short fantasy drama film set in the Mourne Mountains, N. Ireland. The film is written by Rik Gordon and is based in his home village of Rostrevor, Co. Down. The film follows a strange fictional creature known locally as "The Pigman". 

  • Rik has worked on many film projects and this film will be the first professional project undertaken since finishing university.
  • The campaign will help cover some production costs including the make-up required for the main character and also renting of equipment and buying props.
  • This film will be a great advertisement for the area and the final film will hopefully be an enjoyable film that will be sent to short film festivals around the world

The Pigman enjoys a beer before passing out, all alone up in his ruined mountainous home

What We Need & What You Get

  • Though we have a lot of great people volunteering and helping on the production, funds are greatly needed to create the mask and costume for the main character. The mask needs to be made from scratch and will require expensive materials and a lot of preparation days. The mask needs to be realistic and authentic as it is vital to the credibility of the character. Some scenes also take place at night and HMI lights will need to be rented for some of the night shots. Also it is important to pay talent for the grueling film making process so some of the money raised along with our own funds will go towards this. 
  • We have some great perks for those who contribute, including shout outs on fb and twitter, glossy A3 posters, VIP screenings of the film and for a little bit more you can also be included in the credits and have a logo shown at the end of the film.

  • If unfortunately we don't reach the entire goal, the funds will still be put into the film but we will have to cut some corners in regards to the production, which won't be ideal but the show must  go on.

Risks & Challenges

Though the film is a short the amount of work required is still intensive. A great deal of planning has gone into the pre-production of the film but as with all projects we expect some hurdles and obstacles so creating a contingency plan and preparing for the worst will allow the production to run as smoothly as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, no worries! Thank you once again for looking at our project and hopefully you can help in other ways. We would be really grateful if you could share our campaign using the share tools on this page or just by sharing our link. Don't forget to like our Facebook page to keep up to date with the production! If you want to help creatively and feel you can contribute in another way please get in touch!

Thank you

Rik & Team

story:
Why blackout?

blackout is a story about two brothers who grew up in less than desirable circumstances, yet they both lead considerably different paths in life. While one brother is a stereotypical product of his environment, the other brother has defied odds and excelled scholastically, socially and athletically. Why is this important? It's simple. It doesn't matter if you're black, white, purple, blue, yellow or green; everyone deserves a fair chance at life. A chance to succeed. 

You'd be hard-pressed to find a bigger NFL fan than me. I love the game. However, periodically the NFL will black out NFL games if a stadium fails to sell out the stadium. It bugs me to no end. When a team fails to perform, many fans of that team won't support them, mainly by not showing up to the games because there's no value in wasting your Sunday afternoon watching your favorite teams get crushed. Similarly, if you follow the news and notice the lack of diversity in film and television, it is my belief that black people are effectively blacked out from relevance because our stories don't hold very much value. It is sad but undeniable that our lives/stories aren't given that much attention and that needs to change.

We Need You!

This film won't be possible without your support! As we gear up for principal photography, post-production and our film festival campaign, we'll need all the support that we can get!

Your funds will help offset fees for: 

  • camera and lighting packages
  • location arrangements
  • production design materials
  • production insurance
  • feeding our crew
  • film festival entry packages

Meet The Crew (:

My crew and I all attended Florida State Film School together, where we spent countless hours perfecting our craft and preparing for the rigors of the film industry. We're qualified and talented storytellers and together we will be phenomenal!

Ronin - Writer/Director

Born into a military family, Ronin Lee spent time in several different places as a child including Alaska, Detroit and Ohio. At the age of eight, Ronin's mother finally planted roots in Las Vegas, Nevada, where he would spend his formative years. He went on to graduate from high school and attend Howard University, where he attained his Bachelors in Business-Marketing. Ronin followed in his mother's footsteps and joined the US Air Force, where he would serve as an officer for four years and attained his Masters degree in Entertainment Business from Full Sail University. After his separation from the military, he spent one year working towards his Masters in Film Production from Florida State University. After completing a year of the program he moved back to Los Angeles to follow his dream full-time. Ronin has written and directed five short films of his own along with working over 1000 man hours on short films in every position from producer to grip/gaffer to script supervisor. 


Becky - Producer


Born and raised in the foothills of Los Angeles, filmmaker and producer Rebekah Rae Peck learned early on how to work a crowd as the youngest of five. Growing up with such a big family, she learned to corral the masses and take charge in order for anything to get done. After college she thought it made the most sense to move out of the Entertainment Capital of the World to Tallahassee of all places. studying writing and producing. Now traveling between the humid alligator infested towns of Florida to the reality hungry streets of L.A. she uses her growing skills as a storyteller and producer to bring her projects to life.

Che - Director of Photography


Growing up in the robust streets of Manila, Che Espiritu is a Filipina filmmaker-cinematographer who has developed an eye and passion for street cinematography and neorealist drama. In search of more stories to tell through the lens, she has travelled to the other side of the world and has recently finished her MFA in Motion Picture Arts in Florida State University. With long time aesthetic influences from Philippine independent guerilla cinema as well as her greatest hero, the Mexican cinematographer Lubezki, she now explores the city of Los Angeles, and captures its life and grit with urban and neorealist cinema. 


Nia - Production Designer


Nia Imani is a visual artist and filmmaker from Florida with an MFA from FSU’s College of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.With 7 years experience in editing and marketing she has worked on campaigns for companies such as ABC Family and Hard Rock Cafe.


The Takeaway...

While one of the brothers in blackout never had a chance, the other brother makes a way out of no way. Despite this, his chance at life is ruthlessly taken from him. Similar stories have been broadcast across America. However, it is critical that these stories cease and people begin to value black lives. It is a hard truth, but black people need to start valuing black lives as well, as our best and brightest are being taken too soon. It is our goal for this film to start conversations to change the negative perceptions of black people and instill in everyone that all lives matter.


You can't donate? Totally fine!!! We still need you!

We could definitely use your help getting the word out about the project! Please share our IndieGoGo page as much as you can using your Twitters, Facebooks, Instagrams, Vines, Snapchats etc. Make sure you share our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/blackouttheshortfilm?r...) as well. We anticipate that this project will be a HUGE success and that is solely because of contributors like YOU!
Thank you for your support!
