story:
English

 

Angélica has spent her whole life running away from her mixed racial identity, but a family crisis forces her to confront her identity, her family, and rethink her life.

About the project:

Angélica is a psychological drama that exposes the implications of racism and sexism, reflecting on how the oppressive nature of discrimination affects family relations and the individual. Angélica has to confront the decisions she must make about her life. In the process she rediscovers herself as a strong, independent, mulatto Puerto Rican woman in a globalized world.

Angelica is a micro-budget film in the final stages of post production. During the years it has taken to get to this point, we have received the financial support of various entities and organizations as well as the generous support, effort, time, and resources of many others. Nevertheless, we still need additional cash funding to be able to complete Angelica. That is why we are asking for your collaboration in order finish our film.

Please help us by becoming a supporter!


  

The destination of the funds:

Donations will be completely for the post production of the movie.  As follows:

Color Correction
Sound Design
THX Mix
Final DCP delivery
licensing fees

 With your contribution you become our supporter.

Plans for the movie:

The movie will be distributed through national and international film festivals. Angelica will be released in 2016 in theaters in Puerto Rico and Mexico. It will also be distributed in DVD VOoD and in TV cultural centers and academic forums.


Cast:

 

Michelle Nonó Rodriguez – Angélica

Michelle Nonó is an up and coming actress and theater director from Puerto Rico. She is also a scenic artist, cultural manager, and educator.  She has performed in Argentina, Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico. 

 

Johanna Rosaly - Ángeles

Veteran Puerto Rican actress was the star of numerous soap operas, some of the them very successful soap operas, such as Ël hijo de Ángela María” (The Son of Angela Maria) and "Cristina Bazán."  She has also been presenter of film programs, reporter, news anchor and has acted in unitarians and miniseries . In film she has participated in multiple short films and feature films, including “Lo que le pasó a Santiago (What Happened to Santiago,) which was nominated for Oscar - for best foreign language film, and " Linda Sara”.

 

Willie Denton – Wilfredo

An actor and mime, who in the past two decades has distinguished himself in the national and international artistic scene. In theater, we can mention titles such as:  La Vida es Sueño, La Carreta, Dona Barbara, Othello, Euridice, Race. In film he had his debut under Stephen Hopkins in Under Suspicion.  In 2015 he starred as Pedro Knight in Telemundo’s TV series Celia.


 

Yamil Collazo – José

Actor, dancer , visual artist y announcer has participated in theater plays such as: El Cartel del Bacalao, Tiempo Muerto, Ahmen, Coraje and The Livingroom. In film he participated in films such as: Héroes de otra Patria, Miente, Maldeamores, y The Argentine, directed by Steven Soderbergh. 

 

Rene Monclova – Carlos

René Monclova has been part of the television programs: "¡Que Vacilón!", "El Condominio" y "Club Sunshine".  The long list of theater plays in which he has participated includes: "La Verdadera Historia de Pedro Navaja", "La Carreta", "Tiempo Muerto", "La Pasión según Ántigona Pérez" and the musicals "Hair Spray",  y "Cabaret". His career includes titles in film such as: “Lo que le pasó a Santiago",  "Jugando en serio", "Ángel",  y "Havana".


 

Modesto Lacen Cepeda - Juan

Modesto Lacen studied Drama at the University of Puerto Rico and Art Administration at NYU. In theater, we can mention plays such as: "Sophy a Rafael Hernández… Hasta siempre, mis jibaritos", La Barbería (HOLA award), DC-7: La historia de Roberto Clemente (HOLA, ATI award), Ser o no cer…vantes (HOLA award), Réquiem por Yarini (HOLA award), amongst others. He has also participated in more than 25 films amongst them: El Cimarrón, Héroes de otra patria, Sudor Amargo, Kidnapped in Paradise, Back in the day, Cualquier infinito posible. In 2015 he starred as the young Pedro Knight in Telemundo’s TV series Celia.

 

 Kisha Tikina Burgos - Vanesa

Kisha Tikina Burgos is an actress, writer, director, producer and educator.  “Anoche soñé que me comías”, “De mala muerte”, “La memoria de los elefantes”, “7 Plays, 7 Days” y “Oh De Sea” , are some of her theater plays produced in Puerto Rico and New York. Kisha is the writer, producer  and actress of the film UNDER MY NAILS, with which she won awards; Best Female Performance at the San Juan International Film Festival and “Best Individual Performance” in the l Festival Cine La Américas, Austin, Texas. UNDER MY NAILS.


The creative team:

Marisol Gomez Mouakad -screenwriter, director, editor, and producer

Puerto Rican filmmaker and painter. Her first and Second short film Rosa and Lazos respectively have both premiered in several festivals including the Boston Film Festival, Festival Tous Courts in France, XXII International Festival Guadalajara Film, among others. As a visual artist she has had exhibitions in New York, Boston, and Puerto Rico.

Ignacio Decerega - Co-Producer

Historian and filmmaker Ignacio Decerega, is the co-producer of Angélica. Throughout his career, Ignacio has worked with all aspects of film production, from script development and writing, to digital postproduction. Many has been the undertakings of Ignacio, and some of the latest include “Altépetl-Bosque de Agua” a documentary on the social history of water in Central Mexico and “Angélica”.

Rocio Zambrano - Post Producer

Trained in traditional animation, Rocio Zambrano is an editor and postproduction supervisor in feature films, documentaries, broadcast and commercials. Her credits include award-winning shorts such as Oscuro Animal (Ignacio Decerega/2006,) feature-length documentaries like Furious Madmen: Taraf de Haidouks in México, and commercials and feature films like Matando Cabos , Carambola, Satanás, and 7 Soles

Erika Licea Orozco -Director of Photography

Graduated from the “Centro Universitario de Estudios Cinematograficos” (CUEC-UNAM), where she specialized in cinematography,  She has been the Director of Photography of short films and Feature length films in titles such as: "En los cuernos de la luna," "Quemar Las Naves" (Best Cinematography Award at the 5th International Film Festival in Morelia,) "My Life Inside" (recognized in Cannes Critics' Week 2000.)

Rosino Serrano - Musical Director

Rosino Serrano has worked with prominent Latino artists and has composed original music for 29 films, many of them gaining international awards. His credits include: Edward James Olmos’ "Walkout," with Carlos Santana’s collaboration, and "The Crime of Father Amaro,” which received the Mahayuel for Best Music in the International Film Festival in Guadalajara, and was nominated for an Oscar, Best Foreign Film.

Nydia Mercedes Gonzalez - Production Designer 

Graduated from the Theater Arts program from the University of Puerto Rico,  She has had extensive experience in theater. In film she has worked as Assistant Set Decorator, Assistant Production Designer, Property Master, and Art Director in films like “Life During Wartime”, “The Argentine”, “La Mala” and “The Losers”.


Contact:

Marisol Gomez Mouakad: hormigacinema@gmail.com

www.angelicathemovie.com

Thank you. We really need your support!

 



Español

Español

Angélica lleva toda su vida huyendo de su identidad birracial, pero una crisis familiar la obliga a enfrentarse a su identidad y a su familia y a replantear su vida.

Sobre el proyecto

“Angélica” es un drama psicológico que expone las implicaciones del racismo y el machismo, reflexionando sobre cómo la violencia opresiva de la discriminación afecta las relaciones familiares e individuales.  Angélica se enfrenta a decisiones sobre su ser y se redescubre como mujer fuerte, independiente, mulata y puertorriqueña en un mundo “globalizado”.

“Angélica” es una película con un micro-presupuesto. Estamos en la fase final de postproducción. Durante estos años hemos recibido el apoyo financiero devarias entidades y organizaciones, al igual que los recursos, el tiempo y el esfuerzo que otros han aportado desinteresadamente. Pero todavía necesitamos recaudar fondos que permitan terminar la película.

Es por eso que solicitamos la colaboración de todos ustedes para finalizar nuestra película.


La destinación de los fondos:

El dinero recaudado será utilizado completamente para la post producción la película.  Especificamente para:

Correción de Color
Diseño de Sonido
Mezcla THX 
Entrega final de DCP 
pagos de licencias

  Con su aportación usted se convierte en nuestro  auspiciador.


Planes para la película:

“Angélica” se distribuirá en de festivales internacionales y nacionales y estrenará en el 2016 en las salas de cine en Puerto Rico. También será distribuida por medio de DVD, VOod, televisión, centros culturales y foros académicos. 


Elenco

 

Michelle Nonó – Angélica

Michelle Nonó es una actriz y directora de teatro emergente de Puerto Rico.  Fundo el espacio cultural; Patio Taller Las Nietas de Nonó;  en 2011 con el propósito de promover las artes. Se ha presentado en las tablas de Argentina, República Dominicana y Puerto Rico. Se ha presentado en Argentina, República Dominicana y Puerto Rico. 

 

Johanna Rosaly - Ángeles

La renombrada actriz puertorriqueña Johanna Rosaly  fue la protagonista de un sin número de telenovelas, algunas sumamente exitosas como “El hijo de Ángela María”y "Cristina Bazán".  Ella ha sido presentadora de programas de cine, anfitriona, actriz de unitarios y miniseries, reportera y ancla de noticiarios, y ha participado en múltiples cortometrajes y largometrajes, entre ellas la candidata al Oscar a la mejor película extranjera “Lo que le Pasó a Santiago”y“Linda Sara.

 

Willie Denton – Wilfredo

Actor y mimo, que en las pasadas dos décadas se ha destacado en la escena artística nacional e internacional. En el teatro podemos mencionar trabajos como:  La Vida es Sueño, La Carreta, Dona Barbara, Othello, Euridice, Razas, . En el cine hizo su debut de la mano de Stephen Hopkins en el papel de Ben en la cinta Under Suspicion . En el 2015 protagoniza a Pedro Knight en la serie de televisión Celia de la cadena Telemundo. 


 

Yamil Collazo – José

Actor, bailarín , artista plástico y locutor,  ha participado en obras teatrales como El Cartel del Bacalao, Tiempo Muerto, Ahmen, Coraje y The Livingroom. En cine ha participado en películas como Héroes de otra Patria, Miente, Maldeamores, y The Argentine bajo la dirección de Steven Soderbergh. 

 

Rene Monclova – Carlos

René Monclova a formado parte de los programas de televisión "¡Que Vacilón!", "El Condominio" y "Club Sunshine".  La extensa lista de obras en las que ha participado incluye: "La Verdadera Historia de Pedro Navaja", "La Carreta", "Tiempo Muerto", "La Pasión según Ántigona Pérez" y los musicales "Hair Spray",  y "Cabaret". Además su carrera  incluye títulos de cine, como: “Lo que le pasó a Santiago",  "Jugando en serio", "Ángel",  y "Havana".


 

Modesto Lacen Cepeda - Juan

Modesto Lacen estudió Drama en la Universidad de Puerto Rico y Administración en las Artes en NYU. En el teatro podemos mencionar trabajos como: "Sophy a Rafael Hernández… Hasta siempre, mis jibaritos", La Barbería ( Premio HOLA), DC-7: La historia de Roberto Clemente (Premio HOLA, ATI), Ser o no cer…vantes (Premio HOLA), Réquiem por Yarini (Premio HOLA), entre otras. Ha participado en más de 25 películas entre ellas: El Cimarrón, Héroes de otra patria, Sudor Amargo, Animal, Kidnapped in Paradise, Second Honeymoon, Back in the day, Cualquier infinito posible.. En el 2015 protagoniza al joven Pedro Knight en la serie Celia de Telemundo.


 

 Kisha Tikina Burgos - Vanesa

Kisha Tikina Burgos es actriz, escritora, directora, productora y educadora de teatro y cine. “Anoche soñé que me comías”, “De mala muerte”, “La memoria de los elefantes”, “7 Plays, 7 Days” y “Oh De Sea” (adaptación de “La Odisea”), son algunas de sus obras teatrales producidas en Puerto Rico y en Nueva York. Kisha es la escritora, productora y actriz del filme UNDER MY NAILS, con el cual recibió dos premios por su trabajo actoral; Mejor Actuación Femenina en el Festival de Cine Internacional de San Juan y “Best Individual Performance” en el Festival Cine La Américas, Austin, Texas. UNDER MY NAILS.


Los creativos:

Marisol Gómez-Mouakad - Guionista, directora, editora y productora

Cineasta y artista plástica puertorriqueña, su primer y segundo cortometraje Rosa y Lazos, respectivamente, se estrenaron en varios festivales de cine internacionales tales como Boston Film Festival, 2004 Festival Tous Courts en Francia, Festival de Cine de Huesca 2006, Festival Internacional de Cine de Cartagena 2006, XXII Festival Internacional de Cine de Guadalajara. Como artista visual ha tenido exhibiciones en Boston, Nueva York, y Puerto Rico.

Ignacio Decerega - Coproductor

Historiador y cineasta, através de su carrera ha trabajado con todos los aspectos de la producción de cine, desde el desarrollo del guión, hasta la post producción digital. Ha trabajado en muchas producciones. Algunos de los últimos proyectos son: “Altépetl-Bosque de Agua” un documental sobre la historia social del agua en México y “Angélica”.

Rocio Zambrano - Post-productora

Entrenada en la animación tradicional, Rocio Zambrano es editora y supervisora de post producción.  Sus créditos incluyen cortometrajes premiados tales como Oscuro Animal (Ignacio Decerega/2006,) documentales  como Furious Madmen: Taraf de Haidouks en México, y largometrajes como Matando Cabos , Carambola  , Satanás y 7 Soles (Pedro Ultreras/ Cuadrante Films / Mexico).

Erika Licea Orozco - Directora de Fotografía

Graduada del Centro Universitario de Estudios Cinematográficos” (CUEC-UNAM) donde se especializó en cinematografía,  Ella ha fungido como la Directora de Fotografía de cortometrajes y largometrajes, y también ha fotografiado muchos documentales. Algunos de los títulos en los que ha trabajando son: "En los cuernos de la luna", "Quemar Las Naves" (El Premio a Mejor Cinematografía en el 5º. Festival Internacional de Cine de Morelia), "Mi Vida Adentro" (reconocida por La semana de Críticos de Cannes 2000).

Rosino Serrano - Director musical

Rosino Serrano ha trabajado con importantes artistas latinos y ha compuesto música original para 29 películas, y muchas de ellas logrando reconocimiento internacional.  Sus créditos incluyen: "Walkout"  de Edward James Olmos y con la colaboración de Carlos Santana, y  "El Crimen del Padre Amaro,” la cual obtuvo el Mahayuel por Mejor Música en el Festival Internacional de Cine de Guadalajara y fue nominada para mejor Película extranjera en los Oscars.

Nydia Mercedes Gonzalez - Diseñadora de Producción

Graduada del Programa de Artes Escénicas de la Universidad  de Puerto Rico, Nydia Mercedes Gonzalez es la Diseñadora de Producción de “Angélica”. Nydia tiene una vasta experiencia como Jefa de Utilería, Diseñadora de Vestuario, Directora de Escena, y Asistente del Director en Teatro. En 1991 comenzó a trabajar en cine donde a trabajó como  Asistente Decorador, asistente del Diseñador de Producción, Jefa de Utilería, y Directora de Arte en películas como: Life During Wartime, The Argentine, La Mala y The Losers.


Contacto:

Marisol Gomez Mouakad: hormigacinema@gmail.com

www.angelicathemovie.com

Gracias por su apoyo!
story_txt:
English

 


Angélica has spent her whole
life running away from her mixed racial identity, but a family crisis forces
her to confront her identity, her family, and rethink her life.

About the project:
Angélica is a psychological
drama that exposes the implications of racism and sexism, reflecting on how the
oppressive nature of discrimination affects family relations and the
individual. Angélica has to confront the decisions she must make about her life.
In the process she rediscovers herself as a strong, independent, mulatto Puerto
Rican woman in a globalized world.
Angelica is a micro-budget film
in the final stages of post production. During the years it has taken to get to
this point, we have received the financial support of various entities and
organizations as well as the generous support, effort, time, and resources of
many others. Nevertheless, we still need additional cash funding to be able to complete
Angelica. That is why we are asking for your collaboration in order finish our
film.
Please help us by becoming a supporter!  

The destination of the funds:
Donations will be completely
for the post production of the movie.  As follows:
Color CorrectionSound DesignTHX MixFinal DCP deliverylicensing fees
 With your contribution
you become our supporter.


Plans for the movie:
The movie will be distributed through national and international
film festivals. Angelica will be released in 2016 in theaters in Puerto Rico
and Mexico. It will also be distributed in DVD VOoD and in TV cultural centers
and academic forums.



Cast:
 
Michelle Nonó Rodriguez – Angélica

Michelle Nonó is an up and coming actress and theater
director from Puerto Rico. She is also a scenic artist, cultural manager, and
educator.  She
has performed in Argentina, Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico. 

 
Johanna Rosaly - Ángeles




Veteran Puerto Rican actress was the star of numerous soap operas, some of the them very successful soap operas,
such as Ël hijo de Ángela María” (The Son of Angela Maria) and "Cristina
Bazán."  She has also been presenter of film programs,
reporter, news anchor and has acted in unitarians and miniseries . In film she has participated in multiple short films and feature
films, including “Lo que le pasó a Santiago (What Happened to Santiago,) which
was nominated for Oscar - for best foreign language film, and " Linda Sara”.


 
Willie Denton – Wilfredo


An actor and mime, who in
the past two decades has distinguished himself in the national and
international artistic scene. In theater, we can mention titles such as:  La Vida es Sueño, La Carreta, Dona Barbara,
Othello, Euridice, Race. In film he had his debut under Stephen Hopkins in Under
Suspicion.  In 2015 he starred as Pedro Knight in Telemundo’s TV series Celia.
 
Yamil Collazo – José


Actor, dancer , visual artist y announcer has participated in theater
plays such as: El Cartel del Bacalao,
Tiempo Muerto, Ahmen, Coraje and The Livingroom. In film he participated
in films such as: Héroes de otra Patria,
Miente, Maldeamores, y The Argentine,
directed by Steven Soderbergh. 
 
Rene Monclova – Carlos


René Monclova has
been part of the television programs: "¡Que Vacilón!", "El
Condominio" y "Club Sunshine".  The
long list of theater plays in which he has participated includes: "La
Verdadera Historia de Pedro Navaja", "La Carreta", "Tiempo
Muerto", "La Pasión según Ántigona Pérez" and the
musicals "Hair Spray",  y
"Cabaret". His career includes titles in film such as: “Lo
que le pasó a Santiago",  "Jugando
en serio", "Ángel",  y "Havana".
 
Modesto Lacen Cepeda - Juan


Modesto Lacen studied Drama at
the University of Puerto Rico and Art Administration at NYU. In theater, we can mention plays such as: "Sophy a Rafael Hernández… Hasta siempre, mis
jibaritos", La Barbería (HOLA award), DC-7:
La historia de Roberto Clemente (HOLA, ATI award), Ser o no cer…vantes (HOLA award), Réquiem por Yarini (HOLA award), amongst others. He has also participated in
more than 25 films amongst them: El
Cimarrón, Héroes de otra patria,
Sudor Amargo, Kidnapped in Paradise, Back in the day, Cualquier infinito posible. In 2015 he starred as the young Pedro Knight in
Telemundo’s TV series Celia.
 
 Kisha Tikina Burgos - Vanesa


Kisha Tikina Burgos is an
actress, writer, director, producer and educator.  “Anoche
soñé que me comías”, “De mala
muerte”, “La memoria de los
elefantes”, “7 Plays, 7 Days” y “Oh De Sea” , are some of her theater plays produced in Puerto Rico and New York. Kisha
is the writer, producer  and actress of
the film UNDER MY NAILS, with which
she won awards; Best Female Performance at the San Juan International Film
Festival and “Best Individual Performance” in the l Festival Cine La Américas,
Austin, Texas. UNDER MY NAILS.


The creative team:
Marisol Gomez Mouakad -screenwriter, director, editor, and producer
Puerto Rican filmmaker and painter. Her first and
Second short film Rosa and Lazos respectively have both premiered in several
festivals including the Boston Film Festival, Festival Tous Courts in France,
XXII International Festival Guadalajara Film, among others. As a visual artist
she has had exhibitions in New York, Boston, and Puerto Rico.
Ignacio Decerega - Co-Producer
Historian and filmmaker Ignacio Decerega, is the co-producer
of Angélica. Throughout his career, Ignacio has worked with all aspects of film
production, from script development and writing, to digital postproduction.
Many has been the undertakings of Ignacio, and some of the latest
include “Altépetl-Bosque de Agua” a documentary on the social history of water
in Central Mexico and “Angélica”.
Rocio Zambrano - Post Producer
Trained in traditional animation, Rocio Zambrano is an
editor and postproduction supervisor in feature films, documentaries, broadcast
and commercials. Her credits include
award-winning shorts such as Oscuro Animal (Ignacio
Decerega/2006,) feature-length documentaries like Furious Madmen:
Taraf de Haidouks in México, and commercials and feature films
like Matando Cabos , Carambola, Satanás, and 7 Soles
Erika Licea Orozco -Director of Photography
Graduated from the “Centro Universitario de Estudios
Cinematograficos” (CUEC-UNAM), where she specialized in cinematography,  She has been the
Director of Photography of short films and Feature length films in titles such as: "En
los cuernos de la luna," "Quemar Las Naves" (Best Cinematography
Award at the 5th International Film Festival in Morelia,) "My Life
Inside" (recognized in Cannes Critics' Week 2000.)
Rosino Serrano - Musical Director
Rosino Serrano has worked with prominent Latino artists
and has composed original music for 29 films, many of them gaining
international awards. His credits include:
Edward James Olmos’ "Walkout," with Carlos Santana’s collaboration,
and "The Crime of Father Amaro,” which received the Mahayuel for Best
Music in the International Film Festival in Guadalajara, and was nominated for
an Oscar, Best Foreign Film.
Nydia Mercedes Gonzalez - Production Designer 
Graduated from the Theater Arts program from the
University of Puerto Rico,  She has had extensive experience in theater. In film she has worked as Assistant Set Decorator,
Assistant Production Designer, Property Master, and Art Director in films like
“Life During Wartime”, “The Argentine”, “La Mala” and “The Losers”.

Contact:
Marisol Gomez Mouakad: hormigacinema@gmail.com
www.angelicathemovie.com
Thank you. We really need your support!


 








Español




Español
Angélica lleva toda su vida huyendo de su identidad
birracial, pero una crisis familiar la obliga a enfrentarse a su identidad y a
su familia y a replantear su vida.






Sobre el proyecto
“Angélica”
es un drama psicológico que expone las implicaciones del racismo y el machismo,
reflexionando sobre cómo la violencia opresiva de la discriminación afecta las
relaciones familiares e individuales.  Angélica se enfrenta a decisiones
sobre su ser y se redescubre como mujer fuerte, independiente, mulata y
puertorriqueña en un mundo “globalizado”.
“Angélica”
es una película con un micro-presupuesto. Estamos en la fase final de postproducción.
Durante estos años hemos recibido el apoyo financiero devarias entidades y organizaciones, al igual que los
recursos, el tiempo y el esfuerzo que otros han aportado desinteresadamente.
Pero todavía necesitamos recaudar fondos que permitan terminar la película.
Es
por eso que solicitamos la colaboración de todos ustedes para finalizar nuestra
película.







La destinación de los fondos:

El dinero recaudado será utilizado completamente para la post
producción la película.  Especificamente para:
Correción de ColorDiseño de SonidoMezcla THX Entrega final de DCP 
pagos de licencias
 
Con su aportación usted se convierte en nuestro  auspiciador.





Planes para la película:
“Angélica” se distribuirá en de festivales
internacionales y nacionales y estrenará en el 2016 en las salas de cine en
Puerto Rico. También será distribuida por medio de DVD, VOod, televisión,
centros culturales y foros académicos. 






Elenco

 
Michelle
Nonó – Angélica


Michelle Nonó es una actriz y directora de teatro emergente de Puerto
Rico.  Fundo el espacio cultural; Patio Taller Las Nietas de
Nonó;  en 2011 con el propósito de
promover las artes. Se ha presentado en las tablas de Argentina, República
Dominicana y Puerto Rico. Se ha presentado en Argentina, República Dominicana y
Puerto Rico. 
 
Johanna
Rosaly - Ángeles




La renombrada actriz puertorriqueña Johanna Rosaly  fue la protagonista de un sin número de telenovelas, algunas sumamente exitosas
como “El hijo de Ángela María”y
"Cristina Bazán".  Ella ha sido presentadora de programas de cine, anfitriona, actriz
de unitarios y miniseries, reportera y ancla de noticiarios, y ha participado en múltiples cortometrajes y largometrajes, entre ellas la
candidata al Oscar a la mejor película extranjera “Lo que le Pasó a Santiago”y“Linda Sara.



 
Willie Denton – Wilfredo



Actor y mimo, que en las
pasadas dos décadas se ha destacado en la escena artística nacional e
internacional. En el teatro podemos mencionar trabajos como:  La Vida es Sueño, La Carreta, Dona Barbara,
Othello, Euridice, Razas, . En el cine hizo su
debut de la mano de Stephen Hopkins en el papel de Ben en la cinta Under
Suspicion . En el 2015 protagoniza a Pedro Knight en la serie de
televisión Celia de la cadena Telemundo. 

 
Yamil Collazo – José






Actor, bailarín , artista plástico y locutor,  ha participado en obras teatrales como El Cartel del Bacalao, Tiempo Muerto, Ahmen, Coraje y The Livingroom. En cine ha participado en
películas como Héroes de otra Patria,
Miente, Maldeamores, y The Argentine bajo la dirección de Steven Soderbergh. 
 
Rene Monclova – Carlos




René Monclova a formado parte de los programas de televisión
"¡Que Vacilón!", "El Condominio" y "Club
Sunshine".  La extensa lista de obras en las que ha
participado incluye: "La Verdadera Historia de Pedro Navaja", "La
Carreta", "Tiempo Muerto", "La Pasión según
Ántigona Pérez" y los musicales "Hair Spray",  y "Cabaret". Además su
carrera  incluye títulos de cine, como: “Lo
que le pasó a Santiago",  "Jugando
en serio", "Ángel",  y "Havana".
 
Modesto Lacen Cepeda - Juan




Modesto
Lacen estudió Drama en la Universidad de Puerto Rico y Administración en las
Artes en NYU. En el teatro podemos
mencionar trabajos como: "Sophy
a Rafael Hernández… Hasta siempre, mis jibaritos", La Barbería (
Premio HOLA), DC-7: La historia de
Roberto Clemente (Premio HOLA, ATI), Ser
o no cer…vantes (Premio HOLA), Réquiem
por Yarini (Premio HOLA), entre otras. Ha participado en más de 25
películas entre ellas: El Cimarrón, Héroes de otra patria, Sudor Amargo, Animal, Kidnapped in Paradise, Second
Honeymoon, Back in the day, Cualquier infinito posible.. En el 2015
protagoniza al joven Pedro Knight en la serie Celia de Telemundo.
 
 Kisha Tikina Burgos - Vanesa



Kisha Tikina Burgos es actriz,
escritora, directora, productora y educadora de teatro y cine. “Anoche soñé que me comías”, “De
mala muerte”, “La memoria de los
elefantes”, “7 Plays, 7 Days” y “Oh De Sea” (adaptación de “La Odisea”),

actoral; Mejor Actuación Femenina en el Festival de Cine Internacional de San
Juan y “Best Individual Performance” en el Festival Cine La Américas, Austin, Texas.

Erika Licea Orozco - Directora de Fotografía
Graduada del Centro Universitario de Estudios Cinematográficos” (CUEC-UNAM) donde se especializó en cinematografía,  Ella ha fungido como la Directora de Fotografía de cortometrajes y largometrajes, y también ha fotografiado muchos documentales. Algunos de los títulos en los que ha trabajando son: "En los cuernos de la luna", "Quemar Las Naves" (El Premio a Mejor Cinematografía en el 5º. Nydia tiene una vasta experiencia como Jefa de Utilería, Diseñadora de Vestuario, Directora de Escena, y Asistente del Director en Teatro. En 1991 comenzó a trabajar en cine donde a trabajó como  Asistente Decorador, asistente del Diseñador de Producción, Jefa de Utilería, y Directora de Arte en películas como: Life During Wartime, The Argentine, La Mala y The Losers.

story:
What Valley Rounds Needs:

It is a new show about a young upcoming politician, his personal life involving his relationships with his boyfriend, ex wife, and their child, as well as the antics that go on behind the scenes.        

John Lincoln and David Roman Daniels met while working on marriage rights campaigns and have both work on numerous film projects.   First John is the author, together they are complementary directors, finally, David is the editor.

We add a very talented cast and crew. Patrick Toolan, our protagonist, plays Mark. He is the up and coming politician who has the knack of finding ways to get into trouble. Mark's good-looking boyfriend (Sean) is played by Timothy Bowman. He is both as adorable as he is oblivious to Mark's shortcomings. However, Sean sees Mark as the love of his life and has a reckless passion that will not wait for a single moment to advance their relationship whenever possible.

Complicating matters further for Mark is his ex-wife Carrolyn portrayed by the lovely and talented T'Lane Balue who fixes up a batch of life-changing surprises that will effect both Mark and their child Kate (Kira McLean). The delightful character Donna, played by Carrie Lynette Stringfellow, who is the secretary who manages both the campaign office and her boss Mark in her own creative way. She interplays well with Alhaji Sesay who plays Paul the campaign manager and Mark's childhood best friend.

Joining the cast are Stefan Petrenco, Sidney George, Kelly Wilson, Michael Gmur, Sandy Beckerman, Erin Reinhard, Erika Apelgren and Ali Cesur and many more talented truth seeking actors.  (Some of the cast may change do to availability and other reason.)

We want to thank you, our contributors, for your help in raising the quality of the production and helping us tell this interesting, important and compelling story.

What the Money Will be used for:

Our largest expense is Professional Video and Sound shooting and production, paying the talented cast, craft services, costumes, filming permits, location and insurance cost, music rights,  assistance director and other crew expenses, props, costumes, legal issues and contracts. 

The Impact

We feel that this is an exciting show that will not only entertain, but also educate about the importance of same sex marriage rights, give the public a glimpse of the goings on behind a campaign and business, and challenge people to not smoke.

Every supporter of $50 or more will get a copy of all 5+1 episodes of our finished project.  Higher level supporters will get the copy, plus additional scenes and everyone's favorite, the blooper reel.  The highest levels may have a part written specifically for them on an episode (or two) of the show!

If we do not reach our goal we will shoot with what we can, then may try again with more footage to finish the project.

Risks & Challenges

The risk are not having enough fund to hire our crew, pay our actors or finish the post production finishing.  Also, if we do not raise enough money to start soon we risk losing our very talented and painstakingly selected actors and crew.  We have gone trough hundreds of actors to get this quality cast.  Many of the rolls have been crafted around the specific actor's talents and it would not be the same without them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • If you find Valley Rounds interesting please share this campaign!

  • http://igg.me/at/ValleyRounds

  • www.ValleyRounds.com

  • https://www.facebook.com/ValleyRounds

story:
What is "What Doesn't Kill Us?"

What We Need & What You Get

     Since we will be relying on cast and crew looking to gain experience, most of our budget will be going towards PROPS, WARDROBE and LOCATIONS. For a better understanding on where our money will go, please reference the graph below.

     Although we set our goal at $5,000, we hope to exceed that amount and apply the extra funds to raise the overall production value of our film. With that said, there are plenty of PERKS for YOU, our backers, to get your hands on. There is an option for everyone, and we hope that you become as enthusiastic about this project as we are. 



Can't Help? No Worries.

     Hey, we get it. All we ask is that you wish us luck and pass on this page via Facebook, email, ect. Thanks!

"What Doesn't Kill Us" The Short

     Here's the short film we made in 2012 with no experience, money or community support; just a few creative kids with a camera.
story_txt:
What is "What Doesn't Kill Us?"



  What We Need & What You Get      Since we will be relying on cast and crew looking to gain experience, most of our budget will be going towards PROPS, WARDROBE and LOCATIONS. For a better understanding on where our money will go, please reference the graph below. 





     Although we set our goal at $5,000, we hope to exceed that amount and apply the extra funds to raise the overall production value of our film. With that said, there are plenty of PERKS for YOU, our backers, to get your hands on. There is an option for everyone, and we hope that you become as enthusiastic about this project as we are.

story:
Hi, we're the makers of the upcoming documentary, “The Harvest: Generation Y-Not”. We are six college-age young men from different backgrounds united by two things: our love of God and our desire to save our generation, Generation Y. Living in Chicago, we’ve seen firsthand the pitfalls and moral decline of our generation. The nation knows our city as the “Chi-raq" because they see nothing on their television but stories of suffering and violence, but fail to see beyond that. In the study of medicine, one learns that treating symptoms is temporary. Unless you treat the cause, the symptoms will return. The moral decline and heinous crimes committed in all corners of the world are merely symptoms. To find the cause, we must be willing to look within ourselves. However, before people can begin enacting change, they must decide within themselves if change is possible. They must have hope. Our next project aims to give them an in-depth look into our society and our generation through, not only, evidence, but the eyes of members of Generation Y and older generations to determine if there is hope for the future. But we need your help.

We have covered many expenses out of our own pockets, but that has its limitations. We need to raise $10,000 to cover the further expenses of the film so that we may move forward with the vision. So we're turning to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. It is said too often that we want change, but we don’t want to change. This is our chance to be a part of something far greater than ourselves. This is not just a documentary, it’s a movement. In the immortal words of Mahatma Gandhi, this is our chance to “be the change [we] wish to see in the world”. Your contribution will help us cover the cost of paying editors, sound mixers, and a variety of other expenses when piecing together a film,  but, most importantly, it will enable us to bring our vision of showing an honest depiction of society into fruition. Please join us as we move forward. Thank you for your time and thank you for your contribution, and welcome to The Harvest. 

WHAT WE ARE AIMING TO RAISE, AND WHY

We are aiming to raise a total of $10,000 which may seem like a lot but there is a considerable amount of costs that we must factor in:

Color Grader/Editor ($2,500)

A color grader is essential to making the film look good. As most of this footage has been shot documentary style, which means that it was explicitly shot on-the-go and in action, and much of it is either over-exposed or in the dark. We need a color grader to correct these technical glitches and make it look aesthetically pleasing. Our color grader will also be doing the bulk of the editorial work.

Editor ($1,000)

Hiring an editor is an essential part of this process. An editor brings technical expertise and knowledge of how to structure a visual narrative to best portray the message; without an editor, making a film wouldn't be possible.

Music ($1,000)

We have some great personal and artists on board to create the soundtrack and musical score for our film. The work of these talented people will help to set the backdrop for our scenes, and they must, of course, be compensated for their hard work.

Sound Mixer ($1,000)

Like a color grader, a sound mixer is needed to cut out the unnecessary background noise in a shot. This enhances the dialogue and gives you, as the audience, a clearer sound.

Animation Director ($500)

An animation director is responsible for creating stop-motion and other graphic sections of the film. The amount of labor that goes into this area of filmmaking is absolutely painstaking, and begs to be compensated as such.

Equipment ($800)

Although we have used our own cameras and equipment where we can, we have discovered throughout the process that we needed to buy more hard-drives, microphones and lenses, all out of our own pocket.

Outreach & Communications ($1,000)

This refers mainly to the promotion and buzz around the film. We need money to go towards flyers, posters, website and artwork amongst other things.

Stock Footage ($1,000)

While we have filmed the majority of what will be shown, however, there is still a need for the use of public footage.

Distribution ($1,200)

Finally, once the film has been made, we need to get it seen. We need money for film festival entries, private screening costs, travel to festivals and screenings, DVD authoring, shipping and venue hire.

We have tried our hardest to keep the cost as low as possible. We have pulled favors from friends, and are all currently working for free! However, our resources and contacts are running out. We want to be able to finish the film in a way that it deserves.

story:
Short Summary

Ten years ago, Darren owned and operated a successful offshore charter fishing business.  In the off season, he was a professional tree trimmer, then disaster struck.  While trimming a tree, he fell 40 feet fracturing C4, breaking C5, and smashing C6.  Most people in that situation enter a downward spiral of depression but Darren beat the odds and went back to school.  He obtained his BS in Business Administration then immediately entered the MBA program.  Now he's forming a small business in the aerial survey industry to become self sufficient once again.

Darren and his team need capital to cover the aerial platform, support computers, and typical startup costs for insurance, legal fees, web development, and advertising.

You have the opportunity to Soar with Darren!

story:
** If by any reason you can't see the video, please click here and watch via YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJqVY4USSmM **

Eat with your Eyes open

This documentary intends to enlighten our society about local and global foodwaste and helps to seek for alternative solutions.

  • I am a 23 year old student (english/art history) and a filmmaker in my free time .
  • About one year ago I heard about the concept of "Foodsharing" for the first time and since then I tend to attach more importance to the topic of foodwaste. Everyone I talk to agree, but haven't heard of any alternative ways or solutions in order to meet with this problem.
  • With a global wide documentary I'd like to first give people a reality check about the distribution of food in our society, second how much food is going to the garbage for unnecessary reasons and third what kind of solutions and concepts there are/going to be to help reduce foodwaste all over the world.

What I will do

This Video is just a TRAILER. Of course there will be a lot more coming up.

  • I'd like to take you on a long journey related to this topic. I want to show places you haven't been and show you something that you've never seen.
  • More topics/activities will be documented, e.g. non profit relief organizations, leader of food corporations, legislative authorities, dumbster diving, urban gardening, nutrionists, ...
  • Everything will be compared to other countries - if I get the possibility to travel into foreign cities.

How you can help & What you get

I am doing films out of my own pocket forever, but now that I am going for bigger documentaries, I rely on some support. 

  • Everything about film takes a lot of money. Starting with the making of a concept, the preproduction, getting helpers and assistenz, who for example research new possibilites and events we need to catch with the camera. Coming to the camera: Most of the cash is going for the Equipment (camera, tripod, lights, microphone...etc.). Since I am aiming to produce a global documentary, I'd like to compare countries and cities and their traditions about nutrition and how to treat groceries. Therefore a little travel also needs support.
  • Beginning of last year I started living without money as far as possible. I also worked for filmprojects for free or with my own money as far as possible. Since I was forced saving a lot of times (to even pay rent), I know exactly how to get a lot of things (or even a HUGE project) with little money - because I'm used to it. 
  • With the donated money I will start to film right away. I already have a few helpers waiting to start researching where to begin with. So even if the fundraising contribution couldn't be accomplished, it ain't no harm to stop me from completing the documentary anyhow.

Coming Up

This is something that has to be done NOW. The issue of foodwaste doesn't vanish by itself - in fact, it grows bigger and bigger.  

  • A documentary, which will be able to watch for free on YouTube and any other Socialmedia, will help enlighten people all over the world about what is happening and what will happen, if we don't do anything.
  • This issue concerns children, mothers, families, businessmen, hipsters, doctors, divorced couples, noble price winners, celebreties, homeless - just everyone who does eat sometimes. Therefore elucidation is VERY important. 
  • I am always occupied with serious topics like poverty, unemployment, racism and diseases like dementia. The Issue of food waste is very important to me and should be to everyone.

The Challenge

The biggest challenge would be to illustrate the comparison between the countries. Traveling into foreign countries without knowing the language, without knowing people to interview or having a place to stay. 

  • Personally I am very open minded and I already traveled a lot like this. I also like to work with pedestrians as you can see in the Trailer of the documentary "I call it foodge".
  • Almost all of my films were produced spontaneously, with people I found on the street in different cities/countries.

Open your Heart - Open your Mind - Open your Mouth

One of the biggest problems of the society worldwide is a lack of elucidation and the knowledge about what is happening around us. This leads to unmeant and unneeded ignorance thinking and intolerance.

  • With small steps, like informing yourself by watching the trailer and talking to your fellow men about the issue of foodwaste, you can help to look for a long-run cure.
  • Please help me to fulfull my dream, so many wishes and hopes of people in need can be fulfilled, too.
