story:
The Author/ Producer

"Hello! My name is Christos A. Djonis. I am the author of the recently released book "Uchronia? Atlantis Revealed," and the producer of the upcoming feature-length documentary, "Atlantis Revealed!".

Before discussing further the upcoming film, first and foremost, I must confess that when I first started the research for my latest book (more of a passion project that touches on several controversial topics), I never in a million years thought I'd be able to locate a site that in every way will match Plato's Atlantis. Even later, more than two years into the project, when eventually all clues brought me to look for Atlantis within the Mediterranean Sea, still, in all honesty I was not sure where to look for it.

I remember thinking, if Plato's given chronology on Atlantis coincided with the rise of the oceans at the end of the last Ice Age, then, this island could have gotten lost during the rapid rise of the Mediterranean,  just prior to the flooding of the Black Sea and roughly 10,000 years ago. If so, then Plato's lost island should only be 400 feet beneath the waves and not few miles deep, as some researchers theorized in the past. 

The search was lengthy, challenging, and at times I felt it would never come to fruition. Even when I spotted my first real clue, an underwater plateau around the Cyclades Islands, I did not fully understand the significance of the find until several hours later, when I was able to outline its entire shape. Only then I realized that the submerged super-island I just found, formed by the Cyclades Plateau, perfectly matched Plato's description Atlantis. The chronology, every physical aspect of the topography, the volcanic geology, the flora and fauna in that period, the island's destruction by a "great flood", archaeological remnants of an unknown prehistoric civilization in the immediate area, all pointed to a genuine discovery. And that was not all".

I INVITE YOU TO CONNECT WITH US AND SUPPORT THE MAKING OF THE DOCUMENTARY THAT WILL FINALLY UNRAVEL PLATO'S TWO THOUSAND-YEAR-OLD- PUZZLE!


Why look for Atlantis in the Mediterranean Sea and not in the Atlantic Ocean? What was the large island/ continent Plato mentioned across the Atlantic? Is it possible that remnants of Atlantis were left behind?

For answers to these and other questions, please look for "Uchronia? Atlantis Revealed", the book behind the upcoming documentary (available at Amazon and major booksellers around the world).



The Book

At around 360 BC, in his dialogues of Timaeus and Critias, the Greek philosopher Plato introduced an incredible story, a tale of an enigmatic island civilization which since captivated the imagination of every generation that followed. This was the story of Atlantis, one of the most advanced societies of the ancient world, a prehistoric civilization capable of crossing the Atlantic Ocean more than 10,000 years ago.

Today, regardless of the many archaeological discoveries which support Plato's claim of such advanced culture (like that of Gobekli Tepe in Turkey, the Lost city of Ubar in the Arabian Peninsula, the submerged city off the coast of west India in the Gulf of Cambay, and others), many skeptics choose to point to the several inconsistencies in Plato's story (like Athens or Egypt did not exist ten millennia ago, when according to Plato the story took place) and quickly label Atlantis as a myth. Are the skeptics correct though?

Just as in the case of Atlantis, for several centuries we thought that the city of Troy, the centerpiece in Homer’s epic saga, was also a myth. All that changed obviously when Heinrich Schliemann, an amateur archaeologist, found Troy in 1868 while following location tips from Homer’s book Iliad. In the case of Troy, after ditching all the details regarding beauty queens, demigods, Trojan horses and scaled back the armies to more rational levels, it was ultimately acknowledged by the scientific community that the setting as well as the bulk of this story was real. Essentially, Homer’s entirely fictional story, which he filled with principles and common elements from his own time, apparently revolved around a tangible setting and a real incident which took place nearly six centuries before his time. Of course, Troy is not an isolated example. Our recorded history is full of stories that contain serious discrepancies and circumstances where once mythological places, or "fairy tales", in the end turned out to be true!

So, a fundamental question remains. Was Atlantis simply a cautionary tale or is it possible Plato crafted a tale based on a real setting and a prehistoric civilization known to ancient Greeks, while he supplemented all the “modern” details as Homer did few hundred years before him?

If true, as in the case of Troy, the true-part of this story should not rest in the story plot, but in the detection and authentication of Plato’s “lost island.”

Locating a matching site, along with signs of an advanced civilization in the immediate area, should be the first step in solving this mystery.

Indeed, a recent discovery of a sunken island that perfectly matches Plato's Atlantis, found in the right period as well as the right location (more on the location later), if anything, it further suggests that Plato based his story on real a prehistoric civilization, which in order to successfully communicate some of his philosophical ideas (divine vs. human, ideal societies vs. corrupt,) he filled with familiar matter and details from later times.

So, unlike earlier theories and faulty interpretations of the story which place Atlantis all over the Atlantic Ocean, in Spain, off the coast of Cyprus, at the Azores Islands, in Antarctica and other places (without ever offering a matching site), the recent discovery shows that Plato's Atlantis was a prehistoric super-island in the Aegean Sea at the doorstep of Greece, and not in some far-away location. Even when setting aside all the other clues that lead to the same conclusion, Plato's own words “your State (Greece) stayed the course of a mighty host,” clearly suggests that Atlantis, as a “host” of mainland Greece, stood at Greece's doorstep and ultimately controlled the path, or better yet, the waters leading into the Aegean Sea. True enough! As it turns out, ten millennia ago, with sea levels lower by 400 feet, the modern day Cyclades Islands were connected by a flat terrain, today known as the "Cyclades Plateau". This massive plateau formed a super-island that when comparing to Atlantis, in every way it matches Plato's description (see Plato's quotation and image below). If Atlantis was ever real, this must have been the place Plato was talking about. Not only the geography is identical, the volcanic geology is there, but when further comparing to Plato's account, the flora and fauna, including elephants, chronologically match the topography. How is this possible? To be able to locate a place that slightly resembles Plato’s Atlantis is extremely difficult, to produce one where all the physical aspects perfectly match, is virtually impossible, unless of course the proposed site is the real thing. When up until today, to prove Atlantis real, the most difficult task was to find a place that matched Plato's description, now that we have such a place, how can skeptics explain this finding away? Not only we now have a matching site but relics from an unknown pre-Bronze civilization in the immediate area further reinforce this discovery. 

An island comprising mostly of mountains in the northern portions and along the shore, and encompassing a great plain of an oblong shape in the south extending in one direction three thousand stadia (about 555 square kilometers), but across the center island it was two thousand stadia (about 370 square kilometers). Fifty stadia (9km) from the coast was a mountain that was low on all sides…broke it off all round about . . . the central island itself was five stades in diameter (about 0.92 km).

  

Image from the book "Uchronia?-Atlantis Revealed"

                            

The Island of Santorini, present day (Left).  Santorini prior to the eruption of 1600BC, based on a 1991 study by Druitt and Francaviglia (Right).

Of course, as skeptics often do, without ever attempting to explain away the matching site, many will quickly point that according to Plato (see Plato's text below) Atlantis was somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean and not in the Mediterranean. Was it though? Can this be true, or is it possible that the real meaning of the story could have been lost during the original translation from ancient Greek to English?

Before analyzing the text below, those not familiar with Greek, must be reminded that the syntactic structure of the language that Plato used has a very different structure than the English language we often use to translate it. What often seems strange to those who first try to learn Greek is the inversion of the possessive adjective in respect to the noun.  Similarly, text inversions like these may also exist in the sequence of entire sentences. For example, in an independent clause, an item which is stressed, i.e. which is uttered with emphasis or is contrastive, in ancient Greek it generally goes at the beginning of the clause, rarely at the end. Middle position is occupied by an item receiving no particular emphasis. In a series of clauses in a sentence, though, as in the translated passage below, a prominent item goes at the beginning of its clause if it relates to the previous context, and at the end if it relates to the following one (look at first sentence of the first paragraph, and the last sentence of the second one).

For it is related in our records how once upon a time your State stayed the course of a mighty host, which, starting from a distant point in the Atlantic ocean, was insolently advancing to attack the whole of Europe, and Asia to boot.
(For) the Ocean that was at that time navigable; for in front of the mouth which you Greeks call, as you say “the Pillars of Heracles” [Strait of Gibraltar] there lay an island which was larger than Libya and Asia together; and it was possible for travelers of that time to cross from it to the other islands and from the islands to the whole of the continent over against them which encompasses the veritable ocean ...

In this case, and contrary to what many automatically assume, Plato does not point to the direction of Atlantis across the ocean. As explained earlier, the phrase “your state stayed the course of a mighty host”, at the beginning of the clause, is where the emphasis should be placed. While in this part Plato reveals the very close proximity of Atlantis to Greece, in the rest of the sentence he poetically describes the might of Atlantis and its capacity that stretched around the world to a “distant point” and another continent across the ocean. Of course, once he illustrates their incredible capability, he then describes their audacious and warlike character and their plans to “advance against the whole Europe and Asia”.

The same rule applies when analyzing the remaining text. In this case the revelation of a continent across the ocean is not where the emphasis should be placed. As explained earlier, in a series of clauses in a sentence, prominent items usually are either placed at the beginning or at the end of their clause. The middle part of a sentence is occupied by items that should receive less emphasis. According to this rule, and in this particular case, the explanation of how Atlantians were able to reach the continent across the ocean, at the end of the clause, is where the emphasis should be placed and not on the continent itself that is mentioned earlier (the part that many automatically are drawn to). Not knowing where the emphasis on a clause should be placed, can cause a great deal of confusion, as often and depending where the emphasis goes, two separate meanings can emerge out of a single paragraph. Actually, when it comes to ancient Greek, sometimes even a single comma can cause a short sentence to have two different meanings. Such example is a famous quote from the oracle of Delphi. "Go, return not die in war", can have two entirely opposite meanings, depending on where a missing comma is supposed to be - before or after - the word "not".

In short, when a story from ancient Greek is translated to English, the translated sentences may require proper "re-positioning" in order for an English reader to make better sense of it. For instance, when understanding the syntactic structure of the Greek language and how to "read it" correctly, Plato’s second paragraph above, to an English reader should appear as follows:

(For) the Ocean that was at that time navigable;  and it was possible for travelers of that time to cross from it (from Atlantis) to the other islands, and from these islands to the whole of the continent over against them which encompasses the veritable ocean....  for in front of the mouth which you Greeks call, as you say “the Pillars of Hercules,” there lay a continent which was larger than Libya and Asia together.

When seen in this context, the continent across the ocean is no longer the place of origin for Atlantians, but a destination. Here, Plato simply describes the might of Atlantis by depicting their incredible capability to travel half way around the world. He explains that via island hopping (most likely from Scotland, to the Faroe Islands, to Iceland and then to Greenland), the Atlantians were able to reach another grand island/continent on the other side of the Atlantic, one across from the "Pillars of Hercules". Which other continent is on the opposite side of the Atlantic across from the Strait of Gibraltar? The American continent, of course! It was the American continent that Plato said was larger than Libya and Asia put together and not that of Atlantis, as many wrongly had interpreted and even to this day continue to interpret.

Those unconvinced that the ancient Greeks could have known of the American continent around the 4th century BC, must be reminded that unlike other European civilizations at the time, not only did the Greeks know of the continent across the ocean but they were also aware that the earth is round and not flat. The Antikythera mechanism is a technological testament of that advanced knowledge. Additional evidence though, point that more ancient cultures during that period may have been aware of the continent across the ocean. Piri Reis, a Turkish admiral and a famous cartographer (1465-1553) repeatedly claimed that his controversial maps which showed the American continent, and some say Antarctica (300 years before its discovery by the Europeans), were actually based on ancient maps dating from the 4th century BC. Additionally, a recent discovery of a Carthaginian coin which depicts a world map (circa 350 BC) also demonstrates that at around the 4th century BC not only Plato and the Greeks may have been aware of the American continent, but others did as well.

By the way, when altogether discarding Plato's claim, that 10 millennia ago a prehistoric civilization from the Mediterranean travelled to North America via island hopping, how do we otherwise explain the migration of haplogroup X in the region of the Great Lakes, 10,000 years ago? (For those not familiar with mtDNA studies, while all Native Indians in America were expected to carry the four Asian haplogroups, A,B,C & D, some tribes around the Great Lakes were found to also carry haplogroup X, a gene that originates from the eastern Mediterranean). And, without Plato's explanation in place, how else do we explain that high traces of haplogroup X also happen to exist in  Scotland, Faroe Islands, and Iceland, essentially all the island stops to North America from Europe?

Those who support the Solutrean/ Clovis hypothesis (a migration via a partial ice sheet over the Atlantic), how do they explain that out of at least a dozen haplogroups present in northern Europe at the time (H, V, J, HV, U, T, UK, X, W, and I) only a single one managed the trip to North America, when on the opposite site, every one of the 4 Asian haplogroups sequentially followed each other over the Bering Strait?

As for those who support the hypothesis that haplogroup X migrated to the Great Lakes on foot via the Bering Strait, along with haplogroups A,B,C & D, how do they explain that there is no trace of haplogroup X to fill in the huge void between southern Russia and the Great Lakes of North America?  Most importantly, though, if haplogroup X migrated to America via the Bering Strait, how do we explain that the heaviest concentration of haplogroup X, away from the eastern Mediterranean, exist on the east coast of the United States, around the Great Lakes, and not in Alaska or the west coast? Is it time perhaps to give Plato's story another closer look?

Finally, in regards to the critics who will remind you that Atlantis was entirely swallowed by the sea, while obviously in this case remnants of it were left behind, in the following paragraph Plato clarifies this flawed belief.

The consequence is, that in comparison of what then was, there are remaining in small islets only the bones of the wasted body, as they may be called, all the richer and softer parts of the soil having fallen away, and the mere skeleton of the country being left.


The Project

Your contribution will assist in producing "Atlantis Revealed", the pilot documentary in a series that will help unravel some of the most contentious mysteries of our time!

Most every previous claim about the discovery of Atlantis, has produced NO tangible evidence. Unlike past failures on the subject, this documentary will establish the following:

  1. Proper translation and analysis of Plato's account, places Atlantis in the Mediterranean, at the doorstep of Greece, and not in the Atlantic Ocean, or in some exotic location as many researchers previously thought.
  2. A thorough look for Atlantis in the Mediterranean ultimately revealed a prehistoric super-island (now 400 feet below sea level) that in every way matches Plato's description.  
  3. Around the 4th century BC, Plato and the ancient Greeks were fully aware of the American continent across the Atlantic. In effect, the continent across the Atlantic Plato mentioned in his story, was the American continent and not that of Atlantis.
  4. Past mtDNA studies, which confirmed the existence of a Mediterranean gene (haplogroup X) among certain American Indian tribes around the Great Lakes, not only corroborate Plato's claim of an advanced prehistoric civilization 10,000 years ago, capable crossing the Atlantic, but these tests further reinforce our conclusion that this advanced culture originated in the eastern Mediterranean.  
  5. High traces of haplogroup X in Scotland, Faroe Islands, Iceland, and ultimately around the Great Lakes of North America, also validate that these "Atlantians" (or whatever that civilization was called) visited North America from the Atlantic side via "island hopping" and just as Plato claimed.
  6. Our research will reveal that the super-island of the Cyclades Plateau, otherwise known as Atlantis, was drowned by the sea at around 8000 BC, during the rapid rise of the Mediterranean and just prior to the flooding of the Black Sea (See UNESCO study of 2009 regards to the Black Sea Flood -- See also global flooding caused by Glacial Lake Agassiz -- Read Science News article, 2010: "Global Sea-Level Rise at the end of the Last Ice-Age, Interrupted by Rapid Jumps".)
  7. Contrary to a common belief that Atlantis vanished from the face of the Earth, Plato's own account reveals that remnants of Atlantis remained behind and formed small islets, just as in the case of the Cyclades Plateau.
  8. While several archaeological artifacts around the Cyclades islands point to some unknown pre-bronze age civilization in the area, we must now establish whether these artifacts are the recovering remnants of another slightly older civilization, one that could relate to Plato's Atlantis.
  9. Finally, the discovery of a matching site in the given chronology, confirms past scientific speculations that Plato created a moral fable around a real setting in which, in order to successfully communicate some of his philosophical ideas, he filled with familiar matter and details from his own time, just as Homer did 400 years earlier with the city of Troy. 
____________________________________________________________________________

FACTOID: Did you know the scientific community came close to solve this mystery in the past?

It is well known fact that other researchers and archaeologists in the past suggested that Santorini could have been the spot where the crown city of Atlantis once stood. Unfortunately for them though, since they did not believe that Plato's story could have taken place 10,000 years ago, they discarded Plato's given chronology of 9600 BC, and concentrated their study during the Minoan era, and closer to the time when the Santorini volcano erupted, around 1600 BC.

A huge problem with their "partial discovery" however, was that without the primary island of Atlantis nearby, Santorini alone did not match with Plato's entire description. This allowed for critics in the past to reject the particular proposal and continue to question the validity of Plato's story.

In other words, although archaeologists came close to solve this mystery in the past, apparently they did not come close enough, since they never were able to produce a matching site to Plato's Atlantis. As it now appears, looking for Atlantis in the right chronology, was always the right key to unlock this mystery. 

____________________________________________________________________________

The Budget 

"Atlantis Revealed" will be filmed primarily on location around the Mediterranean and the Cyclades Islands.

Our tight budget of $290,000 must be met prior to production. Every dollar collected will be reinvested into the project, either producing the film or making and shipping the perks. 

If our minimum target is not met, this will obviously cause temporary production delays. In that case, the production will resume once additional funding is obtained and our minimum required budget is met. Excess funding on the other hand, will allow for additional research prior to production, add special effects, and improve production quality. The more money we raise, the more talent we can attract, and bigger and better the project becomes. 

Help Make it Happen!

WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

Wait, Got More to offer! 
$375,000 STRETCH GOAL

At the $375,000 mark, anyone who previously selected a perk worth $50 and up, in addition to their regular perk, will also receive a DVD copy of this Documentary. 

At this level, we should be able to fund an underwater exploration with the use of a "side scan sonar". Our scanning depth of less than 400 feet, should allow us to use a high frequency side scan that produces an excellent resolution at shallow depths. A high frequency sonar picks up everything that the low frequency sonar does (manmade structures, walls, houses), plus small and soft targets like a vase, a small statue, skeletal remains, etc. High frequency side scan sonars are popular with law enforcement, wreck hunters, as well as marine archaeologists looking for ancient wood vessels that may be broken up and decomposing. Scanning the sea (between 50-350 feet in depth) near areas where prehistoric artifacts were previously found on land, as well as the seabed between the islands of Naxos, Sikinos, Antiparos and Irakleia, surveying for underwater ruins and other structures (like Plato's famous water canals), may turn out to be extremely beneficial to our project. 

Please share this link and promote our project to friends and family. Every new donor you help bring aboard, adds to the success of this project. 

If possible, we would really love to have 60,000 backers, even at $5 each. By the way, let's not forget that film distributors love big crowds too. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND GENEROSITY.
story_txt:
The Author/ Producer




"Hello! My name is Christos A. Djonis.
I am the author of the recently released book "Uchronia? Atlantis
Revealed," and the producer of the upcoming feature-length documentary, "Atlantis
Revealed!".
Before discussing further the upcoming
film, first and foremost, I must confess that when I first started the research
for my latest book (more of a passion project that touches on several controversial
topics), I never in a million years thought I'd be able to locate a site that in
every way will match Plato's Atlantis. Even later, more than two years into the
project, when eventually all clues brought me to look for Atlantis within the
Mediterranean Sea, still, in all honesty I was not sure where to look for it.
I remember thinking, if Plato's given
chronology on Atlantis coincided with the rise of the oceans at the end of the
last Ice Age, then, this island could have gotten lost during the rapid rise of
the Mediterranean,  just prior to the
flooding of the Black Sea and roughly 10,000 years ago. If so, then Plato's
lost island should only be 400 feet beneath the waves and not few miles deep, as
some researchers theorized in the past. 
The search was lengthy, challenging, and
at times I felt it would never come to fruition. Even when I spotted my first
real clue, an underwater plateau around the Cyclades Islands, I did not fully
understand the significance of the find until several hours later, when I was
able to outline its entire shape. Only then I realized that the submerged
super-island I just found, formed by the Cyclades Plateau, perfectly matched
Plato's description Atlantis. The chronology, every physical aspect of the
topography, the volcanic geology, the flora and fauna in that period, the
island's destruction by a "great flood", archaeological remnants of an
unknown prehistoric civilization in the immediate area, all pointed to a genuine
discovery. And that was not all".


I INVITE YOU TO CONNECT WITH US AND SUPPORT THE MAKING OF THE DOCUMENTARY THAT WILL FINALLY UNRAVEL PLATO'S TWO THOUSAND-YEAR-OLD- PUZZLE!
Why
look for Atlantis in the Mediterranean Sea and not in the Atlantic Ocean? What was
the large island/ continent Plato mentioned across the Atlantic? Is it possible
that remnants of Atlantis were left behind?
 For
answers to these and other questions, please look for "Uchronia? Atlantis
Revealed", the book behind the upcoming documentary (available at Amazon and major booksellers around the world).



The Book
At
around 360 BC, in his dialogues of Timaeus and Critias, the Greek philosopher
Plato introduced an incredible story, a tale of an enigmatic island civilization
which since captivated the imagination of every generation that followed. This
was the story of Atlantis, one of the most advanced societies of the ancient
world, a prehistoric civilization capable of crossing the Atlantic Ocean more
than 10,000 years ago. 
Today,
regardless of the many archaeological discoveries which support Plato's claim of
such advanced culture (like that of Gobekli Tepe in Turkey, the Lost city of
Ubar in the Arabian Peninsula, the submerged city off the coast of west India
in the Gulf of Cambay, and others), many skeptics choose to point to the several
inconsistencies in Plato's story (like Athens or Egypt did not exist ten
millennia ago, when according to Plato the story took place) and quickly label
Atlantis as a myth. Are the skeptics correct though?
Just
as in the case of Atlantis, for several centuries we thought that the city of
Troy, the centerpiece in Homer’s epic saga, was also a myth. All that changed
obviously when Heinrich Schliemann, an amateur archaeologist, found Troy in
1868 while following location tips from Homer’s book Iliad. In the case of
Troy, after ditching all the details regarding beauty queens, demigods, Trojan
horses and scaled back the armies to more rational levels, it was ultimately
acknowledged by the scientific community that the setting as well as the bulk
of this story was real. Essentially, Homer’s entirely fictional story, which he
filled with principles and common elements from his own time, apparently
revolved around a tangible setting and a real incident which took place nearly
six centuries before his time. Of course, Troy is not an isolated example. Our
recorded history is full of stories that contain serious discrepancies and
circumstances where once mythological places, or "fairy tales", in
the end turned out to be true!
So, a fundamental question remains. Was
Atlantis simply a cautionary tale or is it possible Plato crafted a tale based
on a real setting and a prehistoric civilization known to ancient Greeks, while
he supplemented all the “modern” details as Homer did few hundred years before
him?
If true, as
in the case of Troy, the true-part of this story should not rest in the story
plot, but in the detection and authentication of Plato’s “lost island.” 
Locating a matching site, along with signs of
an advanced civilization in the immediate area, should be the first step in
solving this mystery.
Indeed, a recent discovery of a sunken island
that perfectly matches Plato's Atlantis, found in the right period as well as
the right location (more on the location later), if anything, it further
suggests that Plato based his story on real a prehistoric civilization, which
in order to successfully communicate some of his philosophical ideas (divine
vs. human, ideal societies vs. corrupt,) he filled with familiar matter and
details from later times. 
So, unlike earlier theories and faulty interpretations
of the story which place Atlantis all over the Atlantic Ocean, in Spain, off
the coast of Cyprus, at the Azores Islands, in Antarctica and other places (without
ever offering a matching site), the recent discovery shows that Plato's
Atlantis was a prehistoric super-island in the Aegean Sea at the doorstep of
Greece, and not in some far-away location. Even when setting aside all the other
clues that lead to the same conclusion, Plato's
own words “your State (Greece) stayed the
course of a mighty host,” clearly suggests that Atlantis, as a “host” of
mainland Greece, stood at Greece's doorstep and ultimately controlled the path,
or better yet, the waters leading into the Aegean Sea. True enough! As it turns out, ten
millennia ago, with sea levels lower by 400 feet, the modern day Cyclades
Islands were connected by a flat terrain, today known as the "Cyclades
Plateau". This massive plateau formed a super-island that when comparing
to Atlantis, in every way it matches Plato's description (see Plato's quotation
and image below). If Atlantis was ever real, this must have been the place
Plato was talking about. Not only the geography is identical, the volcanic
geology is there, but when further comparing to Plato's account, the flora and
fauna, including elephants, chronologically match the topography. How is this
possible? To be able to locate a place that slightly resembles Plato’s Atlantis is
extremely difficult, to produce one where all the physical aspects perfectly
match, is virtually impossible, unless of course the proposed site is the real
thing. When up
until today, to prove Atlantis real, the most difficult task was to find a place
that matched Plato's description, now that we have such a place, how can
skeptics explain this finding away? Not only we now have a matching site but
relics from an unknown pre-Bronze civilization in the immediate area further
reinforce this discovery. 

An island
comprising mostly of mountains in the northern portions and along the shore,
and encompassing a great plain of an oblong shape in the south extending in one
direction three thousand stadia (about 555 square kilometers), but across the
center island it was two thousand stadia (about 370 square kilometers). Fifty
stadia (9km) from the coast was a mountain that was low on all sides…broke it
off all round about . . . the central island itself was five stades in diameter
(about 0.92 km).


  

Image from the
book "Uchronia?-Atlantis Revealed"
                            
The Island of Santorini, present day (Left).  Santorini prior to the eruption of
1600BC, based on a 1991 study by Druitt and Francaviglia (Right).
Of course, as skeptics often do, without ever attempting to explain
away the matching site, many will quickly point that according to Plato (see Plato's
text below) Atlantis was somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean and not in the
Mediterranean. Was it though? Can this be true, or is it possible that the real
meaning of the story could have been lost during the original translation from
ancient Greek to English? 
Before
analyzing the text below, those not familiar with Greek, must be reminded that the syntactic structure of the language that Plato used has a very
different structure than the English language we often use to translate it. What
often seems strange to those who first try to learn Greek is the inversion of
the possessive adjective in respect to the noun.  Similarly, text inversions like these may
also exist in the sequence of entire sentences. For
example, in an independent clause, an item which is stressed, i.e. which is
uttered with emphasis or is contrastive, in ancient Greek it generally goes at
the beginning of the clause, rarely at the end. Middle position is occupied by
an item receiving no particular emphasis. In a series of clauses in a sentence, though, as in the translated passage below, a prominent item goes at the beginning of its clause if it relates to the previous context, and at the end if it relates to the following one (look at first sentence of the first paragraph, and the last sentence of the second one).


For it is related in our records how once upon a time your State stayed
the course of a mighty host, which, starting from a distant
point in the Atlantic ocean, was insolently advancing to attack the whole of
Europe, and Asia to boot.(For) the Ocean
that was at that time navigable; for in front of the mouth which you Greeks
call, as you say “the Pillars of Heracles” [Strait of Gibraltar] there lay an
island which was larger than Libya and Asia together; and
it was possible for travelers of that time to cross from it to the other
islands and from the islands to the whole of the continent over against them
which encompasses the veritable ocean ...


In this case, and contrary to what many automatically assume, Plato does
not point to the direction of Atlantis across the ocean. As explained earlier,
the phrase “your state stayed the course of a mighty host”, at the beginning of
the clause, is where the emphasis should be placed. While in this part Plato
reveals the very close proximity of Atlantis to Greece, in the rest of the
sentence he poetically describes the might of Atlantis and its capacity that
stretched around the world to a “distant point” and another continent across
the ocean. Of course, once he illustrates their incredible capability, he then
describes their audacious and warlike character and their plans to “advance
against the whole Europe and Asia”. 
The same rule applies when analyzing the remaining
text. In this case the revelation of a continent across the ocean is not where
the emphasis should be placed. As explained earlier, in a series of clauses in
a sentence, prominent items usually are either placed at the beginning or at
the end of their clause. The middle part of a sentence is occupied by items
that should receive less emphasis. According to this rule, and in this
particular case, the explanation of how Atlantians were able to reach the
continent across the ocean, at the end of the clause, is where the emphasis should
be placed and not on the continent itself that is mentioned earlier (the part that
many automatically are drawn to). Not knowing where the emphasis on a clause
should be placed, can cause a great deal of confusion, as often and depending
where the emphasis goes, two separate meanings can emerge out of a single paragraph.
Actually, when it comes to ancient Greek, sometimes even a single comma can
cause a short sentence to have two different meanings. Such example is a famous
quote from the oracle of Delphi. "Go,
return not die in war", can have two entirely
opposite meanings, depending on where a missing comma is supposed to be -
before or after - the word "not".
In short, when a story from ancient Greek is translated to English, the
translated sentences may require proper "re-positioning" in order for
an English reader to make better sense of it. For instance, when understanding
the syntactic structure of the Greek language and how to "read it"
correctly, Plato’s second paragraph above, to an English reader should appear
as follows:
(For) the Ocean that was at that time navigable;  and it was possible for travelers of that
time to cross from it (from Atlantis) to the other islands, and from
these islands to the whole of the continent over against them which encompasses
the veritable ocean....  for in front of
the mouth which you Greeks call, as you say “the Pillars of Hercules,” there
lay a continent which was larger than Libya and Asia together. 

When
seen in this context, the continent across the ocean is no longer the place of
origin for Atlantians, but a destination. Here, Plato simply describes the
might of Atlantis by depicting their incredible capability to travel half way around the world. He explains that via island hopping (most likely from Scotland, to the Faroe Islands, to Iceland and then to
Greenland),
the Atlantians were able to reach another grand island/continent on
the other side of the Atlantic, one across from the "Pillars of
Hercules". Which other continent is on the opposite side of the Atlantic
across from the Strait of Gibraltar? The American continent, of course! It was
the American continent that Plato said was larger than Libya and Asia put
together and not that of Atlantis, as many wrongly had interpreted and even to
this day continue to interpret. 
Those unconvinced that the ancient Greeks could have
known of the American continent around the 4th century BC, must be reminded
that unlike other European civilizations at the time, not only did the Greeks know
of the continent across the ocean but they were also aware that the earth is round

knowledge. Additional evidence though, point that more ancient cultures during

that at around the 4th century BC not only Plato and the Greeks may have been
aware of the American continent, but others did as well.

Great Lakes were found to also carry haplogroup X, a gene that originates from
the eastern Mediterranean). And, without Plato's explanation in place, how else

essentially all the island stops to North America from Europe? 
Those who support the Solutrean/ Clovis hypothesis (a migration
via a partial ice sheet over the Atlantic), how do they explain that out of at
least a dozen haplogroups present in northern Europe at the
time (H, V, J, HV, U, T, UK, X, W, and I) only a single one managed the trip to
North America, when on the opposite site, every one of the 4 Asian haplogroups
sequentially followed each other over the Bering Strait?
As for those who support the hypothesis that haplogroup X migrated to the Great Lakes
on foot via the Bering Strait, along with haplogroups A,B,C & D, how do they
explain that there is no trace of haplogroup X to fill in the huge void between
southern Russia and the Great Lakes of North America?  Most importantly, though, if haplogroup X
migrated to America via the Bering Strait, how do we explain that the heaviest
concentration of haplogroup X, away from the eastern Mediterranean, exist on
the east coast of the United States, around the Great Lakes, and not in Alaska
or the west coast? Is it time perhaps to give Plato's story another closer
look? 
Finally, in regards to the critics who will remind you that Atlantis was entirely
swallowed by the sea, while obviously in this case remnants of it were left
behind, in the following paragraph Plato clarifies this flawed belief.
The consequence
is, that in comparison of what then was, there are remaining in small islets
only the bones of the wasted body, as they may be called, all the richer and
softer parts of the soil having fallen away, and the mere skeleton of the
country being left.

story:
Hi! 

I'm Aaron J. Cooper and I'm currently studying Media Production at The University Of South Wales.

I'm doing my degree through the Welsh language and my work to date has reflected that through working on film projects in Welsh and in English.

To date I have directed and shot many music videos for bands around the South Wales area, most notably Welsh music prize nominees "The People The Poet", Radio 1 band of the week "Peasant's King" and "Straight Lines".

As well as this I have recently directed and shot my very first documentary "Llais/Voice" that has been shortlisted in "Ffresh film festival"

Now its time to try my hand at a short drama film...

"While Vacant Sheep Lie" came to be after I noticed myself reading about an increasing number of news stories where wealthy companies, countries or individuals where taking advantage of less wealthy or weaker individuals.

As I'm writing this it was only last week that I read of a woman who's home had been demolished against her will because Tescos had been given permission to build a new store on the site of her home.

This film is a reaction to situations like that. It's time we joined this woman, and people like her in the future and stand up against these corporate bullies. The message that 'enough is enough'. We need to wake up, realise what's being done to normal people, by the wealthy and powerful people of the world. This message can transcend cultures, beliefs, religion and that is what "While Vacant Sheep Lie" achieves to do.


With your help this film can be a success. 


Film is such a beautiful art form because it can transcend many cultures and beliefs and deliver a pure story and pure message. That is what I hope to do with this film.

But sadly things cost money. 


I need money to make this film realise its potential and that's why I've set up this campaign.

With your donation, however small, we will get closer to our goal of being able to tell a story that will resonate with many, enlighten a few and hopefully encourage more to take action.

Our aim for this campaign is to raise £500. The minimum required to set up an Indie-GoGo campaign. 

We aren't looking to make a profit from this campaign, money is not the goal of this project. We simply want and need enough money to make a successful film that we can all be proud of, and that will hopefully raise eyebrows and make people think.

If we reach our entire goal we will be able to pay our crew, a group of professionals that have taken time out of their schedule to work on this passion driven project that deserve to be given a wage for their hard work and their valuable time.

We will be able to get the equipment we need to make the film as visually unique and interesting as we want.

We will be able to afford the locations we need, so that we can tell the story we want to tell in the best way possible.

We will be able to pay our actors, for their time, their artistry and craft  to deliver a good performance .

If there is any money left over after all of this then we will use it to enter the film into Film festivals so that the film has a life and so that we give it the best chance possible to be successful and deliver the message to as wide an audience as possible.

I understand that not everyone is in a position to give money to this campaign, but that's not the only way you can help us:

If you could spare a few minutes sharing this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or any other type of social media it would be enormously appreciated and will go a long way to spreading the word about what we are trying to achieve! Remember that there are share tools available on Indie-GoGo to make this even easier!

Thank you for reading this, there are so many great projects out there asking for funding and I appreciate you taking the time to hear what we're trying to achieve.  

If you like what we're trying to do here, please donate as much or as little as you can.

Thanks,

Aaron J. Cooper
Writer, Director
"While Vacant Sheep Lie"

story:
Meet 'Big Red' - The love of my life! - (oops)


I've had a ridiculous passion for this Big Red Ute… 


And have just spent the last 4 years rebuilding this old girl.


 I now think she deserves an Epic Adventure worthy of her name

 
A 'Big Red' Journey - Across the Continent of Australia!


You can help make this happen by just clicking on a Perk you like, & donate that amount to receive the Post Card, or Video etc…

Thankyou!!!


4,580km North/South - 'Across Australia'


 G'day, I'm Paul Hendriks, -  "The Journeyman" to many, a bit crazy to others, but a proud Aussie still passionate about travelling the Great Australian Outback…                                                                                              

I've  been very very lucky to do this most of my life, camping, fishing & exploring  - Across Australia -  with my Ute, Swag, Dogs & now in 'Big Red' my Old F100 4x4

_________

Together with 'Lady Louise' & our 4 legged mates 'Rose & Lexi'… Rescue Dogs from Berrima Pound, we're attempting a 4,580km Journey 'Across Australia' 

                                                                                                                              

- Our goal is to film this 'Real Life Outback Aussie Adventure'  

& Hopefully Showcase this North/South Journey Worldwide…

every $10 donation helps 'Big Red' a few more km's… 

 

- All Contributers get onto the 'Funders Wall of Fame' 

scroll down for our Secret Perk for all you Crocodile Dundee fans...


'Across Australia'… with A Man, His Ute & His Dog!

#thejourneymantv 

Buying 'Big Red' on eBay in a moment of madness was the 1st thing I did when going through a divorce a few years ago, the 2nd thing was to  rescue Rose from the Dog Pound & the 3rd was to meet Louise & Lexi… 


I met 'Lady Louise' quite literally by chance on the main street of Bowral NSW… I believe the reason we met was to film this Real Outback Aussie Adventure!

Rose & Lexi became best mates & were ready for a Road Trip...


So we ALL completed 'The Birdsville Track in 'Big Red'' & loved it - & thought YOU  & many others around the world would love to experience this also…  

- so we decided to take YOU with us - through the eye of our camera! 


Louise & 'Big Red' on the famous Birdsville Track heading for the Races...

  

We've now decided to drive & film 'Across Australia' in 'Big Red' our  beat up looking 36 yr old F100 4x4… Crazy we know, we've been told!


The planned Journey 'Across Australia' - it really is a hell of a long way -


- But Achievable & Believable… just 1 km at a time - thanks to You!

This North/South Journey 'Across Australia' is huge - 4,580 km's !


Our goal is basically a MASSIVE' Road Trip - 'Across Australia' - as you can see - from way down at the Southern most point of Australia at Wilson's Promontory  to the Far Northern most Tip of Australia - 'Cape York Peninsular' 

We cross Mountains, Deserts, Croc Infested Rivers, Camp under the Stars in a Swag, Cook over Campfires & film everything that happens along the way!

___________________

Why on earth would we do such a Challenging, Old Style Camping & Fishing Journey with Swags, Dogs & Campfires driving - 'Big Red' our beat up looking F100 4x4?

To show you it can be done!!! & you can come along with us…

We're doing it Old School - bringing back the memories of simple times on the road,  fishing & camping & kayaking along with our #journeydogs in 'Big Red'… 
 
#journeydogs & Louise kayak across the flooded Birdsville Track... 


Can we make it in 'Big Red'? I hope so & with your support I think we can do it!

We need to raise $4.44 per km to make this happen...
# Just $10 can help us so much… another couple km's further  & gets you on our 'Funders Wall of Fame' or pick another Perk that you would like…
                                                                                                                                          The Dogs are ready to go:-) their waiting to leave!

 
If successful with this Journey, then it's a dream come true & we will have YOU to thank for that… who knows it may just be the start of  a few more
…

10 'Journeys Across Australia' could be on the cards if we succeed… 

                                                                       


  1. We have spent 3 full years, every minute & every dollar put into in the planning, paying, rebuilding, dreaming & hoping stages & finally ready to roll:-) 
------------------------       
We need YOUR help now to start the film rolling… 

Just $10 can help so so much… another few km's further - thank you!


Get your name on our 'Funders Wall of Fame' on our website… 


Every $10 donated helps us film & share another 2km 'Across Australia'        

Old Style Camping & Touring with our 'Journey Dogs' Rose & Lexi, we roll out the Swag under a million stars every night cooking awesome Road Trip Recipes…


Expenses... 


Intitial funding covers our most Basic Bare Bones Expenses on this North/South Journey - 'Across Australia'… 


Our initial goal is to raise $20,333 - this is $4.44 per km North…  a grand total of 4,580km North - but we will in fact cover 4 times that - 18,320 km's cutting a swath of 300km wide, often crabbing 100km sideways filming interesting points. 

# Basic Bare Bones Expenses covered below… & equate to $4.44 km 
$11,450  - Fuel @ around 25 Lt. per 100 km's, =  4,580 Lt.. x Avg. = $2.50 Lt
$1,810    - 'Big Red' F100 - Breakdown/ Emergency Repairs, Tyres = 40c km. 
$1,440   -  MAX 3 nights/week Caravan & Camping fees & expenses = $40 night
$3,600  -  Food, Drinks etc for 12 weeks on the road & remote towns $43 day
$2,033   - 10% Fees charged by Indiegogo & Pay Pal.

$20,333 - Total of Initial funding Goal to cover the Bare Essentials!
The list above caters for Bare Bones Basics, Emergencies & Everything in-between & is the same across every 'Journey Across Australia' - Min = $4.44 per km, & comes from my years of Remote Outback Touring Experience!

# Extra Expenses Below are covered if we reach our $10 km Stretch Goal
$3,500 - Drone purchase with Camera, repairs, cleaning & replacement 
$3,500  - Ultimate Sony dust/weather proof documentary movie camera
$1,500  - 3 small hand size weatherproof  cameras & extra Go pros
$3,500  - Computer Upgrade, IPhone Upgrade & DSLR maintain & repair 
$3,200  - Camping Gear, Wrap around Awning/Walls & unique rear Awning
$1,000   - Extra's unknown for Camping - replace lights, charging, fridge etc 
$1,000    - New & Extra Clothing Uniform, Hats & Presentation 
$1,000    - Remote area VHF comms, upgrades, repairs & emergencies etc…
$1,190    - Upgrade the Breakdown fund to $3,000 
$1,000  - Donation to 'Pets in the Park' - for Homeless People with Pets!
$497      - 166 Postcard Purchases from Cape York
$4,580   - 10% Fees between Indiegogo & Pay Pal 

$45,800 - Total of Stretch Goal for Better Filming & life on the road!
This 2nd list above is our wish list to make life & filming on the road much easier & with better equipment for filming, safety, & comfort with a better shelter… & gear & comes in at $10 per km…  we may be very lucky & reach this stretch target...

You need a backup of the backup of the backup - that's my motto anyway!

Just like - Water, Tyres & Fuel  - or know how to sort it…


Heading West across The Old Strezlecki Track...


No rest for the wicked...

We will be spending about 12 weeks, 12 hours a Day on the road filming & photographing & gathering ALL the raw material we need to produce the 6 part TV Series of the North South Crossing & believe me - experience tells us we will be working our backsides off from 1st light - way into the night sorting, downloading, processing, planning, documenting & logging, recharging & replacing + cleaning to name just a few commitments of our Life on the Road for that 3 months…

Oh, & did I mention filming constantly for 10 hrs a day:-)
But I love it… & is my passion to showcase Outback Australia!
  
Cooper Creek Camp… Just Awesome!


PERKS… Select one that you would like to receive!


$10 + 'Funders Wall of Fame' for Everyone who donates…


Secret Perk Link

Click here to view Secret Perk…

With Bonus Road Trip Recipes Guide #1...


Old fashioned - Hand Written Thank You Postcards mailed direct to you...


$25 Thank You Postcard - Outback Townships along the Journey…


$50 Thank You Postcard from the - Tip of Australia - 'Cape York Peninsular'…


$100 Personal Video Thank You from this very Sign… Tip of Australia!...


$100 Video Attempt of the Old Jardine River Crossing - will 'Big Red' make it?


Also Includes 'Big Red's Attempt of the Notorious Gunshot Creek Video ...


FUNDING…

If the unexpected happens & we don't reach our initial $20,333  target - the North/South Journey will still go ahead regardless, just delayed - even if we have to run this campaign 3 times or work our way 'Across Australia' - we will complete it!

I want you ALL to know my passion, persistence & pride run deep!!!
I am committed to make this dream come true & will not stop until it's completed…

On the other hand, if we surpass our initial target & go on towards our Stretch Goal  of $10 per km, or $45,800 - then we will cover expenses explained & listed in the Expenses Budget  & will be most appreciated - if we go on to exceed this then the balance will go towards producing a full time business for "The Journeyman" & also will be put towards the next Journey - East/West 'Across Australia' 4,958km

________________

Your contribution - even the $10 Perk all add up & help us not only achieve our dreams, but to know YOU  helped share this dream - & as promised you will get your name up on our 'Funders Wall of Fame'  on "The Journeyman" websiite… 


Click on the any Perk & get your name onto the...

'Funders Wall of Fame'


Together we can Showcase 'Outback Australia' to the Rest of the World…

After we gather ALL our footage our eventual Goal is this…
"The Journeyman" TV Series…
Click on the link above to view the whole TV Series Plan…

Are we capable of making all this come true?
"The Journeyman" - Resume of Life…
Click on the link above to see my life's experiences...

RISKS & CHALLENGES…


# This is not a simple Road Trip Across Australia - it will take a lot of… 

- Planning - Strategy - Roadworthy Vehicle - 3 months of living in a Swag -
- Weather Conditions - Heat - Dust - Wind - Rain - Flies - Insects - Cold -
- Weather Conditions - Road Conditions - Communications & Safety Solutions -
- Maps - GPS Systems - Laptops & iPads - Camera's - Drone  & Film Equipment -  
- Dog Restriction Awareness - Nat Parks - Crossing Rivers - Mountains - Forests -   
- Outback Australia - Townships - People - Crocodiles - Fishing - Camping - Snakes -
- Anything & Everything…

# Above are some of the Risks & Challenges & Issues we will face… but these can all be managed & minimised… let's see how we go!

We will show you how to do that!!! or not to do - if we mess up!

My personal experience of many years travelling & camping Across Australia will stand us in good stead & since I am a simple bloke who really doesn't like complicated sorts of things - that's the type of solutions & lessons you will learn off us doing this - Journey Across Australia - in 'Big Red'


Frequently Asked Questions…?


1/ What happens if you don't make it? 
= Once started we will stay on the Journey however long it takes to complete...
2/ What happens if you don't raise enough funds for the Bare Basic Journey?
= As long as we can get started - even if we have to film, stop, work, film, stop & work our way all the way North - we will complete the Journey no matter what:-)...
3/ Why are you taking Dogs? You can't get into National Parks?
= Our Rose & Lexi are part of our family pack & want them to go where we go, we also want to show you many incredible experiences & areas off the tourist trail… I believe many people want to travel with dogs & I think things need to change...
4/ Are the Post Cards real or Electronic? & are they sent from that town?
= Yes, the Post Cards are REAL printed ones:-) written & mailed from that town…
5/ What happens if 'Big Red' breaks down or you get hopelessly bogged?
= Let's hope not:-), but we do have emergency funds for a breakdown & recovery, & we have winches, snatch straps, air jack, track mats & a good old shovel:-)…
6/ Do you sleep in a tent, or in the back of 'Big Red', what about Crocs?
= Good question! We sleep in our trusty old Swag on the ground in the open or under the side awning or tent sometimes & the dogs have their own bed in the back of the truck, if in crocodile country we also sleep in 'Big Red' with the dogs…
7/ Why are you attempting 2 of the most feared off road 4x4 obstacles in Australia? Isn't that a little crazy - couldn't you damage 'Big Red'…?
= Yes, that's right we are attempting both the Notorious Gunshot Creek Crossing & actually attempting to FORD the (170m wide crocodile Infested) Jardine River,
 = Why? I have unfinished business to complete - I declined to do both of these on my 12 month lap of Australia last visit up the Tip of Cape York & need to attempt them both & many people believe it cannot be done in 'Big Red' :-) let's see!...


Other ways you can help…


# Social Media - Share, Share, Share with Friends & Contacts is a HUGE HELP!

# ANY HELP - in any way would be appreciated very much by Louise & Myself…

# If you can pass the word onto people who may be able to help or contribute & would love to see something fresh & exciting succeed - please do, thank you!


You can also easily use the share tools right here on Indiegogo!

Please - Share! Share! Share!


Thank You So Much…
Paul, Louise, Lexi & Rose…
"The Journeyman" Team


Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 

Paypal needs the above disclaimer to be displayed on the page....

Please note; Louise & I are extremely confident that we will deliver to you all, as promised, we just need to get there 1st…
Thanks so much for all your amazing support and contributions,

Paul, Louise, Lexi & Rose...

This 2nd list above is our wish list to make life & filming on the road much easier & with better equipment for filming, safety, & comfort with a better shelter… & gear & comes in at $10 per km…  we may be very lucky & reach this stretch target...




You need a backup of the backup of the backup - that's my motto anyway!
Just like - Water, Tyres & Fuel  - or know how to sort it…


Heading West across The Old Strezlecki Track...





No rest for the wicked...

We will be spending about 12 weeks, 12 hours a Day on the road filming & photographing & gathering ALL the raw material we need to produce the 6 part TV Series of the North South Crossing & believe me - experience tells us we will be working our backsides off from 1st light - way into the night sorting, downloading, processing, planning, documenting & logging, recharging & replacing + cleaning to name just a few commitments of our Life on the Road for that 3 months…


Oh, & did I mention filming constantly for 10 hrs a day:-)

But I love it… & is my passion to showcase Outback Australia!
  

Cooper Creek Camp… Just Awesome!





PERKS… Select one that you would like to receive!



$10 + 'Funders Wall of Fame' for Everyone who donates…






Secret Perk Link
Click here to view Secret Perk…

With Bonus Road Trip Recipes Guide #1...




Old fashioned - Hand Written Thank You Postcards mailed direct to you...




$25 Thank You Postcard - Outback Townships along the Journey…





$50 Thank You Postcard from the - Tip of Australia - 'Cape York Peninsular'…



$100 Personal Video Thank You from this very Sign… Tip of Australia!...




$100 Video Attempt of the Old Jardine River Crossing - will 'Big Red' make it?


Also Includes 'Big Red's Attempt of the Notorious Gunshot Creek Video ...


FUNDING…

If the unexpected happens & we don't reach our initial $20,333  target - the North/South Journey will still go ahead regardless, just delayed - even if we have to run this campaign 3 times or work our way 'Across Australia' - we will complete it!


I want you ALL to know my passion, persistence & pride run deep!!!
I am committed to make this dream come true & will not stop until it's completed…

On the other hand, if we surpass our initial target & go on towards our Stretch Goal  of $10 per km, or $45,800 - then we will cover expenses explained & listed in the Expenses Budget  & will be most appreciated - if we go on to exceed this then the balance will go towards producing a full time business for "The Journeyman" & also will be put towards the next Journey - East/West 'Across Australia' 4,958km

________________



Your contribution - even the $10 Perk all add up & help us not only achieve our dreams, but to know YOU  helped share this dream - & as promised you will get your name up on our 'Funders Wall of Fame'  on "The Journeyman" websiite… 

Click on the any Perk & get your name onto the...
'Funders Wall of Fame'


Together we can Showcase 'Outback Australia' to the Rest of the World…

After we gather ALL our footage our eventual Goal is this…

"The Journeyman" TV Series…

Click on the link above to view the whole TV Series Plan…

Are we capable of making all this come true?

"The Journeyman" - Resume of Life…

Click on the link above to see my life's experiences...


RISKS & CHALLENGES…



# This is not a simple Road Trip Across Australia - it will take a lot of… 



- Planning - Strategy - Roadworthy Vehicle - 3 months of living in a Swag -

- Weather Conditions - Heat - Dust - Wind - Rain - Flies - Insects - Cold -

- Weather Conditions - Road Conditions - Communications & Safety Solutions -

- Maps - GPS Systems - Laptops & iPads - Camera's - Drone  & Film Equipment -  

- Dog Restriction Awareness - Nat Parks - Crossing Rivers - Mountains - Forests -   


- Outback Australia - Townships - People - Crocodiles - Fishing - Camping - Snakes -

- Anything & Everything…


# Above are some of the Risks & Challenges & Issues we will face… but these can all be managed & minimised… let's see how we go!


We will show you how to do that!!! or not to do - if we mess up!

My personal experience of many years travelling & camping Across Australia will stand us in good stead & since I am a simple bloke who really doesn't like complicated sorts of things - that's the type of solutions & lessons you will learn off us doing this - Journey Across Australia - in 'Big Red'


Frequently Asked Questions…?

1/ What happens if you don't make it? 
= Once started we will stay on the Journey however long it takes to complete...
2/ What happens if you don't raise enough funds for the Bare Basic Journey?
= As long as we can get started - even if we have to film, stop, work, film, stop & work our way all the way North - we will complete the Journey no matter what:-)...
3/ Why are you taking Dogs? You can't get into National Parks?
= Our Rose & Lexi are part of our family pack & want them to go where we go, we also want to show you many incredible experiences & areas off the tourist trail… I believe many people want to travel with dogs & I think things need to change...
4/ Are the Post Cards real or Electronic? & are they sent from that town?
= Yes, the Post Cards are REAL printed ones:-) written & mailed from that town…
5/ What happens if 'Big Red' breaks down or you get hopelessly bogged?
= Let's hope not:-), but we do have emergency funds for a breakdown & recovery, & we have winches, snatch straps, air jack, track mats & a good old shovel:-)…
6/ Do you sleep in a tent, or in the back of 'Big Red', what about Crocs?
= Good question! We sleep in our trusty old Swag on the ground in the open or under the side awning or tent sometimes & the dogs have their own bed in the back of the truck, if in crocodile country we also sleep in 'Big Red' with the dogs…
7/ Why are you attempting 2 of the most feared off road 4x4 obstacles in Australia? Isn't that a little crazy - couldn't you damage 'Big Red'…?
= Yes, that's right we are attempting both the Notorious Gunshot Creek Crossing & actually attempting to FORD the (170m wide crocodile Infested) Jardine River,
 = Why? I have unfinished business to complete - I declined to do both of these on my 12 month lap of Australia last visit up the Tip of Cape York & need to attempt them both & many people believe it cannot be done in 'Big Red' :-) let's see!...


Other ways you can help…


# Social Media - Share, Share, Share with Friends & Contacts is a HUGE HELP!
# ANY HELP - in any way would be appreciated very much by Louise & Myself…
# If you can pass the word onto people who may be able to help or contribute & would love to see something fresh & exciting succeed - please do, thank you!

You can also easily use the share tools right here on Indiegogo!
Please - Share! Share! Share!


Thank You So Much…Paul, Louise, Lexi & Rose…"The Journeyman" Team





Disclaimer"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 
Paypal needs the above disclaimer to be displayed on the page....
Please note; Louise & I are extremely confident that we will deliver to you all, as promised, we just need to get there 1st…
Thanks so much for all your amazing support and contributions,
Paul, Louise, Lexi & Rose...

story:
Jack, un hombre viejo y débil, vive recluido en una oscura y lúgubre capilla subterránea. Atormentado por los fantasmas de su pasado, intentará escapar hacia el mundo exterior, pero un terrible secreto saldrá a la luz para impedir su salida. Jack tendrá que luchar con todas sus fuerzas para conseguir huir de ese maldito lugar y también de si mismo.


Jack, a weak old man, lives in seclusion in a dark and gloomy underground chapel. Haunted by the ghosts of his past, he’ll try to scape to the outside world, but a terrible secret will come out to prevent his departure. Jack will have to fight with all his strenght in order to escape not only from that wretched place but also from himself.

Condamned es un cortometraje de terror de unos 10 min de duración en el que pretendemos sumergir al espectador, en un viaje claustrofóbico y oscuro, donde los miedos y la ambición humana, se darán cita, en una atmósfera diabólica de terror gótico.

Nos trasladamos al Londres de finales del siglo XIX, sumido en plena decadencia victoriana,  donde encontramos a un Jack viejo y débil, encerrado en la capilla de su gran mansión. Jack intentará salir de su propia prisión personal, pero su plan se verá amenazado por  unas presencias que le recordarán sus fantasmas del pasado. 

Condamned es un corto pero intenso viaje hacia la redención del ser humano  y la oscuridad que lo envuelve.


Condamned is an horror short film that lasts about 10 min. in which we want to immerse the viewer in a dark and claustrophobic journey where fears and human ambition will meet in a diabolical atmosphere of gothic horror.

Set in the late nineteenth century London, plunged in full Victorian decadence, we find a weak ald Jack locked in the chapel of his large mansion. He’ll try to leave his own personal prison but his plan will be threatened by a presence that will remind him of his past ghosts.

Condamned is a short but intense journey towards the human redemption and the darkness that surrounds it.


Alfonso Delgado es un actor que ha trabajado en cine, televisión, teatro y doblaje. Ya participó hace unos años en la campaña de Navidad de Loterías del Estado con un papel secundario, aunque el de 2014 es el que le ha servido para un mayor reconocimiento. Luchador incansable, ha aparecido en mas de una veintena de películas, haciendo pequeños personajes.

Alfonso Delgado is an actor who has worked in film, TV, theater and dubbing. A few years ago he took a secondary role on the State Lotteries Christmas campaign, although the 2014 commercial gave him a widder recognition. Tireless fighter, he has appeared in over twenty films, playing small roles.

Aida Qui, actriz Catalana nacida en Lleida, afincada en Barcelona. Donde empieza su trayectoria profesional con algunas obras de teatro y diferentes cortometrajes como “Un café sola con hielo” o “Jacobina”. 

Un par de años después volvió a Barcelona para trabajar en el programa “Polonia de tv3” y en la película “Losers”. Actualmente sigue su formación en el estudio de Laura jou en Barcelona y está pendiente del estreno del cortometraje “Record” en el festival de Sitges, junto con la película “Terra de ningú” en la que se estrena en el doblaje.

Catalan actress born in Lleida, based in Barcelona where she started her career playing theater and acting in short films such as “Un café sola con hielo” o “Jacobina”.

A few years later she returned to Barcelona to work in the TV show “Polònia” and the film “Losers”. Nowadays she continues her training in Laura Jou’s Barcelona studio and is waiting for the premiere of the short film “Record” at the Sitges Film Festival, along with the movie “Terra de ningú” which premieres her in the dub.

Apasionado por el cine de género y la realización cinematográfica. Estudia imagen en su ciudad natal y trabaja en distintos proyectos audiovisuales durante más de 10 años. En octubre de 2011, estrena su primer cortometraje, Silent Agony, el cual llega a estar seleccionado y nominado en más de 50 festivales de género fantástico por todo el mundo. Incluyendo países tan dispares como España, Estados Unidos, Irlanda, México, Italia, Croacia, Canadá, Suecia, Puerto Rico o África del Sur. Silent Agony fue premiado en el Festival Fear Fete de Estados Unidos en 2013 como Best Horror Clasical Short y nominado al Méliès D’Argent en el Imagine Film Festival de Holanda en 2013 y premiado en el Zed Fest de Los Angeles. CondAmned supone su segundo corto profesional como realizador. 

Passionate about genre films and filmmaking. He studied Image in his hometown and worked on different audiovisual projects for over 10 years. In October 2011 he released his first short film, Silent Agony, which was selected and nominated in more than 50 fantasy festivals worldwide, including countries as diverse as Spain, US, Ireland, Mexico, Italy, Croatia, Canada, Sweden, Puerto Rico and South Africa. Silent Agony was awarded with Best Clasical Horror Short at the Fete Fear Festival (US, 2013), nominated Méliès d’Argent in Imagine Film Festival (Holland, 2013), and awarded in the Zed Fest of Los Angeles. Condamned is his second professional short film as a filmmaker.

    

                

                                          PUEDES VER SILENT AGONY AQUI: 

                                            YOU CAN WATCH SILENT AGONY HERE:

Silent Agony Short Film

Sus primeros años los dedica a la producción audiovisual en videoclips y spots publicitarios, hasta que en 2005 firma su primer corto como guionista y realizador, “Ultio” (La venganza). Su pasión por la escritura cinematográfica y la documentación le lleva a colaborar con diferentes guionistas de ámbito estatal. Actualmente su guión “Los muros del silencio”, escrito con su colaborador Yon Raga Kender (1968), se encuentra en fase de pre-producción.

During the early days of his career he worked in audiovisual production for music videos and commercial spots until in 2005 he worked as writer and director in his first film “Ultio” (La venganza). His passion for screenwriting and documentation takes him to collaborations with different spanish writers. His screenplay “Los muros del silencio”, written with his collaborator Yon Kender Raga (1968), is currently in pre-production.

Sus primeros pasos en el mundo audiovisual fueron de foquista de ficción y publicidad. Años más tarde siguió en la dirección de foto de ficción, video arte, videoclips, y  en publicidad con trabajos de mas envergadura. 

Actualmente se dedica en el mundo de la dirección de fotografía, en títulos de crédito, al igual que en el diseño de dirección de fotografía para proyectos ilustrados.

His first steps in the audiovisual world were as a flashlight technician on fiction and advertising. Years later he continued as a cinematographer of fiction, video art, music videos and bigger advertising projects.

Currently engaged in the world of cinematography, title credits and design of cinematography for illustrated projects.

Con más de dieciocho discos editados a nivel internacional, Sathorys Elenorth, se ha convertido a día de hoy, en una referencia dentro de la escena oscura underground Europea. Siendo su música, un excelente reclamo para el séptimo arte, empapada de multiples texturas sonoras, matices neoclásicos y un elevado carácter narrativo que la hace perfecta para el universo de la gran pantalla.

En la actualidad, recorre escenarios de toda Europa presentando sus múltiples proyectos en directo, a la vez que trabaja en nuevos proyectos, lanzamientos discográficos y otros proyectos de índole artística.

With over eighteen albums internationally released, Sathorys Elenorth has become an european referent in the underground dark scene. His music is an excellent lure for cinema being soaked in multiple sonic textures, shades and high neoclassical narrative which it perfect for the universe of the big screen. 

He’s currently travelling throughout european scenarios with his live projects while working in new ones, new releases and other artistic projects.

Con experiencia como escritor y articulista de varias publicaciones escritas sobre el medio cinematográfico en España hasta el año 2008. Graduado por las escuelas de cine “CECC” (Centro de Estudios Cinematográficos de Cataluña) y “Bande a Part – Escuela de Cine” en Dirección, Guión y Producción. Ha recibido formación de contrastados profesionales como Santiago Zannou (“El truco del manco”, “Alacrán enamorado”), Enrique Urbizu (“La caja 507”, “No habrá paz para los malvados”) o Michel Gaztambide (guionista habitual de Julio Medem o Enrique Urbizu, y ganador del Goya al mejor guión original por “No habrá paz para los malvados”).  “Refugio 115”(2011) fue su primer cortometraje profesional en 35mm, después de dirigir y escribir varios spots publicitarios, entre ellos uno para el Festival International de Cine Fantástico de Sitges 2010. “Refugio 115” fue seleccionado en más de 200 festivales y ganó más de una treintena de premios internacionales (con dos nominaciones al Melies de Plata al mejor corto fantástico europeo).

“Mr.Dentonn”(2014) es su segundo cortometraje, de reciente estreno, que ha obtenido cerca de 100 selecciones oficiales en apenas 6 meses de distribución hasta el momento. 

Experienced as a writer and columnist for several spanish film magazines until 2008. Graduate in film schools CEEC (Center of Cinematographic Studies of Catalonia) and “Bande a Part” Film School in Management, Script and Production. He has received professional training by Santiago Zannou (“El truco del manco”, “Alacrán enamorado”), Enrique Urbizu (“La caja 507”, “No habrá paz para los malvados”) or Michel Gaxtambide (long time collaborator as a writer with Julio Medem or Enrique Urbizu, and Goya for the Best Original Screenplay winner for “No habrá paz para los malvados”). His first professional short film was “Refugio 115” shooted in 35mm after directing and writing several commercials, including for the International Fantastic Film Festival Sitges 2010. “Refugio 115” was selected in more than 200 festivals and won over thirty international awards (including two nominations for the Best European Fantastic Short Film Silver Méliès).

Recently released “Mr. Dentonn” (2014) is his second short film and has gained nearly 100 official selections in just six months of distribution.

  

Después de año y medio de duro trabajo, hemos conseguido llegar a las puertas donde nuestros sueños se van a hacer realidad.

Hemos podido reunir prácticamente todo el presupuesto del proyecto sin ayudas. Contamos con costosos decorados, efectos especiales y localizaciones a las que hay que trasladar a todo un gran equipo.

Hemos logrado reunir a un equipo técnico y artístico para crear un proyecto muy profesional. Pero para eso, necesitamos una ayuda final para poder llegar a la fase del rodaje.

After eighteen months of hard work we managed to reach the gates where our dreams will come true.

We were able to gather almost the entire project budget without help. We have expensive sets, special effects and locations where we’ll need to move around a large team.

We have brought together a cast and crew to creat a professional project. For all that we need a final help to reach the filming stage.


Sello donde aparecerá tu nombre mostrando y validando que tu alma forma parte de nuestra obra.

Seal with your name showing and validating that your soul is a part of our work.

Poster del cortometraje firmado por sus autores y texto personal agradeciendo eternamente tu colaboración con el proyecto.

Poster of the short film autographed by the artists with special thanks and eternal gratitude for your contribution to the project.


STEEL BLACK TICKET

Acceso al estreno del corto

Access to the premiere of the short film.

GOLDEN  BLACK TICKET VIP

Te gustaría pasar un día con nosotros?

Te invitamos a pasar un día con nosotros! Ven a sumergirte en un mundo de tinieblas conociendo de primera mano a todo el equipo que hacemos posible Condamned.

Would you like to be with us during the filming? 

We invite you to spend a day with us! Come and immerse yourself in a world of darkness knowing firsthand the whole team that makes Condamned a reality.

STEEL BLACK TICKET VIP

Acesso a pase privado

Acces to private pass

GOLDEN SPECIAL VIP BLACK TICKET

Acceso a todo
Access to all

EDICIÓN ESPECIAL GRIMORIO

Llévate a casa la edición especial DVD / Blu-ray en forma de grimorio medieval!. Una edición limitadísima, numerada y firmada con la propia sangre del director!. Contiene making off, extras y invocaciones diabólicas que podrás usar a tu riesgo.

El Grimorio Contiene:

Manuscrito del infierno, Banda Sonora Original edición especial, Sello de la oscuridad, DVD/Blu Ray Edición Especial, Steel Black Ticket y Steel Black Ticket VIP.

GRIMOIRE SPECIAL EDITION

Bring home the Special Edition DVD / Blu ray as a medieval grimoire! A limited edition numbered and signed by the director’s own blood! Contains making off, extras and diabolical summonings to use at your own risk.

Grimorie Contains:

Manuscript from hell, Original Soundtrack Special Edition, Darkness Seal, DVD/Blu Ray Special Edition, Steel Black Ticket y Steel Black Ticket VIP.


Reservado a 4 mecenas !

¿Te gustaría formar parte de nuestra historia? Aparece en el corto representado un pequeño papel!. Necesitamos a 4 valientes figurantes para una escena muy especial e importante para el corto. ¿Quieres ser uno de ellos?. Atrévete a ser un personaje más de nuestra historia!

Would you like to be a part of our story? Appear in the short film playing a small role! We need 4 brave extras for a very special and important scene. Do you want to be one of them? Dare to be a character in ouy story!

Os damos la oportunidad de poder colaborar y formar parte de esa gran aventura. Viaja y únete a nuestro oscuro mundo!

El señor de las tinieblas te estará muy agradecido, así que, hemos preparado para ti grandes ofertas para tu alma mortal.

We’re giving you the opportunity to collaborate and be a part of this great adventure. Join and travel into our dark world!

The Lord of Darkness will be very pleased so we prepared great deals for your mortal soul.
