His music is an excellent lure for cinema being soaked in multiple sonic textures, shades and high neoclassical narrative which it perfect for the universe of the big screen. 
He’s currently travelling throughout european scenarios with his live projects while working in new ones, new releases and other artistic projects.



Con experiencia como escritor y articulista de varias publicaciones escritas sobre el medio cinematográfico en España hasta el año 2008. Graduado por las escuelas de cine “CECC” (Centro de Estudios Cinematográficos de Cataluña) y “Bande a Part – Escuela de Cine” en Dirección, Guión y Producción. Ha recibido formación de contrastados profesionales como Santiago Zannou (“El truco del manco”, “Alacrán enamorado”), Enrique Urbizu (“La caja 507”, “No habrá paz para los malvados”) o Michel Gaztambide (guionista habitual de Julio Medem o Enrique Urbizu, y ganador del Goya al mejor guión original por “No habrá paz para los malvados”).  “Refugio 115”(2011) fue su primer cortometraje profesional en 35mm, después de dirigir y escribir varios spots publicitarios, entre ellos uno para el Festival International de Cine Fantástico de Sitges 2010. “Refugio 115” fue seleccionado en más de 200 festivales y ganó más de una treintena de premios internacionales (con dos nominaciones al Melies de Plata al mejor corto fantástico europeo).
“Mr.Dentonn”(2014) es su segundo cortometraje, de reciente estreno, que ha obtenido cerca de 100 selecciones oficiales en apenas 6 meses de distribución hasta el momento. 

Experienced as a writer and columnist for several spanish film magazines until 2008. Graduate in film schools CEEC (Center of Cinematographic Studies of Catalonia) and “Bande a Part” Film School in Management, Script and Production. He has received professional training by Santiago Zannou (“El truco del manco”, “Alacrán enamorado”), Enrique Urbizu (“La caja 507”, “No habrá paz para los malvados”) or Michel Gaxtambide (long time collaborator as a writer with Julio Medem or Enrique Urbizu, and Goya for the Best Original Screenplay winner for “No habrá paz para los malvados”). His first professional short film was “Refugio 115” shooted in 35mm after directing and writing several commercials, including for the International Fantastic Film Festival Sitges 2010. “Refugio 115” was selected in more than 200 festivals and won over thirty international awards (including two nominations for the Best European Fantastic Short Film Silver Méliès).
Recently released “Mr. Dentonn” (2014) is his second short film and has gained nearly 100 official selections in just six months of distribution.
  

Después de año y medio de duro trabajo, hemos conseguido llegar a las puertas donde nuestros sueños se van a hacer realidad.
Hemos podido reunir prácticamente todo el presupuesto del proyecto sin ayudas. Contamos con costosos decorados, efectos especiales y localizaciones a las que hay que trasladar a todo un gran equipo.
Hemos logrado reunir a un equipo técnico y artístico para crear un proyecto muy profesional. Pero para eso, necesitamos una ayuda final para poder llegar a la fase del rodaje.
After eighteen months of hard work we managed to reach the gates where our dreams will come true.
We were able to gather almost the entire project budget without help. We have expensive sets, special effects and locations where we’ll need to move around a large team.
We have brought together a cast and crew to creat a professional project. For all that we need a final help to reach the filming stage.







Sello donde aparecerá tu nombre mostrando y validando que tu alma forma parte de nuestra obra.
Seal with your name showing and validating that your soul is a part of our work.


Poster del cortometraje firmado por sus autores y texto personal agradeciendo eternamente tu colaboración con el proyecto.
Poster of the short film autographed by the artists with special thanks and eternal gratitude for your contribution to the project.


STEEL BLACK TICKET



Acceso al estreno del corto
Access to the premiere of the short film.
GOLDEN  BLACK TICKET VIP


Te gustaría pasar un día con nosotros?
Te invitamos a pasar un día con nosotros! Ven a sumergirte en un mundo de tinieblas conociendo de primera mano a todo el equipo que hacemos posible Condamned.
Would you like to be with us during the filming? 
We invite you to spend a day with us! Come and immerse yourself in a world of darkness knowing firsthand the whole team that makes Condamned a reality.

STEEL BLACK TICKET VIP

Acesso a pase privadoAcces to private pass
GOLDEN SPECIAL VIP BLACK TICKET
Acceso a todo

Access to all



EDICIÓN ESPECIAL GRIMORIO
Llévate a casa la edición especial DVD / Blu-ray en forma de grimorio medieval!. Una edición limitadísima, numerada y firmada con la propia sangre del director!. Contiene making off, extras y invocaciones diabólicas que podrás usar a tu riesgo.El Grimorio Contiene:Manuscrito del infierno, Banda Sonora Original edición especial, Sello de la oscuridad, DVD/Blu Ray Edición Especial, Steel Black Ticket y Steel Black Ticket VIP.
GRIMOIRE SPECIAL EDITION

Bring home the Special Edition DVD / Blu ray as a medieval grimoire! A limited edition numbered and signed by the director’s own blood! Contains making off, extras and diabolical summonings to use at your own risk.Grimorie Contains:Manuscript from hell, Original Soundtrack Special Edition, Darkness Seal, DVD/Blu Ray Special Edition, Steel Black Ticket y Steel Black Ticket VIP.



Reservado a 4 mecenas !


¿Te gustaría formar parte de nuestra historia? Aparece en el corto representado un pequeño papel!. Necesitamos a 4 valientes figurantes para una escena muy especial e importante para el corto. ¿Quieres ser uno de ellos?. Atrévete a ser un personaje más de nuestra historia!

Would you like to be a part of our story? Appear in the short film playing a small role! We need 4 brave extras for a very special and important scene. Do you want to be one of them? Dare to be a character in ouy story!






Os damos la oportunidad de poder colaborar y formar parte de esa gran aventura. Viaja y únete a nuestro oscuro mundo!
El señor de las tinieblas te estará muy agradecido, así que, hemos preparado para ti grandes ofertas para tu alma mortal.
We’re giving you the opportunity to collaborate and be a part of this great adventure. Join and travel into our dark world!
The Lord of Darkness will be very pleased so we prepared great deals for your mortal soul.

story:
Summary

We seek $15k to make DVDs of the 19-minute documentary Racing with Copepods, including 10 short educational films using leftover footage from the documentary - all for schools and libraries. Your contribution is tax-deductible. 

The 10 supplementary films we want to create are each of 2-5 minutes.  Along with the documentary, they form a substantial and entertaining educational package for school children and adults. The films will help teachers engage students and promote place-based learning, environmental awareness, and ocean literacy. 

The topics are:

  1. San Francisco Bay: How wind and currents occur there, its uniqueness
  2. Chert: What it is, how it formed, where it’s from, where you can see it
  3. Trash: When we throw something away, where is “away"?
  4. Protecting The Ocean: What we can do to protect our waters
  5. Learn To Sail: Technique, lessons, knots
  6. Marshes: How the marshes act as kidneys, cleaning our waters
  7. Dr Sylvia Earle: Lessons from her talk with the youth of RWC
  8. Copepods & The Lucky Luke Effect: How impossibly fast they are
  9. Extended interviews with the youth sailors of RWC
  10. Questionnaires: The RWC youth report with answers they got from adults to questions like: Where does most of our oxygen originate? How much of the ocean floor have we mapped? Where are most of the species on Earth?  What is the most populous animal on the planet? And the fastest? (If you think it's a cheetah or falcon - think again!)

Says Dr Sylvia Earle: "In school, you learn your letters, your numbers - it should be mandatory that we learn our place in the universe. We need to rewire our relationship to nature." These films will hopefully encourage that shift. 

Wish-list

The 10 films are only a small step towards a broader, long-term goal: To promote our relationship with nature and improve the way we teach our children by introducing more place-based learning. Any amount we receive beyond our funding goal will go directly towards:

  • Writing a curriculum for school teachers, with modular lesson plans, quizzes, and activities - all centered on the films' topics of fun, place-based learning, environmental awareness, and ocean literacy (estimated $8k)
  • Transforming the web site racingwithcopepods.com into a learning resource. We want to give educators and students online access to the curriculum, videos, lesson plans, data, and local experts and scientists willing to share their expertise on-site.  We'd like to give users the ability to contribute by archiving and sharing their ideas, experiences, photos, and video (estimated $10k)
  • Translation, captioning, native voiceover narration of all videos into Spanish, French, Japanese, and Chinese (estimated $35k)
  • Hiring a full-time marketing manager for social media, screenings, radio and TV relations and press releases, and grass-roots engagement with schools. Currently, we simply do not have the time or capital to sustain these vital marketing and outreach efforts ($50k/year).

About Racing With Copepods

Racing with Copepods is a short documentary about 12 middle school students as they learn how to sail in order to study plankton. Students learn what many adults would not commonly know and find that learning science requires seeing differently. Where does most of the oxygen we breathe come from? What is the fastest animal on earth? They learn there is more at play in sailing than merely the currents, winds, and how well they can tie a knot. To see the film, come to one of our many screenings.
Cast:
  • Dr Sylvia Earle, National Geographic Explorer in Residence
  • Kimball Livingston, Narrator, writer, ESPN America's Cup commentator, editor-at-large at SAIL, international sailor, blog: blueplanettimes.com
  • Meghan Hartnett, Marine Biologist, Sailing Education Adventures Program Director, US Sailing Instructor
  • Captain Richard Gillette, Executive Director of Spirit of the Sea
  • Ann Holmes, Scientist Graduate Student Researcher, San Francisco State
  • 12 Youth Sailors speaking for the health of the planet

Racing with Copepods was filmed in The San Francisco Bay Area by Bazooka Mama Productions, directed and co-written by Carlos Graña, produced and co-written by Barbara McVeigh. A Sailing Education Adventures project funded by a grant from 11th Hour Racing, a program of the Schmidt Family Foundation, in partnership with the Romberg Tiburon Center and Derek M. Baylis.

  A program of the Schmidt Family Foundation.


FILM TEAM

Carlos Graña, Director, was born in New York of Peruvian parents and raised in Peru, England, Spain, and the USA. He went to school for painting, sculpture, and writing. Making films is all he wishes to do for the rest of his life. In 2011 he took the full-time dive into filmmaking and founded Bazooka Mama Productions after spending 15 years as a leader in international language education.


Barbara McVeigh, producer of BMP, was a public radio producer and journalist and senior creative and production manager for national art and lifestyle catalogs. More recently, she has been working with nonprofit marine organizations while developing a  private nature program in Northern California. She received "Teacher of the Year" award from Nanjing University, China and is finishing a Masters in Humanities at Dominican University of California. Film work combines her professional experiences with a passion for eco and social justice issues and love for the arts. As a mother of two, she looks to make the world a better place for the next generation.

Why Contribute? 

    The ocean's influence and our relationship to the natural world are the most important topics of our age. Racing with Copepods helps us share this critical message in an inspiring way to help create individual and community responsibility that effects us all. We want the next generation to look back at our generation and know that we lived our lives responsibility to help make their world a healthier and beautiful place. Please join us in that effort.

    What We Need & What You Get

    Our vision: Racing with Copepods will continue to foster education and advocacy for ocean stewardship, the value of place based education and inspire us to "see what we forget to see." Nature and science education are the most important lessons for our youth as we "need to rewire our relationship with nature."

    The perks for your contribution will not only allow you to receive photos, a DVD, credits in the DVD case or a special photo book with stills of the project, signed by key figures in the making of the film, but you'll also be rewarded by a new generation of youth who are inspired to respect the beauty of our natural world be the stewards for a healthy planet.

    If we do not reach the full financial goal, BMP will create a DVD based on the film and the footage that the final budget allows. Any additional funds we receive will go towards our wish-list, above.

    Our Impact

    Racing with Copepods has garnered support from The Wilderness Society, The Orion Society, author Nick Hayes, as well as top sailor Dawn Riley, among others.  Our project is important because it is the inspiring voice for the ocean, one advocating more research, responsibility and respectful recreational values. 

    This project and team have a track record. The film has received great support after many screenings throughout California and, soon, across the US and Canada. Teachers are even learning how the ocean impacts our every day life no matter where you live - our oceans produce oxygen and weather patterns, vital contributions for all of life.  

    Risks & Challenges

    We have received tremendous support for this film, as it seems to resonate a message that we all want to impart: Let's take care of our oceans for the next generation. The film has been screening at schools, universities, science museums, clubs and sailing organizations.

    We will look forward to the full requested funding, however, if we fall short, we will be resourceful and put the funds toward a DVD for the film only and use other remaining funds for marketing and distribution.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help us get the word out about the film Racing with Copepods. Share this campaign with everyone you know and support our mission.

story:
Short Summary

A Force in Nature is a story of an awe-inspiring 92 year-old Icelandic artist living in a remote part of Texas. Jóhann Eyfells, along with his late life-long partner, artist, Kristin Eyfells,  have together forged a path of such pure creative force that their vast body of work can be likened to an undiscovered frontier of new expression and bold ideas.

It's also the story of a man who left his Icelandic homeland and family as a young man to carve a life for himself in America, first as an amateur boxing champion, then as an architect, and finally, as an inspiring artist and teacher. The story will reveal the challenges that shaped his early life in Iceland, a land of fire and ice. Those same forces become sources of unequaled inspiration in his long life as a sculptor and thinker.

To see the teaser trailer click the title link below:

A Force in Nature

As the director and co-executive producer of this film, along with Vishwanand Shetti, we are both honored to have the opportunity to share Jóhann's story to the world. I have personally known Jóhann for close to 10 years now, and through this time my appreciation for this man's art and philosophy has grown immeasurably.

As I strongly suspect that Jóhann's life work will inevitably be recognized worldwide, I also find his vision and ideas to be invaluable and important to us. By being part of this film as a contributor, you will also be part of the history and influence that this man will have on our world.


What We Need & What You Receive

Three years ago, through Indiegogo, we successfully raised $23,115 out of the $35,000 we initially needed for the barebones production of A Force in Nature. Thanks to the generous contributions we received from people everywhere, we were able to send a small crew (myself and a camera assistant) to Iceland and film non-stop for almost three weeks, capturing some of the most spectacular landscapes we've ever seen and meet with some of the most colorful characters that knew Johann intimately. Since then we have been working on and off editing the project, on our own time and resources.

We want to raise an additional $25,700 for the last part of the production which would help us assemble all of the necessary elements we captured in Iceland and Texas and put the finishing touches to it. Here is the breakdown of what we are looking for in terms of support:

This is for editing and other post-production elements for the film:

  • Finishing Fee Post production - $10,500 (assistant editors, color grading)
  • Music rights fee - composers and musicians - $3,000
  • Stock film - $1,500
  • Research - $2,500
  • Subtitling - $3,000
  • Distribution and advertising $5,200

All funds will go toward the making of this film, which means it will help offset all of the major costs associated with post production and distribution.

As a contributor, you will be a part of our growing Force in Nature community, and will be entitled to a gift from us, ranging from our especially designed t-shirt, a free pass to the screening, and even an associate producer credit! There is also a Monograph (see photo) that we will be giving away as part of our 'perks'. Two of the monographs, originally published for the 1992 one-man exhibit at the National Gallery of Iceland, have been especially signed and embossed by the artist, and have been especially offered as part of fund raising for this film.


Our deepest gratitude goes to our initial supporters. This film would not be where it is now without them:

Ingólfur Eyfells (Associate Producer & Production Coordinator - Iceland), Claudia Pictet (Producer), Mona Miller (Associate Producer), Bernadette Gambino (Associate Producer), Glyn Vincent (Associate Producer), G. Vincent Morland (Associate Producer), Driss Ben-Brahim (Associate Producer), Margit Yates (Associate Producer), J. Eugene Marans (Associate Producer), Elizabeth Compton (Associate Producer)

and...

Sonja Luther, Natasha Morland, Don Lampasone, Sherryl & David Paul Brown, Susan Pratt, Eyjólfur Eyfells, Lee Chen & Woody Norman, Tetsuya Aomatsu, Claudine Torfs, Igor Michel, John & Cathy Bennett, Heather Ringman, David Skibsrud, Talon Skibsrud, Elizabeth Kling, Glenn Mobley, Benjamin and Kisha Conroy, Cynthia Rubinstein, Dawn K Donaldson, Dorinda Yates, Frank Souders, Brooke Aaron, Richard Finkelstein, Viviane Vives, Valentina Pero, Groa Hreinsdottir, Eugene Marsh, Pamela Farland, Christian Schmidt, Carol Lafayette, Danu Aribe, Arun Vir-Dawkins, Sarah Sullivan, Karine & Thomas Constantin, Michael Vera, Daniel Terry, David DeBlieck, Tyler Mager, Daniel Hirons, and Claudie de la Maisoneuve,

It should be mentioned that EVERYONE who has initially contributed to the filming phase of A Force in Nature will be receiving a designed t-shirt in addition to the original perk you are slated for. Your encouragement was invaluable to the success of our first phase, the filming, so THANK YOU!



Jóhann Eyfells, a constantly evolving artist, is presently working on a new series of work that embodies his vision that takes prehistoric elements and combines them with contemporary steel structures. Rocks, reminiscent of Stonehenge, shaped and sculpted by time, by the slow erosive power of water and wind are now a part of his vision as an artist.


The Impact

"I am of the opinion that A Force in Nature is an extremely important and historic documentary and a major contribution to contemporary art history."  Mark Alexander - Director of Art Services 2000 Ltd.

I first met Jóhann Eyfells almost 10 years ago. Being in his immediate presence and reflecting on his large body of work, it quickly became apparent to me that Eyfells is by far, one of the most inspiring artists I'd ever known, and quite possibly one of the most influential sculptors of the 21st century. Because of that I was compelled to make this documentary. This film speaks to all artists, young and old alike, who see Jóhann Eyfells as a beacon of hope in bringing artistic expression to an entirely new level of understanding. Eyfells' art, at its core, conveys the very essence of nature's powerful creative force that reside both in the material and metaphysical world we live in.

In Johann's words: 

"the creative forces trump the destructive forces, because the latter is subordinated by it. Love is such a force that it can never be destroyed." 





"Eyfells' work conveys the sense of man being threatened by the earth. It is fate in the form of time and gravity... . The earth is conspicuously titanic in Iceland, and it it this earth in upheaval that finds its way into Eyfells' sculpture."  Donald Kuspit - Art Historian and Critic

And as Jóhann Eyfells so eloquently puts it:

"Yes I am an old man, yet I am now on a wave of growing productivity and ideas. I want the world to know that I am always evolving as an artist and at this moment in time, I am finding a growing momentum in my work. You haven't seen anything yet. I am a force in motion..."


Challenges Ahead

This film has been in the making since 2007. In June of 2012, shortly after our first successful fundraiser campaign, we flew to Iceland and spent 3 weeks filming, interviewing the very people who intimately knew him and had witnessed the challenges he faced as a controversial artist in Iceland. We have intimately followed the life and work of Jóhann Eyfells for 8 years now, and we are now ready to complete final phase  of OUR film so that we may present this phenomenal story to the world.

This production has faced some major hurdles, but thanks to you we overcame one of the most difficult ones, the filming. Now we are faced with one more challenge, and that is to make this story compelling and memorable through the magic of editing. We spent an additional $9500 of our own funds to support our editing team and edit 66% of the film, which is over an hour of scene work. The final third of the film reaches into the past and requires research, stock, and the time to craft the life of the artist.

We cannot do it alone, if we want this story to be seen. Without additional resources for the film, it will take us more time to finish. With your contributions, we will be able to complete it in a timely way, within the next 5 months.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that for some people, contributing actual $$ may be difficult, so we ask you to share this campaign with any of your friends who YOU think would want to be part of this great project and community. Please share the following link to your friends and associates:

As the director and co-executive producer of this film, along with Vishwanand Shetti, we are both honored to have the opportunity to share Jóhann's story to the world. I have personally known Jóhann for close to 10 years now, and through this time my appreciation for this man's art and philosophy has grown immeasurably.
As I strongly suspect that Jóhann's life work will inevitably be recognized worldwide, I also find his vision and ideas to be invaluable and important to us. By being part of this film as a contributor, you will also be part of the history and influence that this man will have on our world.



What We Need & What You ReceiveThree years ago, through Indiegogo, we successfully raised $23,115 out of the $35,000 we initially needed for the barebones production of A Force in Nature. Thanks to the generous contributions we received from people everywhere, we were able to send a small crew (myself and a camera assistant) to Iceland and film non-stop for almost three 
weeks, capturing some of the most spectacular landscapes we've ever seen and meet with some of the most colorful characters that knew Johann intimately. Since then we have been working on and off editing
 the project, on our own time and resources.
We want to raise an additional $25,700 for the last part 
of the production which would 
help us assemble all of the necessary elements we captured in Iceland and Texas and put the finishing touches to it. Here is the breakdown of what we are looking for in terms of 
support:
This is for editing and other post-production elements for the film:


Finishing Fee Post production - $10,500 (assistant editors, color grading)

Music rights fee - composers and musicians - $3,000
Stock film - $1,500
Research - $2,500
Subtitling - $3,000
Distribution and advertising $5,200

All funds will go toward the making of this film, which means it will help offset all of the major costs associated with post production and distribution. 
As a contributor, you will be a part of our growing Force in Nature community, and will be entitled to a gift from us, ranging from our especially designed t-shirt, a free pass to the screening, and even an associate producer credit! There is also a Monograph (see photo) that we will be giving away as part of our 'perks'. Two of the monographs, originally published for the 1992 one-man exhibit at the National Gallery of Iceland, have been especially signed and embossed by the artist, and have been especially offered as part of fund raising for this film.



Our deepest gratitude goes to our initial supporters. This film would not be where it is now without them:
Ingólfur Eyfells (Associate Producer & Production Coordinator - Iceland), Claudia Pictet (Producer), Mona Miller (Associate Producer), Bernadette Gambino (Associate Producer), Glyn Vincent (Associate Producer), G. Vincent Morland (Associate Producer), Driss Ben-Brahim (Associate Producer), Margit Yates (Associate Producer), J. Eugene Marans (Associate Producer), Elizabeth Compton (Associate Producer)
and...
Sonja Luther, Natasha Morland, Don Lampasone, Sherryl & David Paul Brown, Susan Pratt, Eyjólfur Eyfells, Lee Chen & Woody Norman, Tetsuya Aomatsu, Claudine Torfs, Igor Michel, John & Cathy Bennett, Heather Ringman, David Skibsrud, Talon Skibsrud, Elizabeth Kling, Glenn Mobley, Benjamin and Kisha Conroy, Cynthia Rubinstein, Dawn K Donaldson, Dorinda Yates, Frank Souders, Brooke Aaron, Richard Finkelstein, Viviane Vives, Valentina Pero, Groa Hreinsdottir, Eugene Marsh, Pamela Farland, Christian Schmidt, Carol Lafayette, Danu Aribe, Arun Vir-Dawkins, Sarah Sullivan, Karine & Thomas Constantin, Michael Vera, Daniel Terry, David DeBlieck, Tyler Mager, Daniel Hirons, and Claudie de la Maisoneuve, 
It should be mentioned that EVERYONE who has initially contributed to the filming phase of A Force in Nature will be receiving a designed t-shirt in addition to the original perk you are slated for. Your encouragement was invaluable to the success of our first phase, the filming, so THANK YOU!

 


 
Jóhann Eyfells, a constantly evolving artist, is presently working on
 a new series of work that embodies his vision that takes prehistoric 
elements and combines them with contemporary steel structures. Rocks, 
reminiscent of Stonehenge, shaped and sculpted by time, by the slow 
erosive power of water and wind are now a part of his vision as an 
artist. 


The Impact


"I am of the opinion that A Force in Nature is an extremely important and historic documentary and a major contribution to contemporary art history."  Mark Alexander - Director of Art Services 2000 Ltd.

I first met Jóhann Eyfells almost 10 years ago. Being in his immediate 
presence and reflecting on his large body of work, it quickly became apparent to
 me that Eyfells is by 
far, one of the most inspiring artists I'd ever known, and quite possibly one of the most influential sculptors of the 21st century. Because of that I was compelled to make this
 documentary.
This film speaks to all artists, young and old alike, who see Jóhann 
Eyfells as a beacon of hope in bringing artistic expression to an 
entirely new level of understanding. Eyfells' art, at its core, 
conveys the very essence of nature's powerful creative force that reside
 both in the material and metaphysical world we live in. 

In Johann's 
words: 

"the creative forces trump the destructive forces, because 
the latter is subordinated by it. Love is such a force that it can never
 be destroyed." 





"Eyfells' work conveys the sense of man being threatened by the earth. It is fate in the form of time and gravity... . The earth is conspicuously titanic in Iceland, and it it this earth in upheaval that finds its way into Eyfells' sculpture."  Donald Kuspit - Art Historian and CriticAnd as Jóhann Eyfells so eloquently puts it:
"Yes
 I am an old man, yet I am now on a wave of growing productivity and 
ideas. I want the world to know that I am always evolving as an artist 
and at this moment in time, I am finding a growing momentum in my work. 
You haven't seen anything yet. I am a force in motion..."


 
Challenges Ahead
 This film has been in the making since 2007. In June of 2012, shortly after our first successful fundraiser campaign, we flew to Iceland and spent 3 weeks filming, interviewing the very people who intimately knew him and had witnessed the challenges he faced as a controversial artist in Iceland. We have intimately followed the life and work of Jóhann Eyfells for 8 years now, and we are now ready to complete final phase  of OUR film so that we may present this phenomenal story to the world.
This production has faced some major hurdles, but thanks to you we overcame one of the most difficult ones, the filming. Now we are faced with one more challenge, and that is to make this story compelling and memorable through the magic of editing. We spent an additional $9500 of our own funds to support our editing team and edit 66% of the film, which is over an hour of scene work. The final third of the film reaches into the past and requires research, stock, and the time to craft the life of the artist.
We cannot do it alone, if we want this story to be seen. Without additional resources for the film, it will take us more time to finish. With your contributions, we will be able to complete it in a timely way, within the next 5 months.

  
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that for some people, contributing actual $$ may be difficult, so we ask you to share this campaign with any of your friends who YOU think would want to be part of this great project and community. Please share the following link to your friends and associates:

story:
THE STORY

Sanity and reality collide for Carrie and Philip as they try to "Unshatter" their lives. Finding themselves imprisoned in the sanatorium, they escape to places/spaces within their minds, where they search for the truth that could make them whole. This film is a journey filled with twists and changes that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end, that you never saw coming.


THE WHY OF IT

I believe we are all intrigued by the WHY of our existence. How we explore that question defines our personal reality. As we discover new pieces to our puzzle, our reality, we ourselves are changed. This is life's journey, that we all take together but, ultimately, alone. But, what if we were broken? Able to sense that which is missing, but not able to see it or touch it. Certainly that would be maddening. 
"To translate this concept into a sharable experience is why we are making this film, An Unplanned Awakening".  J.M.

"As a visualist and an artist, I will be making this film, disturbingly beautiful. The story is disturbing, and each and every scene will be meticulously crafted to be beautiful". J.M.  

"This is our story. The story of how we lived it, before we lived it, and how it will forever be, when we are gone". J.M.


THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN
The screen clips displayed here are from the TEST SHOOT we did to better understand, as producers and artists, just what we need to individually accomplish in the creation of "An Unplanned Awakening". With this tool we are  learning what we need to do to make a spectacular movie. We also now know what we need to make this happen. We need you. 
Yes, of course we need money. Great movies don't grow on trees. But what we really need is your support. There may be people you know who are are pouring their love and passion into this movie. They may be your family, friends or fellow artisans. Maybe, you just like participating in acts of creation. It's all good. If you can help financially, thank you, thank you, very much. Not everyone has the means to kick down some cash. But everyone has a voice. Please let us use yours.
OUTREACH IS THE NAME OF THE GAME 
We want to decrease the "six degrees of separation" between us and you and everyone you know who shares your passion for creating and supporting art. Please be our voice and reach out to them by spreading the word about our campaign and film, like our Facebook page and follow us on Instagram. This is how our current world works. It is possible to build a great tower, one small brick at a time. "I know this guy, who knows this guy, who's got a brick". Do you?  
"Life is love. Passion is what it feels like". J.M.

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO

Essentially it all goes into production and post productions costs. The renting of film equipment, costumes, permits, feeding people and some pay for the technical team. There is also a nice bit of change there for the cost of our submitting to film festivals around the world.  

WHY FILM FESTIVALS ?
We will put this film out there for the same reason that a comic does "stand-up". In hopes that a talent scout or benefactor is in the audience. Almost everyone who has "made it" began in humble ways. Low in resources but rich in talent and access to other talented contributors, such as actors, producers, cinematographers, composers and the like who are amazing in their limitless creativity. This we have in great abundance. This is why "An Unplanned Awakening" will make an impression and get the attention it deserves. 
We would like to share this with you
Liam Boyle (composer) and Lara Jean Mummert (star) and myself are working on the title song for the movie. It is called, THE DYING CHILD. It is based on a poem that I wrote so very long ago. This is a reading by Lara Jean Mummert, who plays "Carrie" and Ward Sorrick who plays "Philip". This song, like the movie and the movie poster at the end of this posting, share one thing in common. They explore the same narrative. 
THE DYING CHILD
" When my wishes and dreams die, I die with these". J.M.

AN UNPLANNED AWAKENING POSTER
art: james maher / design: charles anselmo


Find This Campaign On:
Facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/An-Unplanned-Awakening/1396022087374206

YouTube:   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WRt8mUORfQw

story:
Welcome to the official GFS Campaign!


Ghost Files Singapore (GFS) needs your help! Contributions to our campaign will allow us to upgrade our equipment so that we can produce a better show.

GFS IN A NUTSHELL: The GFS team goes around Singapore looking for ghosts! Some people call us crazy. We can neither confirm nor deny this. The show was created by Noel Boyd in 2012 to share his love for paranormal investigations. In two seasons, GFS has squashed myths and ghost stories which Singaporeans and fellow Asians believed in. We have also proved beyond reasonable doubt that many locations are indeed haunted.

If this is the first time you've heard of us, click here to view our episodes.


Why Indiegogo?

We love the idea of working together as a community to create something awesome. 


Where is your contribution going?

We need to raise US$2,000 to cover purchasing of equipment. For transparency, we love being transparent, this is where the money goes to...

Tsunami infrared lighting for outdoor use. This lighting is capable of lighting an entire field.

This modified camcorder is rigged special for paranormal research because it captures video footage in full spectrum.

The all new Spirit Box not only scans for voices, it displays compatible words on the LCD screen so investigators can communicate better with entities,

The laser grid allows paranormal investigators to capture outlines of entities when they pass through a grid on a wall.

Motion sensors will allow us to explore a building without having to station our investigators in a particular room or zone.

The all new FLIR for Apple devices is a great gadget to document entities. As seen on the top paranormal shows, a FLIR device will allow us to see what the human eye can't. We'll be able to post LIVE Flir images to our Facebook and Instagram accounts too,


Your Contributions and Perks

We have a bunch of fun perks such as Thank You on GFS Facebook Page and Your Name in End Credits.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Show us some love by sharing this page with your friends and family. Use this hashtag:

    #iloveGFSTV

story:
TO MAKE A DONATION NOW, CLICK HERE:
https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/profile?id=11978

WHY SHOULD YOU CARE ABOUT TATTOO YOU?

Because bullying impacts everyone. 

This film project will help ignite a new conversation that looks at bullying from an adult perspective. Scars are like tattoos - they don't fade away. Tattoo You will also invite people from around the world to share their stories and experiences. 

Based on the award winning play (2013 National 10-Minute Play Award from The Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival), Lisa Kenner Grissom's  Tattoo You tells the story of two women from the same town, yet with very different backgrounds, who re-connect in the bathroom at their 20th high school reunion where their troubled past breaks the cool veneer of the present. 

Tattoo You is a narrative drama that has social relevance beyond the movie screen by offering the following: 

A different perspective on the issue of bullying.

A jumping off point for a broader discussion about the issue.

An opportunity to use the film as an educational tool to discuss how bullying affects people into adulthood, highlighting real stories of inspiration and empowerment.

WHY ARE WE ASKING YOU FOR MONEY? WHAT ARE WE GONNA DO WITH IT?

As everyone knows, making a film requires a lot of resources and wrangling to get to the finish line--to see the completed film on screen in front of an audience. 

For TATTOO YOU, we are asking ALL of our contacts and colleagues for favors on this project. But it's no surprise that making a film costs money. So even with all the favors, we need funds for equipment, locations, production design, sound design, hiring a crew (and feeding them), making sure we get a top-notch cast (and feeding them), and all the post-production costs. Your tax-deductible donation will go directly to these items!

We are hoping that the film will get into a variety of film festivals so we can have this important conversation with audiences and communities across the country. Of course, there is always a risk that we will not get into festivals. If that is the case, we will release the film online. Our goal is to reach a broad audience and we will do whatever it takes to do that. Your donation will go toward getting TATTOO YOU out into the world.

Our goal is to create a compelling film that reaches audiences emotionally. In order to do that, we need your support to tell the best story possible. 

Thanks so much and hope to see you in a movie theatre in the near future!

       HOW CAN YOU HELP MAKE TATTOO YOU a reality?

1. Make a tax-deductible donation - every dollar helps!  

2. Share our Indiegogo campaign with a friend

3. Like us on Facebook and share our content: https://www.facebook.com/tattooyouthefilm

4. Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/tattooyoufilm

5. Visit our website: http://www.tattooyouthefilm.com

6. Spread the word! Like us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter @tattooyoufilm and use the hashtag: #tattooyou

MEET OUR TEAM: 

Lisa Kenner Grissom - Screenwriter/Playwright

TATTOO YOU The Film is based upon Lisa's award-winning play of the same name. The play version of TATTOO YOU won the National 10-Minute Play Award at the Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival and has been seen by audiences in D.C., Boston, New York and LA. TATTOO YOU also won the 2013 Samuel French Off Off Broadway Festival and is published by Samuel French. 

One-Acts: HOME IS A FOUR-LETTER WORD (Chalk Rep), ASSHOLE (Collaboraction’s Sketchbook), THE GIRLS (Boston Theatre Marathon), DRINKS BEFORE FLIGHT (Boston Theatre Marathon; published by Smith & Kraus in 2015), ORANGUTAN & LULU (Estrogenius Festival). 

Full-Lengths: BUILDING THE PERFECT CHAIR (Road Theatre Company Summer Playwrights Festival), MOTHERLAND (Semi-finalist: Princess Grace Playwriting Fellowship; Jewish Plays Project), CHAMBERS (Finalist: O’Neill National Playwrights Conference, The Lark, WordBRIDGE; Semi-finalist: Ashland New Play Festival, PlayPenn), SHELTER (Semi-finalist: PlayPenn). Lisa attended The O'Neill Playwrights Conference as a Kennedy Center Fellow and Playwright Observer and was a Finalist for the Playwrights' Center Core Apprentice Program. Her work has been presented and/or developed at The Kennedy Center, Boston Playwrights’ Theatre, Chalk Rep, The Clurman Theater, Manhattan Theatre Source, The Blank Theatre, The Road Theatre, and more. B.A. Wesleyan University; MFA Lesley University. Originally from Boston and living in Los Angeles, Lisa spends quality time on both coasts. She is a proud member of The Playwrights Union, Antaeus Playwrights Lab and The Dramatists Guild.

S.R. Bindler, Director

Robb (S.R.) Bindler is a director who finds humor, levity, and poignancy in everyday subjects. His eye for natural detail and his comedic instincts elevate his commercial work, and were the cornerstones of his critically lauded film debut, HANDS ON A HARDBODY. The documentary feature, which recorded an endurance contest in Texas that offered a Nissan Hardbody Truck as the prize, was a festival hit around the country and won the AFI Audience Award for Best Documentary.

Robb’s iconic story has since been adapted for the stage and opened on Broadway March 2013 with a score from Amanda Green and Phish's Trey Anastasio and a story by Pulitzer Prize winner Douglas Wright. 

A native of Longview, Texas, Robb attended New York University's Tisch School of the Arts' Film program. He has worked with top advertising agencies including Wieden & Kennedy, BBDO, DDB, Grey, McCann, Arnold, and TBWA/Chiat Day. His work has won ADDYs, Andys, and has been honored by the AICP/MoMA Show.

Noam Dromi, Producer

Noam Dromi is a writer/producer, marketing executive and digital strategist specializing in transmedia content development for corporations, brands & entertainment companies. 

He co-wrote the Warner Bros/Alcon Entertainment film DOLPHIN TALE starring Morgan Freeman, Harry Connick Jr & Ashley Judd. The film grossed $100 million at the worldwide box office. 

Noam is the President of Driveby Entertainment Group, a production company he founded with actor/producer Orlando Jones (Sleepy Hollow, Drumline, Evolution). He oversees development of the company’s film, television, publishing and digital programming slate in addition to heading up business development opportunities in brand partnerships, live events and non-profit ventures.

Noam recently served as the President of social media agency New Medici where he and his team developed campaigns for a wide range of media, technology and consumer brand clients. 

He continues to serve as a digital media and marketing strategist for a range of entertainment companies including Alcon Entertainment (The Blind Side, Book of Eli, Dolphin Tale), The Film Arcade (Afternoon Delight, ACOD, Song One) and Millennium Films (Olympus Has Fallen, Expendables, Legend of Hercules).

From The Writer: 

People often ask, is this story true? The answer is no--the story and characters are entirely fictional. I did go to my high school reunion several years ago, and I had a great time reconnecting with old friends. But as a writer, I'm a keen observer with an active imagination. So I also saw that some people hadn't changed all that much. I noticed that some people, years later, still reverted to those classic archetypes: the popular girl, the shy kid, the partier and the bully.

When I sat down to write, this is what came out--the past meeting the present for these two women, in a haunted place. It wasn't until the play was out in the world, in front of audiences, that I fully realized its impact and the universality of the situation I had created. People from all walks of life could relate to Tammy and Rachel. After seeing the play, they would approach me and share their stories. 

As I listened to their stories, I wondered how their experiences shaped who they are today. I realized this was a conversation worth having. The adult perspective  doesn't come up when people talk about bullying. And that's why we are making this film. Because there are countless stories of how people overcome bullying to lead hugely successful lives. (Check out our website and on Facebook.) Because those who experienced bullying--I do not think of them as victims--are more than just survivors. They are heroes. And they have much to share and to teach us. 

The story of Tattoo You leaves much to the imagination because most, if not all of us, have experienced some form of bullying. We can fill in our own blanks. Maybe you were the bully; maybe you were the bullied. Maybe it happened to you as a kid in the locker room; maybe it's happening right now in your job. Maybe you have witnessed it; maybe you have participated. Whatever the case may be, I hope this film makes people think--and then talk. About the power of our actions, about lasting consequences, and about the question of forgiveness. 

Thanks so much for your interest in this project. And thank you for your help in bringing this story to the screen.

-lisa

MEET OUR TEAM: 

Lisa Kenner Grissom - Screenwriter/Playwright
TATTOO YOU The Film is based upon Lisa's award-winning play of the same name. The play version of TATTOO YOU won the National 10-Minute Play Award at the Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival and has been seen by audiences in D.C., Boston, New York and LA. TATTOO YOU also won the 2013 Samuel French Off Off Broadway Festival and is published by Samuel French. 
One-Acts: HOME IS A FOUR-LETTER WORD (Chalk Rep), ASSHOLE (Collaboraction’s Sketchbook), THE GIRLS (Boston Theatre Marathon), DRINKS BEFORE FLIGHT (Boston Theatre Marathon; published by Smith & Kraus in 2015), ORANGUTAN & LULU (Estrogenius Festival). 
Full-Lengths: BUILDING THE PERFECT CHAIR (Road Theatre Company Summer Playwrights Festival), MOTHERLAND (Semi-finalist: Princess Grace Playwriting Fellowship; Jewish Plays Project), CHAMBERS (Finalist: O’Neill National Playwrights Conference, The Lark, WordBRIDGE; Semi-finalist: Ashland New Play Festival, PlayPenn), SHELTER (Semi-finalist: PlayPenn). Lisa attended The O'Neill Playwrights Conference as a Kennedy Center Fellow and Playwright Observer and was a Finalist for the Playwrights' Center Core Apprentice Program. Her work has been presented and/or developed at The Kennedy Center, Boston Playwrights’ Theatre, Chalk Rep, The Clurman Theater, Manhattan Theatre Source, The Blank Theatre, The Road Theatre, and more. B.A. Wesleyan University; MFA Lesley University. Originally from Boston and living in Los Angeles, Lisa spends quality time on both coasts. She is a proud member of The Playwrights Union, Antaeus Playwrights Lab and The Dramatists Guild.
S.R. Bindler, Director
Robb (S.R.) Bindler is a director who finds humor, levity, and poignancy in everyday subjects. His eye for natural detail and his comedic instincts elevate his commercial work, and were the cornerstones of his critically lauded film debut, HANDS ON A HARDBODY. The documentary feature, which recorded an endurance contest in Texas that offered a Nissan Hardbody Truck as the prize, was a festival hit around the country and won the AFI Audience Award for Best Documentary.
Robb’s iconic story has since been adapted for the stage and opened on Broadway March 2013 with a score from Amanda Green and Phish's Trey Anastasio and a story by Pulitzer Prize winner Douglas Wright. 
A native of Longview, Texas, Robb attended New York University's Tisch School of the Arts' Film program. He has worked with top advertising agencies including Wieden & Kennedy, BBDO, DDB, Grey, McCann, Arnold, and TBWA/Chiat Day. His work has won ADDYs, Andys, and has been honored by the AICP/MoMA Show.
Noam Dromi, Producer
Noam Dromi is a writer/producer, marketing executive and digital strategist specializing in transmedia content development for corporations, brands & entertainment companies. 
He co-wrote the Warner Bros/Alcon Entertainment film DOLPHIN TALE starring Morgan Freeman, Harry Connick Jr & Ashley Judd. The film grossed $100 million at the worldwide box office. 
Noam is the President of Driveby Entertainment Group, a production company he founded with actor/producer Orlando Jones (Sleepy Hollow, Drumline, Evolution). He oversees development of the company’s film, television, publishing and digital programming slate in addition to heading up business development opportunities in brand partnerships, live events and non-profit ventures.
Noam recently served as the President of social media agency New Medici where he and his team developed campaigns for a wide range of media, technology and consumer brand clients. 
He continues to serve as a digital media and marketing strategist for a range of entertainment companies including Alcon Entertainment (The Blind Side, Book of Eli, Dolphin Tale), The Film Arcade (Afternoon Delight, ACOD, Song One) and Millennium Films (Olympus Has Fallen, Expendables, Legend of Hercules).
From The Writer: 
People often ask, is this story true? The answer is no--the story and characters are entirely fictional. I did go to my high school reunion several years ago, and I had a great time reconnecting with old friends. But as a writer, I'm a keen observer with an active imagination. So I also saw that some people hadn't changed all that much. I noticed that some people, years later, still reverted to those classic archetypes: the popular girl, the shy kid, the partier and the bully.
When I sat down to write, this is what came out--the past meeting the present for these two women, in a haunted place. It wasn't until the play was out in the world, in front of audiences, that I fully realized its impact and the universality of the situation I had created. People from all walks of life could relate to Tammy and Rachel. After seeing the play, they would approach me and share their stories. 
As I listened to their stories, I wondered how their experiences shaped who they are today. I realized this was a conversation worth having. The adult perspective  doesn't come up when people talk about bullying. And that's why we are making this film. Because there are countless stories of how people overcome bullying to lead hugely successful lives. (Check out our website and on Facebook.) Because those who experienced bullying--I do not think of them as victims--are more than just survivors. They are heroes. And they have much to share and to teach us. 
The story of Tattoo You leaves much to the imagination because most, if not all of us, have experienced some form of bullying. We can fill in our own blanks. Maybe you were the bully; maybe you were the bullied. Maybe it happened to you as a kid in the locker room; maybe it's happening right now in your job. Maybe you have witnessed it; maybe you have participated. Whatever the case may be, I hope this film makes people think--and then talk. About the power of our actions, about lasting consequences, and about the question of forgiveness. 
Thanks so much for your interest in this project. And thank you for your help in bringing this story to the screen.
-lisa

story:
Short Summary

The Warzone Boxing Club has been in existence since 2002. In this time we have developed 18 National and International Champions as well as two World Boxing Council (WBC) Intercontinental Champions in the professional ranks. Our Champions run all our programs for youths, adults and veterans. 

In 2009 we began an all Military Veteran Boxing program that is 100% FREE and has brought in several veterans who showed interest in not just gym use but actual competition. We also work with local VET Centers and several of their employees donate time here. Today we have almost 100 veterans signed-up and are looking to double that in 2016. We have formed an all veteran boxing team known as the WarDogz and they are currently training to compete in USA Sanctioned Boxing events.

Our goal is to raise enough money so that we can begin a new program for veterans with mental and physical disabilities while serving and advancing the current men and women we have with us now. Equipment will be purchased and the hiring of veterans with experience in PTSD will be brought in to work along with our trainers. With your help this can all be obtained

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of $75,000 so that we can:

·  Replacement Old Used Equipment

·  Purchase New Equipment

·  Hire Veterans

·  Start a Kids of Military Personal Program

·  Expand Operation Hours of Programs Dedicated to our Military

Our ultimate goal by 2020 is to move into a large facility so that we can further expand programs to spouses and children of active duty soldiers for Free seven days per week.

Any amount of donation is greatly appreciated and with enough help we will succeed in our goals. 

The Impact

We all know that many of our servicemen come back with disabilities physically and mentally. A lot of these men and women need more than just a counselor; they need a sense of belonging and a way to let out their anger and frustration. We give them that, we make them comfortable and allow them to become a part of our family. We also give them tasks to meet physically and mentally. We challenge their minds and bodies and this gives them a satisfaction that can be seen in their faces.

For the past 6 years we have been offering our services for Free to these fine individuals and we always will. But we need your help. Please take the time to speak to a veteran or watch a video of our Wardogz Team.  

Since 2009 a majority of our veterans here have become a part of our family, we attend events together; they show tremendous support and are always willing to give a helping hand. They are grateful when in fact it is our staff that is honored to have these heroes who have chosen to serve our Country and allow us to sit back and enjoy the freedom they defend and have defended. We are the ones who are and should be grateful.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest issue today is our lack of equipment and the need to replace the used equipment that is no longer usable. Up until this point we have never asked for any donations and have covered all expenses 100%. We need to purchase and replace this equipment and we need to hire more staff. We lack qualified staff with experience in the struggles of these men and women. We cannot expect everyone to donate their time and are willing to pay, but we will need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of Money or equipment would be greatly appreciated. Equipment must be made for commercial use and we are in need of treadmills, elliptical cycles, spin bikes, free weights, benches etc. Again all equipment must need to meet commercial use specifications.

Please let everyone know that we are here and available to all veterans and spouses of active duty military for free. Also let those who can help know about us. They can visit us at: 

http://warzoneboxingclub.com/Home/military/

Please stay tuned for our soon to be available Military Kids Boxing Programs. Here I have attached our kids page link: 

http://warzoneboxingclub.com/Home/kids-boxing/

story:
Help Break The Silence

The idea for this App was borne last year, when I noticed large gaping holes in our services, commitment and support for people in domestic and family violence situations. Violence doesn't discriminate. Every person on this planet has the RIGHT to live without harm or prejudice.

After yet another tragedy from domestic and family violence made the news only days ago here in Australia, taking the lives of a mother, her unborn baby and a beautiful and innocent 7 year old, we need to BREAK THE SILENCE. This is UNACCEPTABLE and we cannot wait any longer. The time to act is NOW. 

Although I cannot divulge the complex & complete details of this App (due to Intellectual Property) I wholeheartedly believe this App will evoke the innate courage to surface from within victims, yet at the same time it will assist dramatically in deterring perpetrators. It is a one-of-a-kind App and there is nothing else like it on the market. 

In my research I have found that most domestic violence education occurs prior to the violent event, is aimed at prevention via information sources and centres on providing resources to the worldwide Community. The intervention after the trauma is focused on victim safety, breaking the cycle, dealing with PTSD, and starting over. These services are utterly essential in rebuilding lives.

However, there is NOTHING available for the victims of domestic and family violence DURING the terrifying trauma itself. THIS APP ADDRESSES THIS! 

It is worthy of noting too, that this innovative App is in no way limited to domestic violence incidences.  I also see it being utilised in areas such as suicide prevention, and hostage and seige situations, to name but a few. Victims will be able to contact Emergency Service personnel when there is no option to call, or be heard (hiding in a cupboard, or locked in a bathroom, for example). Children can be shown how to use it too. It is SILENT. The secret is to remain one step ahead of the perpetrators. This App arms the authorities with the element of surprise, as it is when the victim is heard, and trying to phone for help, that rage in the abuser escalates, and the victim is most vulnerable.  This App eliminates this scenerio. 

The App will be:

  • Free - This App will cost nothing to download.
  • Quick - Easy to use, and fast acting. Individual details are entered on download, and stored in the App.
  • Simple - In moments of terror, this App needs to be simple and straight-       forward.
  • Efficient - This App will need constant monitoring and updating.  It cannot afford to fail.
  • Silent - an absolute MUST.
  • Secure - Lock screen enabled. The App icon will be changed every six weeks.
  • Responsive - The information and circumstances are in the hands of those that can help INSTANTLY
  • Fast Acting - App must be quick to load.
  • Safe - The App will have a Quick Exit button to take you out of the App immediately. The Lock Screen keeps all details and information safe.
  • Child Friendly - Children can be shown the passcode, and how to use the App.
  • Easily disguised - App icon will not be easily identifiable as a Domestic Violence App.
  • Quick Exit strategy - a one touch Exit button from the App


The Impact

This App will revolutionise the way we provide help and intervention for victims of domestic violence. It will assist in decreasing the number of domestic and family violence cases, allowing potential victims to live without fear. We also aim to have it deter potential perpetrators from abusing.

The biggest Impact: Lives will be saved. There is no impact more important than that.


What We Need :

Our Small Goal of $25,000 will go towards: 

App Development - My team consists of like-minded people, but unfortunately we are in not specialists in the area of App Development so this area of expertise will need to be outsourced. Funding will be used towards hiring professional App Development experts to design the App itself. The beta version will be targeted to Australia initially, where the creases will be located and ironed out. 

A small percentage of the contributions will be used to pay for Perks; Shipping; Professional Services & Marketing on Social Media sites.
Big Picture Goal:
App Development - Build the App with an unlimited user base on both IOS and Android platforms, across all devices, for use GLOBALLY.  Just like domestic violence, this App knows no borders.  Once the initial version is tweaked, it can be customised and distributed to countries around the world.  
Once again, a small percentage of the contributions will be used to pay for some Perks; Shipping; Professional Services & Marketing on Social Media sites. 
Charitable Causes - 6% of contributions above the original $25,000 goal will be divided up (2% each) between  the following three charities:
  • White Ribbon - An organisation that works to prevent male violence against women. It is Australia's only male led campaign. Their vision is that all women live in safety free from all forms of violence perpetrated by men.
  • Bravehearts - Their key purpose is to educate, empower and protect Australian kids from sexual assault. Their vision is to make Australia the safest place in the world to raise a child by 2020.
  • No More.org - This is a public awareness and engagement campaign focused on ending domestic violence and sexual assault in the United States.


What You Get:

                                        

 Social Media Shout Out - We will customise a Photo Shout Out on our Facebook Page just for you, highlighting your Zero Tolerance for Domestic Violence.  You can make it your Profile Picture, and share with your friends.      

                   

Our Supporter Tee - Exclusively designed for our Campaign. Available in Black or White, and in sizes XS-2XL (unisex). Only $40 delivered to your door.

Our Supporter Hoodie - Also designed especially for us. Available in Black or Purple, and in sizes S-3XL (unisex). Only $55 delivered to your door.

        

Women's Supporter Tee - Also exclusively designed for our Campaign. Available in Black, and in sizes XS-2XL (fitted style). Only $45 delivered to your door.
EARLY BIRD App Special: We will list your name (business name, or dedication) on the "Contributors Page" of our App. This will be the last page of the App.  Only 500 spots available so BE QUICK! 

Gala Dinner Perks - Whether you come alone, with a friend or partner, or shout 10 people from work, the Gala Dinner Launch will NOT want to be missed! Being held at one of the Gold Coast's biggest venues, this fully inclusive, Black Tie affair will have you rubbing shoulders with special guests and VIPs. Our aim is to launch the App in November, in conjunction with White Ribbon Awareness Month.


Who I Am: 

Ask my friends and they'll tell you that my entrepreneurial mind never stops.  I'm ALWAYS thinking of ways to better myself, better the community, and provide the best life I can for my kids. As a single Mum of two beautiful boys, I'm pretty proud of what I've achieved.  This week I celebrate the 3rd Birthday of my Cake business, Chocs & Pops. I started it from inception as a Cake & Chocolate Shop in 2012, and although I have scaled it back to fit in with my somewhat chaotic life, it is flourishing.


Other Ways You Can Help:

They say it takes a village to raise a child. Think of the innocent victims as the child, and the global contributors as the village! 

The truth is we have no hope of getting this App made without the input of the global Community. The world needs to band together to make this happen.  It is our duty to better the world by ridding society of domestic and family violence. 

Your contribution  of $1 or $100 - it all adds up. Let the power of the people do its thing! How good would YOU feel, knowing that YOU helped get the App out there to those in need?

We totally understand that not everybody is able to contribute financially, but please, please, please share this link via all your social media sites - Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter - as well as email it to everyone you know... 

The more people who can share this, contribute to this, and jump on board, the quicker we can launch and make a difference - one LIFE at a time.
