story:
So what's your story about?


The short answer: Grief and personal transformation.

    When her partner is suddenly killed, Natalie Grant is left to answer the questions surrounding his death and the blame laying at her door.  They say it is better to have loved and lost, but who after all are they?

    Natalie's journey through devastation and self reinvention is a personal journey that anyone walking on two legs and calling themselves human shares a piece of. "Bluebird," in a few short minutes extols the vulnerabilities in each of us and demands belief in the resilience of the human spirit.

A personal note: "This story is important to me, obviously in the sense that it touches on my family's pain and dealing with mortality; but on a basic human level it transcends that. It's important that Natalie be guilty, that people see a woman who is incredibly flawed, perhaps even unlikable- that they see her reinventing herself and reimagining the world, because that's reality. That's everyone's story. "-Kimberly Wehr writer/director

So Why Do You Need This & What Do I Get?

This is a HPV (High Production Value) project intended for entry in the festival circuit.

Are you going to make money off it? No.

Why do it then? To have a unique and meaningful examination of grieving as a piece of cinematic art. We are setting out to create something that people can relate to and hopefully open their hearts and souls towards healing their wounds from loss.  Also, we are making this film to create more opportunities for ourselves. This venture is our opportunity to showcase who we are as filmmakers to the critics as well as our colleagues. Recognition breeds opportunities for bigger and better things.

Your generous contributions will help us secure a portion of what it takes to fully realize our artistic vision. That portion includes set needs, cast, crew and the following:

  • Location: We're lucky to be able to film the entirety of the project in one location! Nestled in beautiful Twin Lakes Wisconsin, at the home of David and Paula Soderman, this two story home provides us with beautiful interiors and exteriors to bring what is uniquely a heavily visual story to life.
    

                                               

  • Gear: a major portion of our budget goes to secure the equipment we need including lighting & electric. 
As it is so crucial that we carefully compile the aesthetics, The ARRI Alexa XT is the camera we intend to use in order to shoot this project. The Alexa has lensed such projects as:

Alfonso Cuarón's "Gravity" 


Sam Mendes' "Skyfall"

Lena Dunham's "Girls" 


    Risks & Challenges

    It takes productions years to complete from start to finish. The contributions we receive here will cover a few of our essentials and help us along our way. When you think about us and the challenges we have ahead, think of us scouring discount bins and our bedroom drawers for loose change, because the nature of this business means giving it everything you have.

    We have roughly a month before our designated shoot date to raise our budget and have everything we need in place to shoot. The leadership on this project has invaluable experience on independent as well as major sets including: 2013 Indie film Melody and The Old Sock, TV shows such as The Voice, America's Got Talent, ABC's Empire, and major motion picture Transformers.

    With experience, passion and a knowledge of the industry we're excited and well prepared for the journey ahead.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We wouldn't be anywhere without the support and love from our communities (you guys truly do make this happen). No film lives without an audience and neither will Bluebird, so we need your help most in spreading the word.Gab really is a gift. Share us with your friends, your neighbors, the neighbors cat. Don't forget to visit our social media pages for frequent updates and pass them along.

    • PLEASE make use of the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
So what's your story about?
The short answer: Grief and personal transformation. 
When her partner is suddenly killed, Natalie Grant is left to answer the questions surrounding his death and the blame laying at her door.  They say it is better to have loved and lost, but who after all are they? 
Natalie's journey through devastation and self reinvention is a personal journey that anyone walking on two legs and calling themselves human shares a piece of. "Bluebird," in a few short minutes extols the vulnerabilities in each of us and demands belief in the resilience of the human spirit.
 A personal note: "This story is important to me, obviously in the sense that it touches on my family's pain and dealing with mortality; but on a basic human level it transcends that. It's important that Natalie be guilty, that people see a woman who is incredibly flawed, perhaps even unlikable- that they see her reinventing herself and reimagining the world, because that's reality. That's everyone's story. "-Kimberly Wehr writer/director   So Why Do You Need This & What Do I Get? This is a HPV (High Production Value) project intended for entry in the festival circuit.
Are you going to make money off it? No.
Why do it then? To have a unique and meaningful examination of grieving as a piece of cinematic art. We are setting out to create something that people can relate to and hopefully open their hearts and souls towards healing their wounds from loss.  Also, we are making this film to create more opportunities for ourselves. This venture is our opportunity to showcase who we are as filmmakers to the critics as well as our colleagues. Recognition breeds opportunities for bigger and better things. 
Your generous contributions will help us secure a portion of what it takes to fully realize our artistic vision. That portion includes set needs, cast, crew and the following:
Location: We're lucky to be able to film the entirety of the project in one location! Nestled in beautiful Twin Lakes Wisconsin, at the home of David and Paula Soderman, this two story home provides us with beautiful interiors and exteriors to bring what is uniquely a heavily visual story to life. 

      
                                                  Gear: a major portion of our budget goes to secure the equipment we need including lighting & electric.  

As it is so crucial that we carefully compile the aesthetics, The ARRI Alexa XT is the camera we intend to use in order to shoot this project. The Alexa has lensed such projects as:Alfonso Cuarón's "Gravity" 


Sam Mendes' "Skyfall"

Lena Dunham's "Girls" 



 Risks & ChallengesIt takes productions years to complete from start to finish. The contributions we receive here will cover a few of our essentials and help us along our way. When you think about us and the challenges we have ahead, think of us scouring discount bins and our bedroom drawers for loose change, because the nature of this business means giving it everything you have.We have roughly a month before our designated shoot date to raise our budget and have everything we need in place to shoot. The leadership on this project has invaluable experience on independent as well as major sets including: 2013 Indie film Melody and The Old Sock, TV shows such as The Voice, America's Got Talent, ABC's Empire, and major motion picture Transformers.With experience, passion and a knowledge of the industry we're excited and well prepared for the journey ahead. 
  Other Ways You Can Help We wouldn't be anywhere without the support and love from our communities (you guys truly do make this happen). No film lives without an audience and neither will Bluebird, so we need your help most in spreading the word.Gab really is a gift. Share us with your friends, your neighbors, the neighbors cat. Don't forget to visit our social media pages for frequent updates and pass them along.   PLEASE make use of the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
An Introduction

Thank you for taking the time to check out this campaign. Really does mean the world to me.  I'm just a guy following his dreams and helping others to follow theirs. 
I've worked in education as well as the film industry for over 4 years now and it's fair to say that this film is one that's extremely close to my heart. 


Once the film is made and released 50% of producers profits will be donated to Educational charity.


Working 3 jobs round the clock night and day to fund my first feature film had to be done and I will be carrying the same ethos into this project. But I realise it cannot be done alone.  We're offering amazing awards. From dinner with the cast and crew, to speaking parts.                                                         


Join our team and support our Indiegogo campaign. 



Synopsis

The Tutor tells the story of ballet dancer and former teaching assistant Alex, a twenty nine year old Londoner disillusioned by rejection of dance roles which she feels capable of doing justice to.  As she dances her way from one audition to the next and daydreams in the park she finds herself and her dancing subject to a voyeur in the form of a five year old boy named Junior. 


When Alex tries to return Junior to his parents she is met by dismissive and angry behaviour. On returning him home. Alex is approached by Juniors father Dan, a working class single parent. Dan remembers Alex from her teaching assistant days and asks her to be a home tutor for Junior for a week. 


Alex initially declines but after a visit to a former student is reminded why she began teaching in the first place. Alex takes the home tutoring position. During the sessions Juniors aggressive outbursts and reluctance to listen present Alex with extreme challenges. 


Dan's lack of presence in the household and his absence as a parent is confronted by Alex who threatens to leave the position unless something is done. Dan challenges Alex and calls her a quitter, stating she gave up ballet and now going to give up on his son. Shortly after the argument Dan apologises, giving his assurance that he will talk to his son. As the sessions continue Alex and Junior begin to work together. The tutoring sessions not only have a positive affect on Junior but also vice versa. Dan also learns and confronts his past realising the mistakes that he made in his life. 

I see a film trailer. Has this film been made?

NO NOT YET! After months of saving up and planning we filmed a couple of scenes from the script and put together this trailer. The plan is (pending we raise enough funds) to shoot the feature film this summer. We filmed the scenes and made the trailer to give audiences a vision of our film. 

Why should you support us?

i'd be lying if i didn't say i felt a little "squeamish" in asking for your money to help us make a movie.  I prefer to think that this is an investment in the message of the film. I intend to donate half of the Producers profits (after expenses) from the release film to an educational charity. 


When filming my debut feature film Sweetboy I tried to do everything (directing, acting and self funded it outright) and as a result endured some failures. Some stories are so crazy you really won't believe them (read my directors diary). It's fair to say that these failures through learnt lessons and a lot of hard work were a stepping stone to a successful ending (selected for the American black film festival 2014). Hooligan my first ever short was made for three hundred pound (selected for the Short Corner at The Cannes Film Festival). Sweetboy my debut feature film was made for around ten thousand pound. These are zero budget. 

Our budget will be used towards not only equipment but also locations, talent, crew and marketing. This will go along way to restraining our struggle.  We are extremely excited to be filming with the ARRI AMIRA. This camera has fulfilled our vision. The script is catered to our budget. Minimal locations and a minimal cast and just the Most Amazing Team (my fav word). 

We're offering amazing awards. From dinner with the cast and crew, to speaking parts.

OKAY BUT WHY ELSE SHOULD I BACK THIS PROJECT?

I've been working in education for quite a while, its only right a percentage of the profits made from the release of the film is donated to help young lives. 

YOU WILL BE SUPPORTING UP AND COMING DIVERSE TALENT! 


How will this film be distributed?

We plan to screen the film on the International festival circuit to create a momentum and buzz around the film and also share it with the world. Before selecting the right distributors to help assist in our VOD, home video and theatrical release. 

Cast and Crew 

Stefan Bakic / JUNIOR

Stefan Bakic is an Actor and Model. Stefan's first film was when he was only 4 years old. He was a lead role in a short film called Cinnamon in 2013. It followed by a feature film As Bad As Me in 2014. 


Anu Ogunmefun/ ALEX

Anu began dancing from a young age. At the age of 14 she joined The London's children's ballet company. In 2009 Anu made her first TV debut in BBC's Knight Crew. In 2011 she was awarded a dance and drama award at The Urdang Academy which she graduated with a diploma in performing arts in 2014. Since graduating Anu has performed part of Classically British for part of Black History Month and has danced for the likes of artists such as The Wanted, Hannah Perry, David Jordan and Holiday Sidewinder.


John Terence / DAN

John Terence is an award winning actor. John trained for three years at Drama Centre Of London under the tuition of Yat, Christopher Fettes and Reuvin Adiev.  He has acted on both film, TV and theatre. Classical and contemporary. 

He played Robbie in Murphy's Law for the BBC with James Nesbit. His recent film Corinthian, he acted in has won 2 awards for best film and has been accepted into 15 film festivals in Europe and the US. He has toured Macbeth internationally, worked at the Wimbledon Theatre in Romeo and Juliet, played Skeet a prisoner in Walking an award winning play chosen for its London showcase at The Arts Festival 2014. He is also a member of SAG. 


WRITER AND DIRECTOR / Anthony Vander


Anthony Vander is British director, actor, writer and producer. As an actor his first professional stage appearance was in a two hander opposite Emilia Clarke (Game of thrones), followed by Helen opposite Penny Downie and Paul McGann at Shakespeare's Globe Theatre in 2009.  As a writer his debut play Inhibitions was given a rehearsed reading by The National Youth Theatre in September 2009. His second play Studio 66 was also performed to sell audiences at the historic Roundhouse. 

In 2012 his debut short film Hooligan which he wrote and directed was selected for The Short Film Corner at Cannes Film Festival. In 2014 his debut feature film Sweetboy, which he directed, produced and acted in was screened at The British Film Institute and also was Official Selection at The American Black Film Festival last June. 

Anthony has  qualifications in Sociology and Communications (Goldsmiths, University of London), and also graduated from the prestigious Drama Centre London in 2009 with a BA Hons in Acting. He has worked in education for over four years teaching drama, teaching assisting and running outreach projects for young actors. Anthony Vander is CEO of Film production company Distortion Entertainment. 

PRODUCER / Nicole Behrens

Born and raised in Germany, Nicole Behrens has always had a great interest in storytelling. After working as a judicial clerk for a while, she decided to follow her heart and get into the film business. In the past couple of months she has worked as a production manager on documentaries like Eleven Campaign, line produced the feature film Rehearsal  and produced a couple short films. She also recently co-founded the London based production company ArtManic Films with cinematographer Marco Prates.

Just recently a short film Nicole produced called Anita's Birthday Wish was selected for the NewFilmmakers LA Film Festival and will have its world premiere in Los Angeles.

CINEMATOGRAPHER / Sophie Piedallu

Sophie Piedallu is qualified in Film Production Technology with a BSc from Staffordshire University and a French degree in cinematography. She is experienced with 16mm, digital and 3D film making (made her own 3D beam splitter rig). She has worked for major TV channels: Sky, CBBC, BBC ONE, France 3, Arte, Colours and Zee TV. She has also worked for Burberry doing Fashion Videos.

In 2012, she created an award winning TV channel, Staffs TV, that was rated 7th best broadcaster in the UK after only 8 months of existence. Staffs TV won the Tim Marshall Award for Special recognition and 2nd place for best live, with it’s flagship show What’s Next at the National Student Television awards, beating 40 other stations. This live weekly TV show, was produced and directed by Sophie Piedallu. Overall, Sophie was responsible for over 50 programmes, including NaSTAvision, a 3 hour national music TV show.

Sophie Piedallu received her first awards at the festival illumines with The People’s Choice Award  and The Grand Prize of The Jury in 2009 for a 3D short. In 2013, The Hub a short film also shot in 3D, was awarded 2nd place by industry professionals at GradEx.


COMPOSER / Richard Birchall

Richard Birchall is one of the UK's most versatile young musicians, pursuing a varied and colourful career as cellist, arranger, composer, and lyricist.  Listen to the score composed by Richard. 


As a classical composer, Richard has completed commissions from the Park Lane Group, London Cello Orchestra, Ernest Read Orchestra, Doric, Barbirolli, Tippett and Piatti Quartets, and his music has been performed at the Purcell Room, Wigmore Hall,The Sage Gateshead, King's Place and other festivals across the UK, in France, Germany, the USA and Korea. His Psycho Suite, commissioned by the Tippett Quartet and transcribed from the original film soundtrack, is available on Signum Classics and has featured on BBC Radio 3 and France Radio. Richard has produced numerous transcriptions for the UK's leading cello ensemble Cellophony, of which he is a founding member and director, and he has written words and music for a broad range of children's songs and plays. In September this year Cellophony will give the London premiere of his new work 'Alice in Wonderland', narrated by Simon Callow.
Richard has recently completed his studies in Film Music composition at Goldsmith's College, London.

Richard also works as a concert cellist: as a member of the Philharmonia Orchestra he performs regularly in the world's finest concert halls, and has appeared as guest Principal Cello with the Northern Sinfonia, Irish Chamber Orchestra and as concertmaster of the London Cello Orchestra; his solo and chamber work has ranged from Wigmore Hall to the catwalk at London Fashion Week.


The team is currently rounded out by: Ben Thompson (1st AC), Courtney Andrews (2nd AC), Hildegard Ryan (1st AD), Kieron Jansch (Grip), Adam Pietrzyk (Sound Recordist), Richard Bell (Stills photographer/Videographer) Jodie Woodall (runner), Matt Brading (Grading)


Distortion Entertainment                                                  Production House

In the space of just four years Distortion Entertainment has gone from one breakthrough to another. Since its inception Distortion Entertainment has been present at over six major film festivals including Cannes, Venice, Berlin to name a few. 

We believe in  producing risk taking independent films and also to be bold and fearless in our productions. We also believe in working and showcasing up and coming diverse talent. 


Distortion Entertainment

Facebook

IMDB

Twitter

Youtube


THE PERKS 

The Tutor is on Indiegogo to give everyone an opportunity to get involved.           

CHECK OUT THESE AMAZING PERKS! 


Get this T-Shirt from my debut feature film Sweetboy. Designed specially by Fangpunk. 

   Anthony Vander at the World Premiere of his debut film Sweetboy in NYC.


With the LEARNT LESSONS PERK you get an invite to the WORLD PREMIERE OF THE TUTOR. 

          The Tutor cast and crew during the weekend shoot earlier this year.

With the SUPER EXECUTIVE PRODUCER PERK not only is your name in the closing credits but you also ACT IN OUR FILM. 


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

YOU CAN HELP US BY SPREADING THE WORD, SHARING on social media, to your friends, family and everyone you know, This will help us and WE SEE THIS AS A CONTRIBUTION IN ITSELF :) 

A HUGE THANK YOU for supporting this project that is very close to my heart. 

Anthony Vander

story: Hi! We're a filmmaking team at Connecticut College in New London, CT who are in the process of creating a short film for our senior thesis  project. "The Devil You Know" was co-written and developed by us, George Scarles and Trey Chapman and will be shot later this spring.  We really believe in this project and are looking for financial help to bring our ideas to life.
story_txt: Hi! We're a filmmaking team at Connecticut College in New London, CT who are in the process of creating a short film for our senior thesis  project. "The Devil You Know" was co-written and developed by us, George Scarles and Trey Chapman and will be shot later this spring.  We really believe in this project and are looking for financial help to bring our ideas to life.

story:
"A dark comedy, thriller about a young nurse with a secret, who is left to care for a doctor who survived a fiery car accident. Soon, the nurse must come face to face with the doctor’s wife who has a secret of her own". 

It will be shot April this year. The storyline is very exciting, with a big twist at the end.  

Cast and Crew 

Jeffrey Staab - Dr. Nelson

 Katrina Volonnino - MacKenzie

 Misty Dixon - Sandy

 Kristin Rea - Michelle

 Adam Polk - Donald

 Davis DeRock - Nico


Jason Turner- Man

Director - Patrick Rea

DP- Hanuman Brown-Eagle

Production Company - Tony Ontiveros Production Services and SenoReality Pictures

Alan Watkins- Prop master

Colleen May- Makeup

Patrick Rea has won many awards for his shorts and feature films. His latest feature film “Nailbiter” won Best Director and/or Best Feature Film awards in several film festivals. “Nailbiter” was released on May 28, 2013 through Lionsgate Home Entertainment on DVD/VOD and Digital Downloads.  It has since aired on FearNet and the Chiller Network.  Rea's stylized short films have screened in over a hundred film festivals around the world. He has also been nominated for two Mid-America Emmy Awards.  Other directorial efforts include the recent six-part documentary series on Kansas City's Children's Mercy Hospital titled "Inside Pediatrics", which was narrated by Paul Rudd.  We plan to shoot this short film in April 2015 and promote it at film festivals.  Any help will be much appreciated. THANK YOU!!!

story:
Alex and I (Michael Emmer) met at an indie filmmaker's meetup last October. He came to me with this idea for a webcast featuring entrepreneur's throughout the state of New Jersey. I immediately offered to produce it for him. 

Many people are dissatisfied with their quality of life after graduating from school. They are saddled with a low-paying job and student loans. They give up on their dreams. Young and Thriving will teach viewers what is possible.

We are looking to raise $1,700 to purchase the IKAN IFB-576 light kit. Our stretch goal (if we exceed $1,700 and the indiegogo fee) is to purchase a lavalier microphone or two. These microphones will record better sound than the camera microphone.

Donors who contribute enough will be given a Young and Thriving t-shirt and/or poster. We will record an episode with those who contribute $150 wherein they explain why they chose to donate. 


Alexander Matos is a young entrepreneur with a growing business in Multilevel Marketing whose dream is to coach 100 million people to Financial Success and Fortitude. Yet it is his passion for creating opportunity for others that makes Young and Thriving possible. In his words:

"You see, I learned in leadership a long time ago that people are generally an average of what they see the most. And for most of us, what we consistently observe has a lot to with chance. Factors like where we were born, who are friends are, what we believe and what we do is largely based on luck. If we never learn that we can change or grow then we become stuck in this unintentional prison, but thanks to the invention of books and now the internet we have the power to truly and freely choose what we see and how we grow or become the average of. So Young and Thriving is seeking to move the entire average up, and who better to help do that than young brilliant forward thinking entrepreneurs."

Michael Emmer recently graduated from Temple University where he studied Film & Media Arts, He has acted as producer, writer, and director on many short films. In 2013 he produced the short documentary "The Little Things in Life" about mini horse therapy, and is the director of the 48 hour film festival entry "This One Goes Out To".

Michael is always looking for new opportunities in the world of media production. He is eager to learn, and jumps at every chance to learn a new skill. 

Above is Earlene Cruz, the founder of Kitchen Connection. Earlene is one of the young entrepreneurs who we will feature on Young & Thriving. Her app Kitchen Connection connects people around the world to share recipes, cooking techniques, or experiment. A portion of the Kitchen Connection profits will be donated to feeding the hungry. If you want to hear Earlene's story then donate today!

story:
Hello!

We need your help! Our friend Doug Milton is locked up in the cover photo of his own Facebook page. According to Facebook he must acquire one million likes in order to escape!

We are making a short film called ‘Like’ to spread the word on Doug's story as he faces the harsh consequences of being consumed in his own world and his journey to find out what is truly important in life. Help us raise awareness for his case by donating a like or contributing to the fundraising for our project. 

Logline:
''A man obsessed with posting on his Facebook account suddenly finds himself metaphysically locked up in the cover photo of his Facebook page and must acquire one million likes in order to escape back to the real world.''

It is a live-action comedy film, but in all seriousness we need financiers to make this project a success.

100% of the money that we raise will go towards this production.

We want this to be the best film it can be, so we need your contribution to help us fund our budget. Much like Tom Hanks was stuck on an island in Cast Away, and Jim Carey in the Truman Show ...it's time to help Doug Milton escape!

Where do we need help?

- Rent locations where we can shoot

- Purchase wardrobe and props for the cast

- Building our unique sets

- Obtain film permits

- Rent camera equipment

- Insurance

- Rent a U-Haul truck

- Feed the cast and crew delicious, hot meals in exchange for them donating their time and working so hard on this film

100% of the money that we raise will go towards this production. Unless we can get Morgan Freeman to be the voice-over of Facebook. In that case all the money goes to Morgan Freeman. 

Do you like the concept and want to help us and Doug out? Please select on of the perks on the right side or donate an amount of your own choice. You're awesome!

News and updates
Want to help Doug raise 1 million likes or want to know more about this project? Click here: https://www.facebook.com/liketheshortfilm


Our Amazing Team!

Hidde, born and raised in The Netherlands, won video contests for Adidas, Heineken, and Junami over the past years. Besides this he received the VSB art- scholarship. He studied Media and Entertainment Management (Stenden University) and Directing Film and Television (UCLA). Hidde likes the smell of matches and the 'ping!' sound of an old school typewriter.

Jeremy is an Emmy award-winning cinematographer based in Los Angeles. ​He has been formally trained in film and digital formats, while continuing to explore new technologies and forms of capture. Jeremy likes playing the trombone. 

Hailing from Australia, Tewell began his adventures in the audio world as a live sound engineer working with bands through Australia and Europe, then slowly transitioned into film sound design. Upon moving to the US, he began creating stories and having fun putting pieces of the film puzzle together. Tewell likes red M&M's.

Randy is a Producer with a BA in Film Production with an emphasis in Cinematography in which he received CSU Northridge. Over the past years his work has been screened at festivals and received many awards and honorable mentions. Randy likes any day that his favorite sports team wins.

Michael has studied at UCI for theater and film and has produced several short films such as,  "See You in Five" and web series like "Backlit." Michael likes speaking in a fake Nixon accent.

Auriel Jimenez is Co-founder and a Producer at Los Productions, Inc. based in Los Angeles. She works on and produces feature films, shorts and documentaries. 
Auriel enjoys "pranking" cast members on set and guarantees a few good outtakes.
IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5118396/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1 

Saul, born and raised in Mexico, has studied Entertainment all over the world.
From the Erasmus University in Rotterdam to UCLA in Los Angeles. Producing movies is his passion. Saul likes to walkie-talkie in the rain. 

Itai Forman was born and raised in Israel. He moved to Los Angeles about 6 years ago, after finishing his military service. In the last two years, Itai has worked on a number of films, varying in different aspects, from cinematography to producing. Upon finding passion in Assistant Directing, Itai has developed skills in scheduling, running sets, assessing production issues, and finding creative solutions. Itai likes to eat Oreo cookies and pizza even though it's bad for him.

Megan has grown up immersed in a creative life; she started on stage herself singing, acting, and dancing. She graduated from Wagner College with a degree in Theater and Speech. There Megan studied every aspect of theater she possibly could. Megan likes long road trips with the windows down and the music loud.

Meghan works in various creative fields such as set design, interior design, graphic design, and lighting design. All of her work contributes to her love of the built environment and how we use the space we inhabit.  She is a dedicated to the built environment and committed to good and responsible design. She likes painting and sculpting, driving in Los Angeles traffic, and receiving things in the mail. 

Stephanie is a well known creative in the entertainment industry. From Fashion Design to Set Design and everything in between. You can find her teaching pre-school, at a vintage rack, or in a tattoo chair. Stephanie likes to make a set come alive.

Thi is a sound mixer graduated from Cal State of Northridge.  He is an experienced production sound mixer and post production sound engineer.  Aside from sound mixing, Thi Dinh is also an entertainer who appears regularly at restaurants and private night clubs. Thi likes his phone; he probably cannot live without it.

Jeroen made kids fly, launched starships into outer space, filled Barcelona's sky with paper planes and drew lightsabers on Rembrandt's 'Nightwatch'. All of that for various music videos, commercials, comedy theatre productions and TV-shows on Dutch national television. Currently Jeroen is working on his first children's book. Jeroen likes that.

Romain is a film composer from France and studied film scoring at UCLA. He has dreamed to write music for movies since he saw E.T. for the first time, way before even learning to walk. Romain likes to wear his Sherlock Holmes suit when he listens to John Williams' music. 

Solo is a versatile musician. A Film Composer /Pianist / Audio Engineer from Taiwan. He scored many TV series/ short films/ and commercial musics, and will start to score his first feature film in 2015. Currently, Solo is building his music career, producing instrumental fusion jazz album,and playing in the Christian rock band. Solo likes to make Hans Zimmer's coffee.

...and we have a lot of awesome advisers who contribute to this project! Would you like to join the team? Send your ideas to: liketheshortfilm@gmail.com 

Inspiration

We're inspired by the films: 'Grand Budapest Hotel', 'Amélie', 'It's A Wonderful Life'. ...and point and click video games. We hope to give the viewers a unique experience by letting them explore the world of Facebook together with Doug.

'Amélie':


Example of a 'point and click' game:

We want to turn the digital world into a tangible environment. This abstract film brings to life the world of Facebook, including an actual mailbox instead of a cyber mailbox, a real notification boy who brings the messages, and a maid who cleans the spam.

‘’This is an intriguing comedy short script that benefits from a timely and original premise and some wildly creative visuals such as the blue man maintenance team and the montage of Facebook updates in which protagonist Doug experiences his friends’ Facebook updates while trapped in a strange space. ’’
(ScreenCraft Comedy Script Competition)

WE NEED YOUR HELP!
Our goal is to make the best possible film, so we are asking for your contribution to help us fund our budget. Please check the perks on the right side of this page. The team of ‘Like’ thanks you in advance for any contributions and help for the campaign to #freeDoug. 

*Donations are tax deductible.

Don't have a Paypal account or a Credit Card? Or any other questions? E-mail us here: liketheshortfilm@gmail.com

Do you want to help in a different way? Please donate a LIKE to our Facebook page or let us know what your skills are. We're looking forward to hear from you!

https://www.facebook.com/liketheshortfilm 

You’re already our friend, thank you for helping us out!

Like is a SAG-AFTRA production.

story:
What Would The Future Be Like If Drugs Were Legal? 

In the not so distant future, the Reagan era war on drugs is considered a failure, and prohibition has ended. Recreational drugs are socially accepted and commercialized. 

Four friends, Adrian, Supplies, Advice and Stomach, are planning to attend the week-long Retrosonic electronic music festival. Jaded by the access to legal substances, Supplies, a modern day Timothy Leary, has cooked up an experimental batch of a new drug and is using himself and his friends as willing guinea pigs. The group risks their relationships and sanity to create the perfect drug.

Before It All Went Down The Drain

Where Belushi's Toilet Started

Hi, I’m Andrew Wright, the Director and Writer of Belushi’s Toilet.

The story behind this project begins back in the UK in the early 90s. I ran an independent record label, producing techno and drum and bass, and the rave scene was my life.

When I eventually got a real job, I still looked back on this time with great nostalgia and started thinking about the next venture I could take that could recapture that era. 

What Belushi's Toilet is About

I spent 13 years, on and off, writing a script, based on mine and other friends' experiences, but set in the future. I wanted to explore the question of what would society be like if drugs were legal? Would civilization collapse, or would we just adapt to a new normal? I also wanted characters going to 90s and 2000s nostalgia music events, like we currently go to 70s and 80s nights. So the concept is kind of of future-retro.

Since I moved to Toronto, I’ve been able to tap into the great indie filmmaking scene here and assembled an amazing cast and crew. Now Belushi’s Toilet is a web-series. We've launched episodes 1 and 2, and are in production of episodes 3 and 4. 

See What We've Done So Far - Episode 1 & 2


We Need Your Help to Finish the Project

So far our completed episodes have been fuelled by self-funding and favours from friends. We need your help to finish Belushi's Toilet. 

How Your Backing Will Make a Difference

The funds raised will be used to cover production costs and to accelerate production timelines, including:

  • Recreating rave scenes you'll wish you were at;
  • Improving CGI for crazier hallucinations sequences;
  • More old skool rave, house, trance, drum & bass, synthwave and chiptune tracks that will take you back; and 
  • All of the other necessary stuff to make a film, like props, set construction, equipment and costume rentals.

So, if you're a libertarian, if you’re an old raver, a hippy, a chemist, or if you just enjoy being really confused, please help us get this project completed.

For our international friends please click here for international currency conversion.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than backing our production you can help by:
  • Telling us your stories and opinions on the legalization of drugs in the comments section of Indiegogo;
  • Following us on Twitter, liking us on Facebook, subscribing to our YouTube channel; and 
  • Watching and sharing our episodes 1, 2, and our trailer on YouTube.
Who's Involved

Mark Nocent (playing Adrian Carter)

Mark is a Toronto based actor. He graduated with honours from Humber College's Acting For Film and Television program in the spring of 2013 and has been auditioning ever since. Notable roles as Ash in Evil Dead: The Musical, The #likeacaptain Commercial for Captain Morgan, among others. He is currently on tour in the Fringe Festival with the show Mars and is always looking for more work!

Emmanuel Correia (playing Mason “Supplies” Sargosta)

Emmanuel is a Montreal-born actor who graduated from Dawson College's professional theatre program. He studied Improv at Theatre ste Catherine for two years. His most recent appearance on stage was as Hamlet in Bard in the Park, before appearing as Iago in Othello. He also starred in Raise the Stakes Theatre's production of True West as Austin and subsequently their production of Salt Water Moon as Jacob Mercer.

Hayden Finkelshtain (playing Hyman “Stomach” Katzenelnbogen)

Hayden is currently in his fourth year of studies at Ryerson University's Acting Conservatory. In the last three years alone, he has done work in theatre, film, and voice over for animation and musical demos. Some notable roles include: Christopher in Genesis and Other Stories (presented at the Toronto Fringe Festival 2013 with Aim For The Tangent), Eulipedes in The Birds (presented in Hydra, Greece at the Hydrama Arts Centre with the Ryerson Theatre School) and Baron Hardup in Cinderella (performed with Ryerson).

Alex Frankson (playing Raul "Advice" Alvarez)

Alex is a Toronto actor with a theatre degree from the University of Victoria.  Some recent film credits include the parody music video Mother Russia, the feature film The Long Night from Canterbury Productions and Religious Tinder from Dancing with the Devil Productions.  He has had a tremendous time working with the Belushi's Toilet cast and crew and looks forward to its continuation!

Andrew Wright (Writer, Director, Editor)

Andrew started out as a record label owner, writer and producer of techno and drum & bass music in his home country of the United Kingdom in the early 1990s. After a string of successful releases as The Moog and with Justice & Mercy, but hindered by the UK recession, Andrew moved to a career in I.T. As a background hobby, he worked on a feature length screenplay, based on his experiences on the UK rave scene, but set in a not-too-distant future.

With Music From

Slipmatt

The ‘Godfather Of Rave’ is a name he has worked very hard for nearly three decades to earn, and earn it he most definitely has. As rave was exploding in a majorly successful way, so was Slipmatt, with bookings for such organisations as Perception, Vision, Fantazia, Universe, World Dance, United Dance, Dreamscape, Helter Skelter, Slammin’ Vinyl, Rezurrection, Hardcore Heaven and Moondance all coming a calling.

DJ Billy Daniel Bunter

Daniel was there from the beginning of “Dance” culture. Starting his 23 year DJ journey with seminal London party Labrynth / 2000AD where he remained resident every Friday & Saturday night for 5 years until 1995, playing the ever progressing sounds of Dance Music.

...and many more oldskool rave, house, trance, synthwave and chiptune artists.

As a background hobby, he worked on a feature length screenplay, based on his experiences on the UK rave scene, but set in a not-too-distant future.
With Music From
Slipmatt

The ‘Godfather Of Rave’ is a name he has worked very hard for nearly three decades to earn, and earn it he most definitely has. As rave was exploding in a majorly successful way, so was Slipmatt, with bookings for such organisations as Perception, Vision, Fantazia, Universe, World Dance, United Dance, Dreamscape, Helter Skelter, Slammin’ Vinyl, Rezurrection, Hardcore Heaven and Moondance all coming a calling.
DJ Billy Daniel Bunter

Daniel was there from the beginning of “Dance” culture. Starting his 23 year DJ journey with seminal London party Labrynth / 2000AD where he remained resident every Friday & Saturday night for 5 years until 1995, playing the ever progressing sounds of Dance Music.
...and many more oldskool rave, house, trance, synthwave and chiptune artists.

story:
This has been a very special year for the BGSU Quidditch program as not only did the BGSU varsity team grab a World Cup 8 bid, so did our Falcon Warriors JV team. Under the direction of Daniel Daugherty and Samuel "Sunshine" Roitblat, the program has taken a huge step forward this season and is in need of some help from our generous fans. To save on costs, the team has decided taking a Lakefront Lines charter bus to Rock Hill, SC for World Cup 8, will be the best financial decision in order to get every one of our players safely and efficiently to WC. The bus alone will cost the program about $5000 and the executive board has been working non-stop to raise as much as possible to make this years trip free for every member of our program, just like last year.

BGSU quidditch will be 5 years old this coming fall and in just 5 short years, we have gone from a small 15 person team to a program that consists of 45 athletes who train almost every day either at the gym or on the pitch. These athletes have worked their hardest this year to have the chance to be at World Cup 8 with the best US teams in every region.

To thank you for your donations, we have listed many perks that you can choose from! We want to get you your perk as fast as possible! Take note: there are a few perks that will be sent out after World Cup.

story:
What is the film about?

Desert Mirage is a feature-length live-action/animation hybrid in the vein of Who Framed Roger Rabbit and Cool World. Aspiring cartoonist and middle-aged gumbuster Cliff Morelli (Jeremy Koerner) spends his days at the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk performing minimum wage janitorial duties. When he is put on suspension after harassing a teenager and his parents threaten to throw him out of the house, Cliff decides to actively pursue his lifelong animation dreams by reconnecting with his rich brother Jack. But when Cliff finds himself at the mercy of the animated characters he created as a child, they band together and form a devilish plan to exact revenge on all those that have wronged him.

Why make a 2D animated film?

In a day and age where 3D CGI-animated features have become the norm, there is something to be said for the art of hand-drawn art. Independent animation usually relies on cut-outs or computer-generated in-betweening, making its visuals cheap and robotic. As die-hard fans of the Golden Age of animation, we are taking the approach of Warner Bros. and MGM cartoons of the 40s and 50s: irreverent characters in full, fluid animation. Inspired by the wild works of Tex Avery, Chuck Jones and Bob Clampett, our approach to Desert Mirage is to make something in the same spirit without any of the early Hollywood restrictions the old masters were forced to deal with.  

What is Wild Dogs Productions?

Wild Dogs Productions is an independent film company run by writer/producer/director Michael Fredianelli. Having experimented in a wide range of genres, their goal remains the same: to deliver daring, controversial films outside the mainstream. With over a dozen titles in their catalog including The Minstrel Killer, Apocrypha and The Scarlet Worm, their films have played numerous festivals, garnered excellent reviews, collected audience awards and have received domestic and international video distribution.

What will we do with the money?

There is well over an hour’s worth of animation in Desert Mirage’s 90+ minute running time. With approximately 70% of the rough animation already completed, the funds will go towards additional animation, in-betweening, clean-up, and digital ink and painting. Traditional, fluid animation is a very time-consuming and expensive process and our current goal is the bare minimum to complete our feature film this year.

The Team

Michael Fredianelli (Writer/Director)

From a very young age, Michael has always had a passion for visual storytelling. Without any formal training or schooling, he formed his own production company, Wild Dogs Productions in 2004 and has since written, produced and directed 17 feature films and over 25 shorts in a variety of genres. Over the years, his work has reached a large number of local film festivals in addition to an international audience.

Chad Kaplan (Animation Director)

Born and raised in New England, Chad Kaplan is a 2D artist and animator who has worked on a variety of short films in addition to several features. While initially self-taught, Kaplan chose art and animation as something to seriously pursue as a young adult. He graduated cum laude from Emerson College in 2012 where he majored in animation and motion media. In addition, he received further education at Rhode Island School of Design where he developed more skills in the medium.


 Jeremy Koerner (Actor/Voice Actor)

The multi-talented Jeremy Koerner has always had a passion in performing, creating his own Mysteries for Hire company and starring in dozens of shorts and feature-length films. With a natural screen presence and a specialty in improvisation and physical comedy, he is the perfect choice to play the lead in Desert Mirage in addition to voicing many of the cartoon characters.

The Animators and Supporting Actors

We have a very capable team of animators, clean-up artists, inkers and background painters including Francis Tan, Brian Royer, Josh Cianciulli, Bill Tiller, Arika Dion, James Tully, Steven Guardado, Lace Lancaster, Moises Mercado, Chris Lines, Jon Caron and many others.

Rounding out the live-action cast includes the talents of John S. Boles, George S. Gemette, Sheilah Morrison, Melinda Torgersen, Tabbitha McBride, Morgan Finley King, Brandon Peterson and Tyler Torgersen.

story:
About Ashley

I am a senior cinema production student at Ithaca this semester and am using my cumulative experience and skills to make my thesis. I've worked on various student films in every role imaginable and have created a few of my own already. This project is a test of my skill as not only a director but as a director of photography. This film relies on heavy visual storytelling and no dialogue to reach the desired outcome. Last semester I learned a lot about the film world outside of production through my internship at Raindance Film Festival  in London and am using those skills to create the best possible film I can to submit to places like Raindance. I'm also heading to Los Angeles next semester to finish my college career and I'm excited to have a strong film to back me up as I dip my feet in the water there.

Check out my LinkedIn at
www.linkedin.com/pub/ashley-kristoff/60/37a/b/en

Short Summary

This film is about an unnamed girl who recently has lost a loved on in her life, Audrey. This girl turns to vices such as alcohol and smoking to cope with the pain of that loss, grieving for weeks in such a manner until she sees pictures of herself and Audrey, motivating her to start picking up the pieces of her life. Through this process she finds old art supplies and uses them as a means of recovery from this grief with the ultimate result of her getting back on her feet, even if not fully recovered.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds for a variety of reasons:

  • Props
  • Set Dressings
  • Gas
  • Food
  • Distribution (for festivals)
You will get one of the various perks on the side!

The Impact

My goal is to express through this film the theme of loss, something universal, that it does happen to everyone. I want to reveal a way to cope with loss using the outlets that make you unique. This film is important because a key component is that there is no dialogue in the film, only visual symbolism. This means that it can reach a worldwide audience who actively feel loss and potentially help people cope with the loss in their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and attend the screening at Ithaca College in May!

story:
Summary

My name is Joanna Triebel and I am a senior Film student at Baylor University. I moved to Waco in 2011 to leave a life of drugs, alcohol, and abusive relationships and start a new life of letting Jesus love me. I am pursuing my dream of becoming a screenwriter and director, armed with a message of hope for all people.

Based on a true story, this film is important to me because I know many women can relate to it, and I believe these women need to know that someone else sees their pain and understands. I want women living any kind of lifestyle to see this film and feel validated and encouraged to speak up and not give up.


What We Need

$600.00 will cover:
Gas, Food, & Equipment
Wardrobe, Props, Set Dressing, & Make-up
Distribution & Entry Fees for Film Festivals

*Any money we get above the $600 will allow for additional Festival entries.*


Other Ways You Can Help

One of the BEST ways you can help is to SPREAD THE WORD! We want as many people as possible to be on board with our project, not just so we get funded, but so that our film can reach many people. 

This film may not look like the most uplifting, inspiring stories ever told, but it is a story that NEEDS to be told. So please help us tell it!

story:
The Story:

“Hey, aren’t you that girl whose mother has green hair and comes to school with her?”

Imagine hearing that over and over at the age of sixteen. Imagine knowing that it was true. Imagine the daily humiliation being the least of your troubles.

I don’t have to imagine it. I lived it.

I was a junior in high school at the onset of my mother’s psychosis. I watched in helpless horror as she transformed from a cheerful, caring woman into a vicious, violent monster. For many months I waited – waited for someone to help me, to help her, to help us.

The help never came.

I was seventeen when I finally fled cross-country. I spent months living alone on the streets of Berkeley, gathering bottles and cans I could trade in for food. It was still easier to bear than the unpredictable terror of life with my mother.

In May of 2013, I found her obituary online. She had died, six years before, in 2007.

This is how my memoir was born. I wrote On Hearing of My Mother’s Death Six Years After It Happened: A Daughter’s Memoir of Mental Illness in order to commemorate my experience of my mother’s illness.

I had never wanted to tell our story before. Part of me was afraid that she would find it and then find me. Yes, more than two decades later, I was still scared. But once she was gone, I felt it was time. Someone has to tell these kinds of stories.

It wasn’t my mother’s fault, what happened to her. She was sick, and I knew it. But knowing that makes it no better. In some ways, it’s worse. A physically sick person gets help. A mentally ill one may not.

There’s a lot of concern today about the stigma surrounding mental illness. Although attitudes are gradually changing, very few people want to admit that they’re hurt or in pain. They’re afraid of being accused of being lazy or pathetic or simply insane. After my experience, I can’t say that I blame them. I wouldn’t want to tell, either. It’s bad enough having to confess that you have a close relative with such a condition. I can’t imagine being the person suffering from the disease.

And this, at its heart, is the driving force behind stories like mine. No one is talking, and even fewer are listening. No one wants to confess that they have a problem, and no one knows how to react if they do. It’s suffering in damning, damaging silence. Because stories like mine and my mother’s are not going to end until we begin telling them.

The Campaign:

My goal in this campaign is to put my story in front of the next generation.

I want to bring my book into classrooms, at the high school and college levels, to present my story as a raw and painful example of how devastating an untreated mental illness can be. I want college psychology students to read it, to get an understanding not just of my mother’s illness, but of the effect that it had on the development of the child in her care. I want to discuss it in high schools, where even now there may be students in similar situations – or those who, perhaps, are suffering themselves, and might benefit from learning what can happen if a person doesn’t seek help.

No one can go back and fix what happened to me or my mother. But it doesn’t have to happen the way that it did, over and over, to parent after parent, and kid after kid. There’s still time for the youth of today. I want to see them talking about things that my generation kept quiet, and my mother’s generation hushed up all together. They don’t have to repeat our mistakes – they only need us to give them the tools with which to understand how and why we went wrong.

The time is ripe; people are ready to listen. All we have to do is tell them – what we need to tell, and what they need to hear.

The Plan:

The first step is to mail copies of my book to teachers and professors in my local area (San Francisco – East Bay) and inquire whether they might be interested in using it in their curricula. I believe that sending out physical copies attracts more attention than an email or letter, and it gives the recipient a chance to examine my story as well as my writing. I will include a request that the book be donated to the institution’s library if the recipient elects not to use it, which will have a similar, if smaller, effect in sharing my story.

If I obtain a sufficient number of positive responses, I would like to expand this program to other areas of California, and eventually, across the whole country. However, I prefer to begin in the Bay Area because it will give me the opportunity to make personal appearances – to meet with students and answer their questions, which I think would be a very valuable additional benefit.

The funding I am seeking, less Indiegogo’s fees and the estimated costs of perks, will cover the expense of printing and shipping about eighty books.

The Perks:

I can make the following perks available to contributors at the following levels:

$10 – Contributors at the $10 level will receive an autographed paperback copy of my memoir On Hearing of My Mother’s Death Six Years After It Happened. I can ship to both the U.S. and Canada at no additional expense. Both standard and large print sizes are available.

$20 – Contributors at the $25 level will receive an autographed paperback copy of my memoir On Hearing of My Mother’s Death Six Years After It Happened as well as an autographed paperback copy of my autobiographical short story and essay collection Stories from My Memory-Shelf: Fiction and Essays from My Past.

$70 - Contributors at the $70 level will receive ten autographed paperback copies of On Hearing of My Mother's Death Six Years After It Happened. Includes media mail shipping within the U.S. Both standard and large print sizes are eligible for this offer.

$100 – Contributors donating $100 or more will be given the opportunity of having me meet with their students, book club, or other group in order to discuss my memoir and answer any questions about it or my mother’s mental illness. I will be happy to do this in person if you are in the San Francisco Bay Area; otherwise, we could arrange a live interview via Skype or similar technology.

I have a host of other "perks" options available, including discounted bulk orders of my book as well as extended-distance personal appearances; please see the full list of perks at right for details.

Like My Project But Unable to Fund It?

If you’re unable to contribute at this time, you can still help to fund my campaign by spreading the word! Indiegogo has lots of social sharing tools, and, of course, you are welcome to contact me directly at lorilschafer(at)outlook(dot)com or on Twitter @LoriLSchafer. You can learn more about me and my book on my website at http://lorilschafer.com/on-hearing-of-my-mothers-death-six-years-after-it-happened-memoir/ or on Amazon at http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N0WYHDQ/.

Thank You!

I appreciate you taking the time to listen to my story and learn about my campaign.

or on Amazon at http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N0WYHDQ/.
Thank
You!
I appreciate you taking the time to
listen to my story and learn about my campaign.

story:
A MidKnight Pictures Production

Where Does the Maiden Lie?

Four people, linked by fate and haunted by their past, are drawn to a mysterious encounter with the Maiden, a mystical, angelic yet tragic personification of their sins.

She offers them the chance to redeem their tortured souls, but first they must survive a horrific ordeal that forces each of them to relive the worst traumas from their past.

Introduction

The first feature film from MidKnight Pictures, “Where Does the Maiden Lie?” is a psychological horror film inspired by many horror classics such as The Exorcist, Seven and The Ring.

We here at MidKnight Pictures are movie lovers and our goal is to create original, thrilling, compelling films that are committed to good, old-fashioned storytelling. So many films these days are made behind the closed doors and locked gates of studios and production companies. With the exception of the occasional set photo, the general public knows next to nothing about the movie or the people making it until they’re shelling out money at the theater to see it.

MidKnight Pictures is not that kind of Production Company. Not that we don’t plan on making money, but we understand the principle that a film’s success will be determined not by the stars, budget or effects, but by the connection it creates with the audience. With that in mind, we’re making a concerted effort to bring you into the film as much as possible, and we don’t just mean making an awesome movie that you’re going to love. We mean putting you right on set with us as we actually make the movie! There will be live production blogs, interactive web chats from the cast and more behind the scenes cameras than you’ll find on the next (insert generic superhero movie title) set. We’re giving you an all access look into how a professional feature film gets made, and trust us when we say, you’re going to be glued to your screen every step of the way.

We love movies, we have fun making them and we want to share that experience with you. In addition to all of our tremendous perks, a donation to our campaign establishes you as part of the MidKnight Pictures social media community so you can comment, like and share your thoughts and experiences as we create this film. So please, get involved, reach out to the cast and crew on social media and stay tuned for all the exciting updates we have in store for you!

story:
A CRIME STOPPERS INTERNATIONAL (CSI) CAMPAIGN

This appeal is being undertaken by Crime Stoppers International  (www.csiworld.org) in order to raise funds to embark on a project to help stop the trafficking of human beings. Through this project CSI is seeking to enhance its capability to acquire intelligence anonymously from the global community which law enforcement can use to dismantle criminal networks, and arrest the perpetrators of this heinous crime.

WHY WE ARE RAISING MONEY

Human Trafficking is the third largest international crime industry (behind illegal drugs and arms trafficking). It reportedly generates a profit of $32 billion every year. Of that, $15.5 billion is made in industrialized countries.

There are approximately 20 to 30 million slaves in the world today and according to the U.S. State Department, 600,000 to 800,000 people are trafficked across international borders every year.

More than 70% are female and half are children. 80% of these victims are used for sexual exploitation, and 19% are subject to labor exploitation.

Crime Stoppers International intends to partner with a leading international media agency and our law enforcement partners to embark on a global project with a view to obtain intelligence on criminal networks and perpetrators who are involved in modern day slavery.

Once this intelligence is received it will be relayed to the relevant law enforcement agencies to assist them with their investigations which would hopefully lead to arrests being made and the freedom of victims who are enslaved.

HOW YOUR FUNDING WILL BE USED

To help us acquire the initial capital outlay required to build a new intelligent driven information management software. This application will possess a user friendly interface with latest generation data capture & data mining functionalities which will enhance our capability to obtain intelligence on the perpetrators of human trafficking and the whereabouts of victims from users anywhere around the world.

WHO WE ARE

Crime Stoppers International (CSI) is a global, not-for-profit organization that offers an anonymous and confidential mechanism to the public to provide intelligence on crimes which have occurred or crime that are being planned without having any fear of retribution.

Our mission is “to mobilize the world to report crime anonymously”.

Crime Stoppers programs operate in 26 countries around the world with 1,200 such programs directly serving over 500 million people at national, local and community levels. Each of these national and local programs provide the communities which they serve some with some form of mechanism to report crime anonymously whether it be via a toll free number, online via a website, texting or mobile app. Once intelligence is received by the local or national Crime Stoppers program, it is relayed to the relevant local or national law enforcement agency for action to be taken.

Since the creation of Crime Stoppers 38 years ago, our local and national programs around the world have cumulatively been responsible for providing to law enforcement which has led to one million offenders being arrested and over US$10 billion worth of illicit drugs being seized. In fact, statistics indicate that every 14 secs a crime is solved somewhere in the world as a result of intelligence received by a Crime Stoppers program. This information clearly demonstrates the power and success of anonymous reporting.

As Crime Stoppers has become an invaluable intelligence gathering mechanism to law enforcement, the organization maintains a co-operation agreement with INTERPOL which has been effective since October 2010.  Through this agreement, we have participated in several global interventions to address transnational crime particularly in the area of fugitives through Operation INFRA-RED and INFRA-TERRA (which is currently ongoing).

HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT OUR EFFORTS

This heinous crime has no borders, and because of this, a global response is required. Crime Stoppers International intends to empower the international community to report whatever they know about the perpetrators of this crime or the whereabouts of victims, by providing intelligence in a confidential and anonymous manner.

By donating to this appeal, you will be helping to put an end to modern day slavery.

By supporting Crime Stoppers International and letting others know about the work that we do, you will be helping to keep your communities safe whilst contributing to global security.

story:
NEW PERKS!!! - (as of April 23rd)


Two additional perks have been added to the campaign:

$30 Perk - Seesix T-Shirt
This perk gets a ringer style T-shirt, featuring Blue Shift's beautiful ever-stalwart android Seesix. 

$40 Perk - Blue Shift: The Card Game
For tabletop game enthusiasts, a dice and card game based on Blue Shift has been in development for some time now. This perk is an early Alpha Edition of the Blue Shift card game that will be for sale online later this year. This game has already been through some play testing and is quite fun if you enjoy tabletop games.

...and of course, both perks include the 'Social Media Shoutout' perk.

---

WHAT IS THIS FILM ABOUT?

'Blue Shift' is a short film based on the story found in a science fiction novella named 'Blue Shift: A Starfall Chronicle' released earlier this year. The story focuses on Commander Shen, a formidable elite alien law officer, who is also something of a short-sighted hot-head. When tasked with the mission of recapturing a deep space prison ship that has been hijacked by it's own prisoners, Shen’s impulsive cowboy-like actions give multiple alien convicts the chance they need to escape to a little blue planet called Earth. Now these very dangerous extraterrestrial fugitives are running around on our world, doing God knows what to whoever they please, and no one can stop them, other than Shen, his attractive android partner Seesix and a mysterious man in black known only as Mr. McGrath.


The source material is a 115 page novella, and we're shooting for roughly a half hour adaptation that can be distributed as an independent film, while serving as a TV pilot or proof-of-concept for a larger production.


WHAT'S GOING ON WITH THE FILM NOW?

The film is currently in mid-production with all of the characters and environments created and ready to go. Several of the characters have already been cast and voiced, and as one can see by watching the trailer, some notable animation and visual effects work has already been done.

We're very proud of what has been created so far, and with your help, we're extremely sure that 'Blue Shift' will be very cool once it's complete.


WHAT IS NEEDED...

While all of the principle artwork is done and most of the characters have been voiced, there are still a lot of animation and visual effects work to be done, and there are still a couple of important character voices who have not been cast yet. Also, over the past two years, one person has basically been doing over 90% of all the animation and VFX work on this production... and he really could use a professional hand or two.

Plus, the technical side of this production has gotten very far, mostly with inexpensive and out-of-date software, as well as a pair of computers that aren't completely ideal for rendering a lot of CGI footage. To finish this show, investing in at least a few higher-end tools is a definite must.


WILL I CRINGE WHEN I LOOK AT THIS THING?

Unlikely... The guy in charge of this production is a trained animation and visual effects professional that has worked for years on numerous live action and animated productions, including Spongebob Squarepants: Sponge Out of Water and several Marvel Cinematic Universe films, such as Thor, Captain America, and The Avengers.

Plus, a lot of time and work have gone into putting together an appealing and consistent aesthetic, vibe and overall atmosphere for the story to take place within.


WHO'S INVOLVED WITH THIS PRODUCTION?

A fun and interesting group of talented people have been assembled to make this production including, but not limited to:

Ace Gibson

Ace Gibson is a multi-talented a New York born actor who has appeared in numerous productions, including notable TV shows like 'The Mentalist', 'Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles', and 'Key and Peele'.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2192245/
http://acegibson.com/


Redd Horrocks

Redd is a professional Voice Actress from England. She currently resides in the United States. For several years, Redd Horrocks has lent her voice to documentaries, phone systems, commercials, demo videos, rock albums, audio books, app previews and many other projects. Her accent can swing from proper English to Southern Belle to standard American, as well as many characters in between.

http://www.reddhorrocks.com/


Ed Mace

Ed Mace is an extremely talented and versatile performer with over 30 years of voice acting experience in animation, video games, and advertising.

http://edmace.com/
https://www.linkedin.com/in/edmacevoiceovers 
https://www.voices.com/people/edmace


Julianna Barninger

Julianna Barninger is an actress who has appeared in numerous independent films, as well as well known TV shows such as '1000 Ways to Die', 'Scandal', and 'Rizzoli & Isles'. In 'Blue Shift' Julianna uses her performance skills for both character voice work and 3d motion capture.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3000577/


Ashley Eddy

Ashley Eddy is an up-and-coming actress who's voice has been in animations, radio plays, anime and video games.

http://ameangelofsin.weebly.com/


River Kanoff

River Kanoff has been voice acting in numerous video games and several other productions since 2006. He currently heads a small but growing group of talented voices, writers and artists called "SolidStudios."

http://www.riverkanoff.com/


Joona Lätti

Joona Lätti is a young and talented pianist from Finland. He is also a self-taught composer and has provided some great music for 'Blue Shift'.

http://www.joonalatti.com


Chris P. O'Connell

Chris P. “Coco” O'Connell is the director and main animator on 'Blue Shift'. He is also the author of the book that shares the same title and story. Chris is a digital artist, entrepreneur and former educator with many years of diversified training and experience in many different artistic disciplines, such as animation, multimedia design, indie game design, graphic design, and motion picture visual effects.

http://www.chrisoconnell.net/
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2755394/
http://www.linkedin.com/in/chrisoconnell


RISKS AND CHALLENEGES 

Every project has a certain amount of risk when you decide to lend your support. However, the people involved with this production have a long list of credits on diverse and interesting projects, and we plan to deliver a fun and exciting animated product. As stated above, we're very proud of what has been created so far, and with your help, we're extremely sure that 'Blue Shift: The Animation' will be very cool once it's complete!

...besides, could you really say no to this puppy? :)

story:
PATRICK ASKIN as NICK

The movie will be marketed as a mainstream comedy featuring a lovable and witty couple that happens to be GAY. The current goal is to raise enough funds($25,000) to finance the filming of the climactic wedding scene this FALL  at the magnificent VANDERBILT MUSEUM  pictured below

We have already filmed several scenes in such spectacular locations such as The Hamptons, Palm Beach and The KING COLE BAR at The St Regis Hotel(see scenes in the video gallery and below). The wedding scene is not only funny and romantic but will also help further the promotion of MARRIAGE EQUALITY to a mainstream audience.

                                                            IAN WHITT as NICKY
What makes NICK and NICKY unique is that it is a genre film that challenges traditional gender roles.  Sometimes the best way to sell an idea is through comedy. Hopefully,we will raise enough funds to film the entire movie. The overall budget is $250,000. The exciting cast includes actor/writer/producer  Patrick Askin, up and comers Ian Whitt and Glen North and BLADE RUNNER star SEAN YOUNG pictured below. We have assembled a very talented cast and crew and the over the top glamorous wardrobe is being done by celebrity stylist Montgomery Frazier.

              Sean Young as GLORIA

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this specific campaign is to raise enough funds to help film the climactic wedding scene this Fall.  You get all kinds of perks for helping out including the chance to BE IN THE FILM!.

                                   OPENING SCENE AT THE ST REGIS HOTEL

        The Impact

Once the wedding scene is filmed I feel very confident that it will be easier to raise funds. The timeliness of the Marriage Equality issue on a national basis should provide incentive.  The legal battle may be won but the fight to win hearts and minds continues.        

                                                    PALM BEACH SCENE


   

       

Risks & Challenges

Getting a movie made is never easy but if enough money is raised I have every confidence that "Nick and Nicky" will do very well at the box office. Several scenes have already been filmed and the wedding scene will be filmed this summer and the rest of the movie in the late Fall of 2015. The goal is to release the film in 2016. Many of the locations have been secured.


                                            NICK AND NICKY MEET THE PARENTS
story_txt:

Ever wonder "Why don't they make movies like that anymore?"  The answer: WE ARE! "NICK and NICKY" takes the witty sparkling spirit of these films and recreates it in a modern day, upscale, Gay setting.

Several scenes have already been filmed and the wedding scene will be filmed this summer and the rest of the movie in the late Fall of 2015. The goal is to release the film in 2016. Many of the locations have been secured.

                                            NICK AND NICKY MEET THE PARENTS

story:
Imagine sitting in a corner of your room, curled up on a ball, weeping, fists clinched, struggling to breathe, doing everything you can not to pull the hair out of your head. It’s a horrible experience. I’ve been there. Those were the dark days of living with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.

I’ve come a long way since then. In fact, to most people I look and act “normal.” But that is because they only see part of my life. It’s not because I hide my symptoms, but because I have learned to manage many of them. In the Fall of 2013 I was officially diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. (You can read more of my story here.) Yes, civilians suffer from PTSD.

I have given several radio interviews and written many blog posts on my journey with PTSD and the tools I use to manage my illness (therapy, EMDR, supplements, art, etc). My hope has always been that as I share my journey others will be encouraged and perhaps educated.

But I’m at a point now where I need help. And the most amazing help has been offered to me in the form of a Service Dog trained by 3K9 Working Dogs.

So much more than a family pet, although they are amazing, this service dog will give me life. He will be trained specifically to deal with the issues that impact me on a daily basis, the issues that hold me back and keep me from living the life I am created to live.

As someone who made her living as a Corporate Team Builder and Speaker, it’s devastating to live a life changed by PTSD. My life after PTSD looks very different.

• I now struggle with crowds (I can’t go to the grocery store or farmer’s market on weekends. I can’t go to a movie theater on Friday or Saturday night. I avoid restaurants except during off hours. Standing in line is a challenge, etc.)

• I struggle with hypervigilance, constantly looking around me to see who is approaching. (This too impacts my ability to be in public even interfering with my ability to walk outside.) This also means I am super sensitive to noise and sudden movements. Here is a snippet from a post I wrote titled The Unexpected Still Happens:

I explained it the best I could. “Because I am in hypervigilance mode I am hearing everything. Every laugh, every kick of the table, every book drop, every chair scooting on the floor, everything. And all this noise is constant. It’s like what you see in the movies when someone is being interrogated with sleep deprivation. They’re in a room with no sleep, extremely bright lights, and sirens blaring all the time. That’s what I feel like. It’s so bad my ears are going numb.” I don’t know if they understood, it’s hard for anyone to understand, but that was the best explanation I could give.

• I have nightmares, many I don’t remember, and some I do, often waking up in a cold sweat and panic attack.

• As you can imagine, all of these things (and more) cause a tremendous increase in anxiety.

Life with PTSD is definitely different.

The Gift of Life

Having a service dog will be an incredible gift. My service dog will be trained specifically for me and the situations in which I want to live. He will:

• Provide pressure therapy – when my anxiety starts to build, he will either place his head in my lap or his paw on me to get my attention and “ground” me, calming me down and enabling me to get to a safe state of mind.

• Interrupt panic attacks – with a special bark he will approach me and grab my attention, again grounding me and helping pull me from a panic attack.

• Interrupt nightmares – in much the same way, he will alert to my body temperature and physical responses when I sleep, interrupting nightmares before they start.

• Provide crowd control – he will be trained to maintain a specific distance from my person not allowing anyone to accidentally bump, knock, or push me.

• Be a rear facing guard – one of the issues I have in public places is people walking up behind me. My dog will, in a restaurant, for instance, sit next to me facing behind me. This way he can alert me when someone is approaching from behind,

With the help of my service dog I will again be able to build my speaking career impacting the lives of others; enjoy a trip to the grocery store or a date night with my husband; travel for both business and personal reasons; give a presentation without having to clear my schedule for days afterwards (due to ‘recovery’ time;) sleep through the night; and so much more.

Your generous support means more to me than words could ever say. I am truly blessed by your willingness to help and be a part of my journey.

Meet Truman

To see more pictures of Truman and learn his story please visit his page. 

I am also posting updates about his training at Service Dog School there too, including his first text message home!


To Learn More

To learn more about me and my life visit StephanieHester.com

For specific information on how PTSD has impacted my life visit my blog and search PTSD. Here are a few of the more popular topics:

An Open Letter to My Stalker … PTSD

PTSD: Not Just a Soldier’s Fight

PTSD and Faith

Gifts of PTSD

The Good Side of PTSD

To view my PTSD Artwork visit my website or my Pinterest board.


Funds

To view the breakdown of funds needed please go to Updates.
