story:
Short Summary

The Devil's Toy Box is a sequel to the found footage horror movie, "7 Nights of Darkness". "7 Nights of Darkness" was distributed in The United States and Canada via major cable providers' On Demand access, chain rental outlets such as Family Video, Amazon and Amazon instant video as well as chain stores such as Wal Mart. It also received foreign distribution in Germany and Japan.

While the sequel will answer questions that many had about the first movie, "The Devil's Toy Box" will also be its own stand alone movie that is not dependent on the first, bringing back many faces from the first and introducing a new cast of main characters.

What We Need & What You Get

You will notice that we are using the flex option on this project. Rest assured that no matter how much is raised, we intend to begin principal photography in July. Yes! No matter how much money we raise, this project is happening! Sure, we will need some re-writes here and there, but the current cast and crew are dedicated to getting this done.

The script that is currently written, scheduled and budgeted out would need a minimum of $45,000 to produce the way we want to be able to pull it off with a total of 13 days of shooting. We really want to step up our game from the first movie, which was made on a shoe string budget of $5,000 and principal photography lasted a total of 5 days. If we can make a feature length movie that obtained distribution with just $5,000, think of what we could do with 8 times that amount!

No matter what amount you contribute, you will get exclusive access to a link with behind the scenes pictures, footage and interviews.

The Team

We've assembled a great team of producers with many different skill sets that combines for almost a century's worth of experience working on film productions.

The Impact

Every single dollar will count here! Just think, we may only be $20 away from hiring a great make up effects supervisor, effects editor, sound mixer. The more professional people we have working, the better the product and a better chance of wider distribution.

Risks & Challenges

Let's face it, $45,000 isn't a whole lot of money to produce a feature length movie, but we have become masters of stretching every cent and making sure that money is allocated to the proper resources for the good of the project. No one will be lining their pockets with any production money, that is certain. We are doing this because we all enjoy it and want the final product to be the best it can be.

story:
Ballet Film Suite ...no.2 

My films are part of my thesis, a suite of films which combines dance with acting and which represents my individual contribution to our world community. My hope is to create compassion for those in need, giving a voice to those who have been silenced, and creating space in which they can heal and thrive.


I can't be late for ballet… a short film

This film is about a woman, Raphaela, who is still reeling from a hard life in foster care and then on the street. She loses her only experience of peace. Now she must decide whether to process that pain with dance or continue to live with the pain through self-denial and apathy.

My hope is that this film will be a form of cathartic art, that it will inspire people to choose dance or music or other forms of movement over drugs, alcohol, food or rage in trying to process pain.

I was very lucky to meet activist actor Russell Means. When he asked what I did, I said, "Nothing important — dance and acting." He told me dance and acting is an important and good career. Change in society begins with art.

With your help, this film could effect change and help people. Even if it helps just one person, it will create a trickle effect in the lives of everyone that person knows, making a difference for good.


MY PTSD

Even the most peaceful, productive, safe day can be interrupted by the slightest trigger igniting Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, PTSD. 

This film explores the feeling of the moment a trigger occurs and a person with PTSD begins to spiral.

My wish with this film is to honor those who deal with PTSD every day.


About us

Rita Alicia Marques - Choreographer, Filmmaker 

As a child, I was told that I danced like Maya Deren, one of the great avant-garde artists of the 1940s and ’50s. In graduate school when I discovered who she was, I was inspired and joyful as I began my journey combining dance and film.

My dance and acting training both derive from the Russian school of acting inspired by Harold Clurman. 

My dance training from the time I was a child has been with teachers who danced under ballet masters from Ballet Russe de Monte Carlo.

My acting training is with Jim Jarrett, the last protégé of Sanford Meisner, one of the founders of the Group Theatre.

My focus is on combining choreography, acting and filmmaking.


What We Need 

BREAKDOWN

Total: $9,500

Travel to Film Festivals: $3,000

Lodging: $700

Film Festival Workshops: $350

Film Festival Submissions: $700

Production & Publicity: $2,700

Housing: $1050

The rest will go to pay taxes and the Indiegogo fee. 

If we do not reach our goal, the money will contribute to all of the above.

If we raise more than our goal, the funds will go to completing short films that we are currently filming, in addition to publishing films that are currently in post production, detailed below.


FILMING:

The First High School Protest – about a peaceful high school protest that heads toward a violent end.

The Ugly one – about a child dealing with the effects of living with addict parents.

Georgian G. – about a woman who overcomes sexism and racism to marry her true love.

Please see trailers of films completed and in post at this link:

rita alicia marques - ballet film suite no.7 ...a short film stop

https://vimeo.com/channels/900136ritashortfilmstop


What You Get

$75 – a discount card for dance clothing.(early bird)

$500 – special custom-made t-shirt with "I can't be late for ballet" still image (limited edition).

$1,000 – a special thank you in the film credits!

$2,000 and over ... you will receive a  Producer credit!


The Impact

Judith Lewis Herman in her book, Trauma and Recovery, speaks of how an unprocessed trauma resurfaces in the brain again and again. In the book, This is Your Brain on Music, author Daniel J. Levitin says that music engages every region of the brain and nearly every neural subsystem. Researchers have discovered that endorphins from movement are natural stress fighters, so it follows that dancing ballet would be a healing activity.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Get the word out about this campaign!

Talk, twitter, post on FB, anything you can offer :)

Thank you!

We want to create a District Heat experience that no one will ever be able to forget! We want to bring you exclusive soundtracks, sexy calendars, DVDs with exclusive content, tours, special guest stars and more!

story:
What is " Pink Canoe "

Well ... you could just Google it, but let us help you out here ... Pink Canoe is an Australian based classifieds site.... but just for fun Google it anyway :)

Puts a whole new meaning into " whatever floats your boat " ...

 Our main objectives:

  • Provide an easy to navigate & easy to list advertising site.
  • We want to provide a service that everyone can afford to use.
  • Our aim is to give people a choice that is that little bit different.
  • Take some market share off of the big players like weebay and gummytree.

Pink Canoe .. we are a bit like the other sites ... only sexier!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Please help us with some funding to keep our site online.
  • Unless we reach our target our site may have to close :(
  • So as you can see we need your help!
  • Seriously we really do.
  • You can receive some great rewards and every dollar helps.

Do you love the Pink Canoe ?

  • Wear one of our T's and show your love of the Pink Canoe.
  • One for the ladies

One for the men.


And for the cooler weather ... available in 5 sizes.


The Impact
  • Very easy site to use  that everyone can afford to use.
  • And our aim is to provide a free listing service for everyone.
  • Great way to sell all of your unwanted items.
  • Iteract with other sellers and buyers.
  • Never pay for advertising costs again.
  • And that's about it folks, check it out at www.pinkcanoe.com.au

Risks & Challenges

  • Risk number one - not receiving enough pledges to keep the Pink Canoe afloat.
  • Being run out of town by those large multinationals that think they own the space.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • For those that don't wish to make a financial pledge there are still ways to help us... we need help " Spreading the Pink Canoe word " .
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools or just let some friends know about our campaign or website ... remember it's www.pinkcanoe.com.au   

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for reading and if you have something to sell, then why not make a free listing yourself at www.pinkcanoe.com.au 

Seriously though ... if we have made you smile or smirk even a little bit ... please pledge a dollar and help our cause :) :) ;) ... and thanks again for reading :)

story:
The Film

A mockumentary following a group of amateur free-runners, 'Ardcore Parkour' is a coming of age comedy about three hapless young men who dream of breaking free from sleepy suburbia and proving their worth at a competition in the big city. Along the way, Martin, Trey and Seb must scale the hurdles of teenage angst, negotiate fallouts, and contend with a distinct lack of ability. With the tragic loss of Martin's older (and more talented) brother hanging over them, can the boys defy the odds and emerge as champions in their own right?
www.facebook.com/ardcoreparkour
www.twitter.com/ardcoreparkour


Humphrey Barclay (three times BAFTA nominated former Head of Comedy at LWT/Granada, executive producer of Spaced etc.) has just read our script and said:

"Lively, contemporary and very, very funny.

 If this isn’t a hit I don’t know what is.”




The Characters


Martin Rogers

Le Parkour advice from Martin:
  • "You never know when you might see a good bin to jump over so always wear shorts."
  • "Thermal underwear isn't just for old people."
  • "Always keep smiling."
Martin's fun facts.
  • "I've read the first four  Harry potter books more than ten times each (Rowling tries to be too dark and 'edgy' in the latter ones.)"
  • "I have over two hundred railway train tickets collected from family, close friends and just people I've met at the station."

Trey (Trevor) Morley

What's you're proudest moment? 
"I once pulled a moony on the local news. They pixelated it out but you could still see I had excellent definition."
Your hottest date?
"Every single date I've had has been steamy as hell. Both of them."
Any advice for young freerunners?
"Just basically, you know, like, be yourself and stuff. Be a yes man. Take those spanish lessons you've always wanted, try a new cuisine... learn to bake. Chicks love baked goods man."
... and hone your parkour skills?
"... Yeah that too."

Sebastian Terry

What's your biggest inspiration?
"Spirituality is the governing force in my life. If you say it fast enough it sounds almost exactly like 'spirit-duality.' Powerful, isn't it? Nobody ever told me that. I just knew it, instinctively."
And instinctively contains the word 'stink.'
"You don't understand me... I think your chakras need to be cleansed. Here's a free-running haiku I wrote: 
My legs, my brushes,
The skyline my canvas,
Urban Picasso "
Further Reading: 
  •  http://www.momonaspiritualjourney.com/

Dan Meade

Dan is an emerging documentary filmmaker, known for his previous urban works: "High Art in Hoxton" and "Ghetto Grannies" both of which are currently doing the festival circuit. Dan has a deep interest in urban sports having hailed from South London and growing up around it. Over the past 10 years he's watched the spreading of parkour out of the big cities with interest. When he heard of the death of Harri Rodgers (a prize winning traceur from York) he was interested in finding out more. He has a 2.1 in Architecture from Oxford and trained as a filmmaker at the London Academy of Metropolitan Filmmaking.


What We Need

We're lucky to have an exciting creative team willing to give there time to this project; however, there are some costs we can't avoid. 90% of our story takes place in York where the boys are from. We also have a section in London. We aim to raise £3,500 which will cover the following:
  • Camera, lighting and sound equipment
  • Travel expenses
  • Location costs
  • Feeding the crew


Impact

The finished film will be 25 minutes in length. It will stand alone as a finished short and also allow us flexibility for taking things further. Future avenues we hope to explore include using the finished film as a pilot for a full web/television series and entering it into major festivals.


Cast

Izaak Cainer/Trey
Izaak trained at Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts. Most recently he appeared as Peter in the Olivier Award winning The Railway Children at York Theatre Royal. The production has been filmed by Genesius Pictures, due for nationwide cinema release next year. Other credits include: Privates on Parade (Theatre Royal Brighton), 24 Hour Plays (The Old Vic), Frank Sent Me (Theatre 503 and Underbelly), On the Shore of the Wide World (York Theatre Royal), The Upstanding Member (The Old Red Lion),  and commercials for Mentos and Play Station 4.

Christopher Lakewood/Martin
Christopher trained at LAMDA. Credits include: X-Company (CBC/Netflix), Doctors (BBC), The Village That Forgot (Raw Television), Another Country  (Trafalgar Studios), Adot’s Apprentice (Upshot Entertainment). Workshops: Doctor Foster (BBC/Drama Republic), Rudin (Straw Cage). Short films: Nightfall, The Handover Period , When The Dream Ends and commercials for Netflix and Irn Bru.

Pip Barclay/Seb

Pip trained at the Birmingham School of Acting. He has recently finished shooting feature film The Man Who Knew Infinity starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Stephen Fry. Other credits include Doughnut (London Film Academy), Kays at the Hive (Worcester County Council), Disconnected (Makinov/Movie Mint LTD) Arcadia, Time and the Conways and Macbeth (BSA).

James Bailey/Dan Meade

James is a graduate of LAMDA and Oxford University. He is currently filming feature film The Rack Pack where he stars alongside Luke Treadaway (Olivier award winner) and Will Merrick (Skins, About Time). Other Credits include: Doctor Who (BBC), Downton Abbey (ITV), The Shakespeare Papers (High Tide), Familiar Strangers, The Harvey Brothers, The Priest, Heart of Gold (Met Film School) I Caught Crabs in Walberswick, Faustus, Much Ado About Nothing (LAMDA).

Corey Campbell/Brad (Trainer)

Corey trained at the Birmingham School of Acting. Credits include: 
Dunsinane (NTS and RSC), Julius Caesar (Cheltenham Everyman), Tempestory (UK Tour and Madrid Fringe) Observe How Tiredness Defeats the Thought (El Conde de Torrefiel) May Be The Devil (ITV) and feature film The Quiet One.


Hannah Davies/Ms Evans

Hannah trained at Mountview and Royal Court Young Writers Programme and has a PhD in Theatre from York University. Acting credits include: The Frederica Quartet Of Love and Other Demons (BBC Radio 4), Hollyoaks (Mersey Television), Emmerdale (Yorkshire Television), Cigarettes and Chocolate, (York Theatre Royal Studio). Writing credits include: The Nine O Clock Slot (Ice&Fire Theatre - developed with National Theatre Studio), Githa (The Flanagan Collective).


Creative Team


Arturo M. Antolin - Editor

In May 2013, Arturo finished his BA in Audiovisual Communication in Madrid, Spain. After that, he moved to London where he completed studying a Masters in Screenwriting. While he was studying in Madrid, he worked as editor in the transmedia project “The cosmonaut”  (http://en.cosmonautexperience.com) and as freelance director. Additionally, he’s been writing about cinema in http://www.videodromo.es for a few years, where he works as critic going to festivals such as Berlinale, Cannes and London Film Festival.

Here you can find out more: http://www.am-antolin.es

Rob Ayling  - Co-Director

Rob is a former Starbucks Barista champion turned award winning filmmaker, with a BA HONS in Film Studies and a Masters in Directing. Credits include, Listen To Me, The Girl with the Compass Tattoo, La Critique, Capture. Rob's latest short film Listen To Me was nominated for the Best UK Short Film at the East End Film Festival 2015 and has recently been officially selected for the BAFTA accredited London Short Film Festival, January 2016. Rob's favourite filmmakers are Christopher Nolan, Stanley Kubrick and Alfred Hitchcock.

http://rob-ayling.wix.com/robaylingfilm

Ben Calloway - Director of Photography

Ben has recently completed a Masters in Cinematography. After studying and working for over seven years in the field, he has gathered a wide range of experience in cinematography, working on BBC productions, short films, music videos and commercials.Credits include two in production shorts, Battle (In production) (2015) and Untitled (In production) (2015). Further short works include, Listen To Me (2015), Heart of Gold (2014), Balloon (2014) and Time And Again (2013).

Owen Franklin - Producer

Owen is a filmmaker and musician from Bristol. He directed, produced and wrote feature film She Moved Through The Fair, which is currently being submitted for festivals. He has also produced short promotional films and music composition work for clients including Accessorize, Issey Miyake and Lombok; he has also produced over a dozen music videos to accompany his original material. Owen holds a BA (Hons) and MA (Dist), both in English Literature, from the University of Durham. 

Christian Lloyd - Composer

Christian is an experienced music composer for film, television, advertising and media. He has scored numerous short and feature length films. including a succession of short films screened at the 2014 Cornwall Film Festival and the Landshuter Kurzfilm Festival, the Plymouth Film Festival and Cannes in 2015. As well as composing for and conducting the BBC Concert Orchestra, Christian has composed for commercial and online channels including the Box Nation television network and The App Business. Christian has a Masters Degree in Music Composition for Film and Television from the London College of Music and Media. Alongside his composing, Christian has had a successful career as a guitarist and songwriter, writing and performing for cult Metal band Killerfix and co-writing songs for Julienne Irwin (who came in 4th on the 2007 America's Got Talent). As a guitarist he has toured the UK and Europe, performing with established European artists and playing guitar for both television adverts and theatre productions.

www.christianlloydmusic.com

Paul Romero Mendez- Co-Director

Paul has a Masters in Directing. Formerly a Civil & Structural Engineer who studied his Masters at University College London and has worked in the construction industry for over 5 years, giving him a wealth of experience in running high profile projects. Credits as director include: Hacia el Oeste (Westbound), The Handover Period, The Exchange, The 13 th Hole, Second Chance. Credits as 1 st AD include: Listen to me, Clean Slate, Tell me you love me, Dreams of a Boogeyman, Happily ever after. Promotional Videos include: BSS Health & Safety, Study UK Conference. Paul is inspired by the films of Alfred Hitchcock Sergio Leone, Martin Scorsese, Edgar Wright and The Coen Brothers.




Risks & Challenges


With any film project, there are obvious risks and possible setbacks. However, we feel confident that we can deliver a quality finished product, for the following reasons:
  1. all the key cast and crew and creative team have been assembled in advance, have pledged their time to the project, and are extremely excited to start work on it and share it with you as soon as possible
  2. we have already shot a fair amount of test footage, as the B rolls will reveal; in the unlikely event of production being cut short, we have enough existing material to bridge any gaps and complete the film
  3. the "lo-fi" nature of the documentary makes shooting flexible;  for the majority of our locations there are no rental costs to worry about in the event of running behind schedule
  4. the chakra is in our favour (apparently, Seb says he can feel it - Ed.)
story_txt:
The Film A mockumentary following a group of amateur free-runners, 'Ardcore Parkour' is a coming of age comedy about three hapless young men who dream of breaking free from sleepy suburbia and proving their worth at a competition in the big city. Along the way, Martin, Trey and Seb must scale the hurdles of teenage angst, negotiate fallouts, and contend with a distinct lack of ability. With the tragic loss of Martin's older (and more talented) brother hanging over them, can the boys defy the odds and emerge as champions in their own right?www.facebook.com/ardcoreparkourwww.twitter.com/ardcoreparkour Humphrey Barclay (three times BAFTA nominated former Head of Comedy 
at LWT/Granada, executive producer of Spaced etc.) has just read our 
script and said:
 "Lively, contemporary and very, very funny.
 If this isn’t a hit I don’t know what is.”




The Characters


Martin Rogers



Le Parkour advice from Martin:

"You never know when you might see a good bin to jump over so always wear shorts."


"Thermal underwear isn't just for old people."

"Always keep smiling."

Martin's fun facts.


"I've read the first four  Harry potter books more than ten times each (Rowling tries to be too dark and 'edgy' in the latter ones.)"
"I have over two hundred railway train tickets collected from family, close friends and just people I've met at the station."





Trey (Trevor) Morley





What's you're proudest moment? 


"I once pulled a moony on the local news. They pixelated it out but you could still see I had excellent definition."
Your hottest date?
"Every single date I've had has been steamy as hell. Both of them."
Any advice for young freerunners?
"Just basically, you know, like, be yourself and stuff. Be a yes man. Take those spanish lessons you've always wanted, try a new cuisine... learn to bake. Chicks love baked goods man."
... and hone your parkour skills?
"... Yeah that too."



Sebastian Terry





What's your biggest inspiration?
"Spirituality is the governing force in my life. If you say it fast enough it sounds almost exactly like 'spirit-duality.' Powerful, isn't it? Nobody ever told me that. I just knew it, instinctively."
And instinctively contains the word 'stink.'
"You don't understand me... I think your chakras need to be cleansed. Here's a free-running haiku I wrote: 
My legs, my brushes,
The skyline my canvas,
Urban Picasso "
Further Reading:  http://www.momonaspiritualjourney.com/



Dan Meade


Dan is an emerging documentary filmmaker, known for his previous urban works: "High Art in Hoxton" and "Ghetto Grannies" both of which are currently doing the festival circuit. Dan has a deep interest in urban sports having hailed from South London and growing up around it. Over the past 10 years he's watched the spreading of parkour out of the big cities with interest. When he heard of the death of Harri Rodgers (a prize winning traceur from York) he was interested in finding out more. He has a 2.1 in Architecture from Oxford and trained as a filmmaker at the London Academy of Metropolitan Filmmaking.


  What We Need
We're lucky to have an exciting creative team willing to give there time to this project; however, there are some costs we can't avoid. 90% of our story takes place in York where the boys are from. We also have a section in London. We aim to raise £3,500 which will cover the following:


Camera, lighting and sound equipment

Travel expenses
 Location costs
Feeding the crew    

Impact

The finished film will be 25 minutes in length. It will stand alone as a finished short and also allow us flexibility for taking things further. Future avenues we hope to explore include using the finished film as a pilot for a full web/television series and entering it into major festivals.

The production has been filmed by Genesius Pictures, due for nationwide cinema release next year. Other credits include: Privates on Parade (Theatre Royal Brighton), 24 Hour Plays (The Old Vic), Frank Sent Me (Theatre 503 and Underbelly), On the Shore of the Wide World (York Theatre Royal), The Upstanding Member (The Old Red Lion),  and commercials for Mentos and Play Station 4.

story:
Pour la version française, voir plus bas!

What's the project? 

This summer, Fly Away will go to Ireland. Discorvering this mythical land, these landmarks shaped by lengends, the country of Guiness, shamrock and leprechaun. But they won't be travelling by car, nor by foot, Fly Away will be crossing this country with fifty shades of green on bikes, with only muscle power. 
You want to discover Ireland and its charming landmarks by staying in your living room? Fly Away offers you this chance! Adventures, events, discoveries, unusual and incredible, fun and emotional meetings will be posted on our Youtube channel. A series of short thematic documentaries will be shot too. They will allow you to get to know with Irish people, their culture and their landmarks, throughout interviews, vox pops, discovering videos, ... 
However, this project is impossible without you! It remains a part of gear to buy. That's why appeal your help! 

Who are we?    

Fly Away, it's two young people of 20 and 23 that have decided to go discovering a world that is disappearing, a world that is full of remarkable places, a world that needs help, a world that cries, shouts, bleeds but doesn't receive anything.  

Fly Away, it's unbelievable meetings, unexpected discoveries, unavoidable places, generous people.  

Fly Away, it's the ambitious goal to change things, to bring a little bit of light in people's eyes, to warm people's hearts. 

Fly Away, it's also a Youtube channel which will quickly fill up of various types of videos. A channel where documentaries meet challenges and travel videos, ... 

Fly Away, it's also a growing community of world citizen that can exchange through social networks such as Facebook or Twitter. 

Fly Away, it's also an Istagram account full of mind-blowing, emotional and inspiring pictures.

The route : 

We arrive in Cork and there begins our trip. We go further south and then cycle along the coast to west point. We go up to the Connemara, still going along the coast. We do an incursion in the country to visit the National Park of Killarney. We cycle through the Ring of Kerry, the Dingle Peninsula and Cliff of Moher. After a few days in the Connemara, we cycle back to Galway, where wi stay 2 days before going to Dublin. Perhaps, we may go to the Wicklow Mountains Nation Park. The final route will be uploaded on our Facebook page. You will also be able to follow to different stages on different social networks.   

What do we do?

Before : 

We actively look for sponsorship

We launch a clothing brand of which every profits will directly finance our travel. 

We are active on social networks

We prepare as good as we can our trip and promote it around us

During : 

We hold a Travel log

We film our everyday life

We share the latest news of the trip on social networks

We immortalise the best moments, the best landmarks

We shot documentaries about Irish culture

We get to know the country and its inhabitants

We sculpt our muscles on Irish coasts 

After : 

We publish an article in a newspaper

We publish our adventures and documentaries on our Youtube channel

We prepare the next travels and next videos to present you

What do we need?

o video gear : 4000€

  • Video Camera : Canon 7D Mark II (1700€) + batteries (60€)
  • Camera : Canon s120 (300€) – Go Pro 3+ (320€) + accessories (35€)
  • Lenses : EOS 17-40mm f/4 (750€) – EOS 10-18 f/4,5-5,6 (280€)
  • Microphone : Rode videomic GO (80€) + micover windscreen (20€)
  • Memory cards (200€)
  • Remote (15€)
  • Zoom audio H1 (120€)
  • Solar panel (120€)
o Camping and Cycling gear : 1500€
  • Bike Care (150€)
  • Tools (80€)
  • Rack (120€)
  • Bags (260€)
  • Saddle bags (40€)
  • Tent (280€)
  • Sleeping Bag (300€)
  • Floor mat (35€)
  • Cooking gear (75€)
  • Portable Stove (20€)
  • Magnesium lighter (15€)
  • Vacuum bottles (25€)
  • Flasks (20€)
  • Lantern (40€)
  • Head Lamp (40€)
o Daily and travel expenses : 1000€

How can you help us? 

- Sponsor us with gear or funds 

-  Make a donation

-  Buy our clothing items

-  Subscribe our Youtube channel and follow us on the different social networks 

- Talk about it around you 

How will you be thanked? 

Sponsoring : 

o Your name will appear at the end of the videos and on our social networks 

o Stickers will be put on our bikes and gear

Donation : 

o Eternal thanks

Crowdfunding : 

o 5€ : Eternal thanks and your name at the end of the videos 

o 10€ : A « Fly Away » stickers + previous compensations

o 15€ : 3 pins « Fly Away » + previous compensations

o 20€ : An Irish Postcard + previous compensations

o 30€ : An enlargement picture of Ireland + previous compensations

o 50€ : A t-shirt « Fly Away » + previous compensations

o 75€ : An album with the best 20 pictures of the trip + previous compensations

o 100€ : A sweat « Fly Away » + previous compensations

o 200€ : A meeting with us to relate our trip + previous compensations 

o 500€ : Your advertisement at the end of the videos and on the Facebook page + previous compensations 

Why helping us? 

By appealing us, besides discovering Ireland in a new way, you allow us to achieve the first step of a major project. Fly Away won't stop after Ireland! Other projects are in progress (humanitarian travel, documentaries, ...) and we invite you to follow us to be aware of all projects.
The aim is to create a community from all over the world that will interact with us and between them. We want to set up a platform where passionates of travel will be able to share their own experiences and tips. Create a kind of huge family of world citizens! By helping us, you become a member of this amazing family!

You have more questions? 

Please contact us! Team Fly Away will be pleased to answer your questions as fast as possible

flyaway.sa@gmail.com

0471 30 31 10 et 0472 31 71 90

Facebook : Fly Away https://www.facebook.com/FlyAwayWorld/

Twitter : @FlyAwaySA https://twitter.com/FlyAwaySA

Youtube : Fly Away https://www.youtube.com/user/flyawaysa

Instagram : FLYAWAY.SA 

A huge thanks for your interest! 


Quel est notre projet?
Cet été, Fly Away mettra le cap sur l'Irlande. A la découverte de cette terre mythique, de ces paysages façonnés par les légendes, du pays de la Guiness, du trèfle et des lutins. Mais ce n'est pas en voiture, ni à pied que Fly Away parcourra le pays aux 50 nuances de verts mais bien sur des vélos, à la force de leurs mollets. Vous avez envie de découvrir l'Irlande et ses paysages enchanteurs tout en restant dans votre salon? Fly Away vous en offre la possibilité! Les aventures, péripéties, découvertes, rencontres insolites et incroyables, amusantes et émouvantes seront publiées sur la chaîne Youtube. Une série de documentaires thématiques seront également réalisés.  Ils vous permettront de vous familiariser avec les Irlandais, leur culture et leurs paysages, à travers des interviews, des micros-trottoirs, des vidéos découvertes… Cependant, ce projet est impossible sans vous! Il reste une partie du matériel à acquérir. C'est pourquoi nous faisons appel à vous! 

Qui sommes-nous? 

Fly Away, ce sont deux jeunes de 20 et 23 ans qui ont décidé de partir à la découverte d’une monde qui est en train de disparaître, d’un monde qui regorge d’endroits exceptionnels, d’un monde qui a aussi besoin d’aide, d’un monde qui crie, pleure, saigne et qui pourtant ne reçoit rien.

Fly Away ce sont des rencontres inoubliables, des découvertes inattendues, des lieux incontournables, des personnalités généreuses.

Fly Away, c’est le projet ambitieux de changer les choses, d’apporter un peu de lumière dans les yeux des gens, de baume au cœur.

Fly Away, c’est aussi une chaîne Youtube qui va bien vite se remplir de vidéos plus variées les unes que les autres. Une chaîne où se rencontrent documentaires, défis, vidéos de voyages, …

Fly Away, c’est aussi une communauté grandissante de citoyens du monde qui peuvent échanger via des plateformes sociales comme Facebook ou Twitter.

Fly Away, c’est également une page Instagram de photos époustouflantes, émouvantes et inspirantes. 

L’itinéraire :

Nous arriverons à Cork et de là débutera notre périple. Nous nous dirigerons vers le sud et puis longerons la côte jusqu’à la pointe ouest. Nous remonterons ensuite vers le Connemara, toujours en longeant la côte. Nous ferons une incursion dans le pays pour visiter le parc national de Killarney. Nous passerons par le Ring of Kerry, la Péninsule de Dingle et les Cliff of Moher. Après quelques jours passés dans le Connemara, nous redescendrons vers Galway. Nous y resterons 2 jours avant d’aller visiter la capitale, Dublin. Peut-être irons-nous jusqu’au parc national des montagnes de Wicklow.L’itinéraire définitif sera mis à jour sur notre page facebook. Vous pourrez également suivre nos différentes étapes sur les différents réseaux sociaux. 

Que mettons-nous en place? 

Avant :

Nous cherchons activement des sponsors

Nous lançons une marque de vêtements dont les bénéfices iront directement dans le financement du voyage

Nous sommes actifs sur les réseaux sociaux

Nous préparons au mieux notre voyage et nous le promouvons autour de nous

Pendant :

Nous tenons un journal de bord

Nous filmons notre quotidien

Nous partageons les dernières nouvelles du périple sur les réseaux sociaux

Nous immortalisons les plus beaux moments, les plus beaux paysages

Nous réalisons des documentaires sur la culture irlandaise

Nous apprenons à connaître ce pays avec ses habitants

Nous sculptons nos mollets sur les côtes irlandaises 

Après :

Nous publions un article dans une revue de presse

Nous publions nos aventures et nos documentaires sur notre chaine Youtube

Nous préparons les voyages suivants et de nouvelles vidéos à vous mettre sous la dent

De quoi avons-nous besoin? 

o  matériel vidéo : 4000€

  •  Caméra : Canon 7D Mark II (1700€) + batteries (60€)
  • Appareil photo : Canon s120 (300€) – Go Pro 3+ (320€) + accessoires (35€)
  • Objectifs : EOS 17-40mm f/4 (750€) – EOS 10-18 f/4,5-5,6 (280€)
  • Micro : Rode videomic GO (80€) + micover windscreen (20€)
  • Cartes mémoires (200€)
  • Télécommande (15€)
  • Zoom audio H1 (120€)
  • Panneaux solaires (120€)
o  matériel de camping et vélos : 1500€
  • Réparation des vélos (150€)
  • Matériel de réparation de vélo (80€)
  • Porte-bagages (120€)
  • Sacoches (260€)
  • Sacoches de selle (40€)
  • Tente (280€)
  • Sacs de couchage (300€)
  • Tapis de sol (35€)
  • Popote (75€)
  • Réchaud (20€)
  • Allume-feu au magnésium (15€)
  • Bouteille isotherme (25€)
  • Gourde (20€)
  • Lanterne (40€)
  • Lampe frontale (40€)
o  Dépenses sur place et déplacements : 1000€

Comment nous aider?

-  Sponsorisez-nous avec du matériel ou des fonds

-  Faites un don

-  Achetez des pulls

-  Abonnez-vous à notre chaine Youtube et suivez-nous sur les différents réseaux sociaux

-  Parlez-en autour de vous

Comment serez-vous remercié?

Sponsoring :

o  Votre nom apparaît à la fin des vidéos

o  Des autocollants de votre marque seront collés sur nos vélos

Dons :

Financement participatif 

o  5€ : remerciement éternel et votre nom au générique

o  10€ : un autocollant « Fly Away » + les compensations précédentes

o  15€ : 3 pins « Fly Away » + les compensations précédentes

o  20€ : une carte postale d’Irlande + les compensations précédentes

o  30€ : un agrandissement photo d’Irlande + les compensations précédentes

o  75€ : un album des 20 meilleures photos du voyage + les compensations précédentes

o  100€ : un pull « Fly Away » + les compensations précédentes

Pourquoi nous aider? 

En nous soutenant, en plus de découvrir l'Irlande d'une autre manière, vous nous permettez de réaliser une première étape d'un projet de plus grande ampleur. Fly Away ne s'arrêtera pas à l'Irlande! story_txt:
Pour la version française, voir plus bas!
What's the project? 
This summer, Fly Away will go to Ireland. Discorvering this mythical land, these landmarks shaped by lengends, the country of Guiness, shamrock and leprechaun. But they won't be travelling by car, nor by foot, Fly Away will be crossing this country with fifty shades of green on bikes, with only muscle power. 
You want to discover Ireland and its charming landmarks by staying in your living room? Fly Away offers you this chance! Adventures, events, discoveries, unusual and incredible, fun and emotional meetings will be posted on our Youtube channel. A series of short thematic documentaries will be shot too. They will allow you to get to know with Irish people, their culture and their landmarks, throughout interviews, vox pops, discovering videos, ... 
However, this project is impossible without you! It remains a part of gear to buy. That's why appeal your help! 

Who are we?    

Fly Away, it's two young people of 20 and 23 that have decided to go discovering a world that is disappearing, a world that is full of remarkable places, a world that needs help, a world that cries, shouts, bleeds but doesn't receive anything.  
Fly Away, it's unbelievable meetings, unexpected discoveries, unavoidable places, generous people.  
Fly Away, it's the ambitious goal to change things, to bring a little bit of light in people's eyes, to warm people's hearts. 
Fly Away, it's also a Youtube channel which will quickly fill up of various types of videos. A channel where documentaries meet challenges and travel videos, ... 
Fly Away, it's also a growing community of world citizen that can exchange through social networks such as Facebook or Twitter. 
Fly Away, it's also an Istagram account full of mind-blowing, emotional and inspiring pictures.

The route : 

We arrive in Cork and there begins our trip. We go further south and then cycle along the coast to west point. We go up to the Connemara, still going along the coast. We do an incursion in the country to visit the National Park of Killarney. We cycle through the Ring of Kerry, the Dingle Peninsula and Cliff of Moher. After a few days in the Connemara, we cycle back to Galway, where wi stay 2 days before going to Dublin. Perhaps, we may go to the Wicklow Mountains Nation Park. The final route will be uploaded on our Facebook page. You will also be able to follow to different stages on different social networks.   

What do we do?

Before : 
We actively look for sponsorship
We launch a clothing brand of which every profits will directly finance our travel. 
We are active on social networks
We prepare as good as we can our trip and promote it around us
During : 
We hold a Travel log
We film our everyday life
We share the latest news of the trip on social networks
We immortalise the best moments, the best landmarks
We shot documentaries about Irish culture
We get to know the country and its inhabitants
We sculpt our muscles on Irish coasts 
After : 
We publish an article in a newspaper
We publish our adventures and documentaries on our Youtube channel
We prepare the next travels and next videos to present you

What do we need?

o video gear : 4000€

Video Camera : Canon 7D Mark II (1700€) + batteries (60€)
Camera : Canon s120 (300€) – Go Pro 3+ (320€) + accessories (35€)
Lenses : EOS 17-40mm f/4 (750€) – EOS 10-18 f/4,5-5,6 (280€)
Microphone : Rode videomic GO (80€) + micover windscreen (20€)
Memory cards (200€)
Remote (15€)
Zoom audio H1 (120€)
Solar panel (120€)
o Camping and Cycling gear : 1500€
Bike Care (150€)
Tools (80€)
Rack (120€)
Bags (260€)
Saddle bags (40€)
Tent (280€)
Sleeping Bag (300€)
Floor mat (35€)
Cooking gear (75€)
Portable Stove (20€)
Magnesium lighter (15€)
Vacuum bottles (25€)
Flasks (20€)
Lantern (40€)
Head Lamp (40€)
o Daily and travel expenses : 1000€

How can you help us? 

- Sponsor us with gear or funds 
-  Make a donation
-  Buy our clothing items
-  Subscribe our Youtube channel and follow us on the different social networks 
- Talk about it around you 
How will you be thanked? 


Sponsoring : 
o Your name will appear at the end of the videos and on our social networks 
o Stickers will be put on our bikes and gear
Donation : 
o Eternal thanks
Crowdfunding : 
o 5€ : Eternal thanks and your name at the end of the videos 
o 10€ : A « Fly Away » stickers + previous compensations
o 15€ : 3 pins « Fly Away » + previous compensations
o 20€ : An Irish Postcard + previous compensations
o 30€ : An enlargement picture of Ireland + previous compensations
o 50€ : A t-shirt « Fly Away » + previous compensations
o 75€ : An album with the best 20 pictures of the trip + previous compensations
o 100€ : A sweat « Fly Away » + previous compensations
o 200€ : A meeting with us to relate our trip + previous compensations 
o 500€ : Your advertisement at the end of the videos and on the Facebook page + previous compensations 
Why helping us? 

By appealing us, besides discovering Ireland in a new way, you allow us to achieve the first step of a major project. Fly Away won't stop after Ireland! Other projects are in progress (humanitarian travel, documentaries, ...) and we invite you to follow us to be aware of all projects.
The aim is to create a community from all over the world that will interact with us and between them. We want to set up a platform where passionates of travel will be able to share their own experiences and tips. Create a kind of huge family of world citizens! By helping us, you become a member of this amazing family!


You have more questions? 

Please contact us! Team Fly Away will be pleased to answer your questions as fast as possible
flyaway.sa@gmail.com
0471 30 31 10 et 0472 31 71 90
Facebook : Fly Away https://www.facebook.com/FlyAwayWorld/
Twitter : @FlyAwaySA https://twitter.com/FlyAwaySA
Youtube : Fly Away https://www.youtube.com/user/flyawaysa
Instagram : FLYAWAY.SA 
A huge thanks for your interest! 




Quel est notre projet?

Cet été, Fly Away mettra le cap sur l'Irlande. A la
découverte de cette terre mythique, de ces paysages
façonnés par les légendes, du pays de la Guiness, du trèfle et des lutins.
Mais ce n'est pas en voiture, ni à pied que Fly Away parcourra le pays aux 50
nuances de verts mais bien sur des vélos, à la force de leurs mollets.
Vous avez envie de découvrir l'Irlande et ses paysages enchanteurs tout en
restant dans votre salon? Fly Away vous en offre la possibilité! Les aventures, péripéties, découvertes,
rencontres insolites et incroyables, amusantes et émouvantes seront publiées
sur la chaîne Youtube. Une série de documentaires thématiques seront
également réalisés.  Ils vous permettront
de vous familiariser avec les Irlandais, leur culture et leurs paysages, à
travers des interviews, des micros-trottoirs, des vidéos découvertes… Cependant,
ce projet est impossible sans vous! Il reste une partie du matériel à acquérir.
C'est pourquoi nous faisons appel à vous! 



Qui sommes-nous? 


Fly Away, ce sont deux jeunes de 20 et 23
ans qui ont décidé de partir à la
découverte d’une monde qui est en train de disparaître, d’un monde qui
regorge d’endroits exceptionnels, d’un monde qui a aussi besoin d’aide, d’un monde
qui crie, pleure, saigne et qui pourtant ne reçoit rien. 
Fly Away ce sont des rencontres inoubliables, des découvertes
inattendues, des lieux incontournables, des personnalités généreuses. 
Fly Away, c’est le projet ambitieux de changer
les choses, d’apporter un peu de lumière dans les yeux des gens, de baume
au cœur. 
Fly Away, c’est aussi une chaîne Youtube qui va bien vite se remplir de vidéos plus variées
les unes que les autres. Une chaîne où se rencontrent documentaires, défis,
vidéos de voyages, … 
Fly Away, c’est aussi une communauté
grandissante de citoyens du monde qui peuvent échanger via des plateformes sociales comme Facebook ou Twitter. 
Fly Away, c’est également une page Instagram de photos époustouflantes, émouvantes et
inspirantes. 


L’itinéraire : 
Nous arriverons à Cork et
de là débutera notre périple. Nous nous dirigerons vers le sud et puis longerons la côte jusqu’à la pointe ouest. Nous remonterons ensuite vers le Connemara, toujours
en longeant la côte. Nous ferons une incursion dans le pays pour visiter le parc national de Killarney. Nous
passerons par le Ring of Kerry, la Péninsule de Dingle et les Cliff of Moher. Après quelques jours
passés dans le Connemara, nous
redescendrons vers Galway. Nous y
resterons 2 jours avant d’aller visiter la capitale, Dublin. Peut-être irons-nous jusqu’au parc national des montagnes de Wicklow.L’itinéraire définitif
sera mis à jour sur notre page facebook. Vous pourrez également suivre nos différentes étapes sur les différents réseaux
sociaux. 
Que mettons-nous en place? 

Avant : 
Nous
cherchons activement des sponsors 
Nous
lançons une marque de vêtements dont
les bénéfices iront directement dans le financement du voyage
Nous
sommes actifs sur les réseaux sociaux 
Nous
préparons au mieux notre voyage et
nous le promouvons autour de nous
Pendant : 
Nous
tenons un journal de bord
Nous
filmons notre quotidien
Nous
partageons les dernières nouvelles du
périple sur les réseaux sociaux
Nous
immortalisons les plus beaux moments,
les plus beaux paysages
Nous
réalisons des documentaires sur la
culture irlandaise
Nous
apprenons à connaître ce pays avec
ses habitants
Nous
sculptons nos mollets sur les côtes irlandaises 
Après : 
Nous
publions un article dans une revue de
presse 
Nous
publions nos aventures et nos documentaires
sur notre chaine Youtube
Nous
préparons les voyages suivants et de
nouvelles vidéos à vous mettre sous la dent

De quoi avons-nous besoin? 

o 
matériel
vidéo : 4000€



 Caméra :
Canon 7D Mark II (1700€) + batteries (60€)


Appareil
photo : Canon s120 (300€) – Go Pro 3+ (320€) + accessoires (35€)

(15€)

solaires (120€)

frontale (40€)


o

sur place et déplacements :
1000€

Comment serez-vous remercié?

apparaît à la fin des vidéos

autocollants de votre marque seront collés sur nos vélos

éternel

générique

les compensations précédentes

o

o

+ les compensations précédentes 
o

compensations précédentes
o 
200€ : une rencontre autour d’un verre pour
vous raconter notre périple + les compensations précédentes
o 
500€ : votre publicité à la fin des vidéos et
sur la page facebook + les compensations précédentes
Pourquoi nous aider? 
En nous soutenant, en plus de découvrir l'Irlande d'une autre manière, vous nous permettez de réaliser une première étape d'un projet de plus grande ampleur. Fly Away ne s'arrêtera pas à l'Irlande! D'autres projets sont en développement (voyage humanitaire, documentaires,...) et nous vous invitons à nous suivre de près pour être au courant de l'avancement des projets. 
Vous avez des questions? 

N’hésitez pas à vous adresser à Fly Away, nous vous
répondrons dans les meilleurs délais !

story:
Thank You!

Thank you so much for supporting "In Retrospect" and helping to make our dreams and goals become a reality.  We are extremely grateful and fortunate for all of the support!  

Check out the series, currently up on our website: www.inretrospectweb.com

You can also help by getting the word out about this series by sharing the project on facebook, twitter, and instagram.

  • FB: facebook.com/inretrospect
  • IG: @inretrospectweb
  • Twitter: @inretrospectweb
  • www.inretrospectweb.com

We look forward to sharing Dennis and Rita's journey with you!

story:
Other fundraising is also happening separate to this campaign.

*IF YOU WISH TO CONTRIBUTE AFTER THE INDIEGOGO DEADLINE, YOU CAN STILL DO SO* - just email for more information to: info@gamedayfilm.co.uk 

WE'RE ALSO HAPPY TO DISCUSS SPONSORSHIP, RIGHTS OF ASSOCIATION AND DISCUSS PRODUCT PLACEMENT

GAME DAY is a science fiction short film, which explores a possible future...

When the Neo Social Party finally get into Government, they enforce a radical new way of life. It's heinously controversial. It's certainly brutal. But it is fair.

It's a system you would never want, but actually has a brilliant idea trapped inside it.

In a world where life can be grossly unjust, the film asks a fascinating question: What would it really mean for life to be truly fair?

It follows the thrilling story of Jeremy coming face to face with this mysterious, totalitarian system. And leaves us with plenty to ponder as to how we might reduce the inequalities in society today.


The Vision for the Film!

London in the near future. After constant riots and unrest, the old government is thrown out - and supplanted by a radical new system. It is meant to make life fair for all its citizens. But as 40 year old Jeremy prepares to find out his fate, the grim reality of it unfolds...




Game Day is the exciting short film that tells the story of this world.

This combines the futurism of Prometheus and Avatar with thought-provoking high concepts akin to Minority Report and Clockwork Orange​.


It's the tale of a radical reaction to social injustice. A new world order. But with all radical solutions, there comes a price.

It follows the story of Jeremy as he tries to escape the brutal fairness that is meted out to everyone. It is a story that explores a very innovative blending of capitalism with communism, in a totalitarian state. It explores what a truly fair society might be and whether it could work. And it follows Jeremy's personal journey as he tries to protect himself from the system, and what happens - both for the bad and for the good.


This is the story of our not-so distant future.

T
he script has already been written. It's 8 pages, which approximately translates to an 8 or 9 minute film. This offers an exciting opening into a world that can be explored in a longer form (feature length or web/TV-series), which we'll be developing once the short film has been completed.

The intended shoot period is August 2015, over 4 days - including night-time riots scenes; Jeremy's arrest and evasion scenes; the high-tech sci-fi "God's Room" where justice is meted out; and then the future world that Jeremy finds himself in.


More information (including the script!) available on request

via: info@gamedayfilm.co.uk

Further Mood Boards and Information can also be found here: neosocial.net


Who We Are

Chris Roberts is the Writer and Director. He's come from an award-winning background of editing broadcast TV documentaries and drama-documentaries, before making the move into directing drama. More information about him and his back-catalogue of work can be found here: realitylies.co.uk

Jennah Dirksen is the Producer. She's moved from LA to UK, with over 10 years experience in film/TV development. During that time she worked for extremely successful Hollywood companies such as Ridley Scott/Tony Scott's Scott Free Productions and AMC Networks (who commissioned the extremely popular series Mad Men, Breaking Bad and Walking Dead).

Sashi Kissoon (sashikissoon.com) is the very talented Cinematographer who's worked his way up through Hollywood films and British TV drama

Jon Bennett (coffeepoweredrobot.com) is our brilliant VFX artist who will be helping to bring the future to life!

Birger Clausen  (birgerclausen.com) is our award-winning and brilliant composer

The kind folk at any-prop.com will be making some of our custom-made props like the futuristic taser - they have decades of industry experience including art directing the Oscar-winning short film "Six Shooter"

Mike Turner (mrmiketurner.com) is the Storyboard Artist. His sketches will help us design the precise look and feel of the film and allow us to create detailed plans for the action scenes and the sophisticated visual effects.

Help us fund this exciting project!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £8,000, which will solely cover costs. We'll be raising money through this site and other funding sources. People will be working for free and there are some very talented people - if this were paid labour, the film would probably cost at least £100,000!

The money raised will help to cover the costs for the 4-day shoot of: hiring equipment (camera, lighting, sound), set design and construction, set dressing and props - some of which will be custom made - and cost of access to locations (location filming fees and transport costs for equipment and cast/crew).

What you get in return for your generosity is both the knowledge that you've made this project a reality, but also the specific Perks (visible on the right) in return for your very kind help!

PLEASE NOTE THAT IF WE DON'T ACHIEVE SUFFICIENT FUNDS TO MAKE THE FILM, ALL DONATIONS WILL BE RETURNED IN FULL - HOWEVER, we fully anticipate raising enough (through this site and from elsewhere) to make this exciting film happen!

Mugs and T-shirt designs - Here's just a selection of a few the designs. We'll check later which design you'd want - and what size of T-shirt...










Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute yourselves, that doesn't mean you can't help. If you would like to assist us, please:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Let your friends and colleagues know about this project!
  • And remember you can use the IndieGogo share tools at the top left of the page to easily share this webpage!

Thanks so much for all your help! We look forward to making the film!

Stay tuned to our Facebook page for updates:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Game-Day/1436736386628261

And our twitter @gamedayfilm

 If you aren't able to contribute yourselves, that doesn't mean you can't help. If you would like to assist us, please:  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Let your friends and colleagues know about this project! And remember you can use the IndieGogo share tools at the top left of the page to easily share this webpage!   Thanks so much for all your help! We look forward to making the film!Stay tuned to our Facebook page for updates:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Game-Day/1436736386628261And our twitter @gamedayfilm

story: Hi my name is Nick and I am 14 years old. I have known Lauren for 4-5 years now, she has been close family friends with my family. About a week ago (14th-16th of March) My step mum Malissa noticed that her skin wasn't looking that good. She then got a blood test a few days later and was diagnosed that she indeed had Leukemia. I found out about this 20/3/2015. I'm finding it hard to believe that this has actually happened. Please help fund the expensive operations and chemotherapy. I live an Adelaide and she is currently in hospital and will be for a while. Also, while she is in hospital she will miss out on an important year of learning. Thus possibly making her repeat a year of schooling. Thank you for reading this and I hope you can help me reach this goal to fund her.

story:
Before we get started, watch our sneak peak 'Bethany Hallway Scene' concept footage to get a tiny insight into our can look and feel like. 

Meet our writer and director Kacey Baker as he gives you an in depth insight into why Bethany requires crowd funding and how vital and appreciated your contribution is in order for this project to get shot and make it to the big screen.


The Conjuring, Annabelle, Sinister, Insidious, Oculus, Saw and Oujia are just some of the movies that have possessed us to bring to life.
Bethany: 4 stranger's night terrors interlink trapping them in a dream state, in order to escape being hunted by the dead and demonic possession, they must be woken from the outside world.

But it's not all scares and ghosts, Bethany is more than that, above all our story captivates you instantly with characters you'll love, relate to and care for, with a couple of laughs included for good measure. 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BethanyMovie
Web: http://www.bethanymovie.com
Contact: kcb@kcbproductions.net

Below you get to meet some of the core cast and crew behind our Bethany 'sample footage' (displayed above on this page). We're currently in the process of finalising full cast and crew.

Following in the footsteps of David Fincher (Gone Girl, Fight Club) and Michael Bay (Transformers, Bad Boys), Kacey intends to draw from his experience as a music video director and tv commercial director in order to delivery a thrilling super natural horror film.

Director Kacey Baker: working at Fox Studios Australia under direction of Russell Crowe and DOP Andrew Lesnie (Lord Of The Rings, Hobbit).


Prior to his recent career change from DJ to Director, Kacey was labelled Australia's next big Radio DJ while standing shoulder to shoulder with Joel Edgerton who was labelled Australia's next big actor.

6 months ago Kacey's emerging rise as a director was covered in a full page editorial in Sydney's leading newspaper, The Daily Telegraph.Kacey's work spans 5 years in exotic fashion promo direction, music video direction  for Universal Music & Sony Music as well as writer/director of the short film 'Autism' lead by Australia's renowned Roy Billing. 

Kacey's worked in multiple forms of film and broadcasting alongside Russell Crowe, Paul Walker, Ben Stiller, Marcia Hines and Will Ferrell.

Below are some samples of Kacey's recent work.



Rupert joins Hollywood A listers Mel Gibson, Sam Worthington and Hugo Weaving in the list of stand out graduates at Australia's prestigious NIDA.

  ‘...rupert was a standout at the NIDA Showcase with a   commanding presence on stage as well as onscreen...’  -  Mark Morrissey, ‘Mark Morrissey & Associates’

Rupert now stands beside Jai Courtney (Terminator, Divergent, A Good Day To Die Hard), Chris Hemsworth (Thor), Liam Hemsworth (Hunger Games, Expendables) with representation by Australia's prestigious Morrissey Management talent agency.

Rupert is currently on set playing a character in one of Hollywood's largest tent pole movie franchises.

 23 year old actor, writer, director, producer, presenter, athlete and voice over artist currently based in Sydney, Australia. Rupert is a nominee for short films that stole nominations at Cannes Short Film Festival and BIFF. Well rounded talent also boasting theatre, Rupert played the role of Sir Toby Belch in the Shakespeare classic ‘Or What You Will’ for Blackfox Theatre in the Brisbane Festival. 

  ‘...an intelligent actor, rupert has all the qualities of a leading   man for work both here and internationally...’   -  Don Groves, ‘IF Magazine’

Rachel Myskiv is an Australian actress who joins a long list of Hollywood A listers to claim humble beginnings in the Australian tv show "Home And Away", including Chris Hemsworth (Thor), Guy Pearce (Iron Man 3), Heath Ledger (The Dark Knight Rises) and Simon Baker (The Mentalist).
Rachel Myskiv (or Strickland) was born in Adelaide South Australia. Her mother has French and German ancestry and her father was from a Ukrainian family. 
Self-described as a "tom boy" as a kid, Rachel left home at 19 and for the next 5 years worked as a runway model in Germany and New Zealand. 
Rachel was working as a model when she secured her first guest role in Home and Away. 
Rachel recently wrapped her latest summer block buster The Half Dead, starring opposite John Rhys-Davies (Lord Of The Rings, Indian Jones and The Raiders Of The Lost Ark), due in cinemas 2017.

Pic: Rachel in Tim Boyle's The Half Dead.
Despite having little acting experience, her agency secured her an audition for the female lead in Paradise Lost opposite Bradley Cooper. 


Casimir Dickson is an award winning Director of Photography who has been working in Film and Television since 1994. 

His work on Feature films, Commercials, Music videos and Documentaries has seen him work all over the world on International productions as well as in Australia. 

Casimir is a member of Australian Cinematographers Society (ACS) and has won Awards for his work. 


His ambition and passion for film really shines through in all aspects of production. From inside Fox Studios to the middle of the Simpson Desert to chasing 100ft surf in the middle of the ocean. 


From Working on Bollywood films such as "Heyy Babyy" and "Victory" to Working with Hollywood director Bruce Beresford, his technical experience and creative eye are a perfect balance. 


From his roots as a Clapper/ loader through Focus Pulling, Casimir has worked with some of the biggest names in Directing and Cinematography. 

As an Owner of Camera Equipment, Film and Digital he shows his commitment to all productions. 

We're looking to wrap our 45 day shoot mid to late 2015.
In order to make this happen we must reach our goal or we'll be forced to shoot this monster on our iPhones (which we're happy to do). Also means feeding our cast and crew bread scraps and tap water (which we're also happy to do). 

So if you love what you've seen and read, then please contribute, we can't do this as effectively as we we want to with out your help.

Thank you so much.

story:
FILM SYNOPSIS

Aiden, a former high school basketball star, is now an up-and-coming head basketball coach on his way to a record number of wins in his young coaching career. As a player he was competitively driven, but as a coach Aiden knows it is more about the souls on his team than the outcome of the game. 

One of Coach Aiden’s players, Kurt, comes to Aiden for help because of personal problems at home. Aiden feels moved by the Holy Spirit to teach the young man to pray. They get down on their knees and pray together. The boy’s father learns of Coach Aiden praying with his son and goes ballistic. He reports Aiden to the public school authorities, leading to Aiden being fired as head coach.

Facing this adversity to his faith, Aiden struggles in prayer to know whether he should fight the school board or walk away from his beloved team. Nearly broke, he hires Michael, a gifted trial attorney who (unbeknownst to Aiden) is stricken with a severe addiction to gambling and a complete lack of faith in God.

The Story of Our Project

Hello, my name is Scott and I am here to tell you about a film we’re creating called, “Prayer Never Fails.” My business partner, Wes, and I are launching this campaign to raise funds and we would love your support and involvement in creating this feature film. 

Our political system requires that there be a separation of church and state. However, what does that mean? 

This film is designed to encourage people to join in the discussion about what religious freedom actually means?

Here is how YOU can SUPPORT!

We are offering participation in the process of making the film — and something tangible, too------------------------------------------------------------->>>>

This film is a great opportunity to get involved! Join us by donating today!

Please participate in helping us spread this story! Just pick a level in the right hand column and click to donate — it only takes a moment. 

If you can't donate, you can still help:

Meet the Writer-Director

The project is being directed by Wes Miller, a former trial attorney turned Writer-Director. Wes accepted Christ, was baptized at and attended Bellevue Baptist under Adrian Rodgers until leaving Memphis for college. Since making the transition to Writer-Director two years ago, he has sold his first screenplay and co-produced a film distributed by Lionsgate. This first film was written as a faith based thriller, but Hollywood ripped out that message. Recently, he took a script to a well known producer who offered to make the movie so long as he included nudity and sex. He refused and decided enough was enough. PRAYER NEVER FAILS is his third feature film and first feature as Writer-Director. This film marks his steps into his true calling as a filmmaker: glorify the Lord with quality storytelling.

Family Films Matter

We are here to send a message.  We want quality stories without having to worry about over-sexualization and language in a film. It is not a new fact that society has changed dramatically since we removed prayer from the school.  

Since the 1962 Supreme Court decision in Engel v. Vitale, 370 U.S. 421 (1962), we have seen several later laws passed that have given rise to a general loss of Christian values in society. If we sit by and do nothing this trend will no doubt continue. 

There is a long standing attack on prayer in schools!



Why Indiegogo? — The films I’m driven to create for Christ are not within the scope of Hollywood projects, I will not water down the Gospel. That’s why I’m utilizing Indiegogo — because I know people want to see thoughtful, ambitious Christian cinema that breaks out from the constraints of traditional genres.

Shooting outside of L.A. and in a state without tax credits creates an additional burden on the production. We are hoping to offset these losses by early involvement into the film!

Please Contribute: Make a Pledge Now!  — This is a great opportunity to be part of an important new film. Prayer Never Fails is a significant Christian film, a cinematic work of art. Every dollar pledged makes an impact. A pledge of any amount will make the difference in enabling us to make this film a success. Please contribute now — even if you can only afford $1.00. Check out all the great incentives in the column to the right and give as generously as you can. 


PLEASE SHARE THIS LINK: http://bit.ly/indiepreview

Help Spread the Word  — The success of our campaign depends on getting the word out as widely as possible. Even if you can’t make a pledge, please support us by sharing the link above with your friends via email, Facebook or Twitter. You can also LIKE us on Facebook and Follow me on Twitter to stay up to date on the film.

Please pledge right now and then please then get 10 friends to pledge!


How You Can Help

For us to bring “Prayer Never Fails” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us create the best film possible. Contributios will be used towards the cost of filming, crew wages, and to increase the production design. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first to see “Prayer Never Fails”.

Final Thank You and Links

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they have to make a difference in helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it has been worth every minute, thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, do not go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation has helped to achieve.  You are part of our “Prayer Never Fails” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

 If not you, who? If not now, when? 

If you wish to contact us:

Website: www.prayerneverfails.com

Our Social Media Connections:

IMDB: Prayer Never Fails

Facebook: bit.ly/prayerneverfails

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from 


-- FAQs

What’s in the digital download package?
Everyone who donates at least $10 will receive our digital download package. We are still adding to this package, but here is what we have confirmed so far. This will include the following:

-All posters, banners and desktop wallpaper used in the Prayer Never Fails Campaign

Can I Gift An Incentive?
YES! Spectacular idea. If you would like to donate to the film but give the reward to someone as a gift, go through all the normal process of making a donation in your name. For billing purposes, this action must be in your name. After our deadline, we will send a message to you on Indiegogo. (It will be forwarded to the email address you provided) Please reply with all the person’s information that is to receive the reward. We will make sure they are the person who receives the reward.

How do we contact you? Glad you asked! You can contact us directly at leonard@sweetunknownstudios.com. We check it. We will get back to you. We promise!

$100,000 seems like a low number for a movie budget. Doesn’t it?
You are correct. Fortunately, there are important investors involved in this film. The film shoots July 6, even if we fall short of the goal, BUT reaching this number allows us to bring in quality talent to increase the production budget of the project.

story:
About Capitol City Supporters

We are Capitol City Supporters, a new independent supporters group for the Madison 56ers semi-pro soccer team in Madison, Wisconsin. Our goal is to create a passionate, lively supporters culture in Madison and for the 56ers.

Founded in 2014, Capitol City Supporters started as a small group of people who wanted to bring a rowdy supporters culture to Madison. Since then, we have grown to significantly in numbers and in our efforts to create a lively match day experience for the club, the players, and those in the stands.

Capitol City Supporters wants to go all-out in its efforts. This includes banging on drums, waving flags, hoisting tifos (large banners), and chanting for the full ninety minutes of every match to show our love and gratitude to the boys on the pitch. However, we cannot do it alone.

What's In It for Us

We are raising funds to purchase materials and apparel to help get our group ready for the 2015 NPSL season, which begins in May. Your donation will go towards funding the following:

  • A new bass drum (equipped with mallets, a carrier, and custom drum heads)
  • Materials to create flags, tifos, and banners (fabric, paint, poles, etc.)
  • Group apparel, including t-shirts and buttons
  • Money for social gatherings (space rental, fees, etc.)
All funds raised in this campaign will go towards these costs. Even if we fall short of our goal, all donated funds will be used to cover any costs they can.

What's In It for You

To show our gratitude, we are offering the following perks to donors:
  • Donate $10 and receive a Capitol City Supporters button
  • Donate $25 and receive a button and a Capitol City Supporters t-shirt
  • Donate $50 or more and receive a button and a t-shirt, plus the right to lead the group in a chant at a home match this season
We want you to not only help us show support, but for you to show your passion as well.

The Impact

Semi-pro soccer teams come and go every season: New teams are added while other teams fold or change cities. Madison is very lucky to have the 56ers, who have been in the league since 2005 and were one of the founding members of the National Premier Soccer League (NPSL) Midwest Conference.
As supporters, we want to demonstrate our gratitude to the team and its players for remaining loyal to Madison for ten years, both on and off the pitch. Players often go out into the community to coach youth soccer; management gives young players from all over the world (England, Romania, Venezuela, and more) a chance to launch their soccer careers; and, in 2014, the team held a charity match to raise money for the family of a former player who passed away after a tragic car accident.
Your donation doesn't just go to Capitol City Supporters—it goes towards showing the team the passion and support they deserve after giving our community so much.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you decide to donate or not, please take a few minutes to help our group continue its tremendous growth over the last few months:

  • Spread the word about our campaign by sharing our link on social media
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter
  • Join our email list to keep up with events and goings-on by emailing info.capitolcity@gmail.com

Group apparel, including t-shirts and buttons
Money for social gatherings (space rental, fees, etc.)

All funds raised in this campaign will go towards these costs. Even if we fall short of our goal, all donated funds will be used to cover any costs they can.

What's In It for YouTo show our gratitude, we are offering the following perks to donors:



Donate $10 and receive a Capitol City Supporters button

Donate $25 and receive a button and a Capitol City Supporters t-shirt

Donate $50 or more and receive a button and a t-shirt, plus the right to lead the group in a chant at a home match this season

We want you to not only help us show support, but for you to show your passion as well.
   The Impact
Semi-pro soccer teams come and go every season: New teams are added while other teams fold or change cities. Madison is very lucky to have the 56ers, who have been in the league since 2005 and were one of the founding members of the National Premier Soccer League (NPSL) Midwest Conference.As supporters, we want to demonstrate our gratitude to the team and its players for remaining loyal to Madison for ten years, both on and off the pitch. Players often go out into the community to coach youth soccer; management gives young players from all over the world (England, Romania, Venezuela, and more) a chance to launch their soccer careers; and, in 2014, the team held a charity match to raise money for the family of a former player who passed away after a tragic car accident.Your donation doesn't just go to Capitol City Supporters—it goes towards showing the team the passion and support they deserve after giving our community so much.
    Other Ways You Can Help Whether you decide to donate or not, please take a few minutes to help our group continue its tremendous growth over the last few months:


Spread the word about our campaign by sharing our link on social media
Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

Join our email list to keep up with events and goings-on by emailing info.capitolcity@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

When boy and girl fall in love at first sight, it’s not always as magical as a fairy tale. Without even learning her name, Sam must face the unluckiest situations in order to reunite with his love before it’s too late.

Kent State University Independent Films (KSUIF) is an organization fueled by students’ passion for film. In 2008, professors Traci E. Williams and David Smeltzer collaborated to create this wonderful program that is designed to give students real-world film experience. Since then, there are more than 100 people now involved in KSUIF.

KSUIF has since produced TV shows, short films, music videos, and three feature length films: “Breaking News," a national award winner, “Research: The Musical," an all-out musical with original songs all written by students, and “Hell at Heathridge," a horrifying film that will scare you out of your seat.

Our current project, “Unlucky”, is set to premiere in May 2016. Our entire crew is very excited to begin working on this film. Each and every student, graduate student, and volunteer is ready to spend countless hours on this film. 

KSUIF is a financially independent organization and we receive very little to no funding from our university. Our project depends on generous donations from people like you. With your help and your support, we can make “Unlucky” happen! 

Our goal is to raise $10,000 from this campaign. Your contributions will be very much appreciated and will go towards state-of-the-art cameras, lighting, electrical equipment, audio, special effects, locations, wardrobe, feeding our hardworking cast/crew during our film sessions, and more!

As you can see, we do have wonderful perks for donating to us! They can range from $1 and receive a thank you note from the cast & crew to $2,000 and receive Executive Producer credit in the film! 

  Buddy Candela & Keegan Larwin                             Andres Kishimoto
                          Directors                                                      Director of Photography


            Anastasia Eliopoulos                                     Nathan Mitchell
       Unit Production Manager                                                    Writer

                       Dylan Bartolovich                                          Ashley Newton

                          Associate Producer                                            Associate Producer

                   Corey Thur                                                  Byron Weems
                 Casting Director                                                   Casting Director

                    Kirsten Charlton                                               Devan Ofcar
                               Producer                                                                  Producer



Unlucky is a film that is extremely important to every single person on our cast and crew. We all have invested so much of our time and effort to make sure that this film happens. There are multiple challenges that we will have to overcome, such as finding the correct locations to shoot for the film. The crew is also preparing and testing camera techniques in order to avoid any problems that may arise during production and postproduction. Our team is also working diligently to market this film and create buzz surrounding the film. To get the word out about this film may be our toughest obstacle. As college students, we need the distribution of the film to be abundant. After completing the film, we do plan on entering as many competitions and film festivals as possible in order to reach maximum distribution. 



Some people just can't donate, and we understand that! Help us spread the word about our upcoming film, Unlucky! Like our Facebook/Twitter pages & look for future contests and/or raffles that we will be doing. We love when our fans are interactive with us or our social media pages. 
Also, make sure to share our IndieGogo page on Facebook & Twitter!

story:
After successful completion of his directorial debut "Are You There Eli?" (Summer 2015) - Evan Maines is back for a new short film titled "Dialtone." - a dystopian based drama. After rounding up another group of fantastic crew and cast, we need your help to get the film rolling. Here is the plot:

Plot: In 2049, the world is now being crippled by overpopulation. In the United States, the government has developed a solution called the "Selective Subtraction Program" - a program that selects the low ends of society (the ill, criminals, homeless) and requires them to take a medication that will essentially take their lives. We follow unemployed writer Calvin McCoy during his last night alive after being selected as he makes phone calls to his remaining family members... at the end of his list, his former fiancee he left.

With the possibility to get this short film transposed into a feature film hopefully, we really are itching to shoot this. Working another group of talented filmmakers from around Cincinnati, OH, we believe this could be an amazing work of art and fiction.

Please make your donations, anything will help.

Thank You,

Evan Maines
