story:
Sisters of the Revolution 

A Historical Drama Feature Film

Sisters of the Revolution is the story of the remarkable lives of two rebel sisters Countess Markievicz and Eva Gore Booth.

“We meet beyond earth’s barred gate where all the world’s wild Rebels are”

Countess Constance Georgina Markievicz and Eva Gore Booth sisters of the Anglo-Irish Aristocracy became some of the most infamous and unlikely rebels to join the struggle for Irish Freedom and women's liberation. 

Constance Markievicz, a rebel commander in the 1916 Irish Rising, was the first woman ever elected as an MP to the British Parliament and the first woman in Europe  elected as a Minister for Labour in the first free Irish Parliament the Dáil Éireann.

Countess Markievicz  known as "The People's Countess"  for her passion and advocacy of working people's rights which made her feared by her opponents and loved by the people. As a rebel commander she was appointed by James Connolly as a Lieutenant, she had an unwavering commitment which made her the most charismatic woman leader in the struggle for Irish freedom.

Eva Gore Booth, her sister, a leading pacifist, suffragette and labour organiser in the North of England stood behind her. There were times when the two sisters worked together, in 1908  they defeated for the first time, Winston Churchill in a by-election in Huddersfield in England.

Constance faced execution with all the leaders of the Rising but was reprieved as a woman. It was from a cell in Holloway Prison in England that she became the first woman elected as an MP in the British Parliament. Yet her greatest triumph in the battle against a fading British Empire was the day she took her seat as the Minister of Labour in the Dáil Éireann

Sisters of the Revolution is a remarkable feature film a dramatic and romantic history of two rebel sisters, a hidden history whose lives chart the turbulent and passionate relationship between two cities, two worlds and the story of their victories in the political struggle for human rights, democracy and freedom.

 For the FIRST TIME the story of the Rebel Sisters will be told on screen.

Support Sisters of the Revolution!

We need your support NOW. We want to screen this film in Cinemas in Ireland in 2016 for the 100 years of the 1916 Easter Rising. 

The feature film script has been written. The film is currently in development. Some fantastic Actors and talent are on board. We have developed digital platforms and extensive historical research during several years.

We need the finance now so the film can go ahead.

CONTRIBUTE AND BE PART OF PRODUCING Sisters of the Revolution!

The Production team @Rebel Sister Films

The Feature Film is being produced by an award winning Producer and Director of Independent features and documentaries  Siobhan Cleary who is dedicated and passionate Director, she wrote her first treatment for this film in her twenties and has pursued a dedicated vision to make Sisters of the Revolution. Her feature documentaries have won awards at the International Festival for Documentary in Nyon for feature documentary The film The Truth Lies in Rostock and they have been specially mentioned at the Cinema Du Reel in Paris. For more information on her extensive filmography  http://siobhancleary.wordpress.com/filmography-directorproducer-siobhan-cleary 

We are building a strong team in the development of the feature film in both Ireland and England including some very exceptional leading talent. On board for the filming is cinematographer Barbara Nicholls 

Sisters of the Revolution - A compelling history 

This is a unique feature film  for the first time in the cinema the film will tell the story of  the two rebel sisters.  In the 100 year centenary of the Easter Rising of 1916 in Ireland we want this feature film to be at the forefront to celebrate a powerful peoples' history.

Sisters of the Revolution will be both entertaining and internationally have a wide audience  as we build the digital platform of the film to make available the extensive work involved in producing the film. 

This feature film will honour the powerful leadership ofrThis feature film will honour the powerful leadership of Countess Markievicz and Eva Gore Booth, rarely told on film. 


"The Irish Proclamation was a radical and progressive statement of intent, especially concerning the equality it sought to afford Irish women. This did not happen because of the benevolence of the men involved in the Easter Rising, but because of strong and courageous women whose input would not be reduced to an historical footnote. Siobhan Cleary's determination to highlight and honour the role of women in this special film, Sisters of the Revolution in the Easter Rising of  1916,  especially the sisters Constance and Eva Gore-Booth, is a story that needs to be told."

Don Mullan Executive Producer & writer of the acclaimed Feature Documentary Bloody Sunday (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Mullan)

"I support this project completely it has my backing and I am looking forward to seeing Sisters of the Revolution on screen for the hundred year commemorations in 2016.  I will be following it closely and giving my support"

Mary Lou McDonald TD for Dublin Central @ the Sisters of the Revolution launch on 23rd April Wynn's Hotel Dublin, an historical meeting place, where Countess Markievicz and her fellow revolutionaries met in 1916.

A Campaign to Honour Countess Markievicz

Rebel Sister Films are launching a campaign to honour Countess Markievicz as a Politician. We are calling for two International Blue Plaques: in Dublin to honour her as the First Woman Minister of Labour in the Dáil Éireann and in London as the First woman elected as an MP to the British Parliament. Sign the petition!! only popular support will get the International Blue Plaques she finally deserves!

SIGN THE PETITION @https://www.change.org/p/dublin-city-council-an...

STOP PRESS: Clare Daly TD one of the first to sign petition!!! 

What will you receive as a Supporter?

You will receive hot off the press an exclusive Sisters of the Revolution Digital Download or DVD of the Feature Film signed by the talent!. 

A heart felt and exclusive Thank You credit on the film, 

A fab Sisters of the Revolution T-shirt, produced by an up and coming designer. 

Invitations will be available to our Cinema premiere and our very special Producer's Premiere party.

When you become an Associate Producer you will be credited on the film. . You will receive the Digital download, DVD, the T-shirt and an exclusive invitations to several of the shoots and editing. There are a  limited to the number of Associate Producers

During the production of Sisters of the Revolution we will be launching regular updates and newsletters and keeping you posted on the events, filming and work of the feature film production.

story:
The Grand Brony Gala!

The Grand Brony Gala is a 3-day charity convention located in Tampa, FL organized by and targeted for fans of the animated TV series "My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic". Donating a portion of all ticket sales and proceeds from our charity auction, the Grand Brony Gala is dedicated in giving back to the community, as well as providing a fun and memorable experience for its attendees.

The charity we have chosen is Children's Miracle Network Hospitals Foundation, which supports local children's hospitals through out the country, and especially the All Children's Hospital in the Tampa Bay area. Donations to Children's Miracle Network Hospitals are needed to pay for research and training, equipment and charity care for families unable to pay their medical expenses. 


The first annual "Grand Brony Gala" took place on June 29, 2013 in Tampa, FL, and raised $2,000 to benefit All Children's Hospital through the Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. The second annual Grand Brony Gala was a three day convention, which took place Aug 15-17, 2014, at a new venue; the Embassy Suites Tampa - USF near Busch Gardens. There were special guests including: Cathy Weseluck, Michelle Creber, and G.M. Berrow, as well as community guests such as Black Gryphon and The Brony Chef. The 2nd convention donated $2500 and with matching funds, raised $4500 for All Children's Hospital through the Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

This year, the Grand Brony Gala will be hosting its third annual convention, from July 10-12, 2015, also located at the Embassy Suites Tampa - USF near Busch Gardens in Tampa, FL. Attendees will get to meet special guests, including actor John de Lancie, composer Daniel Ingram and writer Dave Polsky, experience concerts, shows, games, karaoke, and a variety of panels. Dozens of artists and vendors will be in attendance to show off their creations and wares, from commissioned artwork and prints, to plush ponies and jewelry. To top it all off, the Grand Brony Gala cast presents two original, live stage productions, including immersing the guests in the Grand Galloping Gala experience: "Panic at the Gala: Don't Feed the Plants".
To make the magic happen, and make this one of the biggest charity events of the year, we need you! Every little "bit" helps!  Check out the perks you could receive by helping! 20% Cooler T-shirts, Custom Prints, Stickers, Posters, Singing Telegrams and more!

story:
Fine Art is a film about a young, beautiful, college girl dealing with the fear of exclusion from her family or from the love of her life, painting. Her indecision leads her down a chaotic path to self discovery and growth. The Director, Zoe Munlyn, is composing an art film and centering woman of color as the subject. This movie gives a fresh perspective of a young black woman that we don't get a chance to experience often. We are paving the way to humanizing woman of color in the media. Help us to bring this vision to life!

www.fineartmovie.com
twitter/instagram: @fineartmovie

story:
$17K in 17 Days for Sidewalk 17 + Haikus!

This year’s Festival is right around the corner, August 28-30, and to support the monstrous undertaking we've launched our $17k in 17 Days Campaign, with a goal of raising $17,000 in just 17 short days.  It’s important to note that ticket sales only cover about 1/3 of the costs associated with hosting the Fest so we depend on grants, corporate sponsorships and donations from people just like you to make it all happen, and at an affordable price for our community. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $17,000 in 17 days from you, our super fans, our volunteers, our bestie friends so that this year’s Festival can be the best yet. Giving is pretty simple & every gift of $17 or more will get you a customized Sidewalk Haiku (Haikus contain 17 syllables, get it?) from the Sidewalk family or alumni filmmakers. And when you give, we invite you to share a Sidewalk Haiku of your own with us- we’ll be doing something special with the 17 best at this year’s Fest. 

The funds raised during this campaign will help us bring the artists and filmmakers whose films will screen at our Festival to Birmingham so that they may participate in question and answer sessions following the screening of their films, lead workshops and/or participate in panels. Visiting artists/filmmakers also interact with local filmmakers, developing meaningful professional relationships. This engagement between filmmakers and audiences is a vital part of the film festival experience, setting it apart from viewing films at home or in the typical multi-plex setting. Funds raised will cover airfare, mileage, and lodging for out of state filmmakers. 

We have some awesome perks for this campaign - read on to find out more: 

o  Gifts of $17: Haiku from the Sidewalk Staff and Sidewalk Seventeen Haiku Campaign Sticker

o  Gifts of $34: all above perks plus a Sidewalk Seventeen Haiku Campaign Koozie and a Revelator Coffee Co. Discount Card

o  Gifts of $68: all above perks plus a Sidewalk Seventeen Haiku Campaign T-Shirt

o  Gifts of $128: all above perks plus an Opening Night Pre-Party with Hot & Hot Fish Club and Ovenbird Invite (+1)

o  Gifts of $272: all above perks plus a Revelator & Sidewalk Coffee Keeper w/ Free Refills During Sidewalk Weekend 2015

o  Gifts of $544: all above perks plus a Filmmaker Luncheon and Retreat Invite (+1)

o  Gifts of $1088: all above perks plus a Golf Cart for use during Sidewalk Weekend 2015 and Jury Breakfast Invite (+1)

o  Gifts of $2176: all above perks plus 2 VIP Passes to Sidewalk 2015 with 2 Reserved seats at every single screening

§  **Festival Tickets/passes not included unless listed**

The Impact

The annual Film Festival was recently named one of the Top 25 Coolest Film Festivals in the World by MovieMaker magazine and consistently garners national attention as one of the best fests on the circuit, which propels Birmingham and Alabama into the spotlight as a place of cultural awareness, creative spirit and true hospitality.

But Sidewalk is about more than just publicity and pride of place, the Festival makes an annual economic impact of more than $1.25 million, introduces 200 new films to the local marketplace each year, hosts upwards of 40 educational events each year, supports a youth filmmaking initiative and works to strengthen the filmmaking community through networking and professional development events.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word about the campaign - post to Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/sidewalkfilm ) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/sidewalkfilm ), and be sure to tag Sidewalk 
  • It's easy to share news about the campaign by simply using the Indiegogo sharing tools. 
  • Want to make a contribution in person? Join us for Taste of Uptown (May 7th), or at Mooyah's UAB location from 4:00pm to 9:00pm (May 13th) where we'll be giving out some swag and taking donations.

monstrous undertaking we've launched our $17k in 17 Days Campaign, with a goal
of raising $17,000 in just 17 short days. 
It’s important to note that ticket sales only cover about 1/3 of the
costs associated with hosting the Fest so we depend on grants, corporate
sponsorships and donations from people just like you to make it all happen, and
at an affordable price for our community.    What We Need & What You Get 

We need to raise $17,000 in 17 days from you, our super fans, our volunteers, our bestie friends so that this year’s Festival can be the best yet. story:
What is this?

"The Couple" is a feature film that chronicles a day in the life of Donald and Phyllis Chambers, an elderly husband and wife. The film examines the deterioration of their relationship, both past and present, as a series of issues set in motion decades prior all come to the surface on a single day.
There are six characters total in the film: Donald, Phyllis, Julie, Ryan, Harry, and Mia. Each character is essential to the film and serves the narrative and the character development.
Donald is a retired professor of English. He lives in New York City with Phyllis who was an aspiring artist before taking a job as an administrator. Now that both Donald and Phyllis are retired, they are forced to spend all of their time together in the apartment, creating a tension that serves as a catalyst for the entire film. Julie, their daughter, visits in the morning and has a long and revealing conversation with Donald and Phyllis. Through their interactions, we come to understand more about their familial dynamics as well as their personal motivations.

Ryan is a young professional that lives in the same apartment building as the Chambers. Donald and Ryan share a short, but important conversation that allows the audience to glimpse a different shade of Donald and understand him professionally and personally.
Finally, Harry and Mia are old friends of Donald and Phyllis that visit for a lunch in which they share very intimate and honest conversations. Harry and Mia serve as a marital reflection to Donald and Phyllis and allow the audience to gain richer insights into the characters and narrative.

Why so small?

We seem to have come to a point in cinema where studios and audiences alike seem to agree bigger is better.
I've personally never found that to be true.
The cinema that excites me has to do with people. Watching well-written characters evolve and change throughout a film is one of the most fascinating things that can take place on a screen. When I remember the films I love, the films that impact me, I remember the people; I remember complex and interesting characters with intense pathos.
So, now that I'm making my first feature, it's no surprise that it's entirely about people. The majority of the film takes place in Donald and Phyllis' apartment, usually as they converse around tables and reveal pieces of themselves along the way. I wanted to make a quiet, contemplative film that examines what it means to be human, how relationships evolve, and how time distorts all things.

How far along is the film?

Right now we've gotten as far into pre-production as we can at this point, which is why we need your help!
- The final draft of the screenplay is done and registered with the WGA East
- I've hand drawn hundreds of storyboards for key scenes
- We're in talks with actors for the two leads
- We have a structured budget rundown
- We've secured our locations
- We're currently speaking with composers to score the film
- I'm working with a great DP to craft the visual style of the film
- We've secured the Arri Alexa at a reasonable rate
- We've established a small crew for the film
- We've drafted a shooting schedule (we'll shoot the film in 7 days)


Who are you?

Well, my name is William Bigelow and I'm the writer/director of "The Couple". I'm 18 years old and live in West Orange, NJ. Last year I graduated from Seton Hall Preparatory School.
In high school I saved up a couple thousand and made a short film called "Attrition" that played a few festivals along the east coast.
This is my first feature film and it's a very personal work for me. I started with the idea of an elderly couple trapped in a broken marriage. Everyday, for several weeks during this past summer, myself and Chase Padusniak (co-story by) structured the film out on notecards; deciding on essential pieces of character development, narrative flow, and atmosphere/tone. I then spent a couple months adapting the notecards into the screenplay and refining the drafts until I reached a final draft that I felt happy with as a work of art.
This is definitely the largest undertaking I've ever attempted, but I truly believe in the quality of the product.

How did you come to love film?

I've loved film my whole life. I have distinct memories of watching specific films at one or two years old. I've always had an appreciation for movies and I grew up in a house that watched movies.
In seventh grade I saw three movies in one week that forever changed my perception of cinema. I realized that film (and art in general) is about character interactions. I think it was around this time that I lost faith in the spectacle of movies and fell in love with the language of film.
Although I had a decent knowledge of American cinema at this point, it was really in high school that I came to fully embrace film. Sophomore year I had a teacher named Mr. Binkowski who was a scholar of film and english. He was one of the most respected teachers at Seton Hall and I started talking to him about film after english class. As time went on, he would start assigning me different films to watch each day, usually through the Criterion Collection. The next day I would talk to him after class and we would go over whatever film I watched the previous night, whether it be Blue Velvet, Vivre Sa Vie, or M.
It was during this time that I truly started to understand the language of cinema and how images/sounds/atmosphere effectively evoke emotions.


Now we need your help!

We've gotten as far as we can into pre-production; now we'd like to make this film a reality! To make this happen we need your help!


Where does the money go?
We have a very small budget for this film. Shoestring. Micro budget.
We're trying to make this film for $40,000-$45,000, $10,000 of which we already have and we're asking for $20,000.
The budget is split almost 50/50. Half the budget is going to getting the best possible character actors we can. We've already been in talks with several actors for the lead roles, but as no one is attached, we can't say names!
These are heavy parts and we know that the film rests almost entirely on these performances, and so we must get the strongest possible actors we can to support the weight of the film.
The other half of the budget will help us get the best equipment we possibly can, pay our small crew, feed cast/crew, and put the actors up in a hotel while we film.
We'll be shooting the film on the Arri Alexa, which I consider to be the best digital cinema camera ever created. Our Director of Photography, Jeremy Musher, is a trained technician of the Alexa, as am I.
We've already found rental companies in the New York area that have affordable prices on the dozens and dozens of pieces we'll be renting for this film.

How can you help?

Well, we're asking for $20,000, but anything you can donate, whether that's $1 or $1,000, is greatly appreciated! If you can't donate, but you'd like to help, you can help us spread the word through social media. Share our campaign to get the word out and help make this film!

What will you do with the film once it's done?

Once the film is complete we'll submit it to dozens and dozens if not hundreds of film festivals. We'll submit to Sundance, Tribeca, Toronto International Film Festival, etc. We hope to have a decent run in the indie festival circuit with the intention of acquiring a VOD deal. We hope that within a year and a half to two years, "The Couple" is on all streaming sites (Netflix, Hulu, etc.) so that the widest possible audience can find the film and appreciate it.

What if we don't reach our goal?

If we don't reach our goal, we'll start cutting our budget and try to secure the rest of our budget or get closer to our $40,000 price point. At the end of the day, I'm making this movie. If I have to do it on a cheaper camera with no-name actors that we've auditioned, then we'll do it, but this movie will get made.

Thank you for checking out my campaign! I hope that you can help me make this film!

story:
¨Mantén tu Aché¨  Película documental que cuenta la historia de siete personas con VIH  que usan los sistemas adivinatorios de Osha-IFA como herramienta para prevenir la propagación de la epidemia. “Afroaché” es el nombre del grupo sociocultural que crearon estos practicantes en el barrio de Regla en La Habana, Cuba.  

Este documental hace foco en la labor de prevención y en la forma que usa “Afroaché” los sistemas adivinatorios entre los practicantes de la Santería Cubana en su lucha por prevenir la propagación del VIH.

Me motiva la forma diferente de trabajar de ¨Afroaché¨ y el alcance del mensaje de este grupo de santeros, válido para países como México, Venezuela, Colombia , Brasil, Estados Unidos, España y además para países del África de donde es originario el culto a las deidades Yoruba. Otra de mis motivaciones es el apoyo a las personas con VIH con las que siempre he tenido interacción por vínculos artísticos y de amistad así como la divulgación de otros mensajes a favor del control o erradicación del VHI.


¨Mantén tu Ache¨ a documentary film that tells the story of seven people with HIV who use divination systems Osha-IFA as a tool to prevent the spread of the epidemic. "Afroaché" is the name of the sociocultural group that created these practitioners in the neighborhood of Regla in Havana, Cuba.

This documentary does focus on prevention´s work and the way "Afroaché" use divination systems among practitioners of Cuban Santeria in the fight to prevent the spread of HIV.

My personal motivation in the different way of working ¨Afroaché¨ ​​and scope of this group of Santeria message applies to countries like Mexico, Venezuela, Colombia, Brazil, USA, Spain and also to countries in Africa where Yoruba´s cult come from. Another one of my motivations is to support people with HIV cause I had artistic interaction and friendship relationship and the dissemination of other messages for the control or eradication of HIV.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes 

What we need & What you can get 


Lo que necesitamos como todo el equipo de producción es cubrir los gastos de equipos para la filmación y viajes (Equipamiento-Transporte-Cathering). La financiación obtenida se utilizará para los gastos de rodaje.En caso de no conseguir todo el dinero, todo lo recaudado será utilizado para dar prioridad a los equipos técnicos del rodaje.
Tu también puedes formar parte de la producción del Aché !! Si ,serás parte de nuestro equipo. Con tu apoyo a nuestra campaña podrás obtener varias de nuestras recompensas. Pondremos tu nombre en los créditos de agradecimiento o  un visionado del ultimo montaje antes que estemos listos para lanzar. Es importante tu opinion como parte de nuestro equipo de producción!

What we need as all production team, is to cover the costs of technical equipment for filming and travel (Tech-Trans-Cathering equipment). The financing obtained will be used for filming.En costs of not getting all the money, all proceeds will be used to prioritize renting technical equipment for filming.
You can be part of Aché production too !! Yes, you´ll be part of our team. With your support to our campaign you'll get a few of our rewards. We will put your name in the  thanks credits or viewing the last assembly before we're ready to launch. Your opinion is important for us as part of our production team!


Detalles de producción y equipamiento

Production details & Equipment


Presupuesto/Budget

Equipamiento Video (Video Equipment) = 3190 Euros

Equipamiento de Luces (Ligths Kit)= 490 Euros

Equipos de sonido (Sound Record Equipment)= 490 Euros

SteadyCam (Steadycam)= 745 Euros

Transporte & Alojamiento = 4550 Euros

Cathering = 345 Euros




                El mayor impacto sera propagar el Ashe

Spread ashe will best impact 


Más que  la producción de este documental mediante la colaboración de todos, en mi opinión, ayudaríamos a lograr uno de los objetivos que comparto con “Afroaché”, influir en la integración de todos los practicantes y líderes religiosos en la lucha por la prevención de la enfermedad. 

Te imaginas? colaborar para estar cada vez más prevenidos, atendiendo a las predicciones de Osha-IFA. Sería genial si cada día existieran menos personas expuestas a la enfermedad, o si lográramos influir y evitar que otras personas sean discriminadas por el simple hecho de estar infectados por una enfermedad como lo es el SIDA.

In my opinion a real impact would more than achieve the production of this documentary, was achieved through the cooperation of all ,one of the objectives of Afroché that requires the integration of all practitioners and religious leaders in the fight for prevention disease.

Go figure ??? Achieve increasingly be prevented to predictions of IFA. It would be great that every day there were less sick or discriminated against simply because of being infected with a deadly disease such as AIDS.


 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Other ways you can help us

La ayuda de todos es fundamental, por eso no te limites en propagar el ache!!   Comparte esta campaña con tus amigos en las redes sociales, invitalos a dar Me Gusta en nuestra FanPage del Documental, usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Is essential everyone's help , so do not limit yourself to spread the ache !! Share this campaign with your friends on social networks, invite them to give our FanPage LIKE Documentary, using the Indiegogo tools to share .


Y eso es todo!!    That´s All !!

 #MantenTuAche

                El mayor impacto sera propagar el Ashe



Spread ashe will best impact 





Más que  la producción de este documental mediante la colaboración de todos, en mi opinión, ayudaríamos a lograr uno de los objetivos que comparto con “Afroaché”, influir en la integración de todos los practicantes y líderes religiosos en la lucha por la prevención de la enfermedad. 
Te imaginas? colaborar para estar cada vez más prevenidos, atendiendo a las predicciones de Osha-IFA. Sería genial si cada día existieran menos personas expuestas a la enfermedad, o si lográramos influir y evitar que otras personas sean discriminadas por el simple hecho de estar infectados por una enfermedad como lo es el SIDA.


In my opinion a real impact would more than achieve the production of this documentary, was achieved through the cooperation of all ,one of the objectives of Afroché that requires the integration of all practitioners and religious leaders in the fight for prevention disease.

Go figure ??? Achieve increasingly be prevented to predictions of IFA. It would be great that every day there were less sick or discriminated against simply because of being infected with a deadly disease such as AIDS.




 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar




Other ways you can help us
La ayuda de todos es fundamental, por eso no te limites en propagar el ache!!   Comparte esta campaña con tus amigos en las redes sociales, invitalos a dar Me Gusta en nuestra FanPage del Documental, usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
Is essential everyone's help , so do not limit yourself to spread the ache !! Share this campaign with your friends on social networks, invite them to give our FanPage LIKE Documentary, using the Indiegogo tools to share .
   Y eso es todo!!    That´s All !! #MantenTuAche

story:
Short Summary

Portal web series has launched it's first season of interconnected and interdimensional short films, where the viewer chooses the adventure in an original interactive experience. Follow different characters down rabbit holes throughout a dreamland that can quickly shift into a nightmare, where nothing makes sense but everything feels familiar. 

Co-created by Liz Tabish and Anthony David Montanino, the first season of Portal web series has met with extraordinary reviews. But we need your help to create the second season and beyond. Check out www.portalwebseries.com to experience what people are talking about.

"The shorts (in Portal) use music, minimalistic but psychologically rich dialogue, surreal imagery, and a growing sense of narrative tension to create a singular impression of a world both strikingly similar and disturbingly divergent from our own...The PORTAL series is the expression of a unique and powerful voice, one that could prove potentially revolutionary in the American filmmaking scene." - Reviewed by Eric England

What We Need & What You Get

We want to continue to make uniquely unexpected and quality content. Your contribution would help us keep Portal in production by providing:

-Film Festival Submission Fees

-Location Rentals

-Food and drinks for cast and crew

-Payment to cast and crew

The Impact

There is a demand resonating within the entertainment industry for more complex roles for women. Our goal is to meet that demand by offering unique and interesting roles to actresses that surpass traditional expectations and showcase the complexity and depths of women's experiences.

Please share our campaign with friends and family! 

Cast / Crew

In addition to the returning actors from Season One, Portal welcomes the following:

Guest Cinematographer, Mat Miller +

As an accomplished life-long visualist, Miller has captured the ethos of the Oklahoma art scene since the early 2000s. Whether it’s still, motion or animation, Miller has created an artistic periscope for viewing a 21st century world that lives and dies by the bible of mass media. You’ll find him on Instagram (@matmiller) producing digital shorts or curating his audience with online art shows. His passion for film, however, has always been his first love. Miller has worked with Liz Tabish on five films and helped her produce a series of Shakespearean tragedies. Miller owes his success to his dog, Roger, who speaks to him after smoking trees. Keep an eye out for new work and announcements.

Introducing the newest cast members of Portal Season Two: 

Venus Monique was born and raised in Iraan, TX and received her degree with a minor in Theatre. She's been in Austin, acting professionally since October 2010 and has recently met with success in her leading role in the film Genesis where she has won Best Actress at The Attic Film Festival and Nominated Best Actress in the International Christian Film Festival. She has studied with Carol Hickey, Laurel Vouvrey and Stephen Bridgewater.


Hannah Jones recently decided to pursue acting after graduating from the University of Texas at Austin with degrees in Broadcast Journalism and International Relations and Global Studies with a minor in Latin American Studies. She has studied with renowned coaches Carol Hickey and Stephen Bridgewater and plans to move to New York City in fall 2015 to continue pursuing acting in both film and theatre. Beyond acting, she hopes to advocate overcoming the stigma of mental illness and the representation and opportunities for women in the industry.

Janet Travis is an Austin based writer and actress best known for her role in Grow Up, Tony Philips, a 2013 SXSW film selection. Thanks to the support and encouragement of her incredible husband, she gets to pursue her art and study under the incomparable Carol Hickey at The LA Standard.

Audrey Acosta is an actress from Austin, Texas. She started acting in musicals as a child, and trained in both singing and acting. She made the switch to film a few years ago, and has fallen in love with it. Since then she has acted in independent films and commercials. She is signed with Heyman Talent and studies under the incredible Carol Hickey.

A veteran actor of over 14 years, Patrick Grover made the move to Texas, after studying Theatre at Louisiana State University, where he began to pursue acting on a professional level. During this time he has experienced numerous successes including featured roles in the films Joe, Lazer Team, Cutter, and Six Pack Sam among others; on television series such as Revolution, Fatal Encounters, and The Secret Lives of Wives; and in commercial work, including national commercials for Miracle Whip and Subway. Patrick is thrilled to be joining the team for Portal  and is excited for the future of the project. 

As an Austin resident since 2010, Callisto Griffith has pursued modeling and film full time. Beginning as early as high school, she fell in love with the versatility of both industries and has had appeared in numerous publications and magazines, campaigns, billboards, commercials, music videos, short films, creative projects and feature films. Her most recent starring role is the short film From Eva With Love, which is currently circulating in film festivals across the globe, earning awards and recognition. She has appeared in Robert Rodriguez's Sin City 2: A Dame To Kill For and NBC's Revolution.  Numerous other projects remain in post production including "Fine Line", a feature film in which she has a starring role.

Originally from Chicago, Elizabeth Lestina is an actress/model, now based in Austin and loving the sun and lack of snow. She has modeled runway and print for numerous local designers and businesses and she recently finished in the Top 10 in the Top Austin Model competition. She will be playing the role of Denise in an independent short film called "Arriving" later this summer.

Mariah-Rae Vincent was first discovered in her teens by director Laurie Collyer, best know for the film Sherrybaby. After Mariah-Rae worked on several films with Laurie she took a much different path; became a fashion merchandise manager, a certified pipe welder, blacksmith, cactus aficionado and much more. After years of exploring her other interests her heart fell back into acting. She spent much of 2014 exploring the life of a post-op m-f transsexual to most accurately portray Claudia in her first lead in a feature film, "Clayton & Claudia". She brought in the 2015 new year co-starring with fellow Austinites in her second lead in a feature film, "Art Fair Fever".

As a young boy, entertainment has always been a part of Todd Sapio’s life. From singing and playing guitar and piano in touring rock bands to performing on stage and screen, Todd has always loved the performing arts. Writing, acting, directing and producing short films such as THREADS, by the band KIONA, commercials for companies like Disney, WD-40 and Mondavi, and instructing spin classes are just a few ways Todd remains “on stage”. He has trained with legendary acting coach Carol Hickey and has several years of vocal and performance training.

Laura Shaw is an actress based in New Orleans, LA. Her love of performance and dance began at the age of 3 with the Coast Youth Ballet Academy in Mississippi under the direction of Sharon Loiacano. Her desire to excel in classical ballet led her to additional training with several other prestigious ballet companies. She attended the University of Southern Mississippi in Hattiesburg, MS where she earned a B.S. in Business Administration in 2009. In 2014, Laura decided to return to her love of performing and began to pursue acting. She has recently worked on several major network television series including The Astronaut Wives Club set to air on ABC this Summer and Scream Queens in the Fall on Fox.

Israel “Izzy” Bocanegra, is delighted to join the cast of “Portal” the web series. Izzy is an accomplished bilingual Hispanic actor who has been working in the Texas and Louisiana markets since 2002. He has credits in numerous major films as well as several independent films and television shows. He has been asked on many occasions to work alongside various A list actors and under the direction of Oscar and SAG Award winning Directors. Izzy has had the privilege to study under acclaimed teachers and coaches such as Stephen Bridgewater, Gerry Grennell, Carol Hickey, CK McFarland, Laurie Guzda, and many others.

Will Ruff got into acting as an extra on the set of a major television production in Austin and decided to audition for Acclaim Talent to pursue acting full-time. He's snuck into various classes to learn the craft from some of the best Austin has to offer including Stephen Bridgewater. He published his debut novel, Shitty Beijing Bike, December 2014. You can read more about it here. http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/s/ref=is_box_?k=shitty+beijing+bike

Juliette Kida is a professional actress, model and singer based in Austin, Texas. She's loved entertaining people since she was young, being involved in theater and choir throughout school and started modeling in 2011. Her passion for the entertainment industry intertwines with her love for nutrition, and is currently pursuing a health coaching business for people involved in the industry. She is now signed with Step Forward Entertainment in NYC, Wilhelmina Brown, Revolution Management.

Stan Taylor is a 1987 graduate of Baylor University. After college college Stan served 12 years in the Army with assignments in Germany, Hawaii and Arizona with one tour in Iraq. Stan currently works at Darnall Army Hospital and has taken up acting as a special interest. He  has been in multiple TV series including Revolution, Dallas, American Crime, Salem and The Astronaut Wives Club. Stan is married to his lovely wife Kathleen. They have 3 daughters, 7 grandkids and 4 dogs.

story:
Introduction

Hi! My name is Valiant and I'm glad to announce that I will be going to Northern Thailand for a mission's trip July this year. For four weeks, I will be part of a team that will be reaching out to youth at the Chiang-Khong Christian Education Centre (CCEC). Our team will be teaching and leading English classes and camps and will be spending time living with the students. I will also be taking tons of pictures and videos!

About Me

Previously, I've had the opportunity to serve in Chibougamau, Quebec on the first nation reserves where I took part in holding a Vacation Bible School for the kids and in Toronto, Ontario helping out in food banks and building shelters for the mentally disabled. I feel extremely blessed to have the opportunity to be a part of the Thailand Short Term Mission Team this year.

Background Information

Thailand has a substantial Buddhist population, while the Christian population is a mere 0.7%. It's hard to minister to these people because the sex trade is prominent and many see God as just another god. Ultimately, the purpose of the mission trip is to reach out to the youth and share God's love and story with them so that they can have a relationship with God and trust and rely on Him.

Where is the money going?

Any contribution would be greatly appreciated! The approximate cost of $2,750 includes:
  • airfare
  • rooms and living essentials
  • meals
  • teaching materials

Perks

  • If you donate $5 or more, you get a choice of either a hug or a mention on social media! :P
  • If you donate $10 or more, you will receive a personalized thank you letter from me!
  • If you donate $25 or more, I will buy you a personal souvenir from Thailand!
  • If you donate $35 or more, you will receive a physical photo album of all the pictures that I will take in Thailand!
  • If you donate $50 or more (wow I love you), I will make a video of anything (appropriate) of your choice!
  • If you donate $500 or more (OMAIIIIII <3), you will be allowed to do something wacky with my hair after I return (i.e dye it, shave it, etc.). This can only be claimed once.

story:
VERSÃO EM PORTUGUÊS - logo abaixo!

THE PROJECT - a queer futuristic-punk-boat movie

Ana arrives in a town in the middle of Brasil carrying the ashes of her queer activist brother who has just being murdered. In order to honor his memory she throws his ashes in a beautiful waterfall from the place he was fighting to preserve. As Ana is not able to leave the place, the spirit of her brother Sebastian appears to her. Resisting the pressure of her job and wife to go back to São Paulo, Ana, accompanied by her brother’s ghost, journeys through the Amazon collecting the oral memory from their ancestors.

On a political note, the character will interact with a strong problem of boarders that defines Brazilian society now days. Where indigenous populations are more and more restricted from their space and being removed from their ancestors' land.

In a hybrid fiction-documentary film the character is faced with life changing situations and people, who makes Ana question their own identity.

When you take a trip like this you start to uncover your different selves. Are we not the reflection of the other, and because of that the other itself? Or our particular world is so deep and unique that it looses itself in it’s own unconscious?

Playing with mythological creatures, this magical realistic feature will explore the concepts of polyamory, queer, gender, spirituality and physical frontiers. All embedded in a strong political and loving piece.


O PROJETO - um filme queer-futurista-punk

Ana chega em uma cidade no meio do Brasil levando as cinzas de seu irmão ativista e queer que acaba de ser assassinado. A fim de honrar a memória de seu irmão ela joga suas cinzas em uma bela cachoeira no lugar em que ele estava lutando para preservar. Quando Ana não é capaz de deixar a cidade, o espírito de seu irmão Sebastian aparece para ela. Resistindo à pressão de seu trabalho e esposa para voltar à São Paulo, Ana, acompanhada pelo fantasma de seu irmão, viaja através da Amazônia coletando a memória oral de seus ancestrais.

Em uma nota política, o personagem vai interagir com um forte problema de fronteiras que define a sociedade brasileira hoje dias. Onde as populações indígenas estão cada vez mais restritas de seus espaços e removidas da terra de seus ancestrais.

Em um filme híbrido entre ficção e documentário o personagem se depara com situações e pessoas que mudam seu destino e fazem Ana questionar sua própria identidade.

Quando você faz uma viagem como essa, você começa a descobrir seus diferentes eus. Não somos o reflexo do outro, e por causa disso o próprio outro? Ou nosso mundo particular é tão profundo e único que ele perde-se em seu próprio inconsciente?

Contando histórias de criaturas mitológicas, o filme terá uma característica mágica e irá explorar conceitos de poliamor, queer, sexualidade, espiritualidade e fronteiras físicas. Tudo incorporado em uma obra fortemente política e amorosa.

MEET US - NOS CONHEÇA

THAIS GUISASOLA

Thais, with all my heart and love for the world!

Thais Guisasola, é formada em Cinema e Filosofia Política pela Hampshire College, em Massachusetts, E.U.A, defendeu a tese Corpos Imaginários, sobre como a opressão de determinadas identidades remove-as da categoria de humanos perante a sociedade. Em Cuba em 2010, iniciou sua carreira como cineasta com o curta-metragem Ventanas para tus Colores, ganhador do prêmio de melhor filme no Festival de Cinema de MA.  Ministrou workshops de roteiro e vídeo para adolescentes de baixa renda da ONG Casas Taiguara de Cultura em SP. Pós-graduada em roteiro de ficção Thais desenvolve o roteiro de longa-metragem A Chave de Casa, produzido pela Andara Filmes, Camila Groch e Camila Pitanga. Pelo projeto ganhou o edital de desenvolvimento de roteiro pelo FSA - ANCINE no Brasil.

SIMON(È) PAETAU

And yes, Simon(è)! Anywhere, everywhere I am up to all beauty in life!

Simon(è) J. Paetau has a German father and a Colombian mother. Simon(è) studied at the International Film School Cuba, EICTV and graduated with the film Cruising in High Heels from the Academy of Media Arts Cologne (KHM). Their shortfilm MILA CAOS was invited to several International Film Festivals including Cannes, MoMA and Rotterdam. They have won several awards, including the German Human Rights Film Prize 2008 for OURY JALLOH. Simon(è) co-curated as part of the (heidy) collective the exhibitionWhat is queer today is not queer tomorrow at nGbK Berlin. Currently Simon(è) is developing their First Feature Film Lacrimosa supported by the Résidence du Festival de Cannes and premiered recently their first performance/theater piece Gritty Glamour at Ballhaus Naunynstrasse, Berlin. Other shortfilms and Projects: Lua Verde, Refugee Strike and Beyond, Queer and Beyond, Oury Jalloh etc.

TOGETHER - JUNTOS

Yes! We have been good friends for quite a while, and have been collaborating in our films since 2010. Respect, good connection and the passion for the same subjects makes us great working partners! Since 2010 we have been planning to work on a road film project, and the time HAS COME!

We are mixing our passion for social justice, film and the mixture of languages and nationalities in a beautiful piece that will let surface many of our inquires and love for the themes.

We are both Hybrid in our own ways, divided identities, questions of gender roles, sexuality and moving around in between borders.

You can check out a previous film we made together in 2010. LUA VERDE And you can also check a bit about our own work as artists and filmmakers! Simon(è) Paetau

Sim! Temos sido bons amigos por um bom tempo, e colaboramos em filmes desde 2010. Respeito, boa conexão e a paixão pelos mesmos assuntos nos faz grandes parceiros de trabalho! Desde 2010 planejamos esse projeto e chegou o momento! 

Estamos misturando a nossa paixão por justiça social,  cinema e a mistura de línguas e nacionalidades em uma bela obra que irá trazer para a superfície muitos das nossas perguntas sobre esses temas. 

Somos ambos híbridos em nossas próprias maneiras, identidades múltiplas, questionamentos de papéis de gênero, sexualidade e deslocamento por fronteiras.

Você pode assistir um filme que fizemos juntos em 2010. LUA VERDE. Assim como um pouco de nossos trabalhos pessoais como artistas e cineastas! Simon(è) Paetau

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING TO - ONDE VAI O DINHEIRO

For our project to happen we are trying to go for 12,000 dollars, this will cover our basic production costs and we will be able to make this trip happen. However we will still need support for post-production.

Para o nosso projeto acontecer estamos tentando chegar no 12.000 dólares, isso irá cobrir nossos custos básicos de produção e que será capaz de custear esta viagem. No entanto, ainda precisaremos de apoio para a pós-produção.

FOLLOW OUR JOURNEY - NOS SIGA

YES! It is a long and beautiful way! We are starting on the red spot near BRASÍLIA and going all the way up to the Amazon. As you can see we have two different ending possibilities. One will end in BOGOTÁ, Colombia and the other ends in RIO BRANCO Acre in Brazil. Both are interesting for the film, but it depends on our final budget. They both have very different costs.

Feel free to ask us things about the trip before or after we have done it, we will be happy to give you advices if you plan on doing the same thing!

SIM! É uma maneira longa e bela! Estamos começando a mancha vermelha perto de Brasília e indo todo o caminho até a Amazônia. Como você pode ver, temos duas possibilidades de finalização diferentes. Uma terminará em Bogotá, na Colômbia e as outras extremidades em Rio Branco Acre no Brasil. Ambos são interessantes para o filme, mas isso depende do nosso orçamento final. Ambos têm custos muito diferentes.

Sinta-se livre para nos perguntar coisas sobre a viagem antes ou depois de ter feito isso, teremos o maior prazer de lhe dar conselhos, se você está pensando em fazer a mesma coisa!

LOOK INSIDE - POR DENTRO

Here are some of the pictures from the places we will visit in this journey!

Aqui estão algumas fotos dos lugares que iremos visitar nesta viagem!

POLITICAL ISSUES - QUESTÕES POLÍTICAS

Some of the really important political issues we want to document in our film!

Algumas das questões políticas realmente importantes que queremos documentar em nosso filme!

Spiritual practices

As a practitioner myself, carried on by my ancestors. I hope to be a voice that advocates for the space of this religious practice that suffers a lot of prejudice in Brazil.

Práticas espirituais

Como praticante, conectada com meus antepassados. Eu espero ser uma voz que defende  o espaço desta prática religiosa que sofre muito preconceito no Brasil.

Queer issues

As gender queer people, we plan on advocating for non-western concepts of queer identities. Having the lead character challenge the idea of normalized sexual and gender definitions, we will explore the concepts of polyamory, gender and queerness within non western communities.

Questões Queer

Como pessoas queer, planejamos apresentar conceitos não-ocidentais da identidades queer. Com o personagem principal desafiando a idéia de definições normalizadas a respeito da sexualidade e gênero, vamos explorar os conceitos de poliamor, gênero e queer em comunidades não ocidentais.

FIERCE!!! Just like how we are gonna make this happen!

Indigenous land

The need for the protection of indigenous population's land. Many indigenous populations have being kicked out of their land violently. There needs to be space for resisting voices, and we hope our film can be an ally to their struggle to survive and live with dignity on their ancestors' land.

Terra indígena

A necessidade de proteção de terras da população indígena. Muitas populações indígenas são expulsas de sua terra violentamente. É preciso haver espaço para vozes de resistência, e nós esperamos que nosso filme possa ser um aliado para a luta de sobreviver e viver com dignidade na terra de seus ancestrais.
story_txt:
VERSÃO EM PORTUGUÊS - logo abaixo!
THE PROJECT - a queer futuristic-punk-boat movie
Ana arrives in a town in the middle of Brasil carrying the ashes of her queer activist brother who has just being murdered. In order to honor his memory she throws his ashes in a beautiful waterfall from the place he was fighting to preserve. As Ana is not able to leave the place, the spirit of her brother Sebastian appears to her. Resisting the pressure of her job and wife to go back to São Paulo, Ana, accompanied by her brother’s ghost, journeys through the Amazon collecting the oral memory from their ancestors.
On a political note, the character will interact with a strong problem of boarders that defines Brazilian society now days. Where indigenous populations are more and more restricted from their space and being removed from their ancestors' land.
In a hybrid fiction-documentary film the character is faced with life changing situations and people, who makes Ana question their own identity.
When you take a trip like this you start to uncover your different selves. Are we not the reflection of the other, and because of that the other itself? Or our particular world is so deep and unique that it looses itself in it’s own unconscious?
Playing with mythological creatures, this magical realistic feature will explore the concepts of polyamory, queer, gender, spirituality and physical frontiers. All embedded in a strong political and loving piece.



O PROJETO - um filme queer-futurista-punk
Ana chega em uma cidade no meio do Brasil levando as cinzas de seu irmão ativista e queer que acaba de ser assassinado. A fim de honrar a memória de seu irmão ela joga suas cinzas em uma bela cachoeira no lugar em que ele estava lutando para preservar. Quando Ana não é capaz de deixar a cidade, o espírito de seu irmão Sebastian aparece para ela. Resistindo à pressão de seu trabalho e esposa para voltar à São Paulo, Ana, acompanhada pelo fantasma de seu irmão, viaja através da Amazônia coletando a memória oral de seus ancestrais.
Em uma nota política, o personagem vai interagir com um forte problema de fronteiras que define a sociedade brasileira hoje dias. Onde as populações indígenas estão cada vez mais restritas de seus espaços e removidas da terra de seus ancestrais.
Em um filme híbrido entre ficção e documentário o personagem se depara com situações e pessoas que mudam seu destino e fazem Ana questionar sua própria identidade.
Quando você faz uma viagem como essa, você começa a descobrir seus diferentes eus. Não somos o reflexo do outro, e por causa disso o próprio outro? Ou nosso mundo particular é tão profundo e único que ele perde-se em seu próprio inconsciente?
Contando histórias de criaturas mitológicas, o filme terá uma característica mágica e irá explorar conceitos de poliamor, queer, sexualidade, espiritualidade e fronteiras físicas. Tudo incorporado em uma obra fortemente política e amorosa.
MEET US - NOS CONHEÇA

THAIS GUISASOLA







Thais, with all my heart and love for the world!Thais Guisasola, é formada em Cinema e Filosofia Política pela Hampshire College, em Massachusetts, E.U.A, defendeu a tese Corpos Imaginários, sobre como a opressão de determinadas identidades remove-as da categoria de humanos perante a sociedade. Em Cuba em 2010, iniciou sua carreira como cineasta com o curta-metragem Ventanas para tus Colores, ganhador do prêmio de melhor filme no Festival de Cinema de MA.  Ministrou workshops de roteiro e vídeo para adolescentes de baixa renda da ONG Casas Taiguara de Cultura em SP. Pós-graduada em roteiro de ficção Thais desenvolve o roteiro de longa-metragem A Chave de Casa, produzido pela Andara Filmes, Camila Groch e Camila Pitanga. Pelo projeto ganhou o edital de desenvolvimento de roteiro pelo FSA - ANCINE no Brasil.SIMON(È) PAETAUAnd yes, Simon(è)! Anywhere, everywhere I am up to all beauty in life!Simon(è) J. Paetau has a German father and a Colombian mother. Simon(è) studied at the International Film School Cuba, EICTV and graduated with the film Cruising in High Heels from the Academy of Media Arts Cologne (KHM). Their shortfilm MILA CAOS was invited to several International Film Festivals including Cannes, MoMA and Rotterdam. They have won several awards, including the German Human Rights Film Prize 2008 for OURY JALLOH. Simon(è) co-curated as part of the (heidy) collective the exhibitionWhat is queer today is not queer tomorrow at nGbK Berlin. Currently Simon(è) is developing their First Feature Film Lacrimosa supported by the Résidence du Festival de Cannes and premiered recently their first performance/theater piece Gritty Glamour at Ballhaus Naunynstrasse, Berlin. Other shortfilms and Projects: Lua Verde, Refugee Strike and Beyond, Queer and Beyond, Oury Jalloh etc.TOGETHER - JUNTOSYes! We have been good friends for quite a while, and have been collaborating in our films since 2010. Respect, good connection and the passion for the same subjects makes us great working partners! Since 2010 we have been planning to work on a road film project, and the time HAS COME!We are mixing our passion for social justice, film and the mixture of languages and nationalities in a beautiful piece that will let surface many of our inquires and love for the themes.We are both Hybrid in our own ways, divided identities, questions of gender roles, sexuality and moving around in between borders.You can check out a previous film we made together in 2010. LUA VERDE And you can also check a bit about our own work as artists and filmmakers! Simon(è) PaetauSim! Temos sido bons amigos por um bom tempo, e colaboramos em filmes desde 2010. Respeito, boa conexão e a paixão pelos mesmos assuntos nos faz grandes parceiros de trabalho! Desde 2010 planejamos esse projeto e chegou o momento! Estamos misturando a nossa paixão por justiça social,  cinema e a mistura de línguas e nacionalidades em uma bela obra que irá trazer para a superfície muitos das nossas perguntas sobre esses temas. Somos ambos híbridos em nossas próprias maneiras, identidades múltiplas, questionamentos de papéis de gênero, sexualidade e deslocamento por fronteiras.Você pode assistir um filme que fizemos juntos em 2010. LUA VERDE. Assim como um pouco de nossos trabalhos pessoais como artistas e cineastas! Simon(è) PaetauWHERE IS THE MONEY GOING TO - ONDE VAI O DINHEIROFor our project to happen we are trying to go for 12,000 dollars, this will cover our basic production costs and we will be able to make this trip happen. However we will still need support for post-production.Para o nosso projeto acontecer estamos tentando chegar no 12.000 dólares, isso irá cobrir nossos custos básicos de produção e que será capaz de custear esta viagem. No entanto, ainda precisaremos de apoio para a pós-produção.FOLLOW OUR JOURNEY - NOS SIGAYES! It is a long and beautiful way! We are starting on the red spot near BRASÍLIA and going all the way up to the Amazon. As you can see we have two different ending possibilities. One will end in BOGOTÁ, Colombia and the other ends in RIO BRANCO Acre in Brazil. Both are interesting for the film, but it depends on our final budget. They both have very different costs.Feel free to ask us things about the trip before or after we have done it, we will be happy to give you advices if you plan on doing the same thing!SIM! É uma maneira longa e bela! Estamos começando a mancha vermelha perto de Brasília e indo todo o caminho até a Amazônia. Como você pode ver, temos duas possibilidades de finalização diferentes. Uma terminará em Bogotá, na Colômbia e as outras extremidades em Rio Branco Acre no Brasil. Ambos são interessantes para o filme, mas isso depende do nosso orçamento final. Ambos têm custos muito diferentes.Sinta-se livre para nos perguntar coisas sobre a viagem antes ou depois de ter feito isso, teremos o maior prazer de lhe dar conselhos, se você está pensando em fazer a mesma coisa!LOOK INSIDE - POR DENTROHere are some of the pictures from the places we will visit in this journey!Aqui estão algumas fotos dos lugares que iremos visitar nesta viagem!POLITICAL ISSUES - QUESTÕES POLÍTICAS

Some of the really important political issues we want to document in our film!

As a practitioner myself, carried on by my ancestors. I hope to be a voice that advocates for the space of this religious practice that suffers a lot of prejudice in Brazil.
Práticas espirituais
Como praticante, conectada com meus antepassados. Eu espero ser uma voz que defende  o espaço desta prática religiosa que sofre muito preconceito no Brasil.

Questões Queer
Como pessoas queer, planejamos apresentar conceitos não-ocidentais da identidades queer. Com o personagem principal desafiando a idéia de definições normalizadas a respeito da sexualidade e gênero, vamos explorar os conceitos de poliamor, gênero e queer em comunidades não ocidentais.
FIERCE!!! Just like how we are gonna make this happen!





Indigenous land
The need for the protection of indigenous population's land. Many indigenous populations have being kicked out of their land violently. There needs to be space for resisting voices, and we hope our film can be an ally to their struggle to survive and live with dignity on their ancestors' land.

Terra indígena
A necessidade de proteção de terras da população indígena. Muitas populações indígenas são expulsas de sua terra violentamente. É preciso haver espaço para vozes de resistência, e nós esperamos que nosso filme possa ser um aliado para a luta de sobreviver e viver com dignidade na terra de seus ancestrais.

story:
I am hoping to raise some money for a good friend of mine, whose family has had a bit of a rough time over the last couple of years.

In 2013 Doreen, Lyn’s mother, was very unwell and spent a couple of months in Lincoln County Hospital. Lyn visited on a daily basis, often staying by her mum’s bed for large parts of the day. There was also more than one occasion when Lyn was summoned from home due to staff feeling Doreen may not last the night. Fortunately, Doreen did pull through, but still had hard times ahead…

Later that same year, the family received news that Lyn’s estranged brother, Gary, had died suddenly at his home in Germany. Gary was in his mid-fifties. He went upstairs to use the bathroom, and never returned.  He had a fatal heart attack.

In 2014, Lyn’s other brother, Michael, was diagnosed with Leukaemia. Michael underwent months of gruelling treatments and tests. He is currently in remission, but still not in the best of health.

Most recently, and this is what triggered me to start a crowd-funding appeal, Lyn herself has spent a week in hospital as she was unable to keep food down. After a barrage of tests, Lyn has now been informed that she has a hiatus hernia, accompanied by a malignant tumour. The tumour has been identified as a type of stomach cancer. Gastric Adenocarcinoma is its given name.

Inevitably, this diagnosis means that further tests and treatments will follow, and what I hope to achieve is some funding to assist with the ongoing costs associated with hospital treatment in rural areas such as Gainsborough:

• Fuel and other vehicular costs for transportation to and from Lincoln or Nottingham, or wherever else Lyn may be called to in order to best address her medical needs. Including car parking charges, which can add up to quite a bit over a number of visits.

• Refreshments etc. for the time spent in waiting rooms prior to appointments.

• Internet access, magazines, etc. to while away the hours in hospital wards during assessments and treatments.

• The means to keep paying the household bills and buying groceries, as this must continue despite ill health.

• Little treats at Lyn’s own discretion, to help raise morale.

Lyn’s father passed away as a result of cancer some 15 years ago, and the family have also lost a good friend to this most heinous of afflictions. Of course, these memories will not be far from any family member as they support Lyn through the difficult times to come.

There are all manner of good causes, both nationally, and globally, and I realise there is always an army of people asking for donations, but if anyone can spare a little something to help Lyn in her time of need, it would be gratefully received.

story:
This is not just a film, it is a donation to people suffering from PTSD. 
The film is being made NOT-FOR PROFIT and DONATED, FREE OF CHARGE to charities working with PTSD sufferers.

  • The Project:

'An Unbeaten Path' is a documentary film project with a difference.
It is a film that will give hope. 
It is a film that will educate.
It is a film that will enlighten.
It is a film that will engage.

The film documents the life of Andy Shaw, a former Royal Marine Captain who suffered from undiagnosed PTSD for 30 years after a terrible incident during the Falklands War and now runs a one-on-one experience to help PTSD sufferers begin their path to recovery.

It will focus on Andy's own tragic experiences and his 'PTSD life', but it will not be a depressing or gloomy documentary. 

This story is one of insight, experience, heartbreak, adventure, existence, solitude, and growth. It is a story that few people will find dull, told in a way that will help to peel back the layers of misunderstanding, often associated with mental health issues, and reveal true insight into what some people go through, and ultimately how they overcome it.

This is not a film with a political message or agenda, it is a film about honesty and character. It's purpose is to help people better understand the PTSD condition and offer hope and aspiration to those suffering, both now and in the future.

The film will be offered FREE of charge to charities working with PTSD sufferers in order to help them to understand that their is hope and that this terrible condition can be overcome.

  • Where your donation goes:

The film already has some private funding raised and this crowdfunding campaign has been set up to pay for some of the essential costs of the documentary. We are making the film very frugally but to the highest professional standards, and it is being run as a 'NOT FOR PROFIT' project, so Stitching Pictures is NOT making any money from it.

Funds raised will help to pay to send a small documentary team to various locations to capture the documentary's principal footage. The funds will also be used to help finance professional editing and colour grading to be applied to the film, making it more likely to be acquired by television channels and reach a larger audience. 

  • What you get in return:

We hope that giving to this documentary crowdfunding campaign is done out of benevolence, however, we also want to say thank you to those who do give. 

We aren't going to make a tonne of merchandise to give away, but we will give what we think our donors will appreciate, including:

  • Exclusive access to 'Behind the Scenes' footage and photographs
  • Free digital copies of the film
  • Official film credits 
  • The opportunity to meet the team and discuss the project
  • And other relevant thank you gifts

You also get the satisfaction of helping to create a film that could potentially save someones life, or be that first inspiration to make a change to their life. 

We are pretty sure that no 'gift' can match that!

More info and links:

If you would like to know more about the film or have any specific questions please get in touch with us at the below links, or visit our website. We are always interested in hearing from people and making new connections.

Don't forget to follow us on Twitter to and we will follow back.

Thanks for considering donating to this project, we hope, together, to make something really worthwhile.

Website : www.stitchingpictures.com

Twitter : @StitchPics

e-mail : info@stitchingpictures.com


Thank you for taking the time to look and thank you in advance for your donation!

story:
Hello friends and THANK YOU for visiting this page! You are appreciated! 
We are raising money to bring to life a great, fun film, to share with the world the talents of everyone involved and to build a foundation for our future creative entertainment.  This has been a 3 years development!

And to be CLEAR this video is a teaser that is meant more as a synopsis and NOT a trailer or concept reel.  That's what we need the funds for, to make it look AMAZING!

Xtracted is the first installment of a sci-fi, action, comedy, trilogy and a comic  journey of self discovery, self responsibility and self healing through gene manipulation through thought.  It also touches on the social issues of gun control and assisted suicide.  For a full synopsis and reviews of the script click here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/synopsis

What in the world are we trying to do here?? 

  • Our goal is to raise $375,000.  Or use wisely what we get! :D  Why the hefty price tag? Great question! The funds will be used to rent equipment, for shooting permits, insurance, building sets, to manufacture original vehicles, (https://vimeo.com/120099815) to be built by our famous friends at http://www.cinemavehicles.com.  To build a town made out of bicycles. To see some of the concepts please take a look at some of our storyboards here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/storyboards
  • We will also launch a beverage company featured in the film. WHAT? Think how Bubba Gump Shrimp is a real establishment, now? So will our beverage from the film!!  XL Energy Drink http://www.xl-energy.com not only came on board to help us but is an actual sponsor of this page! They will be providing perks with donations. :D Check out XL and some of our other partners here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/partners
  • We will need some major funds for visual effects.
  • To bring in A-List talent (the more we raise the bigger the the star we will be able to afford) and to make sure that all involved are paid for their talents and experience. Presently Ray Liotta has the script but is NOT confirmed.  Click here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/cast-crew to check out some of the AMAZINGLY talented cast and crew that have already come on board.
  • We have second money...maybe! Over the last 3 years, we established relationships with banks and financial institutions that will lend us money depending on how "Valuable" the female lead is that we can obtain.  Imagine Cate Blanchett as opposed to Betty Romo. Who? Exactly!
  • We also have trusted connections with domestic and foreign distribution but it has yet to be secured as again, we have to wait on the female lead to come on board.  A film is a business and we need to the start up money to get the train rolling that will roll on with 3 Xtracted films over 6 years!

What you will get?

  • Because we're trying to raise so much capital, we wanted to limit the amount of expenditure that we dole out, so, we're offering private passwords to a few very short films that we produced that are getting some Hollywood buzz.  We ask that you DO NOT share the password but rather share "How you obtained it" :D  at least until for the duration of the campaign then you can share them like mad! 
  • A couple of great song downloads from our talented friends.
  • Our friends at XL Energy Drink will be providing a little "taste of awesome" with a couple of perks. http://www.xl-energy.com
  • VIBES OF Y.A.G.O.O.Y! What the?? Vibes is a book from the film that has replaced all written moral codes. In the Xtracted story it has outlasted the Bible, the Torah, the Quran and even 50 Shades of Grey!
  • A DVD of the film when it's completed.
  • And this film is going to need A LOT of extras in the background! 

What if I can't contribute?

We absolutely understand that some are just not in a place to contribute. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • First, email or call those close to you and share or campaign with them. Use your email or facebook address book as you never know who Xtracted might appeal to or who might be able to help.
  • You can share our facebook status', personally and from the film's page.  http://www.facebook.com/getxtracted We'd appreciate a retweet on our twitter posts.http://www.twitter.com/getxtracted Or share our Instagram http://www.instagram.com/xtractedthemovie
  • Please also feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We are also looking for more sponsors from large corporations for product placement that can actually subsidize the budget. Do you know of anyone that would like to have their name on the Jitter Lift? :D
Thank you again for taking the time and being part of this journey.  Please know that by contributing you are apart of the Xtracted family forever!  As is everyone that helped out in the past and continues to assist.

We will also launch a beverage company featured in the 
film. WHAT? Think how Bubba Gump Shrimp is a real establishment, now? So will our beverage from the film!!  XL Energy Drink http://www.xl-energy.com not only came on board to help us but is an actual sponsor of this page! They will be providing perks with donations. :D Check out XL and some of our other partners here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/partners

We will need some major funds for visual effects. 

To bring in A-List talent (the more we raise the 
bigger the the star we will be able to afford) and to make sure that all
 involved are paid for their talents and experience. Presently Ray Liotta has the script but is NOT confirmed.  Click here http://www.xtractedthemovie.com/cast-crew to check out some of the AMAZINGLY talented cast and crew that have already come on board.
We have second money...maybe! Over the last 3 years, we established relationships with banks and financial institutions that will lend us money depending on how "Valuable" the female lead is that we can obtain.  Imagine Cate Blanchett as opposed to Betty Romo. Who? Exactly!

We also have trusted connections with domestic and foreign distribution but it has yet to be secured as again, we have to wait on the female lead to come on board.  A film is a business and we need to the start up money to get the train rolling that will roll on with 3 Xtracted films over 6 years!

What you will get? 
Because we're trying to raise so much capital, we wanted to limit the amount of expenditure that we dole out, so, we're offering private passwords to a few very short films that we produced that are getting some Hollywood buzz.  We ask that you DO NOT share the password but rather share "How you obtained it" :D  at least until for the duration of the campaign then you can share them like mad! 
A couple of great song downloads from our talented friends. 

Our friends at XL Energy Drink will be providing a little "taste of awesome" with a couple of perks.  http://www.xl-energy.com 

VIBES OF Y.A.G.O.O.Y! What the?? Vibes is a book from the film that has replaced all written moral codes. In the Xtracted story it has outlasted the Bible, the Torah, the Quran and even 50 Shades of Grey!
A DVD of the film when it's completed. 

And this film is going to need A LOT of extras in the background!  


 What if I can't contribute?We absolutely understand that some are just not in a place to contribute. Here are some other ways you can help:

First, email or call those close to you and share or campaign with them. Use your email or facebook address book as you never know who Xtracted might appeal to or who might be able to help. 

You can share our facebook status', personally and from the film's page.  http://www.facebook.com/getxtracted We'd appreciate a retweet on our twitter posts.http://www.twitter.com/getxtracted Or share our Instagram http://www.instagram.com/xtractedthemovie

Please also feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!
We are also looking for more sponsors from large corporations for product placement that can actually subsidize the budget. Do you know of anyone that would like to have their name on the Jitter Lift? :D

Thank you again for taking the time and being part of this journey.  Please know that by contributing you are apart of the Xtracted family forever!  As is everyone that helped out in the past and continues to assist.

story:
What is Scratch Impressions?

Scratch Impressions is a message told in the form of photography, sharing the world and some positive thoughts.  Dabbling in many forms and styles of visual art, traveling to different places only comes hand and hand, it's how we learn. As a recent Film Grad my next step is moving out to Colorado to work in the beautiful outdoors and with the local businesses and artists. Helping the little guy.

Winter Park, FL

The Specifics

Driving from Orlando, Florida to Colorado is going to be a little bit of a trek. Pushing a 2000+ mile trip, stopping at multiple locations in each state along the way is going to take a little help from my friends. States being FL, GA, TN, KY, IL, MO, KS, CO. With your help I can rent a vehicle and trailer to make the move and photograph nature's finest along the way.

Blood Mountain, GA

Rt 49 to Waterville Valley, NH

The Trip

I'll be stopping at every opportunity to take the perfect photo. Stopping at state parks and major cities I'll be capturing an evolutionary trip of a lifetime. Equipped with my DSLR, 35mm camera's and a 600 Film Polaroid I'll be taking one of a kind photos. Especially the Polaroid! Let's keep these old formats alive! 

Cocoa Beach, FL

The Challenge

Going to live in a completley new area can be intimidating especially with scarce resources. Living somewhere you have never been before isn't that easy, especially at the start. That's why I'm asking for your help in taking my photography on the road. I don't want to just take from all of you wonderful people I want to give back too! Are you somewhere along my route, in one of the states I'll be traveling? We can work together! 

Squatch Brand, Blood Mountain, GA

No Money, No Problem!

Don't have any money to help contribute that is no problem what so ever. You can help out just by checking out my photos and sharing any you like. Want to offer more? Any advice for my trip, places to see or eat? Have a couch for me to crash on or a meal you'd love to share? Don't allow me to sleep in the car every night!

Cady Way Bridge, Winter Park, FL
