story:
As a filmmaker I believe that films should focus beyond the realm of story and characters, and should be the medium of dramatization of ideas and arguments. Movies tend to be more timeless when that’s done because they don’t become prisoners of the period they’re made.

In the midst of its sometimes absurdist and often times nostalgic and romantic revenge story, I AM JOE is about the dichotomy between the strength of faith and taking charge of your destiny, because you believe in what’s beyond the darkness versus the weakness in rationality and becoming a victim of circumstances, due to fear. Hence, in essence, I AM JOE is about the plight that most artists feel, but told in an entertaining way.

This movie was shot for about ten weeks, only on weekends, with a very small crew and cast. We had very little resources as well. Though it is an experience that will hopefully never need to be repeated, it’s something that I will forever cherish. The bonds, the memories, the lessons learned all occurred because of such a unique situation we've been fortunate enough to experience. It was a labor of love for everyone involved and I’m eternally grateful for them being a part of the dream.

Despite the painful process to get the film done and whatever flaws it might have, it’s something I'm proud of. I hope that it becomes an example to young  filmmakers that with hard work, some ingenuity and being oblivious to what can, and will go wrong, you’ll beat the odds and make a feature film.

Meet Joe. An NYU Quantum Physics professor with an ordinary life. Joe wakes up every morning and takes medication before going to work. This is his daily routine, until it's ruined by Nacho, the leader of a Kaballah conspiracy gang in Los Angeles.

One night, Nacho breaks into Joe’s apartment and drugs him. Afterward, Joe dreams of being in a desert and confronting Jack who bears a striking resemblance to Joe...

The next morning, Joe wakes up and his medication doesn’t work as well. During class he starts to feel strong headaches and passes out. Eventually it dawns on him what has happened and he decides to pay Nacho a visit...

The film is a revenge flick, but more complex than many others of its kind in that it includes Jewish mysticism, Quantum Physic theories, and a bunch of other really nerdy things. Oh, and a Peta joke.


Exhibit A:


(Yeah, we weren't kidding. +1 for dad humor.)


PEDRO BARON


A jack-of-all-trades, Pedro is the Director, Writer, Executive Producer and Editor of the film. This is his first feature length film and his most ambitious project to date. The idea of the film came to Pedro after his experiences as a film student at the School of Visual Arts in NYC and during his time in Los Angeles. Pedro originally hails from Brazil, but moved to Texas with his family when he was child. His many experiences in those places and his diverse background have shaped his view of the world. Film has played an integral part of his world view as well. He's drawn from his inspirations from Sergio Leone to Woody Allen to Kim Jee-woon. Although Pedro is  young and green, he's got several short film projects and commercials under his belt. He's also written three feature length scripts; one of which is in development.


TANAYA RIVERS


During their time at School of Visual Arts, Pedro and Tanaya bonded over their love for film. Tanaya specialized in line producing and editing at SVA. While still in school, she had the opportunity to learn from many Film Producers as an intern and worked on her first feature film, Broken City. It was then that she grew more and more fascinated by producing. For several years Tanaya continued to work in post production at companies like Viacom and NBC Universal, but her passion for producing still lingered. The opportunity to finally produce her own feature film came when Pedro approached her about a year ago with the intention of making an ambitious, but low budget indie film entitled I AM JOE. It was then that Tanaya took on that task of scheduling, budgeting, and being a liaison between the director's creative vision and all the muddy details of the film business.


LAURENT MALAQUAIS 


You may recognize that face...that's because he stars in the role as Joe, but he's also our multi-gifted Associate Producer. When he's not looking fabulous on camera, he's producing his own projects. He's produced over 10 films and some television series as part of the Producer's Guild of America. He's currently working on his documentary film AMERICAN JEDI about real-life Jedi. Several of his projects have been in film festivals such as Cannes Film Festival in France. Laurent attended the prestigious film institute at USC and is part of the Group 101 Filmmakers Alliance. 


ZOLTAN SANDORS


With a keen eye for the aesthetics of film, Zoltan gravitated to cinemtography early on and has since directed, produced, and shot several short films of his own including his most recent film ALIEN JACK HUNTER. He worked on I AM JOE as both the Director of Photography and Associate Producer. He excels at creating deep, rich imagery whilst working very closely with the director to create a picture as close to the vision as possible.

The film is nearly complete, but our biggest hurdle thus far has been trying to get money to fund for some of our post production expenses. We need re-recording in outside scenes that don't sound too great and sweetening of the sound altogether. In addition to that, we also need someone who can compose an original soundtrack because as much as we'd like to pay for rights and clearances for cool music that you can hear on the radio, that's a lot of money. A more affordable alternative is hiring a talented composer to create original music. Sound is at least 50% of the film so without good sound it would ruin its value.   

The other part of our funding campaign is marketing and distribution. We want people to be able to see the finished product with mastered sound, color, visual effects, and music on the big screen. With that comes the necessity to travel both locally and internationally to screen at film festivals across the world. Things like festival submission fees and travel expenses can be pricey, so we've allotted some room in our budget for those.

Post Production expenses include:

   •  RE-RECORDING VOCALS/ADR
   •  SOUND EDITING/MIX
   •  SOUND EFFECT PURCHASES
   •  ORIGINAL MUSIC SCORE

Marketing and Distribution expenses include: 

   •  FESTIVAL SUBMISSION FEES
   •  DELIVERABLES (DVD'S, PRESS  BOOK, SHIPPING COSTS)

   •  OUTREACH
   •  FESTIVAL TRAVEL & LIVING
  •  MOVIE POSTERS



The following are estimates based on our budget.


If we don't reach our goal, all the money that is earned through here will go to any immediate post production and distribution expenses, however every amount accounted for here is needed to get the film completed and seen. Since this is a donation, you won't be receiving any earnings back from the film, but you will be receiving the perks on the side if you so choose and you will have our sincere gratitude.


STRETCH IT OUT

Stretch goals are basically the goals beyond our current goal. Since the present goal is primarily for post production and marketing, any money that surpasses the current goal will then be used to pay for expensive things like legal fees.

We've been lucky in that all our talented cast and crew have worked on deferred basis, but we'd love to pay them. They've put in many hours of their time shooting and on top of that, they have day jobs! They've done so much to help get this film made, and they all deserve to be compensated for their efforts. This is why any money received past our goal, will go to Cast and Crew first and foremost.


SPREAD THE WORD

If you can't donate any money, the best way you can help is by spreading the word about the film and our indiegogo campaign. If you can donate, then please also spread the word! The more people that are aware of this, the better chance we have at reaching our goal.

THAT'S ALL FOLKS (For now)

Questions, concerns, comments? Contact us at iamjoefilm@gmail.com or @iamjoefilm on Twitter and we'd be happy to answer anything that hasn't been covered here.

Please be sure to follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and eventually we'll be putting up a YouTube page for video updates.  We will also keep our indiegogo page current with any new updates as the campaign progresses. If you've managed to get this far reading, thank you and if not, thank you anyway.

story:
El objetivo de ésta campaña es reunir el dinero suficiente para realizar un proyecto  de calidad y distribuirlo por los principales festivales internacionales.


Vamos a rodar un cortometraje en clave de comedia con un reparto de primer nivel. Dirigido y escrito por Juanma Díaz para éste proyecto contamos con grandes actores como Manuel Tallafé, Pepe Quintos, Antonio Melendez Peso, Sergio Hurtado y la queridísima María Luis.


Éste proyecto tiene como objetivo haceros pasar un buen rato.

¿Qué digo buen rato? Que os riais como animales.

Estamos rodeados de un gran equipo técnico y humano que garantizará un gran trabajo con el cual podremos disfrutar tanto los profesionales que hemos trabajado en el proyecto como el público que quiere disfrutar de una divertida historia.



Resumen

Con vuestra ayuda queremos crear una gran comedia y difundirla por los principales festivales internacionales.

  • Aporta lo que puedas.
  • Y si no puedes hacer una aportación economica, ayudanos a difundir ésta campaña.

story:
BY:

ArtisTree Productions is an award-winning group of filmmakers from Atlanta, Ga. We created our first short film, Red River Ode, in 2013 for the 2nd Annual Louisiana Film Prize and exceeded all expectations when we placed in the initial Top 20 and consequently 4th Place over-all with only a mere $700.00 budget. We won a $3,000.00 grant through the Founders Circle Award which led to our second short film, The Ninth, which once again placed in the Top 20 for the 2014 Louisiana Film Prize and is currently in the festival circuit.

In 2014 we gave everything we had to producing The Ninth in order to make it the film it needed to be. Unfortunately, the entire budget was financed through out of pocket expenses from us, the filmmakers, as we did not have the cash on-hand to pay towards the grant. We went broke, lost our jobs and jeopardized our relationships to make the film happen. This time we're taking the crowdfunding route in order to make Beaumont not only the best it can be, but a film that invests into the people who support it and to the community it seeks to help.

Below you will learn what Beaumont is, why it's a story that needs to be told and how you can help to make it a reality.


Beaumont is the story of Katie Blackwell, a teenage girl struggling to come to terms with herself after she and her friends bullied another girl to suicide and the media frenzy that comes after. 

Beaumont is first and foremost a story of self-acceptance. A serious issue across not only the United States, but the world, bullying affects millions of people every day. It has traditionally been represented from the victims' point of view, often times with a schoolmate who taunts and teases. 

But Beaumont is a story from the point of view that hasn't been told. Don't get it wrong, no part of Beaumont will justify bullying. But every aspect of bullying should be explored in order to understand not just the bully themselves, but the environment that creates them. 

Furthermore, Beaumont is an eye-opening story about a girl who made a mistake and has to deal with the aftermath of the wrongs she has committed.



                                      

                                        

In order to be successful, Beaumont will require funds to be used in multiple facets. 

  • Production Costs will cover items such as equipment rentals, professional crew, insurance, location usage contracts and more.
  • Promotions cover advertisements such as t-shirts, ad-space, fliers and more in order to spread Beaumont as far as it can reach.
  • Post Production funds will be used for music composition, licensing, film editing, color correction and more. 
  • Festival Circuit funds will allow the completed film to be entered in as many respected film festivals as possible. There, Beaumont will garner multiple Official Selections and awards, allowing it to reach the largest possible audience.

    All funds will be spent in the community of Shreveport, Louisiana - a fast-              growing and bustling art and film community in Northwest Louisiana!

Beaumont cannot be made without you! Whether or you donate $100 or even $1, every single bit helps. Your donation means a few things:

  • You support Indie Films!
  • You support the anti-bullying movement!
  • You support our dreams!
You can help make Beaumont a reality. Films can reach audiences far and wide and are a powerful way inform and ignite change. Beaumont will powerfully further the anti-bullying movement and share it's message across the world!
                                            BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE!
For every donation starting at $5, you'll get a perk; a prize from US to YOU to thank you for helping us make this film! 
$5.00 DONATION - A thank you from us via our social media
                                                        
We'll plaster your name and thanks on our Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and more!

$20.00 DONATION - A sneak-peek of the film before it's release!

                                                      

You'll get a thanks from us PLUS a sneak-peek at the film and the making-of first!

$50.00 DONATION - An Exclusive Beaumont T-Shirt

        

A thanks, a sneak-peek AND a t-shirt? Sounds great, right?! Because it is!

$75.00 DONATION - A signed DVD copy of the Film

                                                   

After the film premiers, you'll get an exclusive DVD, T-Shirt, sneak-peek and thanks!

$100.00 DONATION - A ticket to the Louisiana Film Prize + Your Money Back

Watch Beaumont with us if and when it premiers at the 2015 Louisiana Film Prize! On top of that, if we win the $50,000 Top Prize, we'll pay you $100 plus an extra 20 bucks! Includes all previous perks as well!

$250.00 DONATION - Signed poster by the cast and crew 

First of all, we make awesome posters (see above). Secondly, you can own a signed copy of the upcoming Beaumont poster along with all other previous perks! You know you want one! 

$500.00 DONATION -  Passes to The Louisiana Film Prize + Executive Producer

                                           

You'll help make indie-film history. No matter what, you'll receive a real production credit as Executive Producer on the film and IMDb as Beaumont is seen by audiences the world over! Includes all other previous perks!

$1000.00 DONATION - You'll be a Producer +Your Money Back again!

                    

A donation of $1000.00 or more will net you all previous perks, as well as the coveted Producer Credit on the film and IMDb. You'll be paid $1000.00 directly from us if we win the grand prize at the Louisiana Film Prize and, no matter what, you'll receive a percentage of profit from the film once it's released and distributed. You'll be able to join us on our journey to make indie-film history and bring Beaumont to the world! Includes all other previous perks as well!

SUPER PERK - $2500.00 DONATION OR MORE - CONNOISSEUR

If you donate $2500.00 or more, the director will PERSONALLY draw or paint a mural on a wall or large canvas! You pick the subject and he'll make it happen! Just check out this 10' x 10' floor-drawing he did to see for yourself! Includes all other previous perks as well! 

     


                                ^^Check out the photos in this Flickr album!^^

                   CAN'T DONATE, BUT STILL WANT TO HELP? YOU CAN!

Sharing is powerful. Via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and more you can help make Beaumont a reality by sharing it with your friends! Know someone you think might be interested in helping to end bullying or even funding a movie? Let 'em know!

                               

                                           Here are some helpful hashtags! 

                   #Beaumont #BeaumontMovie #LouisianaFilmPrize #LAFP  


First of all, thank you. Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign and even think about donating. Our dream is to make great films that do great things, and Beaumont can do just that. Without you, we'll never make it! 

So what's next? Hopefully we'll reach our goal and Beaumont will be made. Filmmaking is a tough road, but it's our passion and our dream and we absolutely will NOT let you down!

Beaumont will get made and hopefully premiere at the 2015 Louisiana Film Prize. It will share the message and story of Katie Blackwell across the world. Will you help us make this journey?

Thank you from the Beaumont Team!

J. Colby Doler - Writer/Director

Corey Hammett - Producer

Trevor Norred - Producer

Taylor Bracewell - Production Coordinator
story_txt:
BY:ArtisTree Productions is an award-winning group of filmmakers from Atlanta, Ga. We created our first short film, Red River Ode, in 2013 for the 2nd Annual Louisiana Film Prize and exceeded all expectations when we placed in the initial Top 20 and consequently 4th Place over-all with only a mere $700.00 budget. We won a $3,000.00 grant through the Founders Circle Award which led to our second short film, The Ninth, which once again placed in the Top 20 for the 2014 Louisiana Film Prize and is currently in the festival circuit.In 2014 we gave everything we had to producing The Ninth in order to make it the film it needed to be. Unfortunately, the entire budget was financed through out of pocket expenses from us, the filmmakers, as we did not have the cash on-hand to pay towards the grant. We went broke, lost our jobs and jeopardized our relationships to make the film happen. This time we're taking the crowdfunding route in order to make Beaumont not only the best it can be, but a film that invests into the people who support it and to the community it seeks to help.Below you will learn what Beaumont is, why it's a story that needs to be told and how you can help to make it a reality.Beaumont is the story of Katie Blackwell, a teenage girl struggling to come to terms with herself after she and her friends bullied another girl to suicide and the media frenzy that comes after. 
Beaumont is first and foremost a story of self-acceptance. A serious issue across not only the United States, but the world, bullying affects millions of people every day. It has traditionally been represented from the victims' point of view, often times with a schoolmate who taunts and teases. 
But Beaumont is a story from the point of view that hasn't been told. Don't get it wrong, no part of Beaumont will justify bullying. But every aspect of bullying should be explored in order to understand not just the bully themselves, but the environment that creates them. 
Furthermore, Beaumont is an eye-opening story about a girl who made a mistake and has to deal with the aftermath of the wrongs she has committed.




                                      
                                        
In order to be successful, Beaumont will require funds to be used in multiple facets. 



Production Costs will cover items such as equipment rentals, professional crew, insurance, location usage contracts and more.


Promotions cover advertisements such as t-shirts, ad-space, fliers and more in order to spread Beaumont as far as it can reach.


Post Production funds will be used for music composition, licensing, film editing, color correction and more. 


Festival Circuit funds will allow the completed film to be entered in as many respected film festivals as possible. There, Beaumont will garner multiple Official Selections and awards, allowing it to reach the largest possible audience.


    All funds will be spent in the community of Shreveport, Louisiana - a fast-              growing and bustling art and film community in Northwest Louisiana!


Beaumont cannot be made without you! Whether or you donate $100 or even $1, every single bit helps. Your donation means a few things:


You support Indie Films!


You support the anti-bullying movement!


You support our dreams!


You can help make Beaumont a reality. Films can reach audiences far and wide and are a powerful way inform and ignite change. Beaumont will powerfully further the anti-bullying movement and share it's message across the world!
                                            BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE!
For every donation starting at $5, you'll get a perk; a prize from US to YOU to thank you for helping us make this film! 
$5.00 DONATION - A thank you from us via our social media
                                                        
We'll plaster your name and thanks on our Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and more!

$20.00 DONATION - A sneak-peek of the film before it's release!
                                                      
You'll get a thanks from us PLUS a sneak-peek at the film and the making-of first!




$50.00 DONATION - An Exclusive Beaumont T-Shirt


        

A thanks, a sneak-peek AND a t-shirt? Sounds great, right?! Because it is!
$75.00 DONATION - A signed DVD copy of the Film

                                                   
After the film premiers, you'll get an exclusive DVD, T-Shirt, sneak-peek and thanks!

$100.00 DONATION - A ticket to the Louisiana Film Prize + Your Money Back



Watch Beaumont with us if and when it premiers at the 2015 Louisiana Film Prize! On top of that, if we win the $50,000 Top Prize, we'll pay you $100 plus an extra 20 bucks! Includes all previous perks as well!

$250.00 DONATION - Signed poster by the cast and crew 




First of all, we make awesome posters (see above). Secondly, you can own a signed copy of the upcoming Beaumont poster along with all other previous perks! You know you want one! 

$500.00 DONATION -  Passes to The Louisiana Film Prize + Executive Producer

story:
From award-winning filmmakers, William Tyler Smith and Kurt Feldhun, comes a feature length rock 'n' roll documentary about the Flamin' Groovies, a colorful and highly influential rock band that had some big hits in the 70's, but met with an untimely and difficult break up in the early 80's.  

Although the Flamin' Groovies had all the makings for a successful career and famous fans like Rock Hudson, Eartha Kitt, Val Kilmer and The Rolling Stones, life seemed to conspire against them and they never quite made it. Since then, however, their songs Slow Death, Shake Some Action and Teenage Head, have been heard on motion picture soundtracks such as Clueless and numerous CD compilations. Shake Some Action is the first song featured in the new book, The History of Rock 'N' Roll in Ten Songs by legendary music journalist Greil Marcus and recently VH1 placed Shake Some Action on their 20 Essential Power Pop Tracks of All Time at #7. The Groovies have also been called the "Godfathers of Punk Rock" and many bands such as The Dictators, Cracker, The Plimsouls and Yo La Tengo have done Groovies' covers. According to Marianne Faithful, the Groovies' album, Teenage Head, was Mick Jagger and Keith Richard's favorite album at the time it came out in 1971. 

The Flamin' Groovies are "the biggest band you've never heard of" …until now.


THE FILM

Our film will take the viewer on a wild journey through the world of the Flamin' Groovies with a behind the scenes and backstage portrayal of their comeback, the new recording sessions and each band member's personal lives. We will capture all of their antics, stories, and general madness. We'll cover the ins and outs, the ups and the downs of life with the Flamin' Groovies. And of course, we'll cover the Groovies' colorful history leading up to their difficult break up.


Cyril, Chris and George are fascinating and intelligent characters. They are unpredictable and still think they are in their early twenties. Who knows what's bound to happen?


If you liked Anvil, Searching for Sugarman, and Spinal Tap you're gonna love this one even more!


WHAT WE'VE ACCOMPLISHED 

We have already begun the rough edit and in addition to the above IndieGoGo trailer, we have completed these following trailers:

   

    -Japan Trailer: https://vimeo.com/115098669

    -Meet The Flamin' Groovies: https://vimeo.com/97155756

    -Short Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VEa5SUHQ91w


The end is in sight. Our first, second, third, fourth, fifth and sixth phases of production have now been completed.

PHASE 1: Northeastern Tour/Studio/Oakland Gig

  • Tour dates in Hoboken, Cleveland, Washington D.C., Boston, Brooklyn and Oakland.
  • The Groovies in the studio recording their soon-to-be-released new album. We captured the creative process and chemistry between the band members. The new songs really rock.
  • Revealing and emotional interviews with band members
  • The Groovies exploring Washington, D.C.
  • Backstage and behind-the-scenes at the shows
  • Interviews with die-hard fans
  • Life on the road from one gig to the next


PHASE 2:  Southern Tour

  • Tour dates in New Orleans, Austin, Houston, Dallas and Memphis
  • Backstage before and after the shows
  • The Groovies hanging in their hotel rooms
  • Graceland with Cyril Jordan
  • Interviews with fans
  • Band members discussing history of band
  • Life on the road


PHASE 3: Major interviews in New York City

  • Seymour Stein, founder of Sire Records (signed The Ramones, Talking Heads, Madonna, Flamin' Groovies, etc.)
  • Greil Marcus, Rolling Stone Magazine journalist and author of The History of Rock 'n' Roll in Ten Songs (The Groovie's song, Shake Some Action, is the first chapter of the book)
  • Ivan Julian, guitarist, Richard Hell and The Voidoids
  • Chris Such, guitarist, The Headless Horsemen
  • Additional interviews with various musicians and fans


PHASE 4:  Tokyo, Japan

The footage is so many things: entertaining, insightful, absurd, hysterical, surreal, intelligent and enlightening.

  • Two shows at Club Seata
  • Backstage before and after the shows
  • Interviews with Japanese rock 'n' roll bands influenced by the Groovies
  • Interviews with fans
  • Groovies interviews
  • Groovies in their hotel rooms
  • Groovies on the streets of Tokyo
  • Groovies interacting with fans
  • Autograph signing. Meet and greet.


PHASE 5:  San Francisco II

  • Interview with Cyril at home and the Filmore West
  • Additional shooting of new studio recordings
  • Cyril at a magic shop
  • Interview with Barry Simons, the band's manager
  • Cyril at home performing magic and showing his collectibles and vintage toys.


PHASE 6:  Northwest Tour

  • Shows in Portland, Seattle and  Vancouver
  • Backstage before and after the shows
  • Additional band interviews
  • Additional fan interviews
  • Life on the road


GREAT NEWS!

We now have strong distributor and broadcaster interest and we've gotten some great international press including The Chicago Tribune, USA Today, BLURT Magazine, UW Daily, IMDB News and Screen Daily/Screen International. 

USA Today: http://www.usatoday.com/story/popcandy/2014/07/10/crowd-funding-art/12467913/

The UW Daily (see page 4):  http://www.thedaily.washington.edu/sites/default/files/pdf/140421%20Web_0.pdf

Rhino.com: http://www.rhino.com/article/kickstart-some-action-put-in-your-pledge-for-the-incredible-flamin-groovies

The Chicago Tribune: http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-flaming-groovies-cyril-jordan-shake-some-action-20140508,0,6979694.column

The Aquarian Weekly: http://www.theaquarian.com/2015/04/22/rant-n-roll-under-the-radar/ 

BLURT Magazine: http://blurtonline.com/news/flamin-groovies-documentary-works-wkickstarter-campaign/ 

Riffraf: http://www.riffraf.net/2014/04/the-biggest-band-you-never-heard-of/

Screen Daily/Screen International: http://www.screendaily.com/news/flamin-groovies-film-launches-kickstarter/5069938.article

IMDB News: http://www.imdb.com/news/ni56970670/

Creative Loafing Atlanta: http://clatl.com/atlanta/flamin-groovies-still-shakin-some-action/Content?oid=14065750

The Skinny - Vancouver: http://theskinnyvancouver.com/flamin-groovies/

Alton Telegraph: http://www.thetelegraph.com/news/lifestyle-local_features-news/1294501/Groovies-movie

Urban Milwaukee Dial: http://urbanmilwaukeedial.com/2014/04/music-finally-the-flamin-groovies/

KUSP 88.9: http://blogs.kusp.org/bergalert/2014/03/29/1897/

BLURT Magazine:  http://blurtonline.com/feature/a-big-footprint-...

MusicFilmWeb:  http://www.musicfilmweb.com/2014/04/flamin-groovies-music-documentary-crowdfunding/

American Standard Time: http://www.americanstandardtime.com/2014/04/10/the-flaming-groovies-are-back/ 

My Spilt Milk: http://myspiltmilk.com/flamin-groovies-cant-stop-shakin 


THE FILMMAKERS


The Flamin' Groovies story goes all the way back to 1965 when the band began in their hometown of San Francisco, California. Their first self-released 10-inch album called Sneakers sold well and caught the attention of Columbia Records, which signed them and released their first official album, Supersnazz on the Epic label.




 "Bill Graham hated our name. He thought we were gay or something. He said, ‘you gotta change your name.' That’s like telling Van Gogh that color don’t work.” Cyril Jordan


The Groovies continued to tour hard and record an impressive number of albums during the 1970's. In 1976, they released their biggest hit to date, Shake Some Action. The song hit 142 on Billboard's top 200 and years later was featured in the film Clueless.

"We were all, you know, basically just too stoned to continue. We needed to take a break. Everybody had cocaine-itis." Cyril Jordan

"It seemed like life was thwarting us at every turn and after ten years of living out of each others suitcases we just couldn't take it anymore and we cracked." Chris Wilson

The band went their separate ways and didn't speak over the next 30 years. George Alexander worked for the United States Postal Service for 25 years, Cyril Jordan started a band called Magic Christian and often held 3 jobs at once, and Chris Wilson joined the Barracudas and put out several solo albums. The clock was ticking, the years were passing when Cyril, Chris and George finally decided that it was time to let bygones be bygones and to continue exactly where they had left off that day in 1981 when they broke up.

"We were just so happy when we first saw each other. We just grabbed each other and gave each other a big hug and a kiss." Chris Wilson


"I made a promise with Cyril...that we would see this out together to the end. Now that we’re back together again, it’s almost as if we get a second chance to fulfill that promise." George Alexander

 "I'm getting a little too old to be doing this rock 'n' roll thing." Cyril Jordan

New drummer, Victor Penalosa, faithfully recreates the style heard on the classic recordings, while at the same time adding his own flavor. The foursome has gone into the studio to record brand new material as well as finish up some long lost recordings. They have begun playing shows again to enthusiastic fans both old and new. Fans have been delighted with what is being called "a dream set list," including original songs the band has never performed before onstage.


""This time around, it happened mostly because of the fans." Cyril Jordan

I thought one day we might get the kudos and attention that we all had craved. I hope that’s what’s happening now.” Chris Wilson

"Time and space don't affect us for some reason when we're together. It's like the day after we broke up in 1980." Cyril Jordan

We are pleased and honored to have music veteran, Joel Jaffe, on board who will supervise the audio recording and mixing, and will engineer and produce The Groovies latest album at Studio D in Sausalito, California. 

Joel has worked with such artists as Ray Manzarek, Roy Rogers, Carlos Santana, Ringo Starr, John Entwhistle, Indigo Girls, Huey Lewis & The News, Todd Rundren and The Call to name a few. Joel was also the engineer/sound mixer for the cult classic films Light Sleeper and Wave Twisters.


FLAMIN' GROOVIES ON THE WEB


The Incredible Flamin' Groovies Movie Website: http://www.grooviesmovie.com

Facebook Page For The Movie https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Incredible-Flamin-Groovies-Movie/660957357273508

Flamin' Groovies Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Flamin-Groovies/85760453541

Pavement PR: http://pavementpr.com/news/flamin-groovies-score-tons-great-tour-press/

Cyril Jordan Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Cyril-Jordan/104017466300915

Wikipedia:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flamin%27_Groovies

End of the World: http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/flamin-groovies-at-the-end-of-the-world-song-premiere-20131105

Shake Some Action: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2XXLQozrq1g

Slow Death: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EL3pP29N-Wc

You Tore Me Down: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXfsHztgH84

Tallahassee Lassie: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6hvNHazbwGI

Little Queenie: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6hvNHazbwGI

Roll Over Beethoven: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_PAr445CwM


FILMMAKER BIOGRAPHIES


William Tyler Smith

William Tyler Smith describes himself as a "very independent" documentary and fiction filmmaker based in New York City. Mr. Smith holds an MFA from the prestigious UCLA Graduate Film & Televsion School, the same school where Francis Ford Coppola, Paul Schrader and Alexander Payne were educated. To date, he has directed five feature films (4 documentaries and 1 fiction) and numerous short films across many different genres. His films have won awards at international festivals and have been broadcast, streamed and distributed on DVD all over the world. His narrative feature, KISS ME AGAIN, premiered at the 2006 Tribeca Film Festival and has sold internationally. Billy's first feature documentary, THE THIRD MIND, about the artistic collaboration of Doors keyboardist, Ray Manzarek and Beat Poet, Michael McClure premiered at the Venice International Film Festival and was broadcast on the Sundance Channel. His second documentary feature, IMAGINE A SCHOOL...SUMMERHILL, is enjoying a successful video-on-demand run.

He is currently in post-production on a film, THE THIRD MIND BLUES about Ray Manzarek and Roy Roger's creative collaboration, from songwriting to recording to live performances. Billy is also in development on two fiction feature length screenplays.

He is a passionate instructor of film directing at The New York Film Academy who believes in a "theo-practical" approach to filmmaking; one that is heavy "hands-on" but grounded in theory. Many of his students have gone on to direct feature films, win awards at film festivals and to have successful entertainment industry careers in their respective countries.  Billy was recently cited as one of the "15 Most Notable Art Professors in New York City," by The Art Career Project. 

Websites

  • Internet Movie Data Base (IMDB):  http://www.imdb.com/find?ref_=nv_sr_fn&q=william+tyler+smith&s=all
  • Rate My Professors: http://www.ratemyprofessors.com/ShowRatings.jsp?tid=646089
  • Ray Manzarek Friendship: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/lauren-cahn/ray-manzarek-a-tribute-to_b_3478557.html
  • 15 Most Notable Art Professors in New York City: http://www.theartcareerproject.com/15-notable-art-professors-nyc/10363/

Kurt Feldhun

As an award-winning director, producer, editor, cameraman and composer, Kurt Feldhun has been involved in a vast range of projects over the past 25 years and has worked with a diversity of world famous artists.

As cameraman for The Miller Time Concerts on the Pier in NYC, Kurt worked with artists such as Frank Zappa, Herbie Hancock, Black Uhuru, King Crimson, Crosby Stills, and Nash, Cyndi Lauper and Stevie Ray Vaughan.

The music video he directed for the legendary band, Bad Brains, premiered on the very first episode of MTV’s 120 Minutes. Clips from the video can also be seen in the highly acclaimed documentary PUNK ATTITUDE directed by Don Letts.

He is currently editing William Tyler Smith’s documentary, THE THIRD MIND BLUES, on the collaboration between Ray Manzarek of the Doors and acclaimed Delta blues guitarist,Roy Rogers.

Besides his experience in the area of music related film work, Feldhun is also known for his work as a documentary filmmaker. His documentary, BERNIE WHITEBEAR: A MODERN WARRIOR, won the American Indian Film Institute Award for Best Short Documentry in 2001. Feldhun also produced and edited the Emmy nominated BUILDING ONE HOUSE , a film about the Red Feather Development Group, an organization which builds houses for Native American elders who are living in abject poverty. The film was narrated by Robert Redford and featured the music of Pearl Jam. The documentary caught the attention of Oprah Winfrey who gave the organization $100,000 from her Angel Network and featured parts of the documentary on her show.

Feldhun also composes music for film and television. His music was recently used on the CARSON DAILY SHOW on NBC and several of his songs are featured in the documentary THE HEART OF THE GAME (Disney/Miramax). Feldhun's song, LET ME OUT opens the film LOADED, a thriller starring Jesse Metcalfe(Desperate Housewives), Chace Crawford(Gossip Girl), and Nathalie Kelley(The Fast and the Furious:Tokyo Drift). His music compositions have been used nationally and internationally in film and TV for the following networks: NBC, Bravo, Comedy Central, Discovery, E!, Encore, ESPN International, G4, MTV, MTV2, National Geographic Explorer, Oxygen, Palladia, Showtime, Spike TV, Starz, Style Network, Travel Channel and the Movie Channel.

Currently Feldhun is the director, co-host and editor for the TV Show FISHIN' IMPOSSIBLE which airs on ESPN International in 72 countries and on the World Fishing Network (WFN) in the U.S.

Websites:
  • Fishin' Impossible: http://fishinimpossible.com
  • Bad Brains: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VExxxzKnoeQ
  • Website: http://kurtfeldhun.com
  • Building One House Excerpt: https://vimeo.com/54977647


PERKS IMAGES


Seattle Gig Poster by world renowned artist Shawn Wolfe

Groovies T-Shirt

WHAT WE'VE ACCOMPLISHED We have already begun the rough edit and in addition to the above IndieGoGo trailer, we have completed these following trailers:
   

    -Japan Trailer: https://vimeo.com/115098669

    -Meet The Flamin' Groovies: https://vimeo.com/97155756
    -Short Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VEa5SUHQ91w

The end is in sight. Our first, second, third, fourth, fifth and sixth phases of production have now been completed.

PHASE 1: Northeastern Tour/Studio/Oakland Gig


Tour dates in Hoboken, Cleveland, Washington D.C., Boston, Brooklyn and Oakland.
The Groovies in the studio recording their soon-to-be-released new album. We captured the creative process and chemistry between the band members. The new songs really rock.
Revealing and emotional interviews with band members
The Groovies exploring Washington, D.C.
Backstage and behind-the-scenes at the shows
Interviews with die-hard fans
Life on the road from one gig to the next


PHASE 2:  Southern Tour
Tour dates in New Orleans, Austin, Houston, Dallas and Memphis
Backstage before and after the shows
The Groovies hanging in their hotel rooms
Graceland with Cyril Jordan
Interviews with fans
Band members discussing history of band
Life on the road

PHASE 3: Major interviews in New York City


Seymour Stein, founder of Sire Records (signed The Ramones, Talking Heads, Madonna, Flamin' Groovies, etc.)
Greil Marcus, Rolling Stone Magazine journalist and author of The History of Rock 'n' Roll in Ten Songs (The Groovie's song, Shake Some Action, is the first chapter of the book)
Ivan Julian, guitarist, Richard Hell and The Voidoids
Chris Such, guitarist, The Headless Horsemen
Additional interviews with various musicians and fans



PHASE 4:  Tokyo, Japan



The footage is so many things: entertaining, insightful, absurd, hysterical, surreal, intelligent and enlightening.


Two shows at Club Seata
Backstage before and after the shows
Interviews with Japanese rock 'n' roll bands influenced by the Groovies
Interviews with fans
Groovies interviews
Groovies in their hotel rooms
Groovies on the streets of Tokyo
Groovies interacting with fans
Autograph signing. Meet and greet.



PHASE 5:  San Francisco II




Interview with Cyril at home and the Filmore West
Additional shooting of new studio recordings
Cyril at a magic shop
Interview with Barry Simons, the band's manager
Cyril at home performing magic and showing his collectibles and vintage toys.



PHASE 6:  Northwest Tour




Shows in Portland, Seattle and  Vancouver
Backstage before and after the shows
Additional band interviews
Additional fan interviews
Life on the road



GREAT NEWS!We now have strong distributor and broadcaster interest and we've gotten some great international press including The Chicago Tribune, USA Today, BLURT Magazine, UW Daily, IMDB News and Screen Daily/Screen International. USA Today: http://www.usatoday.com/story/popcandy/2014/07/10/crowd-funding-art/12467913/The UW Daily (see page 4):  http://www.thedaily.washington.edu/sites/default/files/pdf/140421%20Web_0.pdfRhino.com: http://www.rhino.com/article/kickstart-some-action-put-in-your-pledge-for-the-incredible-flamin-grooviesThe Chicago Tribune: http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-flaming-groovies-cyril-jordan-shake-some-action-20140508,0,6979694.columnThe Aquarian Weekly: http://www.theaquarian.com/2015/04/22/rant-n-roll-under-the-radar/ BLURT Magazine: http://blurtonline.com/news/flamin-groovies-documentary-works-wkickstarter-campaign/ Riffraf: http://www.riffraf.net/2014/04/the-biggest-band-you-never-heard-of/Screen Daily/Screen International: http://www.screendaily.com/news/flamin-groovies-film-launches-kickstarter/5069938.articleIMDB News: http://www.imdb.com/news/ni56970670/Creative Loafing Atlanta: http://clatl.com/atlanta/flamin-groovies-still-shakin-some-action/Content?oid=14065750The Skinny - Vancouver: http://theskinnyvancouver.com/flamin-groovies/Alton Telegraph: http://www.thetelegraph.com/news/lifestyle-local_features-news/1294501/Groovies-movieUrban Milwaukee Dial: http://urbanmilwaukeedial.com/2014/04/music-finally-the-flamin-groovies/KUSP 88.9: http://blogs.kusp.org/bergalert/2014/03/29/1897/BLURT Magazine:  http://blurtonline.com/feature/a-big-footprint-...MusicFilmWeb:  http://www.musicfilmweb.com/2014/04/flamin-groovies-music-documentary-crowdfunding/American Standard Time: http://www.americanstandardtime.com/2014/04/10/the-flaming-groovies-are-back/ My Spilt Milk: http://myspiltmilk.com/flamin-groovies-cant-stop-shakin THE FILMMAKERS


William Tyler Smith and Kurt Feldhun met at New York University and have known each other for over 20 years. Having recently collaborated on a documentary about Ray Manzarek of the Doors and Delta Blues slide-guitarist Roy Rogers, Smith and Feldhun decided to team up once again to tell the incredible story of the Flamin' Groovies, a band that they both knew from their youth. (Please see our full bios below for more information.)




"I had one of their albums in high school and I really liked it. I was   thrilled to hear that they were making a comeback 30 years later." Kurt Feldhun

"I went to see one of their recent shows in New York City and I was introduced to them backstage. As soon as I met them and heard their stories, I knew we had to make this movie."  William Tyler Smith



William Tyler Smith and Kurt Feldhun have been producing, directing, shooting and editing documentary and fiction films for over twenty-five years. Both have always successfully completed all of their films. To date, all three of Smith's feature films have been sold around the world. His fourth,TheThird Mind Blues, edited by Feldhun, about the musical collaboration between Doors keyboardist, Ray Manzarek and slide-guitarist, Roy Rogers, is nearing completion and already has distributor interest. Feldhun's television show, Fishin' Impossible, which he produced, directed and edited, is currently being broadcast on ESPN International.


Smith and Feldhun are the perfect music documentary partners and collaborators for this project, and many future projects to come.






HOW WE WILL USE YOUR FUNDS
For this campaign, our goal is to raise a minimum of $12,500. However, we are hoping to raise enough to fully complete the film. 

If we hit our goal of $12,500 the funds will be used as follows:

European Tour in Spain, France, Austria and Italy
Groovies rehearsing
Shows in Los Angeles (The Roxy), Mill Valley and Big Sur
Additional San Francisco shoot of final studio recording sessions for The Groovies new tracks


If we hit $18,500 the additional funds will be used as follows:


Shoot with bass player, George Alexander, at home in Arizona


Shoot with lead singer/guitarist, Chris Wilson, at home in Portland, Oregon.


Music industry and celebrity interviews in Los Angeles


Additional New York interviews with musicians, fans and industry professionals

Rough cut editing and expenses



If we hit $27,500 the additional funds will be used as follows:


Completion of first rough cut edit with some audio sweetening and a pre-mix for screening and critique purposes



If we hit $34,500 the additional funds will be used as follows:

Completion of final edit


If we hit $39,500 the additional funds will be used as follows:


Color correction
Audio Sweetening
Sound Mixing
Mastering



If we hit $55,000 the additional funds will be used as follows:


Legal fees
Errors and omissions insurance
Marketing and promotion
Distribution expenses
Promotion and marketing
Publicity
Film festival entry fees
Music and video licensing fees


The more money we raise, the faster we can get the film finished. These funds would ensure that we can continue to move forward in making a great film. Please share the trailer and IndieGoGo link with your friends.
We thank you kindly for your support. Your funds will also help us preserve the legacy of the incredible Flamin' Groovies for generations to come.
For further news and updates, go to our website at http://www.grooviesmovie.com. 
Please also like us on Facebook at The Incredible Flamin' Groovies Movie page. https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Incredible-Flamin-Groovies-Movie/660957357273508
If you have any questions and/or comments, please feel free to contact Kurt and Billy at grooviesfilm@gmail.com.
GROOVIES HISTORYThe Flamin' Groovies story goes all the way back to 1965 when the band began in their hometown of San Francisco, California. Their first self-released 10-inch album called Sneakers sold well and caught the attention of Columbia Records, which signed them and released their first official album, Supersnazz on the Epic label.


 "Bill Graham hated our name. He thought we were gay or something. He said, ‘you gotta change your name.' That’s like telling Van Gogh that color don’t work.” Cyril Jordan

The band had its first brush with success in 1971 with the song and album entitled Teenage Head, which is listed in the 2006 book, 1001 Albums You Must Hear Before You Die. In 1972, Chris Wilson joined the band as lead singer and they released the song Slow Death. The gritty sound of this recording was infectious and the band was invited to play television shows around the world. Slow Death on live television: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EL3pP29N-Wc




The Groovies continued to tour hard and record an impressive number of albums during the 1970's. In 1976, they released their biggest hit to date, Shake Some Action. The song hit 142 on Billboard's top 200 and years later was featured in the film Clueless.
In July of 1976, the Ramones opened for the Groovies in London at the Roundhouse. This show is considered a galvanizing event for the UK punk scene. In 1981, after over a decade of hard work and dedication the band experienced a difficult and painful break up. 



"We were all, you know, basically just too stoned to continue. We needed to take a break. Everybody had cocaine-itis." Cyril Jordan

"It seemed like life was thwarting us at every turn and after ten years of living out of each others suitcases we just couldn't take it anymore and we cracked." Chris Wilson


The band went their separate ways and didn't speak over the next 30 years. George Alexander worked for the United States Postal Service for 25 years, Cyril Jordan started a band called Magic Christian and often held 3 jobs at once, and Chris Wilson joined the Barracudas and put out several solo albums. The clock was ticking, the years were passing when Cyril, Chris and George finally decided that it was time to let bygones be bygones and to continue exactly where they had left off that day in 1981 when they broke up.

"We were just so happy when we first saw each other. We just grabbed each other and gave each other a big hug and a kiss." Chris Wilson

"I made a promise with Cyril...that we would see this out together to the end. Now that we’re back together again, it’s almost as if we get a second chance to fulfill that promise." George Alexander


 "I'm getting a little too old to be doing this rock 'n' roll thing." Cyril Jordan



New drummer, Victor Penalosa, faithfully recreates the style heard on the classic recordings, while at the same time adding his own flavor. The foursome has gone into the studio to record brand new material as well as finish up some long lost recordings. They have begun playing shows again to enthusiastic fans both old and new. Fans have been delighted with what is being called "a dream set list," including original songs the band has never performed before onstage.


""This time around, it happened mostly because of the fans." Cyril Jordan
I thought one day we might get the kudos and attention that we all had craved. I hope that’s what’s happening now.” Chris Wilson


"I hadn't played the bass for twenty-five years. I had no reason to play." George Alexander

"Time and space don't affect us for some reason when we're together. It's like the day after we broke up in 1980." Cyril Jordan


We are pleased and honored to have music veteran, Joel Jaffe, on board who will supervise the audio recording and mixing, and will engineer and produce The Groovies latest album at Studio D in Sausalito, California. 

Joel has worked with such artists as Ray Manzarek, Roy Rogers, Carlos Santana, Ringo Starr, John Entwhistle, Indigo Girls, Huey Lewis & The News, Todd Rundren and The Call to name a few. Joel was also the engineer/sound mixer for the cult classic films Light Sleeper and Wave Twisters.

FILMMAKER BIOGRAPHIES

William Tyler Smith
William Tyler Smith describes himself as a "very independent" documentary and fiction filmmaker based in New York City. Mr. Smith holds an MFA from the prestigious UCLA Graduate Film & Televsion School, the same school where Francis Ford Coppola, Paul Schrader and Alexander Payne were educated. To date, he has directed five feature films (4 documentaries and 1 fiction) and numerous short films across many different genres. His films have won awards at international festivals and have been broadcast, streamed and distributed on DVD all over the world. His narrative feature, KISS ME AGAIN, premiered at the 2006 Tribeca Film Festival and has sold internationally. Billy's first feature documentary, THE THIRD MIND, about the artistic collaboration of Doors keyboardist, Ray Manzarek and Beat Poet, Michael McClure premiered at the Venice International Film Festival and was broadcast on the Sundance Channel. His second documentary feature, IMAGINE A SCHOOL...SUMMERHILL, is enjoying a successful video-on-demand run.
He is currently in post-production on a film, THE THIRD MIND BLUES about Ray Manzarek and Roy Roger's creative collaboration, from songwriting to recording to live performances. Billy is also in development on two fiction feature length screenplays.
He is a passionate instructor of film directing at The New York Film Academy who believes in a "theo-practical" approach to filmmaking; one that is heavy "hands-on" but grounded in theory. Many of his students have gone on to direct feature films, win awards at film festivals and to have successful entertainment industry careers in their respective countries.  Billy was recently cited as one of the "15 Most Notable Art Professors in New York City," by The Art Career Project. 
Websites



Internet Movie Data Base (IMDB):  http://www.imdb.com/find?ref_=nv_sr_fn&q=william+tyler+smith&s=all


Rate My Professors: http://www.ratemyprofessors.com/ShowRatings.jsp?tid=646089


Ray Manzarek Friendship: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/lauren-cahn/ray-manzarek-a-tribute-to_b_3478557.html


15 Most Notable Art Professors in New York City: http://www.theartcareerproject.com/15-notable-art-professors-nyc/10363/




Kurt Feldhun
As an award-winning director, producer, editor, cameraman and composer, Kurt Feldhun has been involved in a vast range of projects over the past 25 years and has worked with a diversity of world famous artists.
As cameraman for The Miller Time Concerts on the Pier in NYC, Kurt worked with artists such as Frank Zappa, Herbie Hancock, Black Uhuru, King Crimson, Crosby Stills, and Nash, Cyndi Lauper and Stevie Ray Vaughan.
The music video he directed for the legendary band, Bad Brains, premiered on the very first episode of MTV’s 120 Minutes. Clips from the video can also be seen in the highly acclaimed documentary PUNK ATTITUDE directed by Don Letts.
He is currently editing William Tyler Smith’s documentary, THE THIRD MIND BLUES, on the collaboration between Ray Manzarek of the Doors and acclaimed Delta blues guitarist,Roy Rogers.
Besides his experience in the area of music related film work, Feldhun is also known for his work as a documentary filmmaker. His documentary, BERNIE WHITEBEAR: A MODERN WARRIOR, won the American Indian Film Institute Award for Best Short Documentry in 2001. Feldhun also produced and edited the Emmy nominated BUILDING ONE HOUSE , a film about the Red Feather Development Group, an organization which builds houses for Native American elders who are living in abject poverty. The film was narrated by Robert Redford and featured the music of Pearl Jam. The documentary caught the attention of Oprah Winfrey who gave the organization $100,000 from her Angel Network and featured parts of the documentary on her show.
Feldhun also composes music for film and television. His music was recently used on the CARSON DAILY SHOW on NBC and several of his songs are featured in the documentary THE HEART OF THE GAME (Disney/Miramax). Feldhun's song, LET ME OUT opens the film LOADED, a thriller starring Jesse Metcalfe(Desperate Housewives), Chace Crawford(Gossip Girl), and Nathalie Kelley(The Fast and the Furious:Tokyo Drift). His music compositions have been used nationally and internationally in film and TV for the following networks: NBC, Bravo, Comedy Central, Discovery, E!, Encore, ESPN International, G4, MTV, MTV2, National Geographic Explorer, Oxygen, Palladia, Showtime, Spike TV, Starz, Style Network, Travel Channel and the Movie Channel.
Currently Feldhun is the director, co-host and editor for the TV Show FISHIN' IMPOSSIBLE which airs on ESPN International in 72 countries and on the World Fishing Network (WFN) in the U.S.
Websites:
Fishin' Impossible: http://fishinimpossible.com
Bad Brains: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VExxxzKnoeQ
Website: http://kurtfeldhun.com
Building One House Excerpt: https://vimeo.com/54977647

story:
What is Il Consorzio

#Il Consorzio (a 'Union of...' in Italian) is my story-telling-wine-selling-project, exposing small family owned wineries through stories I wrote about them and not explicitly through their wines; to some extent, a collection of my notes about the vibe around the winery, it's people, my experiences and conversations with them and of course its wines - all through my eyes. 

                                              What are we doing here?

We're here to create short documentary videos about these wineries and expose these pearls to the world. 

So, If you ever saw something with raw potential which couldn't make it its own, you know what I'm talking about. Get on board to tell their stories even better and help the world discover these hidden jewels!

                                                Moshé Weizman basics

- It's Moshé, with the é.

- 37 years old, married, father of one, living in Israel, an only child, color blind, allergic to cats, long distance runner, die hard hockey fan, half French (Mom's side), lived 5 years in Canada, licensed mediator, working in High Tech for the past 15 years...
- A descendant of 2 restaurateurs, practically grew up inside a Beef Bourgignon smothered by wine...

                                           What drove me to Il Consorzio?

From the personal side...2 things...

1. Mom&Dad always had wine around; drinking it, cooking with it, everything... Wine was constantly on the table, a simple, basic consumer good.

2. My weakness to family wineries; simple, modest people with tremendous pride in what they do, who they are, their families and their wines...; I visited so many family wineries through the years, and practically fell in love with each of them. Wouldn't you fall for these faces..?

Luisa, the adorable owner of Colline di Sopra (Tuscany)

3 generations of the San Lorenzo winery (Tuscany)

Tonio, La Contea's living legend (Piemonte)

Every time I would get back home, I just knew I wanted to do something with them. So I did ! :-)

From the professional  side...4 things

1. Family winery wines are simply very difficult to find on the web...

2. In general, online wine shops simply look like one big virtual supermarket! 

3. Information that tells you about who's behind the wines is simply missing! 

Won't knowing who and what's behind it, what's its story - make you more keen on buying it, telling people about it, showing it off?

4. In the evolving web and Social Media reality we live in, technical sheets and reviews won't cut it. People will want an experience, something to feel, to love and to appreciate. They need a story; hey, even Forbes says so... 

(see here: http://onforb.es/1eq4pqb)

                                   So, what makes Il Consorzio different?

- Il Consorzio is a voice for those who still can't or don't know how to speak the international language of the WEB or Social Networks.
- Il Consorzio exposes wines from excellent, high quality family wineries ONLY, making roughly 50K bottles per year.

- Il Consorzio is about quality wines but at prices which are 20-30% cheaper than similar alternatives.

- Yes, Il Consorzio sells wines, but above all, it sells an experience, a passion, a story, a legacy.

                                          What has been achieved so far?

Quite a lot actually...

- A pilot running in The Netherlands for the past 6 months and doing quite good. 

- 12 wineries are already in my 'notebook' with their stories just waiting to be told.

- 2 wineries have already had their stories actually told and wines sold, generating sales of several EU Ks.

So how does it look...? A bit like this... (Oh, yes, it's in Dutch... An English version is part of our next steps...) 

Why a pilot in The NL  you ask...? Good question...

- Size; not too big, not too small of a market.

- Wine consumption; ~24L/capita per year; 13th in the world! Not too bad Dutchies!

- Heavy E-commerce habits.

- Logistic feasibility; The Dutch government is Royal in facilitating 'foreigners' like me with their business in NL.


                                      So, now what...? What's our next step?

- Il Consorzio needs to go to the next level in terms of the Multimedia and 'experience' aspects of its content; currently, I share my stories and my pictures of the wineries and their owners, but there's so much more that can be done to tell these wineries' stories...

I want the site be a mirror of the experience in these wineries and give them even more life with short documentary videos of each of them. 

I want to document those little moments you just wish you could take a picture of, or film: The morning walk with the winery owner; slipping into his wife's kitchen to see what's cooking for lunch; the magical aperitif time at the winery wine-bar, the chat with the girl at dinner...

                               Beyond this campaign, thinking 2 steps ahead... 

Success with this first step in The Netherlands will enable the addition of more wines, more stories, and most importantly - more wineries to the portfolio of Il Consorzio.

                                                 Thinking 3 steps ahead... 

- Expanding to other EU countries, Israel, US and Asia

                                           So what are we raising exactly?

I can't make all of the above happen without you joining me. I'm raising $28,000 in this campaign, which I will use to fund the following:

- Production of  videos exposing my  wineries along with a budget to promote them .

- A budget to make the necessary adjustments to www.il-consorzio.com to be able to carry such Multimedia and offer a better user interface.

                                      

                                         So, what can we give back to you?

          

            Il Consorzio - A One Stop Shop for family wineries around the world!

Il Consorzio is about getting people as close to family wineries as possible. 

- Il Consorzio's portofolio of family wineries will become vast and international.

- Il Consorzio will go offline with tasting event exposing the wines of my wineries in each of the countries it will operate in.

- Il Consorzio will be a Tourism stop to reach these wineries for getaways and dedicated tastings.

And, last push...

I've been working in High Tech for 15 years and specializing in starting up new operations, building or rebuilding relationships and partnerships and translating all of this into commercial success and constant over achievements. I know that if you join me, I can make Il Consorzio the one stop shop for family wineries worldwide. I just need your little push to start this. 

Join me in leading these wineries out of the shadows. If you can contribute - it would mean the world to me. If not - just share this video and my project around, and help me get the world closer to its family wineries.

Thank you! Yours, me

- Il Consorzio needs to go to the next level in terms of the Multimedia and 'experience' aspects of its content; currently, I share my stories and my pictures of the wineries and their owners, but there's so much more that can be done to tell these wineries' stories...
I want the site be a mirror of the experience in these wineries and give them even more life with short documentary videos of each of them. 
I want to document those little moments you just wish you could take a picture of, or film: The morning walk with the winery owner; slipping into his wife's kitchen to see what's cooking for lunch; the magical aperitif time at the winery wine-bar, the chat with the girl at dinner...

Success with this first step in The Netherlands will enable the addition of more wines, more stories, and most importantly - more wineries to the portfolio of Il Consorzio.
